Title: ISU Research Analyst
Description:
Staff - Non Union
 

   Job Category
  M&P - AAPS
 

   Job Profile
  AAPS Salaried - Research and Facilitation, Level A
 

   Job Title
  ISU Research Analyst
 

   Department
  ISU Administration | Department of Family Practice | Faculty of Medicine
 

   Compensation Range
  4,688.67 - $6,754.00 CAD Monthly
 

   Posting End Date
  July 12, 2022
 

   Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
 


   Job End Date
  Mar 31, 2023
 


    Additional Job Description
  






       This position is located within a health-care facility, therefore, the successful candidate will be required to provide verification of full vaccination against Covid-19 provided prior to the start date, as required by a provincial health mandate.
     


       This is a full-time, term position until March 31, 2023, with possibility of extension.
     






   Job Description Summary
 

   The UBC Department of Family Practice (DFP) has established the primary care Innovation Support Unit (ISU) to connect, engage, and partner with those who are actively involved in innovations in primary care. The ISU is initially focused on supporting innovations in community-situated, team-based care (TBC) in BC, which includes initiatives in primary care transformation such as the Patient s Medical Home (PMH) and Primary Care Networks (PCNs) as these are key provincial strategic elements in achieving a sustainable and high-quality community and primary care system in BC. We are working with collaborators at UBC, the Ministry of Health, BC primary care communities and several other groups.
 

 The ISU has several interconnected 
  workstreams related to specific aspects of TBC transformation in Primary Care. Workstreams are a collection of applied, multi-method projects clustering around a particular pressing issue or need in primary care in BC. Workstreams focus on different areas such as: supporting transformation in the primary care system (e.g., designing, testing and deployment of new methods to support change), development of a team-based care evaluation framework and evaluation methods for team-based care; or support for the team based care advisory.
 


   The ISU has been established as a small but nimble and highly networked team, working with many stakeholders. We are currently, looking to hire 1-2 more Research Analysts to support the workstreams.
  
 Analysts will work with workstream leads and ISU faculty, to perform a range of activities including: reviews of literature, support for the Primary Care Transformation workstream in the implementation of primary care transformation tools (e.g. Team and PACC mapping).
 


   We are specifically looking for experience in:
 



     Action Research
   


     Multi-method evaluation (planning and execution)
   


     Quantitative methods to measure changes in behaviour and outcomes in primary care practices
   


     Data visualization
   


     Developing online communities of practice
   


     Coordination
   


     Academic literature reviews
   



   Some of our work will require more familiarity with action research and literature reviews, as well as quantitative and qualitative analysis. Other parts of our work focus more on design thinking, engagement of stakeholders and facilitation.
 


   As the ISU has a Teal organizational structure, the Research Analysts will be responsible for engaging across workstreams as required and as fits the skills of each of the team members. In this way, the ISU works very collaboratively and seeks to match team members to projects / workstreams that build on their strengths and skills. The ISU has opportunities for people with a range of skills and experience to broaden the team’s views as we tackle the complex challenges in primary care. We are looking for diversity and a broad range of experiences to complement other members of the team.
 


   In the ISU we value justice, equity, diversity and inclusion (JEDI) and are working to develop and apply this lens as we work to support primary care systems change. As a team we engage with learning related to the decolonization of research and healthcare systems; team members are expected to have a willingness to learn, unlearn and engage in this work.
  
 Organizational Status
   The Department of Family Practice supports researchers and faculty throughout the province. The ISU is a core unit of the department whose goal is to bring an applied academic lens to the changes that are actively occurring in primary care across the province. The ISU’s initial focus has been on team-based care. The ISU collaborates with the Ministry of Health, Health Authorities, Divisions of Family Practice, communities, and other provincial organizations to develop and link evidence to change initiatives. The ISU seeks to inform new models of care, test assumptions and gather data to inform system changes.
  
 Work Performed
 

   1. Work with TBC projects in communities (PMH or PCNs etc.) that have engaged the ISU with the ISU manager to develop relationships, and develop and implement plans and activities relating to Team Mapping and/or Evaluation support.
 


   2. Support Team Mapping Activities including:
 



     Preparing for Team Mapping Activities, reviewing partner documents, drafting Team Mapping materials, etc.
   


     Overseeing and facilitating Team Mapping Sessions
   


     Drafting the Team Mapping Activity analysis and reports
   



   3. TBC Evaluation Planning / TBC Evaluation:
 



     Review relevant literature and evaluation tools to refine the ISUs TBC evaluation framework
   


     Development of evaluation plans
   


     Manage activities to build local evaluation capacity in partner sites
   


     Perform on-site evaluation
   


     Analyze mixed methods evaluation data (surveys, interviews, EMR queries)
   


     Develop evaluation reports for partner sites
   



   4. Other:
 



     Preparation of academic articles and other knowledge dissemination products (e.g. webinars, videos).
   


     Development of materials and resources to be shared on ISU's website
   


 Consequence of Error/Judgement
   The Research Analyst will be dealing with data that is sensitive in nature and confidential and as such will be required to exercise discretion. The Research Analyst will be a representative of the Dept. of Family Practice and ISU and thus will be required to demonstrate a high degree of expertise and professionalism.
  
 Supervision Received
   The ISU Research Manager will provide direct supervision. The analyst will work with considerable latitude with research work reviewed against achievement of project objectives The successful candidate will report to the ISU leadership and steering committee.
  
 Supervision Given
   May be asked to provide guidance to student employees.
 


   Minimum Qualifications
   Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. Minimum of two years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 

 Preferred Qualifications
   At least a BSc in a related field (e.g. Health Information Science, Life Sciences, Public Health) and ideally an MSc, preferred. Experience in evaluation methods - qualitative or quantitative - and group facilitation (of focus groups and/or other community engagement strategies) is also desired. Work in primary care or clinical experience in primary care an asset. Experience with data analysis (e.g. health data analysis) an asset.
 


   The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic and resourceful team member, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and oral) in order to interact effectively with colleagues, clinicians and stakeholders.

Title: Data Engineering Analyst
Description:
Now is an extremely exciting time to join a newly formed group within Citi. The Institutional Clients Group - Engineering and Architecture Practice (EAP) is responsible for defining and building core architecture and technology strategy for the ICG.
 We are looking for a server-side software engineer empathetic with the challenges that Data Engineering teams face in delivering software in large, heterogeneous organizations.
 What you’ll be doing:

 You’ll develop and take ownership of components in our Data Architecture stack which will provide the services and building blocks for other teams to build upon.
 You’ll code in close collaboration and partnership with line of business and infrastructure teams.

 Who you are:

 3+ years in software engineering, with experience building distributed systems.
 You strive to build solutions that are valued by developers
 You have experience in an agile development environment with modern programming languages and technologies such any of the following: Golang, Java/Spring Boot, Python, Kotlin, Scala or similar.


 You have a working knowledge of distributed systems, Rest APIs.
 You enjoy working together on scalable systems, embracing new technologies, and pushing the boundaries of “the art of the possible” to solve really hard problems.


 You may even have expertise in ‘Big Data’ technologies, and the demands of data engineering.
 You have an active curiosity and eagerness to learn

 If you are hands-on, passionate about engineering excellence and enjoy collaboration, come and build a meaningful career at Citi, make a substantial impact and help thousands of developers.
 Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities (including, without limitation, physical and mental health disabilities) during the recruitment process and otherwise in accordance with law. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minority or racialized communities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Title: Enterprise Insights Analyst
Description:
We are currently seeking an Enterprise Insights Analyst to join our team. 
Please note our preference is to find talent located in BC or Toronto. 
The Enterprise Insights Analyst will work collaboratively with managers, senior analysts, and senior data scientists across business units to understand their information needs and identify the data, analytics and recommendations needed to drive business performance. Through a combination of business acumen, analytical skills and technical expertise, this role will provide business intelligence solutions and support to enable First West to deliver on a variety of strategic initiatives. 
Here’s what would be included as a part of your typical day 


Forecasting: Analyzes “big data” and gathers insights from information to forecast and build models. Develops and prototypes analytical solutions that can be deployed corporate wide. Facilitates cross-functional knowledge sharing. 


Defining Business Problems: Works with stakeholders to define business issues and gather requirements. Understands the business and what information is required to solve complex problems. Effectively translates complex business requirements into technical solutions. 


Analyzing: Uses mathematical and statistical data and techniques to perform analysis on strategic initiatives for Sales, Marketing, Operations and other areas of the organization, while maintaining a holistic enterprise view. 


Developing Business Solutions: Transforms insights into actionable conclusions and recommendations and summarizes solutions in business terms for management and executives by communicating findings through verbal and written presentations. 


Targeted Marketing: Use information and analysis to identify, execute and measure the success of specific sales opportunities to members and prospects across different channels 


Operational Tasks: Run standard tasks, manual reports and support the organization for more day-to-day operations 


Required Skills, Experience & Qualifications 

Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline required 
Other Certifications, Designations or Licenses / Masters in related discipline preferred 
1-3 years of progressive business intelligence experience required 
Experience in Financial Services would be an asset 
Proven ability to collaborate with cross departmental and multiple business unit groups. 
Experience understanding, interpreting, and communicating analytics. 
Knowledge and experience using SQL, Power BI or related technologies to munge and mashup data 
Strong analytical, data mining and creative problem-solving skills 
Experience and/or knowledge of how to effectively visualize information 
Experience with writing and interpreting technical business requirements 
Passionate about data and learning 
Displays an understanding of risk and risk ownership by being able to demonstrate adherence to policies and procedures. 

Why work for us? 
We offer a total rewards package that recognizes the meaningful work you do to support our members and our communities, which includes: 

A competitive base salary plus performance-based incentive compensation 
Annual merit pay increases 
Flexible benefits as well as support for retirement benefits 
Vacation time, a flexible “Day4U” and the option to purchase up to five additional vacation days 
Other financial perks such as our Employee Banking Advantages which includes waived or reduced financial service fees, reduced rates on personal loans, mortgages and no-interest loans on lifestyle-related items that promote health, wellness, learning and business aptitude 

In addition, you can enjoy socially conscious perks, like three paid days off every year, to volunteer for causes you care about. 
What’s your place in the First West story? Apply now and let’s find out together! 
First West regrets that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. 
Diversity & Inclusion: 
First West Credit Union is committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to create an inclusive, accessible environment for our candidates and employees that reflects the communities in which operate. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment or interview process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other types of accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us 
The Ontario Cannabis Store provides safe, responsible access to recreational cannabis for adults 19 and older. We operate the provincial online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and are the exclusive provincial wholesaler to authorized private retail stores. 

 Working at the OCS is a unique opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a ground-breaking new industry. We’re a diverse team passionate about delivering a great customer experience, working together with mutual respect and building value out of our differences. We’re an inclusive organization that understands that delivering great results comes out of ensuring every voice is heard. 

 About the Role 
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Data Science team. You will be responsible for maintenance of datasets, scheduled reporting, and design and development of reports in consultation with other business units and teams to implement new reporting needs (KPIs, data, format, channels, visualizations). You will use machine learning algorithms to create predictive models to drive better decision making and unlock actionable insights. You will play a fundamental role in the execution of data strategy across the enterprise, as well as assisting in building the omni-channel view of the customer. 

 About Your Day 


Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Interpret data, identify trends, and analyze results using statistical techniques to provide regular, timely and accurate reports to internal departments and business units
Collaborate with business units to identify opportunities for business process improvements and make recommendation for system modifications
Ensure KPIs are published and reviewed on a daily, weekly, monthly basis and perform analysis on any behaviors/processes that could impact data integrity
Partner with Data Engineers to implement and support production of analytical data models.
Create enterprise and business dashboards/visualizations for effective tracking of metrics
Design and develop predictive machine learning models to enable better decision making and create more value for our stakeholders
Serves as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for other functional departments
Provide guidance and share expertise with other project teams to support business initiatives
Be connected and influential within the OCS analyst community
 About You 


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Operations Research, Math, or a related discipline.
4+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar Business Intelligence role
Highly Proficient in writing advanced SQL queries and views to analyze large multi-dimensional datasets
Expertise in one or more visualization tools (Power BI is highly preferred)
Hands-on experience in Descriptive and Predictive data modeling using R and/or Python
Demonstrated analytical ability in a results-oriented environment with internal and external customer interaction
Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment
Experience with one or more of the following business domains would be an asset: E-Commerce, Retail, Merchandising, Supply Chain or Business Analytics.
Understanding of data warehousing, data modeling concepts and building new data warehouse tables would be an asset.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills and the ability to express thoughts logically and succinctly.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
 Remote Work 


This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office a minimum of 1 day per week, with the ability to work from home for the remaining workdays (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance)
When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications
 About the Job 


City: Toronto, ON
Employment Type: Full-Time, Permanent
Required Travel: Rare, within the GTA
Application Deadline: July 11, 2022 at 11:59PM
 We are committed to providing an accessible, equitable and inclusive candidate and employee experience. We provide reasonable accommodation throughout the recruitment process and in employment. If you require an accommodation, please let us know, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
COME GROW WITH US!



 ABOUT US:



 McDougall Energy Inc. (“McDougall Energy”) is a Canadian, privately owned, family business serving energy customers since 1949. McDougall Energy is a marketer and distributor of heating oil, propane, gasoline, diesel fuel and commercial lubricants, as well as an Esso™ and Shell® branded retailer. McDougall Energy is proud to be a Platinum Club member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, having retained its designation consecutively since 2011. Now in its third generation of ownership, the energy company serves communities across regions of Ontario and Western Canada. The company is headquartered in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario.
 


 Our success is driven by an uncompromising commitment to provide the highest quality customer service to each and every customer. We recognize that our employees are our most valuable resource and offer opportunities for development for personal and career growth.
 


 Position could be in one of our following locations:
 

 Sault Ste. Marie, ON
 Goderich, ON
 London, ON
 St. Thomas, ON
 Kingston, ON
 Brantford, ON



 ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:


   McDougall Energy is looking for a high energy, results focused individual as a 
  Business Analyst, reporting to Project Management Office and Continuous Improvement Manager. The Business Analyst will facilitate business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications. The Business Analyst will help assess, understand, and improve a wide variety of operational processes and system solutions to help the organization meet its goals and objectives.
 


 Manages requirements development process through elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification of requirements and works to develop technical specifications and test plans that will ensure the delivery of high-quality outcomes
 Develops supporting data analytics and decision support elements of projects, to enable successful business process improvement outcomes
 Consults with management and staff to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current and future state operational processes and procedures, issues, input and output requirements
 Engages with all stakeholders to validate and clarify requirements and desired outcomes
 Acts as a liaison between departmental end users and PMO & CI in the analysis, definition, design, configuration, testing, and maintenance of application systems to ensure optimal operational performance
 Analyses the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing applications, and ensures the solutions being delivered meet the needs of the business and other stakeholders
 Participates in and/or leads Continuous Improvement activities
 Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information system and/or non-system changes; assists in the preparation to develop new system and/or operational changes
 Facilitates the creation of user stories and use cases, acceptance criteria, test plans, testing, and training guides
 Develops analytics dashboards to support project and solution objectives
 Helps transform data into information that stakeholders can use to make informed decisions



 ABOUT YOU:



 The ideal candidate will have:
 


 Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role with direct experience working with Information Technology; Business Analyst certificate an asset
 Bachelor’s degree in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, Operations Management, Engineering, Science, Accounting or related field
 Business process re-engineering experience
 Excellent communication skills; both verbal and written
 Project Management experience working as part of a project team and/or Team Lead in project
 Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement, process mapping, IT Controls (ITIL, COBIT, SDLC, etc.), and Lean Six Sigma
 Effective problem solving and research skills
 Experience working with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI
 Demonstrated ability to make timely, informed decisions; in realm of accountabilities and authority, and in consultation with functional groups and Information Technology
 Experience working with SQL an asset



 WHAT WE OFFER:



 Competitive Compensation
 4 weeks paid vacation
 Company paid Health & Dental Benefits
 Group RRSP
 Employee Assistance Program (EAP)



 Apply on-line at www.mcdougallcareers.com
 


 Confidentiality of all applicants assured. Only those selected for interviews will be contacted and we thank all other applicants for their interest.
 


 McDougall Energy is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you require any accommodations, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Database Analyst
Description:
Designs and develops expansions and modifications to data querying tools developed in SQL, as necessary
Examines incoming problem tickets and resolves application and software issues (ERP (Infor – Visual Manufacturing)/ISM/Filemaker)
Creates, supports, and maintains daily, weekly, or/and monthly Financial and non-financial reports
Creates automated operational reports related to key performance indicators and operational benchmarks.
Builds and maintains a user-friendly interface for the extraction and querying of operational data
Develops strategies to generate and automate improved reports
Evaluates and verifies the accuracy, consistency and completeness of the data via a standardized auditing program
Carries out detailed analysis of data to evaluate operational performance
Uses operational data to generate ideas related to improving the efficiency of processes
Presents results of analyses to internal and external stakeholders
Responds to ad-hoc data queries from internal and external sources
Develops and maintains standard operating procedures and detailed manuals outlining reporting requirements
Audits the company’s systems to ensure consistency, accuracy and completeness of data
Maintains or creates Macros and workflows to improve processes

To succeed in this role, you have:

College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information systems, and/or 3+ years of equivalent work experience.
Experience supporting ERP systems (Visual Manufacturing - Infor experience is an asset)
Proven experience with troubleshooting principles, methodologies, and issue resolution techniques.
Experience of SQL and database queries, macros, workflow and trends in technology relating to software applications.
Advanced Excel functions and presentation skills
Analytical and problem-solving skills to resolve technical issues and recommend solutions
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while effectively prioritizing and executing tasks
Ability to present ideas in a professional and user-friendly manner

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Extended health care
Paid time off
Vision care

Schedule:

Day shift

Title: Associate Sales Data Analyst
Description:

YOUR ROLE

 As an AGI Associate Sales Data Analyst, you are responsible for going through the reported sales within our systems and documenting issues. You will serve as a liaison between the Senior Planner responsible for sales reporting, the sales coordinator, our franchise partners, and the internal IT team. You are responsible for both short- term and long-term solutions to the persistent issues related to sales reporting, and ultimately, responsible for delivering clean data. The job requires analytical work, diagnostic work, and collaboration across many teams to find solutions. The candidate needs to be results oriented and driven to find a permanent solution to the issue. Strong communication skills are a must with extensive coordination across multiple teams.
 Responsibilities:

Support and work closely with the internal teams (Planning, Sales Coordinator, IT) along with external teams (Franchise Partners) to identify and document the issues.
Analyze reported sales daily and cross-reference against what the partner reports manually to confirm accuracy.
Coordinate with AGI sales coordinator and franchise partners to document their issues with uploading sales.
Coordinate with internal IT team and coordinator to work on short-term and long-term solutions.
Prepare reports that outline every error encountered issue and summarize the plans that are in place to address them.
Provide concrete solutions to a variety of issues related to the data.
Follow up with all involved parties to ensure progress is achieved and maintained over time.
Ensure the reported data is correct going forward and provided in a timely and accurate manner.



 DO YOU HAVE THE PROFILE WE'RE LOOKING FOR?


Bachelor’s Degree required
Minimum 1-2 years of previous experience working as an analyst
Strong analytical skills, well organized, and detailed oriented
Strong problem-solving abilities and solutions oriented
Ability to collaborate, work alongside multiple teams, and communicate well, while having the level of autonomy needed to find appropriate solutions
IT background is an asset. Familiarity with Oracle, Microsoft Excel, and working with large data sets.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CCM Hockey is present worldwide, we have offices in Canada, the United States, Sweden, Finland and Taiwan. Our headquarters are located in Montreal, where we create and develop our equipment. Our mission is to inspire dreams and empower every player to fulfill their passion while enjoying their game. Our team's vision is to be the leading brand on and off the ice, by delivering innovative products and outstanding experience to our athletes and partners everywhere, all while putting our employees and communities at the forefront. We aim to unlock the full potential of every CCM athlete from pond to forum by delivering innovation to maximize performance and ignite in them the self-confidence to chase their dream. We’re looking for passionate players who share our core values and will help us become THE industry leader! 


At CCM Hockey, we live our values everyday:

Authenticity: Standing up for who you are, doing what you mean and what you believe in. 

Empowerment: Through their unique contributions, each person is different, each person is important, and each person has the opportunity to make a difference. 

Teamwork: A team that works together always beats a team of highly skilled individual players. 

Respect: Valuing differences and allowing others to express themselves when working together, to achieve common goals, to grow and succeed as a company. 

 PURPOSE 

 The purpose of this position is to enforce the standards and the rules of master and reference data. Individual has a complete understanding of where data originates, how the data applies and integrates to other systems and how it is used across the ERP and process areas. Collaborates with and educates key business partners to broaden their understanding of the full impact of master data decisions, including the implications to all processes. The analyst is accountable for the accuracy and completeness of the production data across various systems and the execution of requests according to the pre-established SLA’s. 

 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 



Ensuring appropriate turnaround time on all data entry
Validates and ensures requests follow the standard operating procedures & policies
Reviewing and entering data information into the appropriate databases
Proactively verifying data through source documents
Monitoring and updating existing data when required
Retrieving data for team members upon request
Performing data searches
Complying with security backups and regular checkups to ensure the safety of the data being stored
Validates and ensures requests follow the standard operating procedures & policies
Participate in the implementation of policies and standard operating procedures that drive continuous improvement to ensure the completeness, consistency, integrity, and quality of the data in the different systems.
Derive insights on current state data health to recommend and implement data standards and rules
Audit and Monitor data quality and raise non-compliance discoveries
Provide proactive data quality recommendations to prevent issues from occurring
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess root cause and drive resolution of data quality issues as needed
Actively involved in project test case creation and execution
Availability to work off hours when mass data updates via DMT are required
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES 



University degree in business analytics, management or equivalent;
2-3 years of experience in Data Management
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Good capacity of analysis, synthesis and problem solving;
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Ability to exercise judgment.
Leadership and ability to work with multiple stakeholders
Bilingual (French and English)
 WHY JOIN THE CCM TEAM? 



Competitive salaries, including a performance-based bonus program.
Full range of group insurance benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, etc.) from Day 1.
Group retirement pension plan with employer matching (up to 5% of base salary).
3 weeks of vacation per year prorated as of your start date.
Flexible work schedule.
Discounted prices on CCM products.
Subsidized sports and wellness activities.
Fun social events throughout the year.
 At CCM Hockey, we celebrate the difference for the benefit of our employees, our products and our collaborators. We work to create an inclusive environment where everyone, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religion, age or other motives, can give the best of themselves.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst
 Location: Vancouver, BC or Remote


 About Us
 Exact Payments is a leading provider of high-performance payment services to bank partners, software platforms, and omnichannel merchants. Exact delivers a highly scaled payments platform integrated with leading processors in the US and Canada including Fiserv/First Data, Elavon, TSYS, Chase Canada, and Moneris.

 Founded in 1999, Exact is a proven player in the eCommerce payments market with deep expertise in building and supporting payment platforms for large banks, ISVs, and its own direct client portfolio. Our cloud-based technology is fully redundant and offers comprehensive integration options including Rest APIs, PCI-compliant hosted payment pages, and virtual terminal interfaces. The technology stack is built for scale delivering the highest level of performance and reliability at transaction volumes exceeding 1 billion annually.
 Exact is a private equity-backed company headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona, and Vancouver, British Columbia.

 Your Role
 We are recruiting a Data Analyst to join our Product Support team. Reporting to our Vice President, Product Support, this person will be responsible for developing data analysis tools designed to identify issues across our infrastructure of high-volume transaction processing servers and applications. The Data Analyst will leverage Kibana and Elastic Stack to build a suite of log queries and data visualizations which will be used by our Support team to rapidly identify processing or integration issues and advise clients on resolution strategies.
 This position will be located in our Vancouver, British Columbia office.

 What You Will Be Doing

Develop expert technical knowledge of our payments infrastructure including gateway processing engines, application services, MySQL and Amazon Aurora databases, and Elastic Stack.
Design and build a suite of data analysis tools using Elastic Stack and Kibana
Build Product Support dashboards using Kibana and data visualizations using Telemetry TV
Take lead on database and transaction log query responsibilities for the Product Support team as well as other groups performing system research and resolution including: DevOps, QA, and Software Development.
Collaborate with Software Development on level 3 technical issues or client integration problems using log queries and transactional data to isolate the root cause
Train Product Support team on Query tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualization services
Participate in Product design sessions leveraging data insights to inform bug fixes, enhancements, and feature prioritizations
Collaborate with DevOps to leverage tooling and data set to inform infrastructure upgrades and enhancement strategies
Developing trusted relationships with technical counterparts across the team as well as with key customers



 About You



3+ years experience in a Data Analyst role for a technology company. SaaS software, Payments, or eCommerce experience is highly desirable.
Experience and working knowledge of Elastic Stack and/or Kibana
Prior experience supporting payment processing systems and/or eCommerce technologies is desirable
Excellent problem solving and communication skills



Development experience including: PHP, Ruby on Rails, .Net, Python, SOAP Web Services, Linux, Node.JS


Fast learner interested in developing strong command of leading-edge tools including Telemetry TV (data visualization)




Works well in a collaborative environment and loves learning from a group of highly technical peers



Exhibits a technical, logical thought process plus a strong commitment to learning and growing in the Financial Technologies (Fintech) field


Interested in growing and moving within a Company always looking for people to take on the next challenge


Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or relevant field preferred



 What We Offer
 We are a team of passionate professionals working together to ‘propel high-performance digital commerce for our clients and partners’. We value diversity, creativity, innovation, collaboration, integrity, and respect and are looking for people who share these same values to join our growing team. We offer a comprehensive benefits program for our Canadian employees including Extended Healthcare benefits and a Retirement Savings Plan with a company match.

Title: Business Operations Coordinator/Analyst
Business Analyst
Description:
Pharm3r is a risk analytics company. We specialize in providing early insights into complex and interconnected drug, device, and supply chain risks. Pharm3r enables our clients to maximize patient safety and minimize financial exposure
 Our firm ingests large, healthcare related data sets, which are refreshed daily. We clean, map, and overlay this data with client specific information. Clients use our software for industry insights, risk ranking and data exploration.
 We are seeking a person, physically located within Halifax and surrounding areas, with interest in the healthcare sector, to join our Product and Consulting Services team. The position requires extensive research into medical device and medication databases. It involves locating accurate data, extracting key information, and generating engaging dashboards and visualizations.
 The ideal candidate has deep curiosity and is relentless in pursuit of solutions. This person:

 Thinks creatively and flexibly
 Communicates clearly
 Enjoys working with data, from finding new sources to solution-oriented analysis and visualization
 Possesses solid analytical and technical skills with a keen sense of accountability, ownership, and commitment to accuracy
 Familiarity with medical terminology, healthcare regulations and drug and medical device data sources is a plus.

 Pharm3r is based in New York with offices in Halifax. This hybrid position, based in Halifax, requires occasional face-time, COVID restrictions permitting, with team members in the Halifax area.

Title: BMO Global Markets Quantitative Analyst (Fall 2022 Co-op)
Description:
Adresse : 100 King Street West 
 
Groupe de famille d'emploi : Vente et serv–Marchés capitaux 
 
BMO Capital Markets 
BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has approximately 2,600 professionals in 32 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America. 

BMO Capital Markets is a member of BMO Financial Group (NYSE, TSX: BMO), one of the largest diversified financial services providers in North America with US$798 billion total assets and approximately 43,900 employees as of October 31, 2021. 

Program Overview: 
Sales & Trading Analysts work in the Global Markets Group of BMO Capital Markets, comprising Global Equities & Financing Solutions, Global Markets HQ, Digital & Liquid Trading, Global Structured Products Trading, and Financial Resource Management, serving our corporate, institutional and government clients. 

Co-op Analysts are assigned to a specific Global Markets group during the 15-week program. In addition to the on-the-job experience, each intern will complete one week of training and participate in professional development sessions and events throughout the term. 

Co-op students have the opportunity to join one of the following areas within Global Markets: 

Global Equities & Financing Solutions 
Global Markets HQ 
Digital & Liquid Trading 
Global Structured Products Trading 
Financial Resource Management 


All candidates will go through a rigorous interview process and team assignments will be made at closer to the start of the term based on previous experience, interest, and educational background. 

Responsibilities: 
These assignments will vary widely from day to day based on the needs of the business and the current market environment. 

Responsibilities may include: 

Development and deployment of business solutions such as pricing and risk models, 
Market data capture and display, spreadsheet development 
Helping with developing insight into trading strategies leveraging quantitative modelling 
Improving on existing technology involving system infrastructure, internal reporting, client/management presentations, etc. 
Work on bespoke projects requiring market, portfolio, or client research and data analytics. 


Qualifications: 
We are looking for highly motivated individuals who can work well in a team based environment and seek a challenge. 

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate program; graduating in 2024, 2025, 2026 (applicants are typically between their second and second last co-op term); 
Currently working towards a degree in: Finance, Actuarial Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Statistics; 
Strong academic record and extracurricular achievement; 
Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of financial markets; 
Excellent research and analytical skills, able to collect, analyze and interpret data; 
Strong interpersonal skills used within a demanding team environment; 
Demonstrated proactivity, resiliency, positive attitude and high motivation; 
Strong written and oral communication skills; 
Ability to attentively review, assess and provide detailed information daily on multiple projects in an organized manner; 
Excellent capacity to independently function as part of a team through self -motivation; 
Strong work ethic and a high level of professional integrity; 
Detail and results orientated. 


Technical Skills: 

Knowledge and/or experience of front end developer languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular); 
Knowledge and/or experience in back end developer languages (C++, C#, Java, Python); 
Knowledge and/or experience of at least one type of statistical programming language (i.e. R, MatLab); 
Database experience (SQL, Oracle); 
Familiarity with data manipulation and strong quantitative/statistical background; 
Understanding of mathematical models; 
Fluency in Excel, including VBA including scripting and efficient spreadsheet design; 
Strong technical writing ability. 


How to Apply: 
For your application to be eligible for consideration, you must apply to both your career center posting and the BMO application link. 

Please ensure the following items are submitted in your application: 

Cover Letter (optional) 
Resume 
Transcript (Required for application review) 


The campus job description above aligns to the internal job description below. 
Provides a markets-based suite of sales and trading solutions to Institutional, Corporate, and Retail clients. Offers a full spectrum of integrated capabilities to deliver leading market insight, risk management, and execution services to issuing and/or investor clients, including access to major global markets across asset classes including: debt, foreign exchange, interest rate, credit, equity, securitization, and commodities. Provides competitive pricing to all clients and seeks out new opportunities with prospective clients. Maximizes profit while prudently minimizing the bank’s exposure and adhering to regulatory statutes. 
Qualifications: 

Acts as point person to provide client support in the form of proposals, marketing material, event planning, and scheduling with the cooperation of trading and sales, research, and marketing and with the support of a senior leader. 
Responds to inquiries from clients, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community in a professional manner and determines acceptable solutions. 
Helps manage the flow of inquiries, market data, and other information from clients. Routes client calls appropriately and responds quickly to client questions. 
Seeks to develop an understanding of client needs and outcomes. 
Coordinates conference calls, client events and meetings. 
Maintains a proactive, client service focus in order to meet their needs and increase revenue; contacts customers to present available investment services and develops client prospects from among current customers, referral leads and other sources. 
Verifies that all confirms on trades or sales are accurate and promptly delivered. 
Communicates transaction details to the brokerage community and custodians. Resolves settlement issues related to incorrect billing. 
Answers phones, file, fax, and coordinates meeting and travel arrangements. 
Develops strong market knowledge to provide comprehensive service to clients, develop new solutions, and construct compelling recommendations. 
Reads, analyzes and interprets common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents in order to better serve client needs. 
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Ensures alignment between stakeholders. 
Cultivates strong relationships with the research team in order to understand their industries and stock coverage. 
Uses analytical skills (probability, statistical inference, etc.) and applies appropriate technical concepts and completes/leads consistent and reliable technical and financial reports/analyses to support client deliverables. 
Defines problems, collects data, establishes facts, and draws valid conclusions. 
Develops an understanding of and proficiency in using all required systems and models. 
Supports change management of varying scope and type; tasks typically focused on execution and sustainment activities. 
Executes a variety of administrative and analytical tasks as assigned and with minimal supervision (e.g. procedural documentation, brokerage and client commission reporting, maintenance of contacts database, disaster recovery planning, tracking and updating of periodic trading or sales metrics, etc.). 
Administers all aspects of the sales and or trading desk, record keeping, reporting, and file maintenance in accordance with internal controls and compliance policies and external regulations. 
Responds to requests for information from both internal and external sources. 
Communicates market data and client changes to colleagues when they are on the road or in meetings. 
Provides feedback on, and, supports continuous improvement opportunities. 
Considers risk, internal controls and compliance as part of day-to-day accountabilities and adheres to policies and procedures. 
Focus may be on a business/group. 
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works mostly independently. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. 
Typically between 3 - 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Familiarity with institutional equity markets. 
Series 7, 63 licenses. 
Able to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, investment and financial reports. 
Strong familiarity with Outlook, Excel, Reuters Plus, Bloomberg, public finance/business news websites is desired. 
I-Star familiarity. 
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 


Ici, pour vous. 

À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde. 

En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences. 

Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr . 

BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Des mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour demander des mesures d’adaptation, veuillez communiquer avec votre recruteur. 

Remarque aux recruteurs : BMO n’accepte pas les curriculum vitæ non sollicités provenant de toute source autre que le candidat directement. Tout curriculum vitæ non sollicité envoyé à BMO, directement ou indirectement, sera considéré comme la propriété de BMO. BMO ne paiera aucuns frais pour les placements découlant de la réception d’un curriculum vitæ non sollicité. Une agence de recrutement doit d’abord détenir une entente de service écrite valide et dûment signée avant d’envoyer des curriculum vitæ.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Cognos Analytics
Description:
To help in our planned growth, we are pro-actively recruiting for a Business Intelligence Analyst for upcoming opportunities specific to the Cognos Analytics platform. The BI Analyst will be a key member of our IT Professional Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.
 Key Responsibilities:

 Conduct business requirements gathering and analysis, identify datasets to support analytics initiatives and expand the existing data warehouse.
 Collaborate with the BI team in detailed design including dynamic reports, executive dashboards, and information portals.
 Work with client stakeholders to support a BI environment that is critical for future decision making and evaluation.
 Review the existing architecture and data feeds and investigate the best approach to incorporate direct calls to source databases.
 Create reports in Cognos and provide Cognos Analytics support & training to data management staff.
 Ensure solutions meet the information, functionality, and performance needs of targeted users through testing

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
PRICING ANALYST


Cavendish Farms is a leading producer of frozen food products for retail and foodservice markets throughout Canada, the United States, and around the world. We have state-of-the-art potato processing plants in Prince Edward Island, Lethbridge, Alberta, and Jamestown, North Dakota, and an appetizer plant in Wheatley, Ontario. Our Head office is in Dieppe, New Brunswick and has sales office locations in Toronto, Montreal, and Boston.


Reporting to the Manager, Pricing Analytics, the successful candidate must thrive in a fast paced, ever changing environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism, accuracy and detail.

 The Pricing Analyst will be responsible for evaluating sales opportunities through the completion of a P&L. In addition will support the Pricing department in determining new pricing solutions, providing analysis on existing business to optimize profitability, and oversee the on-going maintenance and improvement of existing pricing tools.


Successful Candidate will possess the following qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Finance or Accounting;
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience;
Certified Pricing Professional designation would be considered an asset;
Demonstrated organizational and time management skills;
Understanding / knowledge in Sales would be an asset;
Strong sense of urgency to complete tasks;
Strong analytical skills;
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
High attention to detail;
Strong computer skills (Microsoft suite).


 
Key responsibilities:

Responsible for completing Profit & Loss analysis for new sales opportunities and existing business in a timely manner in order to evaluate and analyze the opportunity and/or the current state of business.
Maintain current sales report as well as providing sales analysis and data on an ad hoc basis.
Works with Sales team to identify, create, and implement pricing strategies in order to improve and maximize profitability.
Responsible for the ongoing maintenance and improvement of pricing processes; identifying new pricing initiatives or areas for improved efficiencies.


 
Cavendish Farms is proud to offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including but not limited to:

A flexible health, drug, dental, and vision plan
Employee & Family Assistance Programs
Health & wellness reimbursements, includes gym memberships, fitness classes or online workout programs
Maternity leave top-up program (if applicable)
RRSP matching program
Opportunities to take part in job related training and development as well as 24/7 access to online curated learning
Growth and progression opportunities within Cavendish Farms and the larger network of the JD Irving group of companies
Hybrid Work Schedule (if applicable) to provide you the flexibility to work from home up to 2 days per week


 
For further details, please contact the Talent Acquisition Team at jobs@cavendishfarms.com.


To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please apply online by Sunday July 24th, 2022.


We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


To learn more about our products and services, here.


Cavendish Farms Corporation is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

Our Head office is in Dieppe, New Brunswick and has sales office locations in Toronto, Montreal, and Boston.

 The Pricing Analyst will be responsible for evaluating sales opportunities through the completion of a P&L. In addition will support the Pricing department in determining new pricing solutions, providing analysis on existing business to optimize profitability, and oversee the on-going maintenance and improvement of existing pricing tools.


Successful Candidate will possess the following qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Finance or Accounting;
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience;
Certified Pricing Professional designation would be considered an asset;
Demonstrated organizational and time management skills;
Understanding / knowledge in Sales would be an asset;
Strong sense of urgency to complete tasks;
Strong analytical skills;
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
High attention to detail;
Strong computer skills (Microsoft suite).


 
Key responsibilities:

Responsible for completing Profit & Loss analysis for new sales opportunities and existing business in a timely manner in order to evaluate and analyze the opportunity and/or the current state of business.
Maintain current sales report as well as providing sales analysis and data on an ad hoc basis.
Works with Sales team to identify, create, and implement pricing strategies in order to improve and maximize profitability.
Responsible for the ongoing maintenance and improvement of pricing processes; identifying new pricing initiatives or areas for improved efficiencies.

Title: Tableau Visualization / Marketing Analyst
Description:
AcuityAds is a leading technology company that provides marketers with a one-stop solution for omnichannel digital advertising with best-of-category return on advertising spend. Our journey automation technology, illumin™, offers planning, buying and real-time intelligence from one platform. With proprietary Artificial Intelligence, illumin™ brings unique programmatic capabilities to close the gap between advertising planning and execution. AcuityAds is headquartered in Toronto with offices throughout Canada, the U.S., Europe, and Latin America. For more information, visit AcuityAds.com.
AcuityAds currently has a Full-time Permanent position for a* Tableau Visualization / Marketing Analyst* to join our Analytics & Insights team. The successful candidate will be a critical thinker who is familiar with the AdTech/MarTech space, and can provide value by being pro-active in providing programmatic insights to our clients, while maintaining accurate and timely output for existing campaign reports.If you are self-motivated and demonstrate strong interpersonal, technical, and analytical abilities, we want to hear from you!What You Will Do: 

Responsible for the accurate and timely completion of reports for both internal and external stakeholders
Responsible for being a subject matter expert (SME) for designated reports and processes
Investigate reporting based questions from various groups within Acuity and provide clear and concise answers
Support and coach junior reporting analysts by providing insight into core business functions and reporting workflows
Transform data into insightful reporting information (ability to tell the story) with limited guidance
Create dashboard visualizations for reporting and ad hoc requests
Provide scenario analysis and proposed workflows for changes to existing processes
Document requirements and summarize information related to internal operational and business processes
Understand reporting objectives and deliver insights and commentary that can inform and shape product design and development and business decision making
Collect, analyze and synthesize incomplete information from disparate sources into a clear and compelling story

What You Will Need: 

3-5 years’ experience in data analytics and report management
Completion of college or post-secondary diploma/degree in the field of Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, Economics, Engineering or related field
3+ years of advanced Excel experience, with demonstrated experience in creating reports & dashboards using pivot tables and charts, plus leveraging statistical & nested functions
Expert knowledge of Tableau (Certification is a bonus) or other business intelligence tools
Familiarity with Salesforce reporting/dashboarding desired
Understanding of the Adtech ecosystem and the working of programmatic advertising is a major advantage.
Familiarity of media measurement tools including 3rd party ad serving, syndicated research and web analytics, such as ComScore, DoubleClick, Google Analytics, etc. is a bonus
Familiarity of technical integrations and data structures used to support digital properties.
Proven experience consolidating and analyzing data sources to create insightful business intelligence
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills
Strong attention to detail, superior organizational and time management skills
Ability to support team members and take direction from senior team members and management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated sense of curiosity and ability to ask the right questions, self motivated.
Knowledge of SQL or Python for data analysis would be considered an asset

What You Will Get: 

An inspiring and family-focused culture with offices around the world
A competitive compensation package
Comprehensive health and dental benefits including life and disability insurance
An unlimited vacation policy
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan
Time with our executive coach and Chief Empowerment Officer to assist in your growth and professional development
Participation in our Employee Recognition Awards program
An annual education and learning stipend
Corporate rates and perks including fitness membership discounts
We live and promote our company's values: Act with integrity, Never settle, Design to disrupt, Customer-Driven, Family-focused

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
About Upfeat Media
Upfeat Media is a content technology company that focuses on commerce content. This commerce content ranges from online shopping guides to coupons, deals, and rewards. With our software and services, some of the world's biggest online newspaper and magazine companies use our software to open revenue opportunities in the e-commerce space. As one of Canada's fastest-growing companies for the past 2 years, we are looking for an insightful and dedicated Quantitative Analyst to join our team and help us build quantitative models and client analytics tools that will guide us along our growth trajectory.
What You’ll Be Doing
Upfeat Media wishes to hire a Quantitative Analyst who has experience in developing performance measurement indicators and tracking progress toward targets. You will collect and analyze internal and external data in the e-commerce and consumer goods space and develop tools and models to identify growth opportunities and propose recommendations/solutions that align with the company's strategic direction.
As a member of the Upfeat Media team, we are looking for someone who thrives in a technology-focused company and loves learning and experimenting with new ideas. We are also looking for someone who loves pushing themselves to achieve bigger and better things. We are a small company trying to do big things and every person counts.
Please note, that while our head office is based in Canada, the Quantitative Analyst role is remote.
*Your main responsibilities will include: *

Designing, implementing, and supporting quantitative models across multiple consumer goods categories
Supporting and assisting with the development and maintenance of codebase as required
Research and development of macroeconomic ecommerce forecasts and signals
Helping team members make well-informed decisions


Liaising with internal teams to provide market insights

Qualifications: 

Strong research and development skills and proficiency with computational based analysis


Excellent problem solving, analytical/critical thinking and communication skills


A positive team player who is extremely tech-savvy


A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or Physics


2-3 years' work experience in quantitative analysis, data analysis, machine learning, coding, and/or econometrics

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Supply Chain Planning Analyst (12 Month Contract)
Description:
Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies is recruiting for a Supply Chain Planning Analyst 12-month contract role. This position is located in Markham, ON Canada. 
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies have been working to make surgery better for more than a century. With substantial breadth and depth in surgical technologies, orthopedic and interventional solutions, we aspire to improve and enhance medical care for people worldwide. Together, we are working to shape the future of health through differentiated products and services. 
Position Summary: 
As a Supply Chain Planning Analyst, you will play a key role in Sales & Operations Planning Process to ensure continuous supply of finished goods for the assigned portfolio from multiple global supply locations to meet service level expectations and inventory goals. Locally you will work cross-functionally in with Sales, Marketing, Distribution, Finance, Customer Service, Regulatory & Quality teams. Globally you are the key linkage point to the Global Planning organizations ensuring End-to-End visibility and synchronicity through the supply chain.
You will also implement cycles in the S&OP Cycle (Demand Review, Supply Review) and will contribute to the maturity of the S&OP process towards IBP (Integrated Business Planning).
Responsibilities:

Lead the regional S&OP process aligning communications between Commercial and Supply Chain partners and ensuring connectivity with Business Planning process.
Drive demand planning, supply planning and inventory planning processes for responsible specific franchise platforms
Owns all critical metrics related to product portfolio (Including OTIF, forecast accuracy, SLOB, and BO etc)
Review statistical forecast generated and provide input on changes that may be required. Collaborate with functions such as Sales, Marketing, Commercial Operations, and Finance to identify and incorporate market intelligence (events) into the demand forecast as aligned
Proactively identify and resolve directly or through business partnership any issue affecting the product flow
Collaborate with global franchise on projects affecting the product portfolio and/or the supply network
Partner with Field Assets Management team to find opportunities and implement solutions for field assets management optimization - if applicable
Ensure solid partnership and end to end alignment with key functions: commercial organizations, local and regional supply chain organizations (Plan, Make, Source), CLS, Quality, Regulatory Affairs and Product Management
Build the SOPs for key working process in planning stream.


Qualifications
 Required:

Education background: Bachelor’s Degree or above 
Minimum 3 Years work experience in supply chain
Experience with Demand/Supply/Inventory Planning systems and processes, preferably SAP APO
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with a passion for continuous improvement
Strong communication skill in both verbal and written forms

Preferred:

APICS certification (CSCP/CPIM) is an asset
Healthcare sector experience is an asset
Proficient in advanced analytics and data visualization software design and usage (i.e. Power BI)
Motivated teammate with the ability to collaborate and engage with multiple partners
Highly developed organizational skills – able to handle multiple high priority tasks/projects concurrently
Solutions focused orientation with a bias for action
Ability to work autonomously with limited supervision

At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through innovative programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.
For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

Title: Business Analyst
Company: The Plan Office of the IWA-Forest Industry Pension & LTD Plans
Description:
WHO WE ARE
Established to support Canadian forestry workers and their families, the IWA–Forest Industry Pension and LTD Plans provide members pension and disability benefits and rehabilitation services.
With over $4.7 billion in assets, 400+ participating employers and 65,000 members, the IWA–Forest Industry Pension Plan is one of Canada’s top 100 pension funds and is one of the top three private pension funds in BC. The IWA–Forest Industry LTD Plan was created almost a decade after the pension plan, and now serves over 8,500 members across western Canada.
The plans are intended to supplement government retirement benefits and provide financial protection in the event of illness and injury. They are a valuable part of members’ financial security in retirement and beyond. Both plans are administered by the Plan Office, which manages plan assets and benefits. At the Plan Office, our members are our number one priority. We take pride in offering exceptional service—whether we’re dealing with members, participating employers, union locals or each other.
Working at the Plan Office, you’ll enjoy generous health and pension benefits, an inclusive, close-knit work culture that supports work-life balance, and opportunities to engage in ongoing training and development.
WE OFFER

Full range of benefits include vision, extended health, dental, Health Spending Account
Defined contribution pension plan
Company sponsored staff appreciation day, Christmas party and social events
Three weeks’ vacation to start
Transit/parking subsidy
Central Burnaby location close to transit
Plus much more….

WHO YOU ARE
The Business Analyst (BA) is a systems generalist with a solid operational knowledge of business processes and systems. You understand business functions and processes from end to end; including the system, data generated and used, and the interactions with other systems and processes. The position is the intermediary between the business and the various support teams, leading, collecting, clarifying and translating business requirements into documentation and designs from which solutions are delivered.
Along with a passion for documenting processes and procedures, you will be responsible for:

Project coordination
Data analysis and reporting
Gathering and writing business and systems requirements
Testing, validation and release changes to the system as required
Development and delivery of training as required
Primary contact for internal and external auditors

YOU HAVE/ARE

Bachelor’s degree preferred in information systems, business management, computer science, or related discipline, plus three or more years of experience in a business analyst role; or an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Experience working with relational databases (Oracle Database) and application framework (Oracle Forms & Reports).
In-depth knowledge of SQL and ability to write complex SQL queries.
In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Excel and ability to write macros.
Familiarly with industry framework (COBIT, ITIL, NIST, etc.)
Excellent written, verbal communication and interpersonal skills together with a customer service focus and a professional and respectful approach towards all levels of the organization.
Strong planning and organizational skills with the ability to balance competing priorities and effectively deal with changing situations or priorities.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
The IWA—Forest Industry Pension and LTD Plans are responsible for the management and protection of large amounts of confidential information. All employees are expected to understand the requirements of and act in accordance with provincial privacy laws, as well as to adhere to internal controls and policies to ensure confidential information is not revealed to or distributed or discussed with anyone other than as required to perform the duties of the position.
We thank you for your application; however, only successful applicants will be contacted.
HOW TO APPLY
Please forward your resume with cover letter before Friday, July 22, 2022.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $70,000.00-$90,000.00 per year
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: Senior Associate Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Associate Risk Data Analyst - 0003T9
  



 Posting Date: Jul 7, 2022, 2:15:01 PM
 

 Primary Location: Ontario-Ottawa
 

 Job Type: Permanent
 

 Schedule: Full-time
 


 EDC is Canada’s export credit agency, offering information, knowledge and innovative commercial solutions to help Canadian exporters and investors expand their international business. We take on risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world.
When you join our team, you’ll be helping Canadian companies bring their vision, passion and innovation to the global marketplace. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 25,000 Canadian companies and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. You’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And you’ll know that you’re making a difference every day—for companies, for Canada and for the people you work with.
Year after year, EDC has been recognized as a Top 100 and Top Family-Friendly Employer. #LI-Hybrid
Overview
Within the Risk Quantification group, the primary function of Risk Data & Analytics (RD&A) is Risk Data Aggregation and Risk Reporting (RDARR). Risk data is comprised of exposure data across all lines of business, plus all the associated risk properties and reporting attributes.
To perform its core function, RD&A must first undertake the complex subordinate function of bringing all of the risk data together and performing its certification value stream, which includes:

Data sourcing
Rigorous daily monitoring
Data quality analysis
Proactive data integrity detection
Reconciliation, validation, and correction of errors
Imposition/reinforcement of business rules
Application of retroactive adjustments
Manual repair of system integration failures
Consolidation across all product lines
Harmonization of consolidated data
Ownership, maintenance, and governance of risk properties
Controlled joining to reference data
Certification, publication, audit, and provision of support
Standardized, customized, and ad hoc reporting.

The Senior Associate Risk Data Analyst in Risk Data & Analytics requires experience working with large and complex datasets, sourcing and joining data from various sources/databases. Additionally, they require the ability to assess data quality while both recommending and implementing changes to improve it.
Discipline Summary

Executes and develops complex procedures in function of a large-scale information infrastructure;
Is involved in the post-assessment reporting as well as the aggregation of potential risks for the organization, facilitating priority setting as well as improving decision-making;
Executes and improves data certification procedures;
Produces and shares risk data across the organization to support risk-informed decision making and inform business strategy;
Communicates information regarding business risks with functions across the organization.

Key Responsibilities

Extensively monitors and governs the risk properties associated with EDC’s transactional data as subject matter expert;
Produces operational and ad-hoc reporting for the target audience of EDC management in Risk Quantification, Enterprise Risk Management, Accounting, Internal Audit, the Risk Management Committee, and for submission to Corporate Plan and annual Financial Statements;
Investigates and resolves discrepancies with critical risk data and reports;
Researches and implements improvements to data certification procedures, tools and reports;
Participates in various data governance initiatives and supports the implementation of governance methodologies;
Performs analytics and assist in the creation of reports and dashboards;
Assists in the review of critical risk reports.

Screening Criteria

Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related relevant discipline
Minimum 2 years of experience of data analysis, business intelligence, data quality and governance or related experience.
Experience with advanced MS Excel
Experience with VBA
Experience with SQL
Knowledge of Quality Assurance / Quality Control Methodologies

Assets

Bilingual in both official languages (English & French)
Experience with Denodo
Experience with Power BI
Experience with Python
Knowledge of business analysis and risk management principles and practices

Salary Range

$64,100 - $96,100, plus performance-based incentive




How to apply 


Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


 Application deadline on www.edc.ca/careers : Jul 22, 2022, 10:59:00 PM
  
 EDC is committed to employment equity and actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities. If selected for an interview, please advise us if you require special accommodation.
  

 Candidates must meet the requisite government security screening requirements.

Title: GPO Analytics Analyst
Description:
Job Description


 The GPO Analytics Analyst mainly supports Complete Purchasing Services (CPS) in sales performance reports, month-end close reports and reconciliations, business analytics, and monthly reports. This role closely works with regional VPs of Operation in collection, interpretation, and presentation of the data available from various sources




 Job Responsibilities



 Manage client incentive accrual model including actual payments, projection, rates, spend and groupings. This requires assembling data from multiple sources, organizing and matching data to the model elements and adjusting the model as per VPOs feedback.
 Prepare quarterly sales realization report that compares annualized sales estimates to realized sales performance.
 Perform monthly spend analytics and provide various levels of assessment, then draw meaningful conclusions to present to senior management
 Prepare monthly performance reporting and dashboard report and support monthly Global Procurement Organization (GPO) call with organizing data and analyzing trends, anomalies, and patterns. Prepares quarterly sales performance analytics.
 Support ad-hoc financial and performance reporting requests for CPS Management Team, Finance team, and CPS/Gespra Key Account Managers as required.

 Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, data analytics, and engineering background
 3-5 years of data analytics experiencing of drawing insights and developing action plan from data
 Advanced Excel skills and ability to develop reports as requested
 Strong communication skill and ability to simplify complex information
 Ability to take initiative to deliver result and resolve issues
 Accounting designation is an asset

 Education
