Title: Analyst Business Information
Description:
Posting End Date:
  July 11, 2022
 

   Employee Type:
  Regular-Full time
 

   Union/Non:
  This is a non-union position
 

   We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Information Analyst to join the customer-focused and innovative Energy Services Business Applications team!
 


   We are looking for a motivated individual who enjoys interacting with customers, solving problems, and collaborating with others.
 


   Do you have strong communication skills with a focus on providing outstanding customer experiences? If so, we would love to hear from you - apply today!
 


   Who We Are
 

   Our purpose is to provide safe, reliable, sustainable energy that fuels people's quality of life. We deliver the energy people need and want—to heat their homes, to keep their lights on, to keep them mobile and connected.
 


   We welcome new team members where everyone is committed to helping each other get the job done, while feeling valued and appreciated for your efforts. We are guided by our values of Safety, Integrity, Respect, and Inclusion. These values help us to establish trust with our people, customers, and the hundreds of communities we serve across North America. We believe strongly in supporting the communities where we live and operate—by giving back and contributing to their strength and vitality.
 


   What You Will Do
 

 Improve customer experience by providing timely, courteous, and knowledgeable customer service functions.
 Validate and execute customer data and access requests in accordance with standard methodologies, policies and controls.
 Perform functional and data validations to maintain customer-facing application integrity, quality and reliability.
 Develop, maintain, and deliver internal and external training.
 Act as a technical liaison with internal clients on behalf of customers; assist in the development of business support solutions and provide technical guidance.



   Who You Are
 

   You will have the following:
 

 A related university degree or college diploma with limited experience. An equivalent combination of formal education and experience may be considered.
 Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills and proven Customer Service experience.
 Proven dedication to teamwork in a customer-focused environment.
 Ability to perform multiple work assignments with a high degree of accuracy.
 Ability to think innovatively and creatively.
 Strong analytical, investigative, and problem-solving abilities. Additional technical investigation experience is highly desired.
 Experience with data querying tools is considered an asset.
 Experience in business-to-business contract fulfillment processes is desired.
 Knowledge of the Enerline application would be an asset.



   Flex Work
 

   Enbridge provides competitive workplace programs that differentiate us and offer flexibility to our team members. Enbridge’s FlexWork (Hybrid Work Model) offers eligible employees the opportunity to work variable daily schedules with a flexible start and end time, to opt for a compressed workweek schedule, and the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. Role requirements determine your eligibility for each option or combination of options.
 

   #LI-Hybrid
 


   Diversity and inclusion are important to us. Enbridge is an
  


   Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer
  . We are committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to age, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, veteran status, Indigenous/Native American status, or disability. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats, communication supports, or other accessibility assistance by contacting 
  
   careers@enbridge.com
  .
 


   Information For Applicants:
 

 Applications can be submitted via our online recruiting system only.
 We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
 Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.

Job Duties/Qualifications, Skills and Abilities(QSA)



     Job Duties 
    





Job Duties


        Reporting to the Manager, IT PPM and Relationships the Business Analyst is a highly specialized position with a responsibility to ensure the operational efficacy and high level of service excellence of Information Technology Services. The Business Analyst provides strategic business analysis services to business partners. The focus of this position is to work closely with Sask Polytech’s academic and administrative units to gain in-depth understanding of the business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates. This role is key to documenting the Information Technology capabilities needed to address business challenges. The Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial, and technological risks and to identify opportunities to improve efficiency. The Business Analyst leads key activities including eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business, organizational, and / or Information Technology operational requirements, and related business rules to determine best solutions to client business needs, plans, and objectives.
       







     QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND EXPERIENCE 
    





Specific Accountabilities






Duties






Required Qualifications, Skills and Abilities (QSA)


        1. Two year diploma in Business, Communications, or Information Technology
         or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience (foreign education must have Canadian equivalency certification) and a Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or able to attain within 2 years
         2. 5 years of progressive experience within an enterprise information technology environment.
         3. Demonstrated expert knowledge in two or more IT areas – including, but not limited to:
         a. Project Management
         b. Portfolio Governance
         c. Business Analysis
         d. Software Development Lifecycle
         e. Application development frameworks and methodologies
         f. Information Technology infrastructure implementation projects
         g. Change Management
         4. Strong written and oral communication skills Demonstrated experience in creating, planning and executing testing strategies and in leading the business SMEs through the process of User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
         5. Effective organizational and time management skills. The ability to work in extremely stressful, time critical conditions and make accountable decisions.
         6. Working knowledge of ITS policies, procedures, and frameworks including data and application security, information privacy, and regulatory and compliance regulations for business processes.
         7. Ability to work independently on multiple initiatives and manage priorities and deadlines.
         8. Strong interpersonal and team skills with a demonstrated ability to lead, collaborate and work well in teams with a high level of initiative and motivation.
         9. Values diversity.
       




Desired QSA

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

    The Business Banking Data Governance & Analytics group is responsible for stewardship of all data requirements for Business Banking, including the development and implementation of a data strategy in line with Enterprise standards & policies.
    
 The group supports Business Banking product and sales teams in the areas of data analytics, performance measurement, business intelligence and reporting.
    
 The group also develops and executes policies, practices and procedures that properly manage the business's data needs and adhere to data governance standards as set out by Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO)
   


Job Description

    Reporting to the Senior Manager, the incumbent is accountable as Data Analyst to support the data activities of migration of legacy system to nCino Platform. They will work closely with the Business Bank's Data Steward (DS) Product owner, Business Analysts, Business System Analysts to understand the migration requirements.
    
 Accountabilities Include:
    

Collaborate with Data Modeler, System Analysts and Business Data owners to do Source to Target mapping (STM) for the conversion team.
Hands on developing queries for data profiling and data quality assessment
Developing queries to support the ad-hoc request that support the migration, functional and integration PODs
Understand data structures being modified and created across the projects and conduct lineage / reverse-engineering to understanding impacts to existing DG&A Artefacts (i.e. Reporting, Analytics)
Collaborate with project team to verify business data test cases scenarios covers data quality meeting data requirements; create new test cases if required. High level verification of the quality data in lower environments.
Facilitate and document current data state and future data target states to ensure effects of data are understood and communicated across all project stakeholders
Work effectively with multiple teams across a broad spectrum of initiatives and functional domains, influencing and aligning others as needed.
Participate fully as a member of the Business Bank's Data Governance & Analytics team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues;
Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce




Job Requirements

Seasoned data Analyst with proven ability to develop queries, reconcile migration reports , create source to target mapping documents
Hands-on experience working with SQL language to carry-on daily data profiling and data quality is considered an asset
Experience in working on data conversion and integration projects or large scale, complex technology projects using formal project delivery methodology;
Knowledge of Business Bank data and systems considered an asset including Salesforce/nCino
Knowledge of platform and data warehouse design and principles is considered an asset
Knowledge and experience in Agile projects, Jira and confluence tools is considered an asset
Excellent relationship management skills.
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.
Strong organizational awareness.
Strong attention to detail and well-organized to manage large amounts of information and details
Superior negotiation and creative problem-solving skills



Additional Information

Flex Time & Flex Place  At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Health Information Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 317910
Position Number: 20044379
Posting End Date: July 15, 2022
City: Winnipeg
Site: WRHA Corporate
Work Location: Winnipeg Corporate
Department / Unit: Health Information Services - WRHA
Job Stream: Non-Clinical
Union: EXEMPT-OT
Anticipated Start Date: 08/01/2022
FTE: 1.00
Anticipated Shift: Days
Daily Hours Worked: 7.75
Annual Base Hours: 2015


Grow your career in the Winnipeg Health Region! Our team provides a spectrum of health care services through an integrated network of sites, services and organizations. We’re united by a shared commitment to excellent and equitable health care.



 Position Overview


 Health Information Services provides leadership in the planning, development, implementation and maintenance of systems, standards, policies and processes for health information to meet the needs of patient & client service providers as well as the legal and administrative needs of the Service Delivery Organization (SDOs) acute, continuing care and community sectors.
Main Function 

Facilitate the analysis, redesign and documentation of processes including business flow, current and future state, gap analysis to ensure acceptance and compliance as it relates to registration, health records and client data integrity within the Service Delivery Organization (SDO).
Perform data analysis, information management and training for electronic source systems and ensure compliance with regional health information standards to improve patient and visit information integrity.
Identify needs and develop or participate in the development of regional and departmental policies, procedures, and standards to support data integrity.
Facilitate training for new and existing users within Health Information Services on current and/or enhancements in the Electronic Patient Record (EPR), Electronic Medical Record (EMR), Chart Tracking, etc. source systems and train on systems and workflow processes to Health Information Services staff within the region; including in the acute, community and continuing care. 
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders such as Digital Health, health care providers, staff in the Health Information Services departments within the SDO to identify data integrity concerns; investigate, participate in review, and provide advice on potential solutions to improve the quality of the data.





Experience



5 years of experience in a Health Information Services environment with a focus on health information management systems including registration and records management applications. 
3 years of progressive experience working in an analytical role with a focus on promotion of data quality, data integrity and process review.
2 years of experience with a variety of system data, collection tools, analysis and reporting such as Business Objects, SQL, and Cognos is an asset.





Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)



Post-secondary certificate or diploma in health information management, health administration, management or business administration, or related from an accredited post-secondary education institution.


 
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. 




Certification/Licensure/Registration



Active membership in the Canadian Health Information Management Association (CHIMA).





Qualifications and Skills



Demonstrated mid-level leadership capabilities. The provincial health system in Manitoba has adopted the LEADS in a Caring Environment framework.
Knowledge of software and information system applications (e.g. Electronic Patient Record (EPR), Admission Discharge Transfer (ADT) system, Electronic Medical Record (EMR), Chart Tracking, Scheduling, etc.) is considered an asset. 





Physical Requirements



Must be able to work safely in a typical computerized office environment with frequent meetings at multiple sites throughout the organization, and to lift and carry items of up to approximately 10 kg.
Interruptions to respond to questions are common; incumbent can schedule dedicated and focused time for planning and concentration.
Travel throughout the province requiring a valid Manitoba driver’s license and use of a personal motor vehicle.




This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.


Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions across the WRHA legal entity that combine to equal more than 1.0 EFT. The WRHA legal entity includes Churchill Health Centre, Deer Lodge Centre, Grace Hospital, Middlechurch Home of Winnipeg, Pan Am Clinic, River Park Gardens, Victoria General Hospital, WRHA corporate programs, and WRHA community health services.


Interviewed candidates may be called upon to participate in a skills assessment.


Any application received after the closing time will not be included in the competition.


We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

Title: Market Research Analyst (Full-Time) - Zonda Urban
Description:
Market Research Analyst  Full-Time (Toronto, ON)
 Zonda Home Canada is redefining the future of housing. We are the parent company of Zonda Urban and perfectly placed in the heart of the fast-growing real estate industry. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Here at Zonda, you’ll be able to use your passion and curiosity to drive the next generation of real estate analysts, advisors, and technologists. Zonda is looking for a passionate Market Research Analyst to evolve and expand our team.

 Zonda looks for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. When you join our team, you’ll be in a unique position to make a change with every project. You’ll use your full range of skills to build great experiences and learn about the real estate industry, economics, and data. You’ll be supported with the necessary tools, and you'll be working with an awesome and like-minded team. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary, and collaborative - all working to build the future of housing.

 Who We Are
 Zonda Urban | Zonda Home Canada Inc. is a market-leading research and advisory firm specializing in the collection and analysis of new multi-family residential development data in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Zonda Urban strives to provide a dynamic and team-oriented work environment that offers team-members the opportunity to grow their knowledge and experience within the organization.

 We are looking for someone with positive energy, a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn and grow in the position of Market Research Analyst. Reporting to the Senior Market Analysts and the principals of Zonda Urban, the Market Research Analyst is responsible for assisting with a variety of tasks related to the collection and maintenance of new multi-family home project data in Zonda Urban's proprietary NHSLive data product, and to provide support for our advisory services


 What You’ll Do
 In this role, you will be responsible for:

Collect data on new condominium and townhome projects and newer rental apartment developments throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area using primary and secondary research methods;
Assist with inputting data and relevant information collected from all monitored multi-family projects into Zonda Urban’s NHSLive data platform;
Identify and monitor the pre-launch marketing of all new multi-family projects;
Monitor new rental/multi-family development applications submitted to municipal planning departments throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area, and input/update data on NHSLive;
Monitor economic indicators relevant to the new multi-family development industry as required; and,
Provide general support for data products and advisory


Who You Are

Working knowledge of Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area
Background in real estate, geography, housing, economics, urban studies are preferred
Strong interest in and desire to learn about the residential real estate market and development industry
Organized and resourceful with strong research skills/abilities and work ethic
Ease of use of spreadsheet and primary data analysis software
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment
Have received or are working towards Post-Secondary degree or diploma in related fields of business
Candidate must have a valid driver’s license, access to a vehicle and be willing to travel. (Driving expenses incurred will be reimbursed)
Excellent interpersonal and social skills
At ease communicating with the public in person, phone, email, etc.
A positive and team-first attitude



 Why People Love Working Here

We offer meaningful work and opportunities for career growth
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive benefit package (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Paid vacation and general holidays
Education Allowance
Employee & Family Assistance Program (EFAP)



 Inclusion & Equal Opportunity Employment
 We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion & belonging. People seeking employment at Zonda Home Canada Inc. are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

 Require an Accommodation? We’re here to help
 We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to jlata@zondahome.com. We are committed to work with you to best meet your needs.

Title: PLM Business Analyst
Description:
We are Industry X: We embed innovation, intelligence and sustainability in the way the world makes things and the things it makes. Industry X enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. We define Industry X as digital reinvention of manufacturing / engineering and believe that smart, sustainable, connected digital products and assets are about to create hyper-personalized industrial experiences, completely new levels of operational efficiency, transparency and traceability, tangible impact on sustainability and brand-new sources of revenue growth. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology.

 Responsibilities of the PLM Business Analyst may include:

 Participate in requirements gathering and specifications creation
 Participate in the solution design, helping the solution architect
 Participate in specification workshops
 Develop functional specifications
 Participate in the Business process design
 Participate in industry /corporate process implementation across all related applications
 Successfully supporting the management team in different project area
 Deployment: Troubleshoot complex configuration and system issues. Document and follow up with customer issues to complete resolution
 Implementation: Prepare and support the organizational change management activities. Prepare training plan, training documentation and provide end users training.
 Documentation: Document the configuration and architecture
 Validation Tests: Conduct functional and integration testing, including preparation of test cases/scenarios and test data
 Reporting: Progress status and issues
 Maintenance: Analyze, design and produce solution enhancements
 Meet travel requirements, up to 80%
 Perform feasibility studies and process design reviews




Basic Qualifications:


 Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or related degree
 Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) concepts and solutions


 Preferred Qualifications:

 Business Process Design Experience
 Tests management / execution experience
 Aerospace & Defense experience
 Mechanical and/or Electrical Engineering concepts and solutions
 Ability to understand business needs, articulate trade-offs, and discuss solutions with business and development teams
 Able to comfortably manage multiple tasks, communicate status, escalate issues and juggle competing priorities
 Strong team player with a “can do” attitude, and the flexibility to jump in wherever needed
 Self-starter with a bias toward action and the ability to produce results
 Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
 Collaboration skills

Title: Fall Intern - Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Field:
    

New Graduate / Student




     Job Type:
    

Internship/Co-op





Who are we?
 BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 7,200 globally, we focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses.
 Through our shared values, we focus on building a sustainable future, diversity and belonging, and providing continuous learning and development.


 What will you gain as a student or new graduate?

Mentoring Experience

Industry and Client Experience
Future Leaders Program

 Fall Intern – Business Intelligence


 The goal of our Business Intelligence Analytics team is to address clients’ demand for analytical insights that drive action-based decision-making. This role will provide end-user support to effectively use business intelligence applications to fulfill business objectives. In this role, you will help prepare reports, troubleshoot applications and aid in acquisition related activities such as data conversions.
 The BI team is currently undergoing a transformation within the business. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to add value in dashboard design and overall improvements to the BI platform.
 Start Date: September 2022
 End Date: December 2022
 Location: Remote


 KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Work on BI tool development and information automation – using MS office tools, PowerBI and other tools.
Work with operation teams to define needs, identify opportunities and project manage the implementation of new solutions.
Work with Project Management and Facility Management teams to help them understand dashboard reports and determine root cause of failures.
Conduct data analytics reports – outlier and trend reporting, etc.
Provide recommendations for process improvement, benchmarking and report automation..
Able to develop documentation for training and end user procedures.
Training of new processes and tools (includes written work instructions and verbal/WEB based training).
Project management – executive update, action item tracking.



 KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Knowledge of trends in technology relating to software applications, such as Database tools, Snowflake (web-based data warehouse), MS office tools, PowerBI and others.
Currently working towards College or University degree in Computer Science, Data & Analytics, Engineering, Information Management, or other relevant fields.
Highly analytical and understand the basic principles of working with complex data sets.
Able to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations.
Ability to work with a team towards common goals.
Able to manage multiple projects and priorities.
Self-starter who is comfortable working with and presenting to all management levels and client.
Excellent written and oral communication including ability to communicate with users with various technical backgrounds.
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.
Attention to details.
Ability to work well under pressure.

Title: RPA Business Analyst
Description:
Job Description: 
Seeking an experience RPA business analyst to support process optimization and enhancement of new processes as well as scoping and implementation of new use cases on existing robots. The RPA business analyst will create and update process design documents, document user stories in the team JIRA board. The RPA business analyst will work closely with the RPA developers and the business SMEs to prepare RPA requirements and documentation.
Responsibilities: 

Elicit, document and analyze current state solution from the existing documentation and in workshops with business SMEs


Based on the analysis of the current state, policy and legislative constraints, and business needs identified by business SMEs, define and document future state requirements in a variety of interim and prescribed artefacts, such as PPDs, use cases, user stories, business rules, data dictionary, workflows and data analytics, issue or option papers


Validate requirements with assigned business resources


Raise any issues requiring further investigation and/or business decisions


Provide business analysis expertise and support to aid decision making by conducting in-depth analysis, summarizing, and providing recommendations.


Manage requirements through various stages, including traceability and linkage between different deliverables while using SharePoint Online as a requirement repository


Creation of Business Process Design document (PDD)


Contribute to the Process Solution Design Document


Facilitate the testing of Automated Process


Assist in the triage for defects

Requirements: Knowledge & Skills: 

3+ years of experience in an Robotic Process Automation Business Analyst/ Developer role


3+ years’ Citizen Development experience using UiPath Clould (Orchestrator, Task Capture, Test Manager, Action Center, Automation Hub, Insights, OCR, Document Understanding) with relevant technical or Process analysis, design and development experience

Title: Manufacturing Analyst
Description:
Who We Are: 
Vista is the industry leader in personalized physical and digital products. We empower over 17 million global customers to make an impression – and we’re fueled by forward-thinking and innovative technology. Just last year, Vistaprint generated $1.508B in revenue through customized print products, signage, apparel, websites and more.
 
About the Role:
 You will be responsible for tracking and analyzing trends for Vistaprint Windsor’s global manufacturing and logistics operations. You will work closely with the Operations, Logistics, Supply Chain, Engineering and Financial Teams, applying strong analytical skills to define problems, form hypotheses, gather and analyze data and make recommendations. Types of detailed analyses will include but are not limited to shipping costs, labour costs, throughput time, scheduling optimization, customer complaints, etc.

 What You Will Do:

 Recommend targets, monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) for manufacturing and logistics.
 Respond in a timely manner to ad-hoc analytic requests from the plant for data, analysis and reports
 Work with global partners on exploratory data analysis as well as implementation, monitoring and reporting of approved initiatives
 Share and learn best practices with other Plant Analytics teams globally
 Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior analysts and analyst support staff
 Become the in-house expert in the use of company databases and other data sources for manufacturing and logistics analytics
 Become the in-house expert on Viper optimization and act as a liaison between the Viper software developers and the plant staff
 Work with BI to improve relevant data collection and exposure


 What You Need:

 3+ years of technical, analytical work experience in a related field
 Bachelor or master’s degree in computer science or engineering field
 Solid understanding and experience with analytical tools / languages such as SQL, R, Microsoft BI tools, Qlikview, Tableau, Snowflake, Looker or other similar tools
 Advance level knowledgeable in Excel (pivot tables, macros, VBA)
 Strong understanding of statistical inference
 Confidence communicating openly with stakeholders in a growing global organization
 Confidence presenting to peers and cross-functional teams at all levels of the organization
 Intense curiosity, ability to learn quickly and apply new tools and techniques
 Passion to identify and define problems/solutions
 Drive to work with business owners to improve performance
 Integrity, attention to detail, interpersonal skills and ability to manage projects
 Ability to multi-task and excellent problem-solving skills


 About Us: 
As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth – for both our customers and our team.

 Equal Opportunity Employer: 
Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires

 Financial analysis and/or pricing experience rewarded
  Analyze, monitor, and communicate trends in our loan pricing results. You’ll develop a deep understanding of markets, work with sales to incorporate local strategies into pricing, and create easy ways to showcase results, to aid in senior management decision making.

Title: Inventory Analyst
Description:
Inventory Analyst
General Description
We are looking for an Inventory Analyst who is highly analytical, comfortable dealing with large sets of data and thinks outside the box. The perfect fit would be someone that knows the fundamentals of planning, inventory management and inventory allocation. The role of the Inventory Analyst is to manage inventory items and control day to day inventory operations. Attention to detail, exceptional organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills are necessary for this role.
Responsibilities

Process Stock Returns analysis and coordinate returns to core vendors as per established schedule.
Analyze and maintain stock levels as per the organization criteria with respect of stock requirements.
Work with the Supply Chain group.
Following any discrepancies between physical and system recorded inventory.
Maintain system pricing up to date and perform sales pricing analysis.
Valid items creation and update information in the company’s operating systems.
Work with warehouse and logistics departments to determine and set up inventory transfers.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Work experience requirements

Intermediate Excel skills including experience with macro, Vlookup, pivot tables and advanced formulas.
Bilingual preferred (French and English)
Excellent organization skills
Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills to communicate with all levels of employees, suppliers, and customers (internal and external)
Keen attention to detail and self-motivated

Education requirements

College degree with a specialty in supply chain/inventory management, or equivalent
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Inventory and/or pricing Management & ERP systems

Salary: From $55,000.00 per year

Bonus pay

Dental care

Paid time off
RRSP match

Monday to Friday

macro, Vlookup, pivot tables etc.: 5 years (preferred)
Data mining and analysis: 1 year (preferred)
SQL: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Knowledge and Research Analyst (Intern)
Description:
Company Description
  CAWST is a Canadian charity and licensed engineering firm. We address the global need for safe drinking water and sanitation by building local knowledge and skills on household solutions people can implement themselves.
 At the heart of everything we do is our belief that when people have their basic water and sanitation needs met, they have the opportunity to succeed. This is what drives our dedicated team to work with a global network of more than 1,500 clients and partners. Together, we have reached more than 16 million people since our inception in 2001.
 Collectively, we are making a difference at a scale beyond what any of us could do individually. But our job isn’t done yet and we need you to help us expand our reach.



 Job Description
  The Opportunity
 Do you dream of your work making a difference in the world? CAWST is an international development organization with a focus on Sustainable Development Goal 6 - water and sanitation for all - and we’re looking for an organized, driven and passionate student or recent graduate to support our Water and Sanitation (WASH) practitioners strengthen and grow their program.
 In this role you will:
 1. Support with the improvement and execution on internal monitoring and evaluation systems and processes that help decision-making and communications by:

 Supporting with the design of surveys;
 Leading the administration of survey with clients;
 Coordinating the collection of data to support on-going monitoring and evaluation;
 Leading data cleansing, analysis and interpretation of survey data;
 Preparing summary reports; and
 Supporting CAWST staff to understand monitoring data to help make data driven decisions

 2. Support project evaluation work by:

 Designing monitoring frameworks
 Drafting data collection tools
 Mentoring partners and clients with data collection

 3. Assist in the delivery of CAWST's online courses by:

 Monitoring discussion forums, providing technical assistance
 Providing technical support and troubleshooting
 Supporting with review of online courses

 We don’t expect you to already know how to do all of the above, but do expect you to be a self-starter who has some knowledge of monitoring and evaluation with an ability to interpret data, is passionate about international development and has a strong desire to learn new things!



 Qualifications
  Education

 Pursuing (or recently completed) an undergraduate or graduate degree, in any faculty or program

 Experience and skills

 Passionate and committed about CAWST and our cause - what CAWST does and how we do it
 Enthusiastic about data, possessing a love for digging into details and using data analysis and interpretation to tell the story.
 Interested and experienced with research and analysis techniques with basic knowledge of performance measurement methodologies and evaluation practices
 Organized and motivated young professional, enthusiastic about achieving goals and possessing superior time management and organizational skills
 Self-starter with demonstrated ability to take initiative and seek consultation as needed

 Additional Information
 

 All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada at the time of application.
 This position will be subject to pre-employment anti-terrorism screening.

 Benefits at CAWST

 A meaningful role, making a difference every day for people living without basic water and sanitation
 A workplace culture where collaboration and innovation are fostered
 Rich on-the-job experiences and professional development opportunities
 Attractive, comprehensive compensation package, competitive salary and benefits
 Strong promotion of work-life balance and flexible work environment

 Hybrid Work Environment
 One of CAWST’s principles around our people practises is offering fair and flexible work arrangements to all employees. We understand that the way we do our work has evolved over the recent years and offering flexibility with a blend of in-office and remote work allows the continued balance of driving our mission and vision forward, while supporting our employees’ needs to focus on their life and personal well-being. Currently, employees work from the CAWST office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and are offered the flexibility to choose where they work for the remaining days of the week.

 CAWST values equitable opportunities, sustainable solutions, collaborative and inclusive processes. CAWST recognizes and accepts differences in cultural, religious and political processes.
 We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Primary Locations: Montreal, Quebec
Attendance: Hybrid

Employee Status: Regular


 Schedule: Full-time


 Are you ahead of the curve, agile, curious and creative?
 Do you enjoy analyzing data to better understand when objectives are achieved?
 Do teamwork and challenges motivate you?
 Do you want to work on major projects for the Bank and have a real impact?


   Then keep reading!
 


   As a Senior Data Analyst at National Bank, you will be joining a team of passionate individuals who are striving to change the world of banking. We are client-centric and work on projects to maximize business sector profitability and support decision-making on innovative advanced analytics projects.
 

   You will report to the Marketing Business Intelligence Manager.
  

Your role:


 Serve as a client data expert, develop in-depth knowledge of client and marketing data, and work closely and continuously with the various stakeholders
 Help manage the marketing data ecosystem, including recurring production
 Help define business rules and prepare datasets using reporting tools to make them available, thereby simplifying proactive decision making (e.g., dashboard, analysis, report, model, database)
 Participate in the migration of marketing activities to big data environments
 Use effective visualizations to present results, performance and trends
 Make recommendations based on trends, observe objectives and key indicators, identify areas of risk and opportunity
 Carry out specific analyses and present the results clearly and concisely.

 Required competencies

 A bachelor’s degree and 5 years of relevant experience or a master’s degree and 3 years of relevant experience
 Advanced proficiency in SAS and SQL
 Knowledge of PowerBI tools


 Preferred competencies

 Strong communication skills and ability to explain concepts in plain language
 Proactive and diligent
 Strong ability to develop in an environment undergoing transformation
 Proficiency in R and/or Python, an asset
 Knowledge of big data environments (Snowflake, Hadoop and Spark), an asset
 Bilingualism, spoken and written (French)
 English is an asset.


 Your benefits
 Upon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:
  

Health and wellness program, including many benefits
Flexible group insurance
Defined benefit pension plan
Employee Share Ownership Plan
Employee and family assistance program
Preferred banking services
Volunteer program
Telemedicine
Virtual sleep clinic


 These are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic.  We're putting people first We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have a positive impact on peoples' lives. Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that is accessible to all employees. We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodations, feel free to let us know during your first conversations with us. We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?  Ready to live your ambitions?

Title: Systems Analyst
Description:
What you'll do: 
Reporting to the Team Manager, Enterprise Services, this position is responsible for analyzing, designing, testing and coding programs of Saskatchewan Crop Insurance Corporation’s (SCIC’s) systems, with a focus on our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems. 

Provide Business Systems Analysis by taking high level business requirements and composing detailed solution requirements for application software implementation. 
Design and develop integrations between Oracle, other On-Premise and Cloud Applications. 
Provide software development by writing, unit testing, and maintaining application software. 
Identify and analyze problems, proposing alternatives and implementing solutions with respect to both manual processes and application software. 
Work closely with SCIC's external delivery partners in supporting our ERP systems. 
Work jointly with SCIC security team, defining security roles as required for ERP systems. 
Conduct application software impact analysis, presenting alternatives, recommendations and estimates. 
May provide leadership and act as a liaison between business and systems development, recommending software solutions and application development processes, and providing work estimates for application development. 
Keep up to date with the current ERP technology and best practice, to ensure SCIC capitalizes on key functionality of the the given system and future opportunities. 

Qualifications: 
To be successful in this position you need a diploma or degree in Computer Science with a minimum of two years’ experience in computer programming and systems’ analysis in a business environment. An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be considered. 

Oracle ERP Cloud experience in multiple modules which may include: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Procurement, Suppliers, Expenses, Enterprise Contracts, Human Capital Management (HCM), Recruitment, Talent Management, Payroll. 
Familiarity with processes such as Procure to Pay, Record to Report and/or Hire to Retire. 
Demonstrated experience with Oracle Business Intelligence, OTBI and BI Publisher. 
Experience in building integrations using middleware applications, such as Oracle Integration Cloud, SQL Server Integration Services. 
Verbal and written communication skills, to effectively connect as a liaison between key networks such as system stakeholders, implementation partners and third party product support. 
Knowledge and experience in Business Analysis, to translate business requirements into functioning solution. 
Knowledge of database structure, data integrity and data modelling as it relates to application software development; Understanding of SQL and PL/SQL, with the ability to write high performing SQL to solve complex problems. 
Demonstrated experience in object oriented programming; preference with a background using .Net or Java. 
Experience with EPM suite of products including Narrative Reporting (EPRCS) considered an asset. 
Experience with Azure DevOps Services for source control and backlog management considered an asset. 

Conditions of Employment: 

A criminal record check is required. 
Should the successful candidate participate in the Crop Insurance or AgriStability Pro-grams, their account must be in good standing. 
Must possess a valid driver’s license and be willing to travel throughout the province when necessary. 


Competencies: 

Service Excellence: Evaluates service delivery and makes recommendations to enhance the customer service experience. Uses customer feedback to make changes in work and personally commits to resolving customer issues. Develops and implements practices and programs that will benefit the organization while improving customer satisfaction and customer experience. 
Personal Leadership and Development: Models integrity and inclusiveness by being open, acting with empathy, sharing resources/knowledge across teams and being respectful of all skills and viewpoints. Seeks continuous learning opportunities to further develop skills. Listens and influences others to generate enthusiasm. 
Personal Leadership and Development: Models integrity and inclusiveness by being open, acting with empathy, sharing resources/knowledge across teams and being respectful of all skills and viewpoints. Seeks continuous learning opportunities to further develop skills. Listens and influences others to generate enthusiasm. 
Strategic Thinking: Listens and influences others to generate enthusiasm and commitment to the organization’s vision, values, mission and strategic direction. Commits to achieving success at the team and organizational level. Translates high level and complex information into realistic plans. 
Decision Making: Able to adapt decisions based on new and changing information. Balances risk and potential implications before making a decision. Considers the interests of various stakeholders when making a decision. 
Innovation: Seeks opportunities for innovation and continuous improvement. Adapts methodology and ideas quickly for immediate or anticipated changes in the environment. Generates, maintains and rewards a creative environment within and among teams. 
Analytical Thinking: Makes intelligent assumptions to develop explanations and determine possible steps and options. Identifies and breaks down critical components of complex situations to determine root causes. Takes a multidimensional approach to problems or situations by asking questions and analyzing data and concepts to determine how each component is impacted. 
Team Collaboration: Encourages, supports and motivates team members to share ideas, knowledge, solutions or concerns. Promotes an inclusive environment by working successfully with a wide range of individuals. Takes action to improve relationships between others. 
Building Organizational Community: Actively build relationships by establishing respect, trust, support and understanding. Encourages all team members to participate and offer ideas. Actively supports a one team approach. 
Communication: Uses open-ended questions, active listening and dialogue to encourage others to provide information about underlying needs or issues. Identifies and presents information that will motivate, persuade, engage or influence others. Communicates complex issues clearly and with credibility. 
Accountability: Strives for excellence in personal performance and coaches others to perform at their best. Seeks and/or provides challenging assignments as learning opportunities. Plays a leadership role in shaping the culture of the organization by consistently communicating and exemplifying the values. 
Performance Management: Continuously strives to meet or exceed organization and unit goals and objectives. Takes/provides opportunities to learn and demonstrate new knowledge and skills. Acts as a role model and provides ongoing coaching for others to drive positive results. 
Planning and Risk Management: Continually adapts priorities and responsibilities in response to changing needs. Thinks ahead, evaluates risks and plans contingencies. Clarifies outcomes and provides ongoing feedback to team members to achieve plans.

Title: Operations Support Analyst
Description:
Overview of Position:
 Totten is looking for an Operations Support Analyst to provide and expand on the support capacities in its back-office operation functions in alignment with the company’s strategic roadmap and objectives. This position requires an individual who is a self-starter with attention to details and can work independently as well as collaboratively with other stakeholders. This is a dynamic role and involves working hands-on in various business and insurance operation domains including reporting, compliance, underwriting and technology operations, business and data analytics, training, project coordination, and process engineering. This role reports to the Director, Operations. We offer an excellent opportunity to work for one of Canada’s Leading MGA’s and to become part of a dynamic and knowledgeable team. 


Key Responsibilities:
 Completion of assigned reports adhering to deadlines 

 Develop illustrations, dashboards, and reports as assigned 

 Support Totten’s underwriting applications administration tasks and functions as required 

 Assist with day-to-day technology operations activities 

 Support the escalation of technology issues, translating impact to IT 

 Coordinate and monitor projects and initiatives 

 Identify operational requirements and opportunities for improvement 

 Develop processes and procedures to enhance operations quality and efficiency 

 Identify and implement training needs 

 Track and maintain information and dataset as required 

 Carry out ad-hoc analysis and present findings in a clear manner 

 Assist with special tasks, projects, initiatives as required 


Qualifications and Experience:
 Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Technology, or related field preferred 

 3+ years of relevant experience in an administrative or operation support roles 

 MGA experience an asset 

 Experience with TAM and Policy Works an asset 

 High proficiency in Microsoft Office applications 

 Advanced Proficiency in MS Access and MS Excel 

 Experience working with SQL databases and Power BI or equivalent systems are an asset 

 Technology savvy and eager to learn 

 Strong attention to detail 

 Excellent analytical and reporting skills 

 Exceptional verbal and written communication skills 

 Ability to work independently and in a team structure 

 Solid organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management 


Core Values:
 Entrepreneurship - encouraging innovation and educate risk taking. 

 Integrity – doing things right every time. 

 Teamwork – working together to maximize result. 

 Accountability – measure and take responsibility for outcomes. 

 Service - serving customers, communities, and colleagues. 

 Totten Insurance Group is Canada’s leading national MGA provider of niche products and innovative solutions. Totten Group is committed to servicing brokers across the country and is comprised of six divisions: Personal Lines; Commercial Property; Commercial Casualty; Hospitality; Construction and Professional Liability. With offices across Canada, Totten Group’s corporate office resides in Toronto ON, and has other locations in Oakville ON, Dartmouth NS, Winnipeg MB, Montreal QC, and Vancouver BC. Learn more at www.tottengroup.com. 

 If you require assistance or accommodation during our recruitment process, please notify Human Resources so that we can review and consider how we may be able to assist you based on your individual needs.

Required Travel: No Travel Required
