Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst
ABOUT US
Established in 1982, Bulk Barn is Canada’s largest bulk food retailer with close to 300 stores and growing! The key to our success is progressive thinking, detailed/ methodical planning, and flawless execution by passionate people across our organization. We strive to foster a balanced and flexible culture that benefits both our customers and employees.
OUR VALUES: 
· High Standards
· Passionate
· Committed
· Exciting and Fun
· Supportive
· Customer Oriented
WHAT WE OFFER
In addition to a competitive compensation program and employer-paid benefits, we are conducting a 2-year test pilot on:
· Possibility of work-from-home arrangements, depending on the position
· A 32-hour flexible work week
· Casual dress code
ABOUT THE ROLE
This role is responsible to partner with Project Managers to ensure projects are delivered on time, and within budget and contribute positively to company efficiency and productivity. The Business Analyst is responsible to gather and analyze business needs and assist in the identification of solutions and provide system support with a specific focus on store systems and POS solutions.
Duties and Responsibilities
Project/Task Management
o Develop a Requirements Management Plan and disseminates the plan to all stakeholders.
o Define measurable criteria for ideal, adequate, and unacceptable system performance levels based on data gathered from stakeholders.
o Prioritize features and functions of the product or upgrade.
o Monitor vendor and user-requested enhancements and/or patches to ensure alignment and appropriate approvals are in place.

Examine and document existing business models, flow of data, and communicate the findings in order to clarify details to support technical development, including application solutions alternatives.
Conduct stakeholder follow-up to ensure that needs have been met by the completed project.

o Assess stakeholders’ needs and translate them into clear and concise objectives.
o Evaluates and recommends solutions relevant to projects based on knowledge of the Company and its systems as well as new technology available.
o Perform quality assurance processes to confirm that required business needs are met by the technical solution and process.
o Works with key project stakeholders to formulate and communicate the business plan, gather initial requirements, understand project concept, objectives, and approach, and scope the assigned project.
o Provide system support including identification of the problem, documenting, working with development teams to resolve issues, and implementing into a permanent fix.
· Promotes and works to maintain workplace wellness, health and safety, through active compliance with all workplace health and safety policies and procedures.
· Any other duties as required.
Qualifications

Undergraduate Degree in Business or Computer Sciences
Certificate in technical training and facilitation, an asset
3-5 years’ experience supporting POS systems and/or retail experience
3-5 years’ of Query experience on relational databases
3-5 years’ experience with Business Intelligence concepts and reports
5 - 8 years’ experience working with IT/IS teams
3-5 years’ experience participating and or leading team meetings
5 - 8 years’ experience with data management
3 – 5 years’ experience using project quality assurance management tools
3-5 years’ experience working with tight project deadlines, vendor and internal customer contracts and budget constraints
3-5 years’ experience using systems life cycle management concepts
3-5 years’ experience facilitating IT training

HOW TO APPLY
If you are interested in this role, please forward your resume to us, along with a covering letter telling us why you would like to join our team.
Bulk Barn Foods Limited is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. Accommodation is available in accordance with the AODA if requested. Our corporate facilities require employees to be fully vaccinated. Exceptions will be made in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, and all requests for exemptions will be validated by the Company.
Only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone calls please.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Expected start date: 2022-08-29

Title: Sr. Data Analyst- Tableau
Description:
Technical Lead
 Qualification: Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent
    Responsibility:
 Project Planning and Setup:

 Understand the project scope, identify activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks and provide inputs to Module Lead for review.


 Provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc.


 Review plan and provide feedback on gaps, timeline and execution feasibility etc as required in the project.


 Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams and provide feedback on requirements.

 Requirement Understanding and Analysis:

 Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements.


 Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.

 Design:

 Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead.


 Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable.


 Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review.


 Suggest changes in design on technical grounds.


 Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements.


 Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer).


 Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project.

 Coding:

 Follow coding standards and best practices to develop code and check code quality.


 Share developed code with supervisor for review.


 Rework on the code based on inputs if required.


 Perform complex integration.


 Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results.


 Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor.


 Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced.


 Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor.


 Conduct technical troubleshooting.


 Conduct reviews for codes created by team.

 Testing Management:

 Develop unit test case for each module.


 Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects.


 Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment.


 Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing.


 Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines.


 Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing.


 Raise issues to leads/QA.


 Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines.


 Share revised code with supervisor for review.


 Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.

 Configuration Management:

 Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers.


 Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc.

 Deployment:

 Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan.


 Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in.


 Maintain deployment tracker.


 Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production.


 Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.

 Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities):

 Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them.


 Provide guidance through SDLC.


 Provide status of progress to leads.


 In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan.

 Service Support and Maintenance:
 Specific to production and maintenance support:

 Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team.


 Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident.


 If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process.


 Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team.

 Knowledge Management:

 Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't.


 Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository.


 Guide developers in creating such documents.


 Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required).

 People Management:

 Conduct training through academy or internally within the team.


 Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring.


 Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead.


 Must Have Skills 

Tableau

 Employee Status : Full Time Employee
 Shift : Day Job
 Travel : No
 Job Posting : Jun 27 2022


 About Cognizant
 Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Title: Transfer Pricing Analyst
Description:
Req id: 27581 
    







     Richmond Hill, ON, CA
     










OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY


      OpenText helps companies securely capture, govern and exchange information on a global scale. OpenText solves digital business challenges for customers, ranging from small and mid-sized businesses to the largest and most complex organizations in the world.
     



 The Opportunity




This is a 9 monh contract postion.




      The transfer pricing team at OpenText is looking for a self-driven individual to meet the demands of a fast-paced, data-driven environment. Working within the broad OpenText global tax group, the transfer pricing department is charged with the responsibility to create value by reviewing current business structures on an ongoing basis to ensure that the transfer pricing policies are consistent with the arm’s length principle. The analyst will have a global role in managing the transfer pricing matters within OpenText in accordance with the OECD Guidelines and local country requirements.
     



What you will do


      The Analyst will join a highly technical global tax and transfer pricing function to create value and take proactive approaches to assess the impact of transfer pricing policies to the business model, management or new acquisitions. This includes challenging current processes to ensure they are efficient and effective. You will also review information obtained as part of day-to-day business activities and consider the impact of this data to the transfer pricing policies.
     

      The Analyst will be charged with the responsibility to create value by:
     

Managing the preparation of transfer pricing documentation in accordance with the OECD Guidelines and local jurisdictional requirements to minimize the company’s exposure to significant transfer pricing adjustments or penalties.
Reviewing current business structure on an ongoing basis to ensure that the transfer pricing policies are consistent with the arm’s length principle.
Engaging with OpenText’s external advisors on local documentation matters.
Collaborating with the Managers, Transfer Pricing Operations to ensure that the quarterly transfer pricing calculations are consistent with the transfer pricing documentation and other supporting information. 
Supporting transfer pricing managers and directors with transfer pricing audits globally.
Working with the Regional Tax Directors, Controllers and their teams with respect to the above matters





What it takes


Recent graduate with a University Degree (preference for finance/accounting/business focus)
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Office suite
Prior experience with SAP and/or similar finance systems is desired
Comfortable with applying accounting principles 
Detail-oriented, team player, curious, and self-driven
A problem solver who is comfortable building cross-functional relationships
A proactive, can-do, work ethic 
Those pursuing a CPA designation (or equivalent) may be given preference
Preference will be given to applicants with relevant internship experience in a public accounting firm or in industry




      OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com)
     



      Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Data itegrity analyst
Database Analyst
Description:
If you thrive on success and team work in a team culture, Agnico Eagle offers career opportunities on a global scale. We provide rewarding and challenging work that will help you grow your skills and your career. Agnico Eagle is committed to creating meaningful opportunities for our employees and we encourage everyone who works for us to contribute to their full potential. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We provide a safe work environment and seek to ensure all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, free from harassment, discrimination, bullying and retaliation. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. Disability-related accommodations during the application and selection process are available upon request. Interested? We hope you are.



 INTRO


 Location: Timmins, ON
 Rotation: Monday - Friday (5/2)
 Closing Date: July 19, 2022
 WHAT DO YOU VALUE IN A CAREER?
 At Agnico Eagle, our values never waver. We believe in trust, respect, equality, family and responsibility. Why? Because they express who we are and they have helped us succeed in business for over 60 years.
 WHAT DOES AGNICO EAGLE VALUE?
 We value you – your unique set of skills and experience. We value your willingness to build those skills and make a meaningful contribution to our company. And, we value your commitment to treat every person on our team with respect, helping us to operate safely, protect the environment and make a positive contribution to our local communities.




 ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY


 Based in Timmins, ON we currently have an exciting opportunity for a Database Analyst to join our Exploration team reporting to the Exploration Manager.
 The Database Analyst will be responsible for delivering and maintaining an accurate high-quality database ensuring best practice for QAQC in data entry, data validation, strict procedural adherence, delivering consistent improvement to operating standards.




 RESPONSIBILITIES


 Your responsibilities will include:

 Utilizing software to ensure the drill hole database is up to date and accurate with required data
 Daily importation of data for exploration into Fusion or other database, checking QAQC and following import protocol
 Manage QA/QC on drillhole assay data and input into database. Identifies issues to Senior and or Project Geologists responsible for specific projects and follows through to ensure action taken
 Implement and apply software queries to verify and valid Import all assay data from exploration and mine site drilling
 Completes required weekly, monthly and quarterly and yearly reports and tracks statistics for lab submitted sample numbers for individual projects and lab turnaround times
 Communication with analytical labs related to assay procedures and analytical issues/questions





 QUALIFICATIONS


 Our ideal candidate has:

 Minimum 1-3 years of Exploration or Mine Geology experience
 A Degree in Earth Sciences or equivalent and working towards a P.Geo designation in the province of Ontario would be preferable
 Experience with geoscientific databases and systems such as Fusion, Datamine, SQL server and/or other geoscientific database softwares is considered an asset
 The ability to gather/analyze data, plans, organize and prioritize work while delivering timely information
 Excellent interpersonal, written, time management and oral communication skills
 Proven commitment to health, safety and the environment

 Does this sound like you? If so, we would love to hear from you.




 WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


 Together, we are building a world-class gold mine and our success is determined by the hard work and dedication of our team. All of our team members are rewarded with a competitive benefits package and on-the-job perks, including:

 Competitive salary
 Relocation
 Travel Allowance
 Group benefits package
 Training and learning opportunities

 Should you be the successful candidate for this role, you will be contacted by a member of our Human Resources Department to schedule an interview.



 Together, we are Going for Gold in everything that we do and our success is determined by the hard work and dedication of our team.

Title: Business Analyst - HYBRID
Description:
Job Description Summary

 Job Description
 Be part of something bigger!
 BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.

 General Function:
 The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the sales and marketing organization to provide business decision support in order to achieve strategic and sales objectives. This involves taking a lead role in gathering, understanding and analyzing market intelligence data for Canada to broaden market insights and analytics. A focus for this role is to drive better decision making through financial modelling in support of the RFP/proposal process. Additionally, this role will perform other analytics to support pricing strategy, customer insights, and financial accruals and cash disbursement for incentive agreements, along with developing performance indicators and reports to monitor the health of the business. This includes data mining, quantifying, reconciling, evaluating and redefining internal and external information into business intelligence to further drive the achievement of strategic and sales objectives.

 This position will be hybrid at our Mississauga location.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Provide business decision support through market and sales analytics in support of overall pricing strategy, and offer customer/market insights that will drive sales growth.
 Build solutions to combine multiple sources of data accurately to enhance sales and market intelligence.
 Work closely with sales and marketing to gather reporting requirements and build new capabilities. Includes performing data validation, combining multiple complex data sets, and end user testing of dashboards to ensure data accuracy and usability and self serve dashboarding capabilities as required.
 Responsible for the management, continual customization and development of dashboards, reports, forms, templates and models using varying technologies (Qlikview, PowerBI, PowerPivot, Excel, VBA Macros, Access etc) in support of the business.
 Build alternate proposal models with the business based on market insight. Liaise with Finance and Commercial Operations Teams to ensure all financial and compliance/legal considerations are assessed.
 Work with business to build value add options/alternatives for customers. Responsible for developing model/calculation(s) required for customer contract incentives and to ensure accrual, reconciliation, and payment process can be executed based on terms of proposal.
 Participate, lead and/or manage other Customer Intelligence and global projects as required. Share and use best practices, new learnings and developments from other businesses locally and globally.


 Requirements:

 University Degree
 Min 2 years of business analytics and/or finance experience
 Experience with financial modelling and interpreting contractual agreements/proposals
 Strong organizational and prioritization skills
 Detail oriented, strong analytical and problem solving skills
 Process oriented, proactive and customer focused
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 Ability to work in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment
 Proficient in Microsoft office (advanced Excel capabilities required)
 Experience with uncertainty analysis, forecasting, and general decision support preferred
 Experience with accruals, general ledger entries, and account reconciliations preferred
 Qlikview, PowerBI, SAP, BI/BW, Microsoft Access experience preferred


 For many roles at BD, employment is contingent upon the Company’s receipt of sufficient proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In some locations, weekly testing for COVID-19 may be available instead of vaccination. Consistent with BD’s Workplace Accommodations Policy, requests for accommodation will be considered pursuant to applicable law.
 
Why join us?
 A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life’s purpose through the work that they do every day. 

You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates. 

To learn more about BD visit https://jobs.bd.com/ 

Great Place to Work® has certified our workplace culture based on your feedback in the Trust Index® survey, and we've just published the news about us on their social media channels. You can check these out here. And if you think your friends and networks would be interested in knowing more about your workplace, sharing these posts is a great way to give them some insight! 

Becton Dickinson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from individuals with a wide range of abilities and provide an accessible candidate experience. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Canadian Human Rights Act, Becton Dickinson will provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform us of any accommodation(s) you require by contacting HR at 1-855-234-3577. 

PDN

 Primary Work Location CAN Mississauga - Derry Road West
 
 Additional Locations

 Work Shift

Title: Senior Data Analyst Population Health, Decision Support and Business Intelligence - Full Time - Markham Site
Planning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Description:
Posting NumberCK52305P
Position TitlePlanning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Job ClassificationPlanner Specialist
No. of Staff Required1
Job TypeFull Time
DivisionPlanning & Development Services
DepartmentPolicy and Planning
Job Summary/Basic FunctionThe City of Kelowna is seeking a Planning Data Analyst with a specialization in GIS and data analytics. This role will conduct research and analysis of housing market trends, economic factors, growth strategy forecasting, housing affordability, and other factors influencing Kelowna’s long-range policies. We are looking for a candidate who will use innovative data science approaches and methodologies/techniques to build workflows and/or models for advanced Geo-spatial analysis. This position will analyze statistics and generates projections in support of specific aspects of planning such as land use, housing, labour force and population; identifies data trends; interprets and explains data and presents in a suitable format.
We are looking for someone who has strong experience in dealing with big data using multiple data sources and regression analysis, spatial/non-spatial econometric modeling, and GIS. Someone who understands municipal planning, data analytics and future social, environmental, and economic trends and enjoys working in a sophisticated technical environment utilizing various modeling and programming tools.
We are looking for positive team players with related experience, great communication skills and a proactive and innovative attitude. A university degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture, or other related discipline and holds professional credibility or is eligible for CIP membership with AIBC.
Duties
Qualifications

University Degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture or other related discipline
Professional Credibility (Eligible for CIP membership of AIBC)
Experience
Communication Excellence

Computer Literacy

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department)
Description:
Driven by technology and fueled by innovation, HSB is Canada’s premier specialty insurance and applied technology services provider. Offering 150 years of technical and service excellence, we are focusing on emerging trends and unlocking new opportunities for clients. Today, we are accelerating, changing the future of insurance and risk solutions, for a modern world. 

 At HSB, we value the strengths and contributions of our diverse workforce. We offer continuous learning opportunities, giving you flexibility to grow in your career while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a collaborative approach in our coast-to-coast network of offices. Become part of a rewarding and impactful workplace experience while seeing first-hand technologies and risk solutions that are changing the way we live and work. 

 HSB is much more! It’s insurance. Engineering. Technology. To learn more about us, please visit www.hsb.ca. 


Primary Objectives:
 The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) is responsible for fulfilling all data processing and reporting needs for the Inspections department. The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) will conduct qualitative and quantitative data analysis, data assessments and report generation for the department, while working collaboratively with Area Managers assisting them with special projects and any ad-hoc responsibilities as assigned. The incumbent will work closely with the Inspections team to generate contract documents such as invoices, summary reports for internal and external use and general management of all Inspections data. This role is ideal for an independent thinker with a problem solving mindset focused on enhancing data management processes with accuracy, efficiency, timeliness and professionalism. 

 This position is based out of Head Office, Toronto. 


Responsibilities:
 Analyse all inspection data for accuracy, invoicing and reporting purposes. 
Know how to manipulate Excel files and to use it in conjunction with other programs. 
Compile data, verify accuracy and sort information to prepare for data entry. 
Assist in other data sorting and data cleansing initiatives within the department. 
Design and apply unified reporting and tracking standards to easily report and track KPIs in the department. 
Work within existing BI frameworks and build data models to support analysis and reporting. 
Ability to performing data visualization as required. 
May, at times, work with peers across the organization and may also be involved in non-inspection related projects/requests. 
Other work as assigned. 


Qualifications:
 1-3 years’ experience working with medium to large size data sets and general data management. 
College Diploma or University Degree in a related field. 
Advanced capabilities in computer application software, knowledge of data bases and analytics tools. 
Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Excel functions (complex formulas, macros, pivot tables) is a strong asset. 
Has a keen eye for this discipline and an analytical mind, is able to effectively interpret a variety of data/metrics and contextualize it in a business environment. 

Must possess strong technical skills in applications such as: Excel, SQL, R, DAX, VBA, ETL, PowerBI, etc. 
Excellent data entry skills with high attention to detail. 
Strong communication skills (emails and phone). 
Superior organizational skills. 
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, while maintaining efficiency and accuracy. 

 Creating and maintaining a work environment that promotes respect, diversity and dignity is important to us. We strive for equality in our workplace, to eliminate employment barriers, and promote a workplace based on principles which align with our company values and promote positive employee practices. Candidates requiring accommodation during any stage of our selection process should advise us of this; we will strive to work with individuals to find a suitable means to meet their needs. 

 We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Research Analyst
Company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
Description:
The Institute for Mental Health Policy Research (IMHPR) at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) has an outstanding tradition of combining scientific rigour and practical relevance. Reporting to the Senior Scientist in charge of the project, a Research Analyst is required to support research on adolescent substance use prevention. The successful candidate will support sample recruitment and data collection on a CIHR-funded multisite project, support collaboration with key stakeholders, conduct data analysis using appropriate software such as Stata or R, conduct literature searches, and assist in drafting manuscripts and reports. This position will involve some travel within Ontario. The successful candidate will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and complies with all applicable regulatory and legislative requirements. This position is located at 33 Ursula Franklin Street, Toronto.

 Qualifications:
 The successful candidate will possess a Bachelor (honours) degree in psychology, public health, or related disciplines, in combination with at least one (1) year of related experience in quantitative research. Previous research experience in the area of adolescent substance use, research ethics board applications, proficiency in Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint), experience with data analysis and relevant software for this purpose, particularly Stata or R, and experience conducting literature searches and preparing manuscripts for peer-review publication are required for this position. Experience in using Endnote would be an asset. The candidate will have excellent oral and written communication skills, organization skills, attention to detail, and problem solving skills. Bilingualism (French/English) or proficiency in a second language would be an asset. Successful candidate must pass a criminal background check.
 Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
 Please note: This 12-month full-time contract position is part of the OPSEU bargaining unit
 Salary Range: $25.03-33.38 per hour
 CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.  CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.  At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.  CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).  We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

Title: Data Engineer (Business Analyst)
Description:
POSITION LOCATION: London, ON  


POSITION TITLE: Data Engineer  


POSITION REPORTS TO: Practice Director, Enterprise Analyses

 DEPARTMENT/UNIT NAME: Enterprise Analyses

 JOB SUMMARY:

 The Data Engineer will build and operationalize data necessary for enterprise data and analytics initiatives. This role will build, manage and optimize data architecture and pipelines in accordance with industry standard practices and using industry standard tools, and will move these data pipelines effectively into production for data and analytics use cases across the organization. The incumbent will ensure compliance with data governance and data security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing these integrated and reusable data pipelines and analytical models that will support and promote self-service analytics. Will occasionally provide support to end users on the use of data visualization solutions. Responsible for maintaining and making recommendations to enhance technology as the needs of our client’s change.

 ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:


 Data and Analytics


 Design, build and maintain data pipelines (i.e. data flow from data sources to integration to consumption for specific use cases).
Develop data models (conceptual, logical and/or physical) as required.
Manage metadata using data preparation, integration and AI-enabled tools and techniques.
Drive automation in data integration. Recommend and lead the implementation techniques and architectures to automate the most-common, repeatable and tedious data preparation and integration tasks partially or completely to minimize manual and error-prone processes.
In collaboration with functional leaders, identify the company’s inefficiencies, inaccuracies, missed opportunities, other issues and report on the recommended improvements to the executive team.
Provide technical leadership for Athena (analytics platform) by directing and prioritizing the work of others on the team related to Athena.
Act as a subject matter expert for the Athena platform.



Business Analysis 



Assist cross-functional groups, other Business/Process analysts, and other stakeholders to gather, define and refine their data requirements for various initiatives.
Propose appropriate (and innovative) data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques in optimally addressing these data requirements.
Assess ways to further leverage existing systems and recommend methods for streamlining data flow and data integration.
While identifying and evaluating new projects or requests for enhancements, work with the functional leader to determine the project cost, timeline, goals and feasibility and then support the project through completion.



 Data Compliance and Governance


 Work with corporate leadership to manage and promote compliance with the corporate data strategy
Collaborate with data stewards or appropriate stakeholders to develop policies to ensure the responsible use of data by data users and consumers. 
Lead the development and maintenance of documentation and the data catalog for Alimentiv data assets.
Promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals.
Ensure data or software solutions continue to meet customer needs by capturing changes in requirements and making corresponding updates to existing software or data analytics.



 QUALIFICATIONS:

 Applicants should have a minimum of an undergraduate degree in relevant field of study (preferably in Computer Science, Information System) and 4-6 years of relevant experience + strong analytical training . The successful candidate should be well experienced with Data Management architectures such as Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Catalogue and the supporting processes such as Data Integration, Governance, Metadata Management. Strong experience with Microsoft Azure, and popular database programming languages including SQL. Proficient in PowerBI. Demonstrated success in working with both IT and business while integrating analytics and data science output into business processes and workflows. Experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modeling, optimization and data quality. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team and meet important deadlines. Understanding of enterprise and company systems. Facilitation skills and business process mapping and analysis experience preferred. Statistical analysis skills are an asset.

 WORKING CONDITIONS:

 Office/Home-based


 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request

Title: Service Barrie Customer Systems Data Analyst
Description:
Po
sted:
 
Monday, July 4, 2022


Job Number:
 
PC
-22-44


Job Type:
 
Permanent
 Full-time, Union


Position Closing Date:
 
Monday, July 18, 2022





Choose Barrie



  The City of Barrie is a vibrant, progressive, and growing community with deep connections to our heritage, to nature and to the opportunities surrounding us.
 


  Our community values quality of life; the ability to play year-round with 300 hectares of park space, our beautiful waterfront, our lively downtown core and the nearby hills, wetlands, and forests. We also value connections; to our neighbours and the community, to our road and rail network, and to the opportunity Barrie provides to enjoy life.
 


  Everything Barrie has to offer, from the water we drink to the roads we travel on, has one thing in common - municipal workers. Joining a municipality is one of the most rewarding, engaging, and exciting careers you could choose. It is a career you can take pride in knowing that every day you make a positive impact on an entire community. We are one team, with one goal and we all work together to continue making our community great.
 




The Opportunity



  Access Barrie combines customer service, marketing and communications, and transit and parking strategy. This strategic portfolio reflects the importance and need for the City to easily and efficiently connect the people who live and work in Barrie to the people, places, services and information that matters to them. Marketing and Communications work closely with staff from all departments, the Mayor, CAO and City Council to develop corporate communications plans and marketing strategies in support of City initiatives, programs and services.
 


  Under the general guidance and direction of the Supervisor of Customer Systems, the Service Barrie Customer Systems Data Analyst position is responsible for supporting the development, implementation and maintenance of knowledge management solutions to support the delivery of services offered through Service Barrie. Specifically, this position assists in acquiring, documenting, and maintaining corporate information and processes for the inclusion and use within the Citizen Experience Management (CEM) system and other applicable databases/platforms. In addition, this position assists the Supervisor of Customer Systems with onboarding and training new staff in Service Barrie systems use, assists with various research, extracting data from the CEM, and preparing reports for the Supervisor of Customer Systems and Manager of Customer Service to support overall operations of Service Barrie. Overall, this position plays an integral role in maintaining the knowledge base and CEM to optimize use and to support the efficient, centralized, consistent delivery of customer service for the wide range of City services, procedures, practices, policies, and programs.
 




Our Culture and Qualifications of the Job



Corporate Culture



Your workplace values align with our corporate values of Strive, Share and Care and you want to join us in providing exceptional services and programs to build a prosperous, growing and sustainable community




Education (degree/diploma/certifications)
 


Three (3) year College Diploma in Public Management, Information Systems or related discipline




Experience



Four (4) years of experience performing duties related to the above mentioned major responsibilities 
Demonstrated experience in a customer service role within an office and/or government work environment 
Demonstrated experience maintaining information/knowledge systems




Knowledge/Skill/Ability



General knowledge of the following principles and standards: the City of Barrie’s services, procedures, practices and programs
Working knowledge of the following principles and standards: customer service delivery standards and techniques; municipal, regional, provincial and federal government services and programs; call centre technology, including Citizen Experience Management (CEM) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems
Demonstrated Ability to: 
    
deal with difficult customers individuals, diffuse emotionally-charged situations and resolve customer issues in a diplomatic and professional manner

Advanced skills include: Analytical; Attention to Detail; Collaboration; Customer Service; Initiative; Organizational; Presentation; Prioritization; Problem Solving; Process Mapping; Report-writing; Time Management; Troubleshooting; Written Communication
Advanced computer literacy using the following systems and software: • Computer literacy utilizing knowledge management/customer relationship management software, computerized maintenance management systems software, registration software, financial software, and other related software applicable to City services and programs
Availability to accommodate deadlines or peak period workloads that may extend beyond designated normal workday hours or normal hours per week




Conditions of Employment



Satisfactory Criminal Record Check*



Please note that this is a requirement of the position for any new employees to the City of Barrie in accordance with the Police Record Check Procedure. Existing employees will be grandparented from this requirement.





Other Important Information



Locatio
n: City Hall, 70 Collier Street, Barrie, Ontario
 


Hours: The normal hours of work are 35 hours per week in accordance with the Collective Agreement.
 


Wage: This position is within the CUPE Local 2380 Bargaining Unit with the following pay level and 2022 pay range:
 


Pay Level: Level 6
Yearly Salary: $59,222.80 to $70,998.20 per year
Hourly Pay Rate: $32.54 to $39.01 per hour



Benefits: This position includes a comprehensive union benefit plan, including but not limited to extended health and dental coverage, life and accident insurance, paid vacation and sick days, short/long term disability plans, OMERS pension plan, discounted rate for City Fitness Memberships and much more.
 




  Don’t meet the credentials as outlined but have years of directly related experience? Please see the City’s 
  Education Equivalency Procedure to determine if you may qualify for equivalency. Further information is available at www.barrie.ca/JobOpps.

Title: Big Data Analyst
Description:
About ThinkLP 
ThinkLP imagines a world where there is zero retail crime and all companies operate safely & effectively, ensuring all employees return home at the end of the day.
At ThinkLP, we are helping to drive a loss prevention industry transformation with awesome loss prevention software. The innovative ThinkLP software platform has become an industry leader and The Globe and Mail recently recognized ThinkLP for being a top growing company in Canada. Headquartered in Waterloo, Ontario, we have the honour and privilege of serving some of the world's most recognizable companies, and we continue to grow! We're always looking for brilliant, self-motivated, big-picture thinkers who love software and have a propensity to get things done. 
Tell me more about the ThinkLP software? 
ThinkLP is an incredibly configurable case management software, built on the Salesforce Platform to centralize your data, get immediate results, and act instantly, all from the web or mobile apps allowing you to collaborate and take action from anywhere. We recommend all to check out our website to hear about the latest and greatest we have to offer.
What would I be doing at ThinkLP? 
This is a unique career opportunity for a motivated technical, data-driven individual to help grow an innovative software company. Are you an innovative thinker and passionate about helping companies achieve success in the cloud? Do you live and breathe the digital lifestyle and want to work as a key team member building a cloud-based company? As a Big Data Analyst, you will provide the insights needed to work with and analyze data across numerous domains, structures, and formats. This role has a specific responsibility of developing Big Data Optimization scripts and queries using technologies such as PostgreSQL.
What are my main duties? 
As a small and rapidly growing organization, your primary objective is to understand client data and load it into the ThinkLP product, the core responsibilities will include:

Reverse engineering and analyzing data to be converted into ThinkLP’s data models


Working with established processes to import the transformed data into the product


Contribute towards continually improving the data models developed by ThinkLP, as well as the processes used to import data into these models and the platform


Supporting client understanding of data by creating visualizations within the platform


Building platform data flows to manipulate and merge new and/or existing data


Writing optimized SQL queries to get the best performance out of data transformation and loading processes

What are the requirements for this position? 

Bachelor of Computer Science, Applied Science, Engineering or equivalent educational achievements or work experience


Highly motivated and independent with an ability to help drive growth in a startup software organization


Intermediate to advanced experience with SQL queries and Relational Databases


A passion for analyzing and making discoveries from data


Understanding of different file/data formats (E.g., CSV, JSON, XML, Fixed/Positional, etc.)

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Maplesoft Group is currently seeking a Sr. Data Analyst one of our clients in the National Capital Region.
 
 The following responsibilities are associated with the “Statement Of Work” but are not limited to:
 
 Description of Service
 
 The Master Data Management (MDM) Program is an intensive multi-year initiative to implement a solution that will standardize, consolidate and significantly improve the client’s use of core enterprise data. In 2022, the MDM team will focus on the delivery of a Proof of Value (PoV) MDM solution for assessment by EDC business and technology stakeholders. This effort will be followed by the first production release of the solution. The MDM team is using an Agile approach (Scrum) for the MDM delivery.
 
 Primary Responsibilities
 


Senior Data Analysis services will contribute to the detailed data analysis and design of the MDM solution. The selected candidate will perform key functions to: catalog master and reference data; define data requirements and business rules; perform data profiling; document data processes/flows; document data mapping details; assist standard operating procedure (SOP) analysis and documentation; assist data dictionary definition; perform data quality assessment and testing to align with EDC data governance and quality standards.



Senior Data Analysis services also requires understanding of client ask, working with clients to further refine the details. Deep dive into the business rules and data transformation rules requirements. Data flow diagrams will need to be created for visual representation of data transformation between internal and external systems.



The Senior Data Analyst will be expected to ramp up quickly on current state data architecture and become familiar with client’s data governance and data quality standards.

 Specific Project Requirements
 


Collecting, documenting, and analyzing MDM data requirements



Data profiling/analysis and data querying



Data cleansing, data transformation



Documenting/mapping business processes, SOPs



Building crosswalks and mapping tables for reference data



Analyzing source systems to find discrepancies/collisions for reference data



Working with team members to provide data analysis and design leadership and communicate about deliverables, schedule, possible risks, and appropriate contingencies



Working closely and collaboratively with management, stakeholders, and staff to optimize the overall MDM delivery

 Skills
 
 Top 3 Skills:
 


Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.



Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience in data analysis and profiling, working with multiple data sources and stakeholder groups including end-user/business teams.



Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience in data quality analysis and experience with reverse engineering the source to target mapping to gain data insights



 Other Skills:
 


Prior experience with Informatica MDM (is an asset).



Strong SQL/SQL query skills.



Experience with JSON, XML, and Databricks Parquet data structures and transformations.



Prior experience on MDM/data standardization and consolidation initiatives is an asset.



 Assets:
 


A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related degree.



10+ years of broad experience in IM/IT solution design and delivery, including working knowledge with infrastructure, database platform, middleware, and applications.



Well-rounded experience in the whole data lifecycle management and hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, data quality, SQL programming, ETL development, metadata management and master data management, business intelligence and database administration.



Good understanding and practical implementation experience with integration design patterns. Strong understanding of Data Management Body of Knowledge is a plus.



Excellent verbal and written communication, critical thinking, time management, priority planning and interpersonal skills.


 Maplesoft Group prides itself on its distinct corporate culture and recognizes that success is a direct reflection of our most valuable asset - our people. Therefore, attitude and ambition are key personality traits we seek out, along with skill and aptitude, in potential employees.
 
 Maplesoft Group is committed to having a diverse, representative workforce and continuing to build an inclusive environment. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Maplesoft Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants irrespective of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal peoples or any other legally protected factors.
 
 All employment decisions are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications.
 
 We are committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and a work environment that supports our diverse workforce. Please let us know if you require accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process. We can be reached at Maplesoft Info at info@maplesoftgroup.com.
 
 We thank you for your interest in Maplesoft Group and wish to advise you, that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst - HYBRID
Description:
Job Description Summary

 Job Description
 Be part of something bigger!
 BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.

 General Function:
 The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the sales and marketing organization to provide business decision support in order to achieve strategic and sales objectives. This involves taking a lead role in gathering, understanding and analyzing market intelligence data for Canada to broaden market insights and analytics. A focus for this role is to drive better decision making through financial modelling in support of the RFP/proposal process. Additionally, this role will perform other analytics to support pricing strategy, customer insights, and financial accruals and cash disbursement for incentive agreements, along with developing performance indicators and reports to monitor the health of the business. This includes data mining, quantifying, reconciling, evaluating and redefining internal and external information into business intelligence to further drive the achievement of strategic and sales objectives.

 This position will be hybrid at our Mississauga location.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Provide business decision support through market and sales analytics in support of overall pricing strategy, and offer customer/market insights that will drive sales growth.
 Build solutions to combine multiple sources of data accurately to enhance sales and market intelligence.
 Work closely with sales and marketing to gather reporting requirements and build new capabilities. Includes performing data validation, combining multiple complex data sets, and end user testing of dashboards to ensure data accuracy and usability and self serve dashboarding capabilities as required.
 Responsible for the management, continual customization and development of dashboards, reports, forms, templates and models using varying technologies (Qlikview, PowerBI, PowerPivot, Excel, VBA Macros, Access etc) in support of the business.
 Build alternate proposal models with the business based on market insight. Liaise with Finance and Commercial Operations Teams to ensure all financial and compliance/legal considerations are assessed.
 Work with business to build value add options/alternatives for customers. Responsible for developing model/calculation(s) required for customer contract incentives and to ensure accrual, reconciliation, and payment process can be executed based on terms of proposal.
 Participate, lead and/or manage other Customer Intelligence and global projects as required. Share and use best practices, new learnings and developments from other businesses locally and globally.


 Requirements:

 University Degree
 Min 2 years of business analytics and/or finance experience
 Experience with financial modelling and interpreting contractual agreements/proposals
 Strong organizational and prioritization skills
 Detail oriented, strong analytical and problem solving skills
 Process oriented, proactive and customer focused
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 Ability to work in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment
 Proficient in Microsoft office (advanced Excel capabilities required)
 Experience with uncertainty analysis, forecasting, and general decision support preferred
 Experience with accruals, general ledger entries, and account reconciliations preferred
 Qlikview, PowerBI, SAP, BI/BW, Microsoft Access experience preferred


 For many roles at BD, employment is contingent upon the Company’s receipt of sufficient proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In some locations, weekly testing for COVID-19 may be available instead of vaccination. Consistent with BD’s Workplace Accommodations Policy, requests for accommodation will be considered pursuant to applicable law.
 
Why join us?
 A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life’s purpose through the work that they do every day. 

You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates. 

To learn more about BD visit https://jobs.bd.com/ 

Great Place to Work® has certified our workplace culture based on your feedback in the Trust Index® survey, and we've just published the news about us on their social media channels. You can check these out here. And if you think your friends and networks would be interested in knowing more about your workplace, sharing these posts is a great way to give them some insight! 

Becton Dickinson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from individuals with a wide range of abilities and provide an accessible candidate experience. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Canadian Human Rights Act, Becton Dickinson will provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform us of any accommodation(s) you require by contacting HR at 1-855-234-3577. 

PDN

Planning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Description:

Job Summary/Basic FunctionThe City of Kelowna is seeking a Planning Data Analyst with a specialization in GIS and data analytics. This role will conduct research and analysis of housing market trends, economic factors, growth strategy forecasting, housing affordability, and other factors influencing Kelowna’s long-range policies. We are looking for a candidate who will use innovative data science approaches and methodologies/techniques to build workflows and/or models for advanced Geo-spatial analysis. This position will analyze statistics and generates projections in support of specific aspects of planning such as land use, housing, labour force and population; identifies data trends; interprets and explains data and presents in a suitable format.
We are looking for someone who has strong experience in dealing with big data using multiple data sources and regression analysis, spatial/non-spatial econometric modeling, and GIS. Someone who understands municipal planning, data analytics and future social, environmental, and economic trends and enjoys working in a sophisticated technical environment utilizing various modeling and programming tools.
We are looking for positive team players with related experience, great communication skills and a proactive and innovative attitude. A university degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture, or other related discipline and holds professional credibility or is eligible for CIP membership with AIBC.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department)
Description:
Driven by technology and fueled by innovation, HSB is Canada’s premier specialty insurance and applied technology services provider. Offering 150 years of technical and service excellence, we are focusing on emerging trends and unlocking new opportunities for clients. Today, we are accelerating, changing the future of insurance and risk solutions, for a modern world. 

 At HSB, we value the strengths and contributions of our diverse workforce. We offer continuous learning opportunities, giving you flexibility to grow in your career while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a collaborative approach in our coast-to-coast network of offices. Become part of a rewarding and impactful workplace experience while seeing first-hand technologies and risk solutions that are changing the way we live and work. 

 HSB is much more! It’s insurance. Engineering. Technology. To learn more about us, please visit www.hsb.ca. 


Primary Objectives:
 The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) is responsible for fulfilling all data processing and reporting needs for the Inspections department. The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) will conduct qualitative and quantitative data analysis, data assessments and report generation for the department, while working collaboratively with Area Managers assisting them with special projects and any ad-hoc responsibilities as assigned. The incumbent will work closely with the Inspections team to generate contract documents such as invoices, summary reports for internal and external use and general management of all Inspections data. This role is ideal for an independent thinker with a problem solving mindset focused on enhancing data management processes with accuracy, efficiency, timeliness and professionalism. 

 This position is based out of Head Office, Toronto. 


Responsibilities:
 Analyse all inspection data for accuracy, invoicing and reporting purposes. 
Know how to manipulate Excel files and to use it in conjunction with other programs. 
Compile data, verify accuracy and sort information to prepare for data entry. 
Assist in other data sorting and data cleansing initiatives within the department. 
Design and apply unified reporting and tracking standards to easily report and track KPIs in the department. 
Work within existing BI frameworks and build data models to support analysis and reporting. 
Ability to performing data visualization as required. 
May, at times, work with peers across the organization and may also be involved in non-inspection related projects/requests. 
Other work as assigned. 


Qualifications:
 1-3 years’ experience working with medium to large size data sets and general data management. 
College Diploma or University Degree in a related field. 
Advanced capabilities in computer application software, knowledge of data bases and analytics tools. 
Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Excel functions (complex formulas, macros, pivot tables) is a strong asset. 
Has a keen eye for this discipline and an analytical mind, is able to effectively interpret a variety of data/metrics and contextualize it in a business environment. 

Must possess strong technical skills in applications such as: Excel, SQL, R, DAX, VBA, ETL, PowerBI, etc. 
Excellent data entry skills with high attention to detail. 
Strong communication skills (emails and phone). 
Superior organizational skills. 
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, while maintaining efficiency and accuracy. 

 Creating and maintaining a work environment that promotes respect, diversity and dignity is important to us. We strive for equality in our workplace, to eliminate employment barriers, and promote a workplace based on principles which align with our company values and promote positive employee practices. Candidates requiring accommodation during any stage of our selection process should advise us of this; we will strive to work with individuals to find a suitable means to meet their needs. 

 We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Research Analyst
Company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
Description:
The Institute for Mental Health Policy Research (IMHPR) at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) has an outstanding tradition of combining scientific rigour and practical relevance. Reporting to the Senior Scientist in charge of the project, a Research Analyst is required to support research on adolescent substance use prevention. The successful candidate will support sample recruitment and data collection on a CIHR-funded multisite project, support collaboration with key stakeholders, conduct data analysis using appropriate software such as Stata or R, conduct literature searches, and assist in drafting manuscripts and reports. This position will involve some travel within Ontario. The successful candidate will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and complies with all applicable regulatory and legislative requirements. This position is located at 33 Ursula Franklin Street, Toronto.

 Qualifications:
 The successful candidate will possess a Bachelor (honours) degree in psychology, public health, or related disciplines, in combination with at least one (1) year of related experience in quantitative research. Previous research experience in the area of adolescent substance use, research ethics board applications, proficiency in Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint), experience with data analysis and relevant software for this purpose, particularly Stata or R, and experience conducting literature searches and preparing manuscripts for peer-review publication are required for this position. Experience in using Endnote would be an asset. The candidate will have excellent oral and written communication skills, organization skills, attention to detail, and problem solving skills. Bilingualism (French/English) or proficiency in a second language would be an asset. Successful candidate must pass a criminal background check.
 Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
 Please note: This 12-month full-time contract position is part of the OPSEU bargaining unit
 Salary Range: $25.03-33.38 per hour
 CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.  CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.  At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.  CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).  We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

Title: Data Engineer (Business Analyst)
Description:
POSITION LOCATION: London, ON  


POSITION TITLE: Data Engineer  


POSITION REPORTS TO: Practice Director, Enterprise Analyses

 DEPARTMENT/UNIT NAME: Enterprise Analyses

 JOB SUMMARY:

 The Data Engineer will build and operationalize data necessary for enterprise data and analytics initiatives. This role will build, manage and optimize data architecture and pipelines in accordance with industry standard practices and using industry standard tools, and will move these data pipelines effectively into production for data and analytics use cases across the organization. The incumbent will ensure compliance with data governance and data security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing these integrated and reusable data pipelines and analytical models that will support and promote self-service analytics. Will occasionally provide support to end users on the use of data visualization solutions. Responsible for maintaining and making recommendations to enhance technology as the needs of our client’s change.

 ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:


 Data and Analytics


 Design, build and maintain data pipelines (i.e. data flow from data sources to integration to consumption for specific use cases).
Develop data models (conceptual, logical and/or physical) as required.
Manage metadata using data preparation, integration and AI-enabled tools and techniques.
Drive automation in data integration. Recommend and lead the implementation techniques and architectures to automate the most-common, repeatable and tedious data preparation and integration tasks partially or completely to minimize manual and error-prone processes.
In collaboration with functional leaders, identify the company’s inefficiencies, inaccuracies, missed opportunities, other issues and report on the recommended improvements to the executive team.
Provide technical leadership for Athena (analytics platform) by directing and prioritizing the work of others on the team related to Athena.
Act as a subject matter expert for the Athena platform.



Business Analysis 



Assist cross-functional groups, other Business/Process analysts, and other stakeholders to gather, define and refine their data requirements for various initiatives.
Propose appropriate (and innovative) data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques in optimally addressing these data requirements.
Assess ways to further leverage existing systems and recommend methods for streamlining data flow and data integration.
While identifying and evaluating new projects or requests for enhancements, work with the functional leader to determine the project cost, timeline, goals and feasibility and then support the project through completion.



 Data Compliance and Governance


 Work with corporate leadership to manage and promote compliance with the corporate data strategy
Collaborate with data stewards or appropriate stakeholders to develop policies to ensure the responsible use of data by data users and consumers. 
Lead the development and maintenance of documentation and the data catalog for Alimentiv data assets.
Promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals.
Ensure data or software solutions continue to meet customer needs by capturing changes in requirements and making corresponding updates to existing software or data analytics.



 QUALIFICATIONS:

 Applicants should have a minimum of an undergraduate degree in relevant field of study (preferably in Computer Science, Information System) and 4-6 years of relevant experience + strong analytical training . The successful candidate should be well experienced with Data Management architectures such as Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Catalogue and the supporting processes such as Data Integration, Governance, Metadata Management. Strong experience with Microsoft Azure, and popular database programming languages including SQL. Proficient in PowerBI. Demonstrated success in working with both IT and business while integrating analytics and data science output into business processes and workflows. Experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modeling, optimization and data quality. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team and meet important deadlines. Understanding of enterprise and company systems. Facilitation skills and business process mapping and analysis experience preferred. Statistical analysis skills are an asset.

 WORKING CONDITIONS:

 Office/Home-based


 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request

Title: Service Barrie Customer Systems Data Analyst
Description:
Po
sted:
 
Monday, July 4, 2022

PC
-22-44

Permanent
 Full-time, Union


Position Closing Date:
 
Monday, July 18, 2022





Choose Barrie



  The City of Barrie is a vibrant, progressive, and growing community with deep connections to our heritage, to nature and to the opportunities surrounding us.
 


  Our community values quality of life; the ability to play year-round with 300 hectares of park space, our beautiful waterfront, our lively downtown core and the nearby hills, wetlands, and forests. We also value connections; to our neighbours and the community, to our road and rail network, and to the opportunity Barrie provides to enjoy life.
 


  Everything Barrie has to offer, from the water we drink to the roads we travel on, has one thing in common - municipal workers. Joining a municipality is one of the most rewarding, engaging, and exciting careers you could choose. It is a career you can take pride in knowing that every day you make a positive impact on an entire community. We are one team, with one goal and we all work together to continue making our community great.
 




The Opportunity



  Access Barrie combines customer service, marketing and communications, and transit and parking strategy. This strategic portfolio reflects the importance and need for the City to easily and efficiently connect the people who live and work in Barrie to the people, places, services and information that matters to them. Marketing and Communications work closely with staff from all departments, the Mayor, CAO and City Council to develop corporate communications plans and marketing strategies in support of City initiatives, programs and services.
 


  Under the general guidance and direction of the Supervisor of Customer Systems, the Service Barrie Customer Systems Data Analyst position is responsible for supporting the development, implementation and maintenance of knowledge management solutions to support the delivery of services offered through Service Barrie. Specifically, this position assists in acquiring, documenting, and maintaining corporate information and processes for the inclusion and use within the Citizen Experience Management (CEM) system and other applicable databases/platforms. In addition, this position assists the Supervisor of Customer Systems with onboarding and training new staff in Service Barrie systems use, assists with various research, extracting data from the CEM, and preparing reports for the Supervisor of Customer Systems and Manager of Customer Service to support overall operations of Service Barrie. Overall, this position plays an integral role in maintaining the knowledge base and CEM to optimize use and to support the efficient, centralized, consistent delivery of customer service for the wide range of City services, procedures, practices, policies, and programs.
 




Our Culture and Qualifications of the Job



Corporate Culture



Your workplace values align with our corporate values of Strive, Share and Care and you want to join us in providing exceptional services and programs to build a prosperous, growing and sustainable community

Three (3) year College Diploma in Public Management, Information Systems or related discipline




Experience



Four (4) years of experience performing duties related to the above mentioned major responsibilities 
Demonstrated experience in a customer service role within an office and/or government work environment 
Demonstrated experience maintaining information/knowledge systems




Knowledge/Skill/Ability



General knowledge of the following principles and standards: the City of Barrie’s services, procedures, practices and programs
Working knowledge of the following principles and standards: customer service delivery standards and techniques; municipal, regional, provincial and federal government services and programs; call centre technology, including Citizen Experience Management (CEM) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems
Demonstrated Ability to: 
    
deal with difficult customers individuals, diffuse emotionally-charged situations and resolve customer issues in a diplomatic and professional manner

Advanced skills include: Analytical; Attention to Detail; Collaboration; Customer Service; Initiative; Organizational; Presentation; Prioritization; Problem Solving; Process Mapping; Report-writing; Time Management; Troubleshooting; Written Communication
Advanced computer literacy using the following systems and software: • Computer literacy utilizing knowledge management/customer relationship management software, computerized maintenance management systems software, registration software, financial software, and other related software applicable to City services and programs
Availability to accommodate deadlines or peak period workloads that may extend beyond designated normal workday hours or normal hours per week




Conditions of Employment



Satisfactory Criminal Record Check*



Please note that this is a requirement of the position for any new employees to the City of Barrie in accordance with the Police Record Check Procedure. Existing employees will be grandparented from this requirement.





Other Important Information



Locatio
n: City Hall, 70 Collier Street, Barrie, Ontario
 


Hours: The normal hours of work are 35 hours per week in accordance with the Collective Agreement.
 


Wage: This position is within the CUPE Local 2380 Bargaining Unit with the following pay level and 2022 pay range:
 


Pay Level: Level 6
Yearly Salary: $59,222.80 to $70,998.20 per year
Hourly Pay Rate: $32.54 to $39.01 per hour



Benefits: This position includes a comprehensive union benefit plan, including but not limited to extended health and dental coverage, life and accident insurance, paid vacation and sick days, short/long term disability plans, OMERS pension plan, discounted rate for City Fitness Memberships and much more.
