Title: Big Data Analyst
Description:
About ThinkLP 
ThinkLP imagines a world where there is zero retail crime and all companies operate safely & effectively, ensuring all employees return home at the end of the day.
At ThinkLP, we are helping to drive a loss prevention industry transformation with awesome loss prevention software. The innovative ThinkLP software platform has become an industry leader and The Globe and Mail recently recognized ThinkLP for being a top growing company in Canada. Headquartered in Waterloo, Ontario, we have the honour and privilege of serving some of the world's most recognizable companies, and we continue to grow! We're always looking for brilliant, self-motivated, big-picture thinkers who love software and have a propensity to get things done. 
Tell me more about the ThinkLP software? 
ThinkLP is an incredibly configurable case management software, built on the Salesforce Platform to centralize your data, get immediate results, and act instantly, all from the web or mobile apps allowing you to collaborate and take action from anywhere. We recommend all to check out our website to hear about the latest and greatest we have to offer.
What would I be doing at ThinkLP? 
This is a unique career opportunity for a motivated technical, data-driven individual to help grow an innovative software company. Are you an innovative thinker and passionate about helping companies achieve success in the cloud? Do you live and breathe the digital lifestyle and want to work as a key team member building a cloud-based company? As a Big Data Analyst, you will provide the insights needed to work with and analyze data across numerous domains, structures, and formats. This role has a specific responsibility of developing Big Data Optimization scripts and queries using technologies such as PostgreSQL.
What are my main duties? 
As a small and rapidly growing organization, your primary objective is to understand client data and load it into the ThinkLP product, the core responsibilities will include:

Reverse engineering and analyzing data to be converted into ThinkLP’s data models


Working with established processes to import the transformed data into the product


Contribute towards continually improving the data models developed by ThinkLP, as well as the processes used to import data into these models and the platform


Supporting client understanding of data by creating visualizations within the platform


Building platform data flows to manipulate and merge new and/or existing data


Writing optimized SQL queries to get the best performance out of data transformation and loading processes

What are the requirements for this position? 

Bachelor of Computer Science, Applied Science, Engineering or equivalent educational achievements or work experience


Highly motivated and independent with an ability to help drive growth in a startup software organization


Intermediate to advanced experience with SQL queries and Relational Databases


A passion for analyzing and making discoveries from data


Understanding of different file/data formats (E.g., CSV, JSON, XML, Fixed/Positional, etc.)


Confident and knowledgeable in the software development lifecycle, including system integrations and IT architectures and modelling

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Maplesoft Group is currently seeking a Sr. Data Analyst one of our clients in the National Capital Region.
 
 The following responsibilities are associated with the “Statement Of Work” but are not limited to:
 
 Description of Service
 
 The Master Data Management (MDM) Program is an intensive multi-year initiative to implement a solution that will standardize, consolidate and significantly improve the client’s use of core enterprise data. In 2022, the MDM team will focus on the delivery of a Proof of Value (PoV) MDM solution for assessment by EDC business and technology stakeholders. This effort will be followed by the first production release of the solution. The MDM team is using an Agile approach (Scrum) for the MDM delivery.
 
 Primary Responsibilities
 


Senior Data Analysis services will contribute to the detailed data analysis and design of the MDM solution. The selected candidate will perform key functions to: catalog master and reference data; define data requirements and business rules; perform data profiling; document data processes/flows; document data mapping details; assist standard operating procedure (SOP) analysis and documentation; assist data dictionary definition; perform data quality assessment and testing to align with EDC data governance and quality standards.



Senior Data Analysis services also requires understanding of client ask, working with clients to further refine the details. Deep dive into the business rules and data transformation rules requirements. Data flow diagrams will need to be created for visual representation of data transformation between internal and external systems.



The Senior Data Analyst will be expected to ramp up quickly on current state data architecture and become familiar with client’s data governance and data quality standards.

 Specific Project Requirements
 


Collecting, documenting, and analyzing MDM data requirements



Data profiling/analysis and data querying



Data cleansing, data transformation



Documenting/mapping business processes, SOPs



Building crosswalks and mapping tables for reference data



Analyzing source systems to find discrepancies/collisions for reference data



Working with team members to provide data analysis and design leadership and communicate about deliverables, schedule, possible risks, and appropriate contingencies



Working closely and collaboratively with management, stakeholders, and staff to optimize the overall MDM delivery

 Skills
 
 Top 3 Skills:
 


Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.



Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience in data analysis and profiling, working with multiple data sources and stakeholder groups including end-user/business teams.



Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience in data quality analysis and experience with reverse engineering the source to target mapping to gain data insights



 Other Skills:
 


Prior experience with Informatica MDM (is an asset).



Strong SQL/SQL query skills.



Experience with JSON, XML, and Databricks Parquet data structures and transformations.



Prior experience on MDM/data standardization and consolidation initiatives is an asset.



 Assets:
 


A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related degree.



10+ years of broad experience in IM/IT solution design and delivery, including working knowledge with infrastructure, database platform, middleware, and applications.



Well-rounded experience in the whole data lifecycle management and hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, data quality, SQL programming, ETL development, metadata management and master data management, business intelligence and database administration.



Good understanding and practical implementation experience with integration design patterns. Strong understanding of Data Management Body of Knowledge is a plus.



Excellent verbal and written communication, critical thinking, time management, priority planning and interpersonal skills.


 Maplesoft Group prides itself on its distinct corporate culture and recognizes that success is a direct reflection of our most valuable asset - our people. Therefore, attitude and ambition are key personality traits we seek out, along with skill and aptitude, in potential employees.
 
 Maplesoft Group is committed to having a diverse, representative workforce and continuing to build an inclusive environment. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Maplesoft Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants irrespective of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal peoples or any other legally protected factors.
 
 All employment decisions are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications.
 
 We are committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and a work environment that supports our diverse workforce. Please let us know if you require accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process. We can be reached at Maplesoft Info at info@maplesoftgroup.com.
 
 We thank you for your interest in Maplesoft Group and wish to advise you, that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Audit Data Analyst - Remote or Hybrid
Description:
Date: Jul 6, 2022 
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CA, R3C-3P1 
Company: Wawanesa Insurance 


We’re proud to give our employees the flexibility to choose how and where they want to work. In this role, you will decide whether your preference is to work from home (remote), work from the office or a hybrid of time spent at both. You may live and work anywhere that Wawanesa operates in Canada. 
The Wawanesa Mutual Insurance Company, founded in 1896, is Canada’s largest mutual insurer, with $3.9 billion in annual revenue and assets of $10.5 billion. Wawanesa Mutual, with executive offices in Winnipeg, is the parent company of Wawanesa General, which offers property and casualty insurance in California and Oregon; Wawanesa Life, which provides life insurance products and services throughout Canada; and Western Financial Group, which distributes personal and business insurance across Western Canada. With more than 5,700 employees, Wawanesa proudly serves more than two million policyholders in Canada and the United States. Wawanesa is thrilled to be named one of Canada’s Best Employers by Forbes for 2022. This certification recognizes us as a leading employer and reinforces that we’re a company that values our people for who they are and the work they do to support our customers, communities, and brokers. Wawanesa is also a Manitoba Top Employer for 2022 recognizing that we are an exceptional place to work. Wawanesa actively gives back to organizations that strengthen communities where it operates, donating well above internationally recognized benchmarks for excellence in corporate philanthropy. 
We are currently looking for dedicated, driven, and enthusiastic individuals who thrive in an environment that welcomes change and are looking for an opportunity for diverse experience and advancement on a growing team.





 Job Overview


 Working under moderate supervision, the Audit Data Analyst is responsible for performing data extraction, transformation, descriptive analytics, and diagnostic analytics to support the Wawanesa's Internal Audit team in assurance and consulting activities across the enterprise.


Job Responsibilities

Researches, extracts and manipulates complex and large volumes of data from relevant sources
Assesses data quality to evaluate impact on analytics and identify improvement opportunities
Synthesizes data to support risk assessments and create actionable audit insights based on the engagement scope
Participates and contributes to data analytics planning activities within Internal Audit
Performs descriptive and diagnostic analytics to support assurance and consulting activities
Collaborates with team members on exception analysis and refinement of analytics results
Assists with the presentation of analytics work to stakeholders including Senior Management
Develops and maintains right-sized internal documentation and maintains quality standards
Assists with internal reporting and preparing department KPIs
Challenges the status quo and pursues continuous improvement opportunities
Develops and maintains relationships with IS, Actuarial, and business resources
Maintains a high degree of professionalism in handling confidential and sensitive information
Performs other duties as assigned





Qualifications



Post-secondary degree with a preference for a combination of technical and business study (such as management information systems)
Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data related role, such as data analytics, data management, or other data-related technical.
Working knowledge of SQL and experience with database systems such as Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and Redshift is required
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik is considered an asset
Experience with programming languages such as Python is considered an asset
Experience with reporting tools such as MicroStrategy, Cognos, or SSRS is considered an asset
Experience with the AWS cloud environment and relevant tools (Athena, Glue, Lambda, S3) is considered an asset
Experience in P&C/Life insurance or financial services is considered an asset
Demonstrated ability to collaborate and work as part of a team
Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills




#LI-WAWA
#LI-REMOTE



 Wawanesa provides its employees with a respectful, challenging and rewarding environment where they can maximize their potential while contributing to the company’s goals. Our full-time permanent employees are provided with highly competitive compensation packages (salaries, generous vacation allowance, leave top up, annual bonus plan, premium free benefits and a pension plan). Wawanesa provides a stable environment for its employees in today’s challenging markets.  Wawanesa is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is equitable and inclusive for all. Wawanesa provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s protected status: race/ethnicity, colour, religion, creed, sex or gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family or marital status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, national origin, disability, military or veteran status, or any other protected status. Accommodations are available upon request throughout all aspects of the selection process. Candidates requiring accommodations may contact, in confidence, jobs@wawanesa.com.  If you are interested in this exciting, challenging position with Wawanesa, apply today with your Resume.

 All Wawanesa job applicants are subject to Wawanesa's Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Governance Project Analyst
Description:
Schedule


           M-F, 8:30am - 4:30pm, 35 hours.
          




Education Level



Bachelor's Degree
Master's an asset






Career Level


           Minimum of five years experience in higher education with a demonstrated solid grasp of higher education data taxonomy and/or business processes in all functional areas; a good understanding of data privacy and security policy and practices; and proven experience with current technology solutions in the higher education environment as related to Finance, HR, and Student systems.
          






The Provost and Vice-President (Academic) is the chief academic officer of the University and provides vision and leadership for all of McMaster’s academic activities. The Associate Vice-President, Finance and Planning (Academic) provides leadership and strategic direction for the operating and financial activities of the Provost and academic and support areas. The Data Governance program is a pan-university initiative that engages with University leaders, information technology, privacy, information management and functional areas to identify and define data elements, to govern data systems and reports in order to improve accuracy and efficiency and move the university towards trusted and fit data to support evidence-based decision-making. 









Job Description










JOB SUMMARY:
 The Data Governance Project Analyst reports to the Senior Manager, Data Governance and takes leadership on planning, designing, and conducting various projects, interpreting findings, and disseminating results (written and verbal). Projects deal with various aspects of university business in support of Data Governance. Working closely with the AVP Finance and Planning (Academic), Institutional Research and Analysis office, and University Technology Services, the Data Governance Project Analyst assists with implementing and sustaining Data Governance at McMaster University. This includes the implementation of the data governance framework and associated principles, domains, policies, data quality and integrity standards, to achieve the required degree of consistency, standards, and protection to meet overall business needs and maturity across the enterprise. The Data Governance Project Analyst will assist with creating standards, procedures, and documentation/ training materials in support of Data Governance to ensure standards and best practices are being applied consistently across the organization, particularly as it relates to data quality and metadata management, making contributions that raise the profile and understanding of data and data governance principles and best practices across the University. The position involves collaborating with and training campus data stewards, stakeholders, and functional units to ensure that policy and processes support the effective sharing, protection, and leveraging of data as an asset in our planning, decision making, and mission activities.

 ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Is a key member of the Data Governance team and instructs, organizes, and co-ordinates the activities of others involved in Data Governance university-wide, as required. 
Supports Data Governance by developing and documenting reporting requirements, developing the rules and requirements for reports and/or visualizations, and contributing to the development of reporting requirements to monitor data compliance, KPIs and metrics to gauge the health and maturity of the data governance program.
Demonstrates initiative and effective planning and organization skills to meet deadlines and complete quality work.


Champions working partnerships with functional stakeholders, IT teams and Data Governance bodies as well as Data Stewards, Custodians and the university community.
Responsible for engaging with functional business owners in defining quality standards and improving the quality and management of data assets across domains.
Collaborates with functional area partners to find opportunities to improve data accuracy and support them in their accountability for data quality.
Liaises with internal and external groups to builds effective relationships in support of data governance best practices, established procedures, and technologies.
Contributes to the development of appropriate materials and conducts training sessions related to Data Governance best practices, established procedures, and technologies. 
Work assignments relate to all functional aspects of the University, including applicants and registrants, faculty and staff, finances, physical resources, courses and programmes, design of business intelligence reports and institutional dashboards.
Designs and implements structured projects under broad guidelines for use in the decision-making of senior executives. 
Develops reports, presents the results, and makes recommendations pertaining to Data Governance to senior officers.
Establishes and operationalize data governance and quality control processes to safeguard integrity of data.
Manages the processes around metadata repositories (data dictionary, business glossary, lineage, and quality) and data classification process (identification of sensitive data).
Applies specialized knowledge to review and critically appraise published literature, interpret, and develop tables and charts to support data governance projects. Develops and shares knowledge of key methodologies that pertain to data governance in postsecondary education.
Involved in the design, development and maintenance of management information systems and business intelligence.
In the design of Data Governance methodologies, tools and reports, determines the information requirements and schedules for obtaining information and incorporates known developments in higher education and includes analysis of trends and implications stemming from issues and policies imposed by governments.
Identify and implement technology to support the automation of processes and policy requirements. 
Support the development of communication and training plans around the awareness and adoption of data governance and data governance policy.
Prepares briefing notes, presentations, procedures and training documents on all aspects of Data Governance.


 EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree 
Masters an asset


 EXPERIENCE:

Demonstrated experience and understanding of Data Governance principles combined with a positive client service orientation and consultative approach to understand complex business issues and to drive creative solutions to address internal and external client needs
Minimum of five years experience in higher education with a demonstrated solid grasp of higher education data taxonomy and/or business processes in all functional areas; a good understanding of data privacy and security policy and practices; and proven experience with current technology solutions in the higher education environment as related to Finance, HR, and Student systems.


 KNOWLEDGE/ SKILLS:

Excellent technical, organizational and communication skills with a track record of effectively facilitating discussion with diverse functional business units on complex topics along with experience in training and communicating to internal partners about data governance principles and best practices
Experience with SQL and an understanding of basic query, ETL, extracts and reports along with experience defining data quality and metadata management standards
Ability to work well with, and coordinate effectively, a range of subject-matter experts with cross-functional project teams.


Ability to work independently and proactively.


Proven ability to creatively solve problems and conflict issues


Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new circumstances.











How To Apply










To apply for this job, please submit your application online.









Employment Equity Statement










McMaster University is located on the traditional territories of the Haudenosaunee and Mississauga Nations and within the lands protected by the “Dish With One Spoon” wampum agreement.
 The diversity of our workforce is at the core of our innovation and creativity and strengthens our research and teaching excellence. In keeping with its Statement on Building an Inclusive Community with a Shared Purpose, McMaster University strives to embody the values of respect, collaboration and diversity, and has a strong commitment to employment equity.
 The University seeks qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion, who will contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives, and especially welcomes applications from indigenous (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) peoples, members of racialized communities, persons with disabilities, women, and persons who identify as 2SLGBTQ+.
 As part of McMaster’s commitment, all applicants are invited to complete a confidential Applicant Diversity Survey through the online application submission process. The Survey questionnaire requests voluntary self-identification in relation to equity-seeking groups that have historically faced and continue to face barriers in employment. Please refer to the Applicant Diversity Survey - Statement of Collection for additional information.
 Job applicants requiring accommodation to participate in the hiring process should contact:

Human Resources Service Centre at 905-525-9140 ext. 222-HR (22247), or
Faculty of Health Sciences HR Office at ext. 22207, or
School of Graduate Studies at ext. 23679

 to communicate accommodation needs.









Vaccination Policy Statement










The University is committed to providing and maintaining healthy and safe working and learning environments for all employees, students, volunteers and visitors. The University’s Vaccination Policy-COVID-19 Requirements for Employees and Students (the “Vaccination Policy”), requires all McMaster community members, including employees, accessing a McMaster campus or facility in person to be fully vaccinated or to have received an exemption from the University for a valid human rights ground. While the Policy will be currently paused, this Policy may resume quickly and on short notice, as informed by public health advice and direction. As a result, failure to achieve and maintain fully vaccinated status or an approved human rights-based exemption may result in termination of employment. This is a term and condition of employment. The University will continue to follow the guidance of public health organizations to define fully vaccinated status.

Title: Business Systems Analyst (C1425)
Description:
Summary of Duties

Reports to a Manager of Information Systems as designated by Director, Technology Services. Develops and/or assists with selection and implementation of business solutions, providing consultation services in the selection of business solutions, including recommending appropriate hardware or software platforms; develops systems and applications and provides training and on-going support of hardware and software systems, and monitors effective use of the same.

Work Performed

Responsible for Business Process Reviews leading to recommendations for process change including new or improved business systems. Upon approval, responsible for implementing cost effective solutions using hardware, software, staff and other resources.
 Analyzes problems and develops methods to improve the effectiveness of business systems and equipment through effective programming using appropriate languages and development tools, and recommending support utilities and/or purchased solutions required to support such systems.
 Recommends to and liaises with supervisor, non-Technology Services managers and external vendors as required with respect to personnel, systems and hardware adjustments required to implement and maintain effective systems.
 Instructs and advises Project Team members on matters related to assignments, depending on specific technical skills required may have role of Project Leader.
 Participates in Departmental and outside agency priority reviews, project scheduling, and makes recommendations regarding automation and long term planning.
 Evaluates the ongoing effectiveness of systems in meeting their intended objectives, recommending improvements in both systems and methods within Technology Services and user Departments.
 Assists with plans, schedules and coordination of requests for business systems and/or equipment to ensure the effective and efficient selection, installation, implementation and ongoing use of the same. Responsible for Project Management for assigned projects.
 Provides input towards the development and administration of standards and guidelines (for feasibility studies, data security and integrity methods, systems analysis, systems design, programming, training programs, user developed applications etc.).
 Introduces new ideas towards the development of work plans.
 Performs research, evaluation, review and assessment of hardware and/or software products and recommends changes.
 Responsible for training (including course material development reflecting changing technology, general class room instruction and formal presentations to internal and external personnel) and instruction of both Technology Services and non-Technology Services management and staff.
 Maintains a current knowledge of business technology, through continuous formal and self-learning programs.
 Installs or assists with installation of equipment, software and/or components and develops complex technical coding requirements for special projects, training courses and research projects.
 Liaises with third party application software vendors, Provincial or Federal agencies, internal and external personnel, auditors, and other computer sites regarding business solutions.
 Access to, and/or maintains passwords and User rights to selected areas of Corporate systems as assigned by management ensuring confidentiality of information accessed through use of such passwords.
 Performs related duties as assigned.

Qualifications/Experience

Three year Community College Business Information Systems Diploma.
 Three years related experience.

Specialized Training & Licenses

Valid Driver's License - Class G
 Industry designations and/or courses on specific products may be required.

Compensation and Other Information

$55,175 - $80,171 (Level 14)
 This is a permanent position being filled on a temporary basis for up to 1 year.
 Other Information: Current hours of Work: Monday - Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. These hours of work are subject to change in accordance with the Collective Agreement and may include evening hours and Saturdays.
 NOTE: Applicants may be required to complete a job related test.


Our hiring process is in accordance with the Mandatory Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination Administrative Policy


 As an inclusive employer, we are committed to providing a fully accessible recruitment process. Please contact us at any time during the recruitment process and let us know what accessible supports you may need.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Knowledge Management and Strategic Enablement team provides operational support to the Legal Department at TD.  Business Analyst – Works closely with stakeholders to identify, document, and analyze processes and requirements. Also, candidate will perform Quality Assurance activities and creating and maintain documentation to support implementation of software solutions within the legal department.



Job Description

Depth & Scope:

Define, develop, maintain and employ continuous improvement efforts for report requirements/specification along with delivery policies.
Perform monthly reporting activities that will be published to executives and other legal staff members.
Perform "ad hoc" reporting for the legal department at large.
Develop reporting "Self Service" portal where requests can be tracked, clarified, tested and delivered while maintaining history.
Provide data analysis to find trends, issues, areas of improvement, areas of maturity and support the overall needs of the department, as it continues on its digital transformation.
Must be highly motivated to perform with minimal supervision and direction, while providing business support for and advancing TD Legal's Digital Transformation journey.
Advances TD Legal's Knowledge Management Vision and Strategy and supports design and execution of Strategic Technology Roadmap.
Identifies continuous improvement opportunities in the support of end-to-end process of legal software service delivery.
Fosters an environment that encourages productivity, innovation, process improvement, knowledge management, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism.
Partners closely with members of the Legal team and other shared services functions.




Job Requirements

Education & Experience:

Must have expert knowledge in major enterprise reporting tools, including Tableau.
Bachelor's degree and/or progressive work experience, including as set out below
5+ years of related reporting and data analysis experience required.
Expert knowledge of MS Word and Excel.
3 or more years of experience with TeamConnect and/or TyMetrix 360 is preferred.
Demonstrated ability to lead software configuration projects within a financial institution's corporate legal department or similar.
Experience leading Transformational Change
Demonstrated commitment to and capabilities for Matter Management, document managements, knowledge management and invoice/financial management.
Experience in negotiating with and managing vendors and third parties

Ability to interpret and analyze complex issues and problems and to develop and effectively implement solutions to advance business strategy

Flexible thinker, able to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities.
Understanding of data and information governance
Exceptional oral and written communication skills
Ability to exercise sound judgment
Strong teamwork and client skills
Strong technology aptitude including i) proficiency with standard office software and ability to learn and apply new technologies in work environment and ii) capacity to understand current and emerging technologies in the industry and how they affect business objectives
Role model behaviors consistent with TD's leadership profile

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Research Analyst



 The Canadian Association of University Teachers (CAUT) is seeking to fill the regular, full-time position of Research Analyst.
   


 Reporting to the Director of Legal Services and Labour Relations, General Counsel, and under the coordination of the Research Officer, this position conducts and supports research, responds to internal and external research requests, and manages data orders, data collection, cleaning, coding, comparison, and analysis. The incumbent is an experienced research analyst with expertise in qualitative and quantitative research activities.
   


 Duties and Responsibilities



 Works in consultation with the Research Officer to deliver timely research projects in support of organizational and member association goals.
 Conducts qualitative and quantitative research on collective agreement negotiations, benefits, salary trends, labour market issues, and other issues of interest to CAUT and member associations.
 Interprets information to make formal recommendations.
 Assists in the presentation of research results.
 Maintains research databases.
 Orders, collects, cleans, codes, and analyzes data.
 Identifies information that could be relevant to CAUT’s interests and needs.
 Responds to internal and external general research requests.
 Maintains research documentation and electronic files and databases in accordance with established protocols.
 Adheres to established processes and quality control systems for research workflow and recommends enhancements to improve quality or efficiency.
 Adopts new tools and systems as relevant to the role.
 Participates in regular team meetings to ensure alignment on goals, progress against priorities, and two-way communication.
 Other related duties as assigned by CAUT management.



 Hours



 Full-time position, 35 hours per week
 May be required to work overtime on occasion



 Qualifications



 Education & Experience:
   


 Completion of post-secondary education in industrial relations, economics, or related discipline, including specialized technical education in research.
 At least 3 years of professional experience in a similar capacity.
 Work experience in the post-secondary education field preferred.
 Demonstrated experience in designing and conducting research, using strong analytical skills such as quantitative and qualitative analysis is essential.
 Demonstrated experience in managing data with data/information management techniques and the use of databases is required.
 Professional experience in an association, trade union, and/or not-for-profit organization preferred.



 Language Requirements:
   



 Ability to work in both official languages at an advanced level is a strong asset; fluency in verbal and written English essential.




 Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
   


 Excellent quantitative analytical skills with proficiency in data collection and analysis.
 Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly verbally and in writing to a range of audiences.
 Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build appropriate and constructive relationships with internal and external contacts, founded on credibility and trust.
 Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively and with tact as part of a team.
 Ability to work independently in consultation with the Research Officer and other staff while exhibiting the highest degree of initiative and sound judgment.
 Strong planning, time management, and project-management skills to effectively balance competing requirements and manage multiple priorities, complex projects, and deadlines with minimal supervision.
 Organized, detail oriented, and thorough in researching, developing, and analyzing data.
 Demonstrated ability to effectively condense and summarize large volumes of information into useful and relevant guidance.
 Ability to work within established procedures and identify opportunities for improvements.
 Efficient at using the Microsoft suite of products, including spreadsheet applications, and other tools facilitating member data and internal and external communications.
 Understanding of and commitment to CAUT’s policies, practices and procedures and alignment with CAUT’s values and objectives, including social justice, equity, and human rights.



 CAUT is committed to the principles of employment equity in hiring and in all of its employment practices and seeks to diversify its workforce. Aboriginal People, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTQ2S, racialized people, and women are actively encouraged to apply.



 This position has been classified as Category 3 in the Collective Agreement between CAUT and COPE Local 225. The current hire rate for this category as of July 1, 2021, is $96,269. The position includes five (5) weeks of vacation annually as well as a generous benefits and defined contribution pension plan.
   


 This position is based out of Ottawa.
   


 Interested candidates should submit their applications by 
    5:00 PM on July 24, 2022 via CAUT’s Career Centre at www.caut.ca/careers. All applications must be addressed to the Executive Director including a cover letter and resumé. All applications will be treated confidentially. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Police Criminal Intelligence Analyst - Permanent
Description:
The primary function of this position, through tactical and strategic analysis is to produce, prepare and disseminate a variety of information relevant to actual or anticipated local criminal activity in order to increase operational effectiveness, prevent crime and apprehend suspects. The position also provides assistance for Policing Services strategic planning by identifying, gathering and preparing information related to statistics, demographics and projections. Provides mentorship and direction to less experienced Analysts when required.
 Job Requirements:
 Education & Experience

Post-secondary education – Bachelor’s Degree in a related discipline; Criminology, Criminal Justice, Police Science, Statistics, Mathematics or related fields
A minimum of Five (5) years’ experience in policing or government environment that clearly demonstrates increasing responsibility in crime analysis and research.
Two (2) years directly related Crime Analysis experience in a policing environment and/or Business related analytical experience may be considered.


Competencies


Organizational and planning skills to develop, initiate, prioritize and manage analytical responsibilities of a variety of constantly-changing scopes and timelines while ensuring a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Able to think critically and innovatively to effectively analyze data, see linkages and patterns (e.g. criminal activity), and problem-solve.
Able to research, analyze and retain details of current crime patterns, create and present concise and effective criminal activity reports, presentations and other communication material with limited preparation time.
Proven public speaking and presentation skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal) to interact and build relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Adept in the use of "i2" analytical software, Police information systems (PROS, JOIN, IIS, CPIC, ROADS), open source research, the internet, GeoTime and Arc GIS Mapping.
Knowledge of applicable and relevant legislation at all levels. Must be well versed and highly knowledgeable in the statutes and laws of Canada, including but not limited to The Criminal Code of Canada, Provincial and Federal Statutes, and Municipal Bylaws. Familiarity with the City of Red Deer RCMP policies and Detachment practices will be an asset.
Able to obtain (and retain) a RCMP issued Top Secret Security Clearance.
PROS Certificate(s) – User and Records Management Course, or successfully passing the course when offered.
Advanced knowledge and experience in the use of Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Advanced Level and Adobe Acrobat Pro.
Able to work independently with little supervision, with strong decision making capabilities and critical problem solving skills, able to multi-task and prioritize, and able to remain calm in emergency and stressful situations
Able to discretely handle sensitive information while maintaining confidentiality
Must possess excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to be self-motivated.
Demonstrated ability to work as part of the team; contributing to a respectful workplace at all times and living up to The City of Red Deer Cornerstone Values; embracing our RISE Principles (Respect, Integrity, Service, and Excellence).

Specific Demands of the Job:

Hours will consist of shift work (predominately days, however evenings and weekends may be required) based on 37.5 hours weekly.
Work is performed in a fast-paced and stressful environment often with many interruptions;
Subject to general office noise and sitting for prolonged periods of time

Affiliation: Canadian Union of Public Employees, Local 417
 Hours of Work: 75 hours biweekly, Monday to Friday - 7:00 am to 3:30 pm.
 **Please Note: Must successfully pass a stringent RCMP Security Clearance before commencing employment. If you currently have the required clearance, please indicate it clearly in your resume.

Title: Manual Database/ETL Test Analyst
Description:
Position Description:

   We offer the opportunity to work with Canada’s largest Information Technology Outsourcing and Management Consulting Company with a true global presence in a fast-paced and energetic atmosphere where your personal and professional growth is accelerated by your desire and sense of commitment. CGI’s continuous growth is a testament to the confidence clients place in them and to the dedication of their professionals. At CGI, all employees are called members because they feel a powerful sense of ownership and accountability. Members at CGI are building their own company – in 100+ offices worldwide. CGI has the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for clients – and for members; that’s why an astounding 90 percent of them are CGI shareholders.
    We're expanding in Atlantic Canada and we need your skills, enthusiasm, and dedication as part of our team.
   
 Duties and Responsibilities
    As the Test Analyst, you will carry out the responsibilities required to ensure the quality of the software delivered to the client. Our Client has embarked on migrating legacy applications to Oracle Retail, leveraging Scrum Agile techniques. This is a critical application that helps the client with Planning to manage store operations and inventory. 
   
 Responsibilities
   


Performs testing of medium to high complexity to ensure that the system is implemented and functions as designed
Ensures that testing meets organization standards for compliance
Partners and collaborates with project team members and the business to design/develop testing strategies
Creates medium to high complexity test plans and test cases utilizing business/solution requirements and technical design documentation
Executes medium to high complexity test cases both manually and/or by automation
Performs triage for medium to high complexity defects, which includes detection, risk assessment, documentation and retesting. Escalates more complex defects to the appropriate level
Assesses software for stability
Provides input to QA Project Leader on project status
Share knowledge and provide guidance to team members
Performs other duties as assigned

 Qualifications ( REQUIRED)
   

5-10 years of experience as a manual tester specializing in database / ETL testing
ETL, end to end and functional testing experience.
Write and execute medium complexity SQL queries
Run simple Unix commands and write and execute simple shell scripts.
SAFe Agile / Scrum Experience
 o Engaged in story definitions, assist agile team in story estimates and sequencing
    o Engage in scrum ceremonies and agile project execution
   

Domain knowledge: Retail/Merchandising. Interaction with Business and IT Stakeholders in RETAIL domain

 Qualifications (GOOD TO HAVE)
   

Retail Merchandising / Planning Experience 
Exposure to Oracle Retail (RPAS), Mainframe would be a plus
Good understanding of data analysis and data migration would be a plus
Automation Testing experience 

 Educational Qualifications
    Bachelors Degree in related field
   
 Position requires one to have authorization to work in Canada.
   


LI-AD1 




Skills:

Test Case / Script Development
 Database



What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on  While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.   When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.  At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.   Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI — where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
ABOUT ENVIRONICS ANALYTICS:
 Environics Analytics (EA) is a marketing services company specializing in geodemographic-based segmentation, site evaluation modelling, and custom analytics. At EA, you will solve meaningful and challenging tasks with a friendly team of the most brilliant minds.

 
We hire personality, not just a pair of hands. Here you're free to express your unique qualities and explore different domains and technologies that interest you.

 EA is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you require any accommodation to participate in the hiring process, please note the request in your application. We welcome people of all abilities.


 We enjoy working on-site and spending time with our team. We have a Hybrid work model. We look forward to working with you in our fantastic office located in Toronto at 33 Bloor Street East 2 days per week. Great coffee is on us!


 ROLE OBJECTIVE:
 Reporting to the Insights Leader, the Insights Analyst is responsible for bringing together Environics Analytics (EA) data, software and services to execute client projects. These projects may include customer profiling, creating custom target segments, developing personas, and other similar activities using EA’s core data, analytics platforms, and segmentation approaches such as PRIZM. Given that a significant portion of the Insights Analyst’s time will be spent creating client-facing work (generally Powerpoint presentations), this individual must be very detail-oriented, have excellent verbal and written communication skills, and have a strong client service orientation. There are elements of this role that are client-facing.
 SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
 To effectively fulfill the responsibilities of this position, the employee must be able to:

Summarize data in tables and charts, interpret the data, look for relevant insights and write reports in support of client objectives.
Prepare and present Powerpoint presentations to communicate research results effectively.
Manage projects from start to finish, managing timelines while maintaining a high level of quality.
Participate in client meetings and assist in identifying client needs; help recommend solutions from among EA’s data, software, and services to meet those needs.
In conjunction with the Account Manager and Client Services team, educate, train and support key clients on EA’s data and tools; answer any client questions about the data or other deliverables received.
Work closely with other staff in Sales, Account Management, Client Services, Data Solutions, and other teams to meet client requirements.
Work with the Account Manager to identify new product and sales opportunities among existing clients.
Communicate opportunities for more effective and efficient workflow/processes to the Director of Insights and/or the Account Manager (as relevant).
Other duties as required.



 ______________________________________________________________________


 QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIRED SKILLS:



Education – Post-secondary degree in Geography, Social Sciences, Business or related field
Experience– 1 – 3 years of experience (or equivalent summer experience) at EA or in a related field
Client Focus – Dedicated to setting and meeting the expectations and requirements of clients and acts with the client in mind. Establishes effective relationships and gains and maintains the trust and respect of clients.
Analytical Skills– Effectively synthesizes complex or diverse information. Uses sound judgement to complement data-based insight, supporting and explaining the reasoning for decisions.
Planning/Organizing– Effectively prioritizes and plans work activities and demonstrates the ability to multi-task.
Results-Oriented– Focused on delivering high-quality work product to clients professionally and promptly.
Communication Skills– Able to communicate ideas and expectations. Effectively listens for understanding and asks questions for clarification. Presents ideas effectively in both verbal and written form.
Interpersonal Skills– Approachable and easy to talk to. Relates well to all kinds of people in the organization, particularly with others in Insights and the Sales department. Able to effectively build rapport with others.
Presentation Skills– Able to create and deliver informative, compelling presentations that capture and keep the audience’s attention in person and via online meetings.
Technical Skills – Expertise in all Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and facility with other software applications, including EA’s proprietary ENVISION product. Working knowledge of Tableau is a plus.
Teamwork- Balances team and individual responsibilities. Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views, giving and welcoming feedback.
Innovation- Generates suggestions for improving the effectiveness and efficiency of workflows and deliverables.

Title: Business Analyst, Client Governance
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our PRESTO Division, Client Governance is seeking a Business Analyst, Client Governance to identify and clarify business requirements to support PRESTO Client Governance team’s deliverables. 
What will I be doing? 

Identifies and clarifies business requirements to support the PRESTO Client Governance team’s deliverables 
Acts as a key liaison with business units to ensure full business participation in Scheme related projects and recommending priorities to mitigate risks on significant projects 
Supports Manager with oversight of scheme participants with respect to adherence to scheme interface and security strategies, and payment scheme regulations 
Develops a thorough understanding of PRESTO client business goals, practices, and processes to translate them into required Scheme documentation artifacts 
Identifies and facilitates development of documentation for new and modified business policies and procedures to ensure effective implementation of Scheme rules 
Provides support to governance forums and processes to assist in guiding client contractual relationships, ensuring decisions are made in a timely manner and under the appropriate forums 
Administers the document approval, storage and access processes and tools to enable tracking of decisions made and commitments delivered as it relates to Scheme Governance 
Provides support to scheme related change request processes, including coordination with internal teams and external stakeholders 
Supports the Manager Client Governance, PRESTO in ongoing client governance to ensure policies are well socialized, represented and implemented 
Facilitates dialogue and discussions between internal stakeholders and Scheme participants, when required, to ensure alignment to Scheme governance 
Assists the business to prepare business cases, understand scope limitations, and manage expectations during project implementations as it relates to Scheme governance 
Represents Scheme to develop requirements and customer-focus objectives, especially during issues resolution 
Collaborates with diverse stakeholders to gather qualitative and quantitative data needed for solid decision-making 
Monitors Scheme governance documentation, agendas, materials and implementation procedures to meet corporate and any contractual obligations 
Identifies opportunities for improving or streamlining scheme processes and practices 
Update and improve SharePoint site for the Client Governance department to hold a repository of governance related materials and references for PRESTO 
Provide support with finding opportunities for continuous improvement within the Client pillar 

What skills & qualifications do I need? 

Post-secondary degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related discipline – or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent 
Minimum four (4) years’ experience, preferably in the transport or construction industry and / or the public sector 
Experience successfully deploying technology solutions in the transport or construction industry is an asset 
Experience with computerized quantitative and analytical tools (e.g. workflows, and business process analysis) and with MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project, etc.) 
Interpersonal, oral/written/presentation communications skills to document and present business needs, specifications, reports, project documents, and implementation plans 


Accommodation:  Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance 

Application Process:  All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application. 

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. 
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Job Information




Job Requisition ID: 30573
Ministry: Justice & Solicitor General
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full-time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Scope: Open
Closing Date: July 18, 2022
Classification: Subsidiary 02B 3625 Program Services 3




 About Us


  The Ministry of Alberta Justice and Solicitor General helps ensure that all Albertans can live in safe and resilient communities while having access to a fair and innovative justice system. Working alongside its partners in law enforcement, family justice, health, the judiciary, criminal justice system and other stakeholders, the ministry has a direct or shared responsibility in all elements of the justice system in Alberta. To follow this link find out more about our department  Transformation Support Services (TSS) is a multi-disciplined area within the Business Transformation Branch under the Strategy, Support and Integrated Initiatives Division. Transformation Support Services provides key expertise for the Ministry in fundamental disciplines relating to the planning and execution of major transformational initiatives. Expertise can consist of training, mentoring, advice, assistance, methodologies, tools and templates, all of which are designed to improve the Ministry's capability and capacity to successfully achieve its business goals.






Role


 As a member of the TSS team, reporting directly to the Senior Project Manager, the Business Analyst is responsible for:

Liaising with key stakeholders;
Provide a range of business analysis services for internal and external stakeholders; and
Leading, participating and contributing to projects, managing their work, applying premium service delivery; enabling/achieving business priorities.


 Responsibilities focus on identifying and defining business needs, processes, requirements and facilitating the successful implementation and transition to business solutions.  The successful candidate will bring innovative research skills, strong understanding of business analysis best practices and data collection methodologies to support business solutions; have the ability to gather information and report on analysis to Ministry executives, stakeholders and staff; includes talent to lead and facilitate various workshops with the judiciary, internal staff, user community, and stakeholder groups to gather business opportunities, systemic changes, requirements and business processes.  The successful candidate must demonstrate excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills, strong written and oral communication skills, and excellent listening and interpersonal skills. The ability to work well in a team environment as well as being self-motivated is critical.







Qualifications


 University graduation in a related field such as business administration, accounting, marketing, economics, statistics, or computer and information science, plus a minimum of two (2) years progressively responsible related experience in a Business Analyst type role; or equivalent.  Required Please outline how your experience as it relates to the qualifications in detail in your cover letter. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.  Assets

Experience with business analysis methodology, especially in regards to process reengineering, elicitation, process modelling, and requirements analysis.
Experience with the PMI approach to project management
Completed business analysis certification


 Equivalencies considered: Directly related education or experience will be considered on the basis of 1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or 1 year of experience for 1 year of education.  Candidates with lesser qualifications may be considered at a lower classification and salary. 




APS Competencies


 Competencies are behaviours that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:




 Salary


 $2,556.10 - $3,355.81 bi-weekly) ($66,714 to $87,586 per annum) 




Notes


 Hours of work: 36.25/week  Positions Currently available:

one (1) permanent


 Final candidates will be asked to undergo a security screening.  What we offer:

Comprehensive benefits plan:
Pension plan:
Health Spending Account:
Leadership and mentorship programs
Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance


 This competition may be used to fill current and future vacancies within Government of Alberta.

 Please outline how your experience as it relates to the qualifications in detail in your cover letter. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered. 




How To Apply


  If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,  Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.  Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at  Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.  Resources for applicants:  It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)




 Closing Statement


 This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.  We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.  If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, and/or require a disability related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Katelynn Kelly at katelynn.kelly@gov.ab.ca.
