Title: Senior Business Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.
 Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home! 

About the team
 The Sales & Client Success analytics team provides insights and helps optimize strategy by working closely with leadership in our sales and customer care organizations. Our business is a two-sided marketplace of homeowners and service professionals, which makes our jobs complex and data rich. We work daily with sales and customer care leadership teams to develop, execute, monitor, and refine initiatives that drive value and quantify that value as it pertains to financial performance. Due to the multifaceted nature of our business, our team provides an excellent environment to stretch your business acumen, technical know-how and quantitative skills while providing insight to the company.
 Additionally, this team will help support our Marketing team that focuses on growing our pro network. This involves surfacing metrics, providing insights, and identifying opportunities that align with company goals.
 What you'll do

Build curated data sources in star schema and develop data pipelines to support strategic and operational improvements.
Synthesize large data sets into digestible information, primarily utilizing Snowflake, Excel, and Looker.
Conduct deep dive analyses with the intent to provide actionable items that foster new and creative ways to enhance and improve performance.
Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and be the subject matter expert on all data and objectives relating to the team you support.

Who you are

BA/BS in a quantitative field (Finance, Engineering, Economics, etc.)
4+ years of professional experience in a data analyst or data engineering role.
Advanced SQL, understanding of relational databases and Excel
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices and dashboard development
Basic to intermediate understanding of data modeling, data engineering concepts
Experience with Looker and Snowflake is a plus

We value diversity
 We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.
 Compensation & Benefits

The salary band for this position varies, commensurate with experience and performance.
Full medical, dental, vision package and a retirement plan to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

#LI-Remote #BI-Remote

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Senior Business Analyst - Dartmouth, Nova Scotia - 9mth Contract (Full-Time)
 Do you want to work for a company with engaged and passionate employees who lean in everyday?
 Now, imagine working for a company where you can positively impact the health and growth of all living things while protecting the environment.
 That's what the employees of Acadian Seaplants are proud to do each and every day.
 For Twenty consecutive years, Acadian Seaplants Limited has secured the designation as one of Canada's Best Managed Companies! In fact, Acadian Seaplants has achieved Platinum Status for the past nine years!
 Profile: As our Business Analyst, you will review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. Document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies. You should be familiar with relational database concepts and client-server concepts.
 Your Role: 

Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
 Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
 Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications
 Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures
 Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget
 Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
 Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential
 Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends
 Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
 Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models
 Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group
 Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making
 Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and presents findings of studies to client committees
 Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
 Review a variety of areas including operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and facilities
 Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes
 Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes
 Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
 Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues

 Qualifications/Competencies:

 Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study and 5 yr relevant working experience as a Business analyst
 Experience with SAP B1/HANA - SAP B1 being Priority
 Ability to translate Business Requirements into SAP Functional Requirements and create the necessary functional design specifications.
 Ability to write Business Cases, requirements and mock-ups between initially delivered SAP functionality and business needs
 Comfortable working in SAP/ERP environments.
 Ability to impact operations and effect change without being confrontational
 Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive
 Ability to work independently and with others
 Extremely organized with strong time-management skills

 Note: This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties that may be required to be performed now or in future. S/He will be required to follow any additional instructions deemed appropriate by the Vice President of Information Technology.
 If this job sounds like it was made for you, we'd like to meet you. To further explore this opportunity, just submit your application to Steve Empringham at sempringham@acadian.ca
 We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
The Digital Analyst will play a key role at StackPros Inc., where we design, create, deploy, maintain and grow industry-leading Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data Analytics and Cloud For Marketing products, solutions and services.
The Digital Analyst will play a role spanning both Marketing Intelligence and Data Systems workflows, responsible for supporting the delivery of comprehensive end-to-end solutions for StackPros’ clients.
The primary responsibility of this role is to support the Marketing Analytics Team by enabling excellent front-end development skills and technologies to parse web pages/user events, and integrate with Data Systems and Marketing intelligence platforms. The selected Candidate would ideally demonstrate experience working with DOM Objects, using native Javascript. Those who have been deeply involved in front-end web development projects that crossed over into/involved web analytics tools are preferred.
The Digital Analyst will be responsible for supporting client stakeholders and collaborating with internal teams on all StackPros’ deliverables. The individual will use their expertise and best practices to support the team in providing efficiencies, and superior quality to every deliverable.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Role-Specific Responsibilities:

Own end-to-end responsibility of analyzing online environment to deliver fully-functional tracking codes
Designing solutions to track user’s interaction onsite, and integrating massive data sets with Google Analytics 360
Create detailed tracking and tagging plans, following the best standards and conventions
Create custom tracking solutions, dealing with various challenges
Write documented and reusable tracking codes, using the best practices in JavaScript
Define custom dimensions, pushing tracked data into Google Analytics
Test and verify user events in Google Analytics
Work on different types of Tag management systems (Google Tag Manager, Tealium, Adobe DTM/Launch, etc.)
Setting up tag, Triggers, Variables, Custom Dimensions, and Cross Domain Tracking to support delivering full GA360 implementation projects
Execute and support both internal and client team members as it relates to:
Data collection through design and implementation of tracking codes (GTM, GA, Salesforce, Adobe, custom scripts)
Analytics setup, reporting and custom database feeds (GA360, Adobe Analytics, CM, DV360, Salesforce, Data Studio, Tableau etc.)
Data collection, setting and leveraging DMP based infrastructures, attribution modelling, A/B/N & multivariate testing, and dynamic creative will be essential

Internal Workflow:

Collaborate with team members on special projects, pitches and research into new technology, uses, applications and advancements
Oversee and own the delivery of client projects efficiently in collaboration with internal stakeholders
Collaborate with team members on new/speculative initiatives and deliverables as they arise
Work closely within all StackPros’ cross functional teams and collaborate in execution, planning and post delivery
Provide leadership, guidance and support to junior team members, including performance reviews
Maintain a dedication toward achieving excellence in StackPros’ delivery against client needs while maintaining strong internal relationships with internal partners

External Communication:

Act as a primary point of client contact for the marketing analytics needs of StackPros’clients, presenting to senior internal/external stakeholders
Stay involved in the majority of client communications, prioritizing your time based on urgency and importance
Maintain and exceed client satisfaction with deliverables, day-to-day work and overall value as a partner
Aim to involve other StackPros resources as appropriate, while ensuring the Accounts team directly resolves issues when feasible to maximize organizational efficiency
Cultivate opportunities for company growth, always considering areas where StackPros’ role could be expanded upon
Adapt to ever-changing client needs and expectations
Uphold StackPros’ highest standards for project delivery, client satisfaction and reputation

Qualifications:

3+ years of Web Analytics experience in Google Analytics (primary) or Adobe Analytics (secondary)
3+ years experience with Tag Management Systems like Google Tag Manager and Adobe Launch/DTM
Strong familiarity with marketing tracking pixels such as Facebook pixel, Google tags and floodlight tags
Excellent written & verbal communication skills are essential; candidate should be comfortable presenting and participating in group discussions of concepts with internal and external stakeholders
Ability to provide clear guidance and support for advanced problem solving and system design for enterprise-level clients, aiding the evolution of their digital practices

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

"Work from anywhere" in Canada policy
100% employer-paid benefits package
Yoga and meditation classes
Regular Lunch and Learns from your Team Mates
Fun Employee Events and Activities
Participation in Community Engagement

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
The University of Manitoba is a driving force of innovation, discovery and advancement. Our momentum is propelled by our campus community – UM faculty, staff and students whose determination and curiosity shape our world for the better. Our teaching, learning and work environment is uniquely strengthened and enriched by Indigenous perspectives. With two main campuses in Winnipeg, satellite campuses throughout Manitoba, and world-wide research, UM’s impact is global.
Discover outstanding employee benefits, experience world-class facilities and join a dynamic community that values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. We are one of Manitoba’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. At the University of Manitoba, what inspires you can change everything.
The opportunity: 
The data visualization specialist will contribute compelling graphics, charts and interactive visuals to enhance MCHP’s research content, focusing primarily on presentations of research to academic, government, and public audiences. The Data Visualization Specialist will be part of the Deliverable Research Unit and will also collaborate with members of other units such as Research Lab, Data Analysts, and the Communications team to support their work. This work of position will facilitate faster comprehension of important patterns and findings in the data, which can then be used by stakeholders to inform policy and planning. It will also enable MCHP to expand the breadth of our reporting products.
The qualifications and experience we’re looking for: 
· Bachelor's degree in statistics, population health, community health sciences, epidemiology, public health, or a related discipline is required.
· Minimum three (3) years of experience in transforming data from large datasets to design compelling data visualizations for reporting research findings, is required.
· Minimum three (3) years of experience using Power BI to develop interactive dashboard reports that vary in design and layout according to the audience is required.
· Experience with data journalism is an asset.
· Experience in communicating information for both an academic audience and a lay audience (e.g., public health policymakers and the general public) is required.
· Experience applying best design practices and accessibility principles is required.
· An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
· Demonstrable proficiency in using visualization tools, primarily Excel and Power BI, to create visuals and interactive dashboard reports from large data sets is required.
· Strong understanding of UX/UI concepts, interface usability, and accessibility guidelines (Accessibility for Manitobans Act guidelines or similar) and demonstrated record of good design flow in interactive applications is required.
· Must be able to implement and advise on visualization best practices in created content.
· Understanding of intermediate level statistics and ability to identify appropriate visuals to display results is required.
· Ability to summarize and build visualizations from statistical outputs/reports provided by data analysts is required.
· Understanding of data modeling (building relationships between tables) is required.
· Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills are required
· Ability to summarize and present complex information clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical audiences is required.
· Effective organizational, research, analytical and problem-solving skills are required.
· Ability to prioritize, adapt, and carry out activities within tight timelines is required.
· Must exhibit a positive and problem-solving mentality, strong work ethic and self-motivation.
· Must be a supportive and collaborative team contributor.
· Must have a creative vision, a passion for learning and willingness to adopt and share new ideas.
· Proficiency in DAX to manipulate data within Power BI is an asset.
· Ability to perform data analysis in software such as Power BI, Tableau, or R/R Studio is an asset.
· Ability to use software suites like ArcGIS for mapping is an asset.
· Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality, is required.
Why the University of Manitoba?
Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:

Comprehensive group benefits and pension plan.
Competitive vacation time.
Employee and Family Assistance Program.
A full spectrum of professional development opportunities.

Apply today through the University of Manitoba’s recruitment site, UM Careers: https://viprecprod.ad.umanitoba.ca/DEFAULT.ASPX?REQ_ID=21798
Closing Date: July 16, 2022
Applications will only be accepted if you apply on UM Careers.
The University of Manitoba is committed to the principles of equity, diversity & inclusion and to promoting opportunities in hiring, promotion and tenure (where applicable) for systemically marginalized groups who have been excluded from full participation at the University and the larger community including Indigenous Peoples, women, racialized persons, persons with disabilities and those who identify as 2SLGBTQIA+ (Two Spirit, lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, questioning, intersex, asexual and other diverse sexual identities).
If you require accommodation supports during the recruitment process, please contact 204-474-7195. Please note this contact information is for accommodation reasons only.
Application materials, including letters of reference, will be handled in accordance with the protection of privacy provisions of The Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (Manitoba). Please note that curriculum vitae will be provided to participating members of the search process.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $57,566.60-$83,064.80 per year
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: System Analyst
Description:
Job ID #342592
 System Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Financial Services Sector, PROCOM is looking for a System Analyst
System Analyst – Job Description 

Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business stakeholders and technology 
Creating system and data flow diagrams 
Lead the development of conceptual/architectural designs and user interface mock-ups. 
Collaborate with development staff on software designs 
Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommend solutions 
Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provides input based on analysis of information 
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment 
Technical analysis of product or application hardware and software to ensure that business and functional requirements can be met 
The Systems Analyst is a liaison and key communication bridge between the development and business teams 
Clear communication of technical requirements to the development team and development concerns to business stakeholders 
The Systems Analyst speaks the language of software development and product management 
Identify cross application/system enhancements 
Outline key dependencies and knock-on impacts of new development work 
Act as a technical consultant for Business partners during implementation of new products/services 
Lead review sessions of technical requirements 

System Analyst – Mandatory Skills 

5-8 years of relevant experience 
Advanced knowledge of Databases, SQL and Data analysis 
Proven experience using UML and creating system and data flow diagrams using industry tools 
Proven interpersonal, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills 
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication 
Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships 
Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly 
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail 
Problem Solver: Ability to solve complex issues and have a high ability to remove barriers, understanding internal and external organizational structures, dynamics and trade-offs 
Committed to a customer-first approach 
Growth Mind-set: Experience and passion for learning; implementing practices from others 
trying, failing, sharing practices and knowledge for others’ benefit 
Proficiency in using Jira and Confluence 

System Analyst - Nice to Have Skills 

Scrum Master certification (preferred) 

System Analyst - Assignment Start Date 
ASAP – 12 months to start 
System Analyst - Assignment Location 
Mississauga, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: ETL Developer & Support Analyst
Description:
Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ: SWIR) (TSX: SW) is an IoT pioneer, empowering businesses and industries to transform and thrive in the connected economy. We are a growing organization with a clear vision for being the IoT partner of choice for wireless device-to-cloud solutions. Our values of Innovation, Execution and Trust are the guiding principles in everything we do. Sierra Wireless has over 1,000 employees globally and operates in North America, Europe and Asia. For more information, visit www.sierrawireless.com.
  



 Our Commitment to Inclusion, Equity and Diversity


    At Sierra Wireless diversity is valued and celebrated. We strive to foster an inclusive organization. As a proud equal opportunity employer, we welcome people of every race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status to grow their careers here.
  


 Job Summary



 We have an opportunity for a ETL Developer & Support Analyst to join our Information Systems team in our Richmond, BC headquarters or remote in Canada working PST hours. In this role, you will design, develop and maintain Sierra’s SQL applications. You will work closely with stakeholders, the internal IT teams, and vendors to co-create solutions that sustain the critical operations of the company.
  


 Ideally, you have extensive experience in SQL along with previous experience in supporting in-house developed business-related Applications. You will provide support on internally built SQL/SSIS applications & related 3rd party systems, investigating, analyzing, and logging ongoing problems, implementing data fixes and bug fixes, developing resolutions with a focus on root cause. You will work with cross-functional internal teams and 3rd party vendors to enhance the applications.
  





 Responsibilities


 Provide efficient application support and administration, including incident resolution, problem management and application enhancements.
 Collaborate with business partners to understand the business process, the data integration and data needs.
 Triage the Production Support issues or Operational Requests, work with internal teams and our offshore vendor to resolve these issues and requests.
 Reverse engineer and document the custom-built SQL applications.
 Utilize fundamental design principles to build scalable applications.
 Write reusable functions, views, and database objects.
 Identify risks, deliver clear documentation, and work directly with internal stakeholders and external vendors to resolve production support issues, operational requests, and escalations
 Create reports and dashboards to perform data analysis and to troubleshoot and fix bugs
 Support and/or lead end user training, product testing, and rollouts
 Familiar with SSIS development skills required such as:
 o Control Flows, Data Flow , Data Transformation,
 o SSIS Catalog, environment Variable
 o Performance Tunning, dynamic connection
 o Troubleshoot production issue
 Familiar with various design and architectural patterns. SQL development skills are required such as:
 o Creating queries and stored procedures
 o Performance tune of queries and query optimization
 o Developing Dynamic SQL and stored procedures
 o Using indexes to speed up the SQL queries
 o Develop stored procedures, functions, packages, triggers, and views using SQL.
 Knowledge and hands on experience
 Designing and developing objects and components of relational and non-relational database.
 Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes.
 Implementing and Managing SQL Agent.
 Production support and reverse engineer the existing solution
 Other projects and tasks as assigned






Required Education, Experience & Skills


 2-5 years SQL application support experience
 Excellent analytical skills, with a can-do approach when facing unknown challenges
 Excellent communication skills to effectively communicate with business stakeholders, end users, vendors and application developers.






Desired Education, Experience & Skills


 Undergraduate degree (Computer Science preferred)






What We Offer


    Our people are friendly, collaborative, and like to share their ideas and knowledge with one another. This creates an amazing environment where we learn from each other and innovate together. 
  



   Our Canadian benefits include paid vacation and sick days, extended health and dental insurance, vision care, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability, matching retirement savings program, and employee and family assistance programs. 
  



   Our Richmond headquarters offers a subsidized cafeteria, free parking, free shuttle service from Skytrain, a Wellness Program that includes activities and challenges to keep our minds and bodies active. We also host various social events throughout the year where we have fun and celebrate. Within our Global Inclusion and Diversity Program, our Employee Resource Groups provide opportunities for our people to support and champion Women in Tech, Emerging Professionals, Pride@Sierra, and Mental Health Awareness.
  



    If you like working with a successful team, are looking for competitive salary and benefits, and the opportunity to represent a recognized and innovative brand, we’d love to have you join our team! 
  



How to Apply


    Please submit your resume online through our careers website: www.iotstartswithus.com. If you are a job seeker with a disability and you need individualized support during the application or interview process, please leave us a note on your application form. 
  



   We thank you for your application and appreciate your interest in Sierra Wireless, however only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
About Mayk: 
Hey, Nice to Meet You! Glad you found us!
We are Mayk Ideas - growth advisors and marketing creatives! Ingenuity without boundaries is at the heart of every strategy we envision and execute. We craft people-oriented, brand-building campaigns and business transformations that are intentional and value-driven. Our creative and venture acceleration services lead to measurable return on investment for the firms and brands we work with, as they are informed by data-driven strategies, good business sense, and meaningful connections. Our portfolio of clients include professional and financial services, sports and entertainment, technology, automotive and other B2B brands. Our clients are growing and so are we!
You are: 
A forward focused Business Analyst with expertise in business systems and applications analysis. You love formulating and defining system scope and objectives based on both end-users needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and applications in an effort to align information technology solutions with business initiatives. Reporting to the COO and working with the IT Team, you will delve into evaluation, analysis, documentation of requirements, translation into proper system requirement specifications and configuration/development/implementation. This role can be based in the Kitchener-Waterloo area or remotely.
What You'll Do: 
Connect discovery elements: Gather business requirements and understanding needs in an agile environment which may include development of business process maps, user stories/cases or scope/statement of work documents and development of solution definition. Manage and execute multiple assigned tasks, while being able to self-direct between assignments. Analyze and document the essential elements of business processes and reporting/data requirements to identify strengths and areas which require improvement. 
Committed, smart, scope building:  Develop and translate the business analysis to formulate and define the system scope and objectives (solution definition), project plan, team and product solution (architecture and design) for defined projects and delivery of progress reports.  
Creative pragmatism:  Access, clean and analyze data that is stored in current systems / various data stores. Test and demonstrate data, design and solution including gaps analysis, documentation of test cases and feedback to appropriate team members relating to QA.  
Collaborative value-creation:  Operate as a liaison between technical personnel and the end-users.  
Develop effective communicative expressions:  Prepare, model, visualize, analyze and deploy business intelligence reports and dashboards using Microsoft BI with data from various sources (Dynamics, Dataverse, Power Apps, SharePoint, etc.)  
Your Superpowers: 
Given your background and work experience you are brave and delve into innovating for internal and client-side requirements. You have the ability and desire to thrive and excel in a fast paced, rapid growth environment.
For the role you will have to be:

Committed and focused: Efficiently manage and execute multiple assigned tasks, while being able to self-direct between assignments.
A collaborator:  Ensure a collaborative ‘One Team’ approach – the road to shared success combines the energy, ideas, and execution of many - architecting value and building lasting impact through teamwork.
A Communicator:  Effectively communicate and present at different levels of the organization.
Connected: To build and maintain relationships - internal and external as it is critical to understanding the needs, desires and ambitions our team and the greater world.

Qualifications: 
Education: You have a degree in Engineering, or quantitative discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics with a focus on Statistics and Data Analytics, Algorithmic Physics, or related field etc.)
Experience: You have more than 2 years (preferred) of work experience in Business Analysis and Data Transformation.
Technical: 

You are able to prepare, model, visualize, analyze and deploy business intelligence reports and dashboards using Microsoft BI with data from various sources
You have a strong proficiency in SQL and deep functional and technical knowledge of Microsoft power platform suite (PowerApps: Model-Driven, Canvas, Portal, Power Automate, PowerBI)
You can build or customize data scraping tools and have experience with data migration, database development, data cleansing and preparation as well as the capability to create and analyze data mapping/system flow diagrams.

Extras that will give You an Edge: 

Knowledge of SQL, PowerShell, MS CRM, Dynamics 365, SharePoint
Willingness to learn and use new technologies/applications, potentially in advance of the start date
Completion of Microsoft certifications or exams and/or willingness to complete in advance of starting
Knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform
Commitment to continuous learning and skills development in data analytics and visualization

Why you’ll love working here: 
Join us and help create a bright future for brands and businesses:

We are engaged, resourceful and we always find a way to support growth initiatives of companies through important milestones. Every member of the team has mental agility with the ability to juggle multiple projects/initiatives simultaneously.
We use communication and tech to level the playing field. Technology and data connect people and brands from all over, building thriving businesses with entrepreneurial partners.
We build campaigns and connections our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to help them not only grow their pieces of the pie – but enlarge the pie. And to do that these businesses need ideas, talent, brand and infrastructure.
We are curious and creative: We always find a way to get things done and come up with creative solutions to whatever problems are standing in our way. We lead with creativity in our decision-making and reason.

We value candidates that bring a range of experience from different industries and a variety of creative influences. If you're special and can bring first-hand experience and empathy for the growth journey, tell us your story! Even if you don’t fit all the desired requirements.
Let’s Get this Started!
Please submit a cover letter, copy of your resume and/or a short video pitch. The link to your video (approx. 1-5 min) should be included in your resume or cover letter.
Why are you the right person for the role? In the cover letter and/or video this is what we are expecting:

Two or three sentence summary about your academic and/or professional background.
Specific accomplishments from your background that explain how you fit with our candidate description above.
Tell us about a special project you worked on and what your biggest accomplishment was.

Please remember to submit your resume, link to your cover letter/video pitch and include answers to the questions above. There is no word limit for your letter, but we’d prefer that you limit your answers to one page. Use the following format as the subject line for your submission "[Your Name] – [Role Title] Application".
We look forward to meeting you!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $50,000.00-$70,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Dental care
Paid time off
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Education:

Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

business analyst: 2 years (preferred)

Title: D&A Reporting and Communication Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

 Job Description:
 The Business Management is a team within the Data & Analytics organization. The key focus for this team is to ensure that we are managing to the DA Vision and Mission by:

 Enabling our leaders to focus on client value-added work without compromising the day-to-day operations
 Transform our processes and enhance our capabilities around productivity and expense management. 
Provide a consistent and streamlined framework for DA to follow


 You will be accountable for your pillar but everyone on the BMG team is encouraged to hop over and support in the other pillars. This will allow you to learn and grow your skills across BMG. 
I am looking for people who are “comfortable being in the uncomfortable”. Simply put – I am looking for people who can challenge our teams and Leadership on “why” and “how” we do our processes and when it doesn’t provide value – strong enough to have the conversation around “decommissioning” the process. 

The role of the Reporting and Communications Analyst will help to build out our DA Brand, support the leaders in the development of technology roadmaps, support in the collection of data required for all aspects of reporting

 What will you do:

 Work closely with DA - BMG TEAM Senior Leadership to:

 Help us to build the DA Brand
 Support in the development of technology road maps and cadence necessary to keep them updated
 Contribute ideas to help innovate and transform DA business with a focus on operational excellence
 Support in the preparation of executive level presentations

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Get started on an exciting career at Element!



   Element employees make a difference in the lives of others every day. We are re-defining the fleet management industry to be people first, then business – delivering on our promise of a superior client experience. This takes hard work and innovation, and we need more like-minded people on our team.
 


   What We Need
 


   We are looking for a Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst who will play a critical part in engineering top-notch products and services in a unique industry and at a rapidly growing organization.
 


   Are you:
 



     A seasoned BI professional with a passion for supporting the delivery of strategic initiatives and building awareness?
   


     Excited about transforming data into easy to digest intuitive visuals and outputs to help the business make educated decisions?
   



   As the Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst, you will lead work across numerous business areas with the support of coworkers to impact and build dashboards to enhance departmental performance. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams in identifying and developing business solutions, using queries and analytical tools to solve the most complex problems.
 


   A Day in the Life
 



     Analyze data and provide trend information and draw conclusions for executive level and business leaders, making consultative recommendations for process improvement
   


     Partner with the user community to create new business intelligence, reporting and data analysis solutions
   


     Drive medium to large-scale projects within the organization
   


     Responsible to meet all deadlines, deliverables, and ensure open lines of communication throughout the operations organization
   


     Help to manage multiple projects, develop project plans and monitor performance ensuring timely completion of projects and appropriate reporting
   


     Capture, develop, and document data definitions, business rules, and data quality requirements
   



   Requirements
 



     Bachelor’s degree required
   


     5+ years of working experience, or education related experience
   


     5+ years experienced user in Sisense and/or PowerBI (or equivalent Business Intelligence platform), SQL, Excel and PowerPoint
   


     Must have knowledge of DAX, Snowflake, SSIS, Python, and/or Visual Basics for Application would be an asset
   


     Demonstrated evidence of and proven analytical and problem-solving capability; including ability to analyze process changes from the business perspective
   



   #LI-HYBRID

A culture of innovation, empowerment, decision-making, and accountability

Title: Business Analyst I
Description:
About ATS Traffic
 ATS Traffic is a family-owned business that has been getting people home safely since 1966. We provide traffic control, on-street services and signage products and services across Canada, currently operating out of offices in Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Saskatoon, Langley, Kamloops and Winnipeg.
 As the successful candidate you will demonstrate the ATS Traffic Core Values at work every day:

Do What’s Right
Our People Matter
Trust Through Teamwork
Striving for Excellence



 
About the Positions
 ATS Traffic is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our high-functioning Technology Team based in Edmonton. Are you customer-service oriented? Do you approach every situation with a solution focused approach? If so, we want to hear from you!
 The Business Analyst is a fundamental position that contributes to the success of ATS Traffic by addressing the needs of the business in terms of software applications and processes. Business Analysts help drive critical business decisions by analyzing business processes, associated metrics and designing reports. They communicate these results to both managers and the Executive, and often provide suggestions based on their findings.
 As a BA - Reporting and Analytics, you must have a bachelor's degree in information systems or a related field. You should also have advanced skills in SQL and Power BI, among other software programs. The ideal candidate has the ability prioritize tasks and manage time well, and effectively communicate the results of your analysis.


 Responsibilities

Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout the business.
Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary to ensure accuracy.
Regularly examine data reports to locate and resolve mistakes throughout.
Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports.
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points.
Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers.
Support various departments, including Executives, marketing and sales, in reaching their goals through analysis.
Monitor data to identify changes in financial and business trends.


Qualifications

One to three years of experience as a financial or business analyst
Experience in Microsoft GP, Power BI, object-oriented programming and other data analysis programs
Analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports
Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
Ability to use SQL and Power BI to create apps, graphs, charts and dashboards
Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively relate data to coworkers
Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions
Tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow



 Why Choose ATS Traffic?
 We have always been a family-owned business. When you join ATS, you aren’t just a number: people remember your name and treat you like one of the family! You’ll be working with a team you can trust, and you’ll be excited to come in on Monday morning.
 Other perks include:

RRSP Matching Program
Health Spending Account and Healthy Lifestyle Spending Account
Competitive benefits package
Regular company events like barbecues and holiday parties

Do you have a good attitude? Are you unafraid to speak up and tell us what you think? Do you work for a higher purpose? Do you do whatever it takes to get the job done? If this sounds like you, we think you’d be a great fit at ATS Traffic – apply today!

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only selected candidates will be contacted.

Title: Transfer Pricing Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY
 OpenText helps companies securely capture, govern and exchange information on a global scale. OpenText solves digital business challenges for customers, ranging from small and mid-sized businesses to the largest and most complex organizations in the world.

 The Opportunity

 This is a 9 monh contract postion.

 The transfer pricing team at OpenText is looking for a self-driven individual to meet the demands of a fast-paced, data-driven environment. Working within the broad OpenText global tax group, the transfer pricing department is charged with the responsibility to create value by reviewing current business structures on an ongoing basis to ensure that the transfer pricing policies are consistent with the arm’s length principle. The analyst will have a global role in managing the transfer pricing matters within OpenText in accordance with the OECD Guidelines and local country requirements.
 What you will do
 The Analyst will join a highly technical global tax and transfer pricing function to create value and take proactive approaches to assess the impact of transfer pricing policies to the business model, management or new acquisitions. This includes challenging current processes to ensure they are efficient and effective. You will also review information obtained as part of day-to-day business activities and consider the impact of this data to the transfer pricing policies.
 The Analyst will be charged with the responsibility to create value by:

 Managing the preparation of transfer pricing documentation in accordance with the OECD Guidelines and local jurisdictional requirements to minimize the company’s exposure to significant transfer pricing adjustments or penalties.
 Reviewing current business structure on an ongoing basis to ensure that the transfer pricing policies are consistent with the arm’s length principle.
 Engaging with OpenText’s external advisors on local documentation matters.
 Collaborating with the Managers, Transfer Pricing Operations to ensure that the quarterly transfer pricing calculations are consistent with the transfer pricing documentation and other supporting information. 
Supporting transfer pricing managers and directors with transfer pricing audits globally.
 Working with the Regional Tax Directors, Controllers and their teams with respect to the above matters


 What it takes

 Recent graduate with a University Degree (preference for finance/accounting/business focus)
 Strong verbal and written communication skills
 Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Office suite
 Prior experience with SAP and/or similar finance systems is desired
 Comfortable with applying accounting principles 
Detail-oriented, team player, curious, and self-driven
 A problem solver who is comfortable building cross-functional relationships
 A proactive, can-do, work ethic 
Those pursuing a CPA designation (or equivalent) may be given preference
 Preference will be given to applicants with relevant internship experience in a public accounting firm or in industry


 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com)

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Quality Control Analyst
Description:
Vita Health Products Inc. is a leading manufacturer and distributor of natural health products and over the counter pharmaceuticals in Canada. G.W. Seier founded Vita Health Products in Winnipeg, Manitoba in 1936. Since then, the company has grown from a small mail-order operation selling herbs and patented medicines into one of Canada's foremost suppliers of over-the-counter (OTC) pharmaceutical products and natural health products.
Based in Winnipeg – the geographic centre of Canada – Vita Health has over 220,000 square feet of manufacturing, packaging and distribution facilities; in addition to a sales and customer support office in Toronto, Ontario.
Vita Health provides private label manufacturing, as well as contract manufacturing and export services.
Contract manufacturing services provide start to finish solutions, including:
· Overall project management from concept to commercialization
· R&D trial work, engineering studies, process validation, protocol and report writing
· Method development, validation and transfer
· Stability studies
· Bulk compression, coating and two-piece encapsulation
· Bottling, cartoning and blister packaging
· In-house artwork design
· Product registration and regulatory affairs support
· Quality control testing (analytical, microbiology, impurity)
· Quality assurance oversight
Quality Control Analyst
Under the direction of the Quality Control Supervisor, the Quality Control Analyst is responsible for conducting HPLC/UPLC Testing on OTC, NHP bulk products and raw materials which includes keeping complete and accurate records of all tests performed in accordance with cGMP and GDP guidelines.
Duties will include:
· Test samples using various analytical and physical techniques
· Collect and analyze data, perform calculations and statistical analyses of data
· Perform sample analyses to support process validation and stability program
· Perform peer review of laboratory analysis data
· Write and revise standard test methods (STMs)
· Provide Out-of-Specification investigation support
· Perform preventive maintenance and calibration of equipment
· Receive and log-in test samples for analysis
· Clean laboratory glassware and equipment
· Perform other related duties as assigned
We are seeking candidates with practical chemistry and analytical work experience. Qualified candidates must have a B.Sc. or College diploma with minimum 2 years of experience of conducting HPLC/UPLC testing, as well as general laboratory techniques including ICP, FTIR, Karl Fisher, titrations, and physical analysis methods. Mathematical skills and/or experience in statistical analysis techniques, word-processing, and experience with graphics and spreadsheet programs such as Microsoft Excel are considered assets.
Preference will be given to candidates who work with precision and accuracy and are capable of performing and mastering new techniques effectively. Further, the candidate must be willing to comply with strict laboratory testing deadlines, be able to take initiative, be an independent thinker and worker as well as function exceptionally in a multi-departmental team environment. The incumbent will also possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be familiar with GLPs and GMPs. Experience in a QC environment in Pharma/Biopharma is considered an asset.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $20.00-$22.00 per hour
Benefits:

Company events
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Store discount
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

What is your email for us to contact you?

Education:

Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

Quality Control: 1 year (preferred)
HPLC/UPLC testing: 2 years (preferred)

Title: Capital Asset Analyst
Description:
(Permanent Full-Time)


 Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the Squamish, Tsleil-Waututh and Musqueam Nations, West Vancouver is a vibrant community on the North Shore and home to parks, beaches, and to sports, recreation and arts amenities. Our dedicated staff deliver services, operate facilities and run the programs that enhance the well-being of our community. We are seeking employees with a passion for public service who share our commitment to creating a complete, inclusive and livable community.


 The West Vancouver Financial Services Department is currently seeking a Permanent Full-Time Capital Asset Analyst to join our highly qualified team and provide leadership with respect to strategic tasks, as well as to conduct a wide range of day to day activities, paying attention to details and delivering complex analytical reports on time.

 
This job requires extensive experience in managing tangible capital assets (facilities infrastructure, equipment, etc. – this portfolio does NOT include financial investments); accounting training and designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA – designated or close to designation); “super user” Excel skills; hands-on experience in managing very large data sets and working knowledge of one or more ERP/accounting systems. Candidates will be required to demonstrate skills, knowledge and abilities is these areas – this is a “hands on” job. Experience in public sector accounting and knowledge of PSAS are an asset, but are not mandatory. This position requires a combination of working remotely and in-office.

 
The successful candidate will be responsible for: 

compiling, reviewing and validating large data sets representing the District’s capital assets with extreme accuracy
maintaining, improving and communicating the District’s asset registry and 20 year asset management plan
preparing monthly and year-end capital journal entries, account reconciliations, and TCA continuity schedule
developing the annual capital budget; quarterly reports; regular variance reviews and remediation strategies
liaising with internal and external contacts such as other sections of Financial Services, other Municipal Departments, other Municipalities and external auditors on matters related to asset management
leading the implementation of new IT tools and business process improvements in asset management
monitoring the availability of grants for capital initiatives and preparing applications for appropriate projects
accounting for capital funds, reviewing capital requests with consideration of available funds
performing other related duties as required within a results-oriented and highly-driven team environment.



 The successful candidate will demonstrate ability to: prepare a variety of financial reports, statements and working papers related to the work performed; compile and analyze data from multiple sources to determine the impact on tangible capital asset valuation and maintenance; assist in maintaining and improving a comprehensive tangible capital asset valuation system, procedures and data base; and, establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts.

 
The successful candidate will be required to supply a police information check and a copy of their credentials, including their accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA). All District of West Vancouver employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of hire.






This posting does not list all the duties of the position, nor does it fully detail the required skills, knowledge and abilities, licenses and certificates required of candidates. For details please refer to the Class Specification which is available for inspection in the Human Resources Department or on WestNet.

 Union (WVMEA) Permanent Full-Time




 






Hours of Work:



 35 hours per week (hours and days of work may vary)

 $42.00 per hour

 11:59 p.m. on July 26, 2022

Title: Business Development Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Title: Business Development Analyst Intern
Location: Etobicoke, ON
About Us: 
We are proud to say we are one of Forbes 2022 Canada’s Best Employers; here’s why!
Lactalis Canada is enriching and nurturing the lives of Canadians with a diverse offering of dairy products such as Black Diamond Cheese, Lactantia Milk, Astro Yogurt, Balderson Cheese, and Cheestrings; our products are in 95% of Canadian homes! For over 140 years we’ve grown through innovation and a strong dedication to quality, and we’re looking for like minded individuals to keep that growth progressing by joining our team!
We offer a hybrid working model to accommodate the evolving needs of our employees, allowing for flexible work-weeks with 40% work-from-home. Our office has a collaborative, newly renovated workspace with a number of amazing benefits; free parking, free coffee, free yummy Lactalis snacks, a free on-site gym and other great perks to provide the best possible environment for success!
General Accountability: 
The Business Development Analyst supports the Corporate Sales team by providing key sales and market data tools that offer insight into opportunities and issues to help the organization reach its business plan objectives.
Critical Success Factors: 

Prepare weekly actual / latest estimate file and analysis for overall business market segments. Provide commentary summary by customer by identifying any major trends or variances to Budget, Prior Year or Forecast.
Prepare weekly flyer review of Lactalis and competitive Private Label activity in retail market.
Prepare weekly report for packaging for existing products that are transitioning to new designs
Manage internal sku creation and GS1 upload processes
Consolidate and prepare national retail audits for monthly update to customers.
Assist in management, operations and maintenance of new product launches timelines, pre and post launch. Work with Account, Field, Supply Chain to resolve any distribution gaps or issues.
Work with Business Development, Corporate Planning and Account and Category Managers to identify business opportunities through the assessment of market trends, product performance and propose solutions with the use of internal / account specific retail scan data.
Other tasks as required as they relate to business development
Maintain product listing base information by customer and regularly review and analyze distribution results through the Nielsen database
Manage product and packaging sample request

Key Attributes of the Ideal Candidate: 

Pursuing University degree in Finance, Economics or Business Administration
Proficient with standard office computer technology including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Powerpoint
Strong verbal and written communication skills including meeting facilitation and presentations. Ability to clearly articulate goals and objectives, and ability to present and communicate ideas in both written and oral forms
Leadership capabilities including being able to work well in a team environment. Ability to lead initiatives and project teams. Ability to work cross functionally and develop rapport with all levels of the organization.
Economic and strategic thinking ability
Excellent quantitative/qualitative skills
Strong technical skills including knowledge of budgeting, investment analysis on economic profit concepts
Sales and account management experience is an asset
Knowledge of the dairy industry is an asset

CLOSING DATE: July 22, 2022
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
The duties for this position may involve but are not limited to:
· Analyze data and apply research methods to identify crime patterns and series, modus operandi profiles, victim/target profiles and identify high crime, and high call areas or locations where public disorder is likely to occur and assist in deployment strategies.
· Identify and monitor known criminals/organizations and any potential police hazards within the community.
· Gather information by extracting, organizing and reviewing data from internal, external, open and closed sources. Research and monitor current events as they relate to regional, national and international events and determining any impact on South Simcoe Policing jurisdiction, including but not limited to: criminal, political, terrorism/extremism, social, and economic events via social media networks; external agency alerts, bulletins and reports; and news releases.
· Compile data and prepare analytical products using investigative analysis software, database programs, statistical calculations and other computer software to produce link diagrams, event flow charts, telephone toll analysis, timeline diagrams, geographical maps, frequency diagrams, crime bulletins, proactive and reactive reports, and maintaining extensive criminal profiles for current and continuing investigative support, and writing intelligence reports.
· Developing and maintaining databases for use in crime and intelligence analysis.
· Maintaining the information in the databases as incidents occur or new information develops.
· Monitor databases to identify emerging trends, patterns and series in order to search for suspect and offender information and to identify possible linkages.
· Collect and disseminate information regarding current crime patterns, trends, significant incidents and other criminal information.
· Participate in meetings, briefings and conferences with police personnel, management and related government agencies and external stakeholders.
· Court testimony related to analytical work products.
· Forecast, project and analyze crime by conducting correlation and regression analysis and use various investigative analysis software, database programs, statistical calculations and other computer software to determine if crimes are linked, in order to identify problem areas, actual and anticipated criminal activity, crime patterns and series.
· Remain current with various software applications related to crime analysis.
MANDATORY QUALIFICATIONS: Successful completion of a three (3) or four (4) year university degree in Criminology or Social Science (or related field) or the equivalent combination of training and experience. Minimum of two (2) years previous experience in a directly related role, including crime or intelligence analysis, data analysis or research.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Specialized Analytical Training or Certification in Crime or Intelligence Analysis, through the International Association of Law Enforcement Intelligence Analysts (IALEIA), the International Association of Crime Analysts (IACA), Canadian Police College (CPC) or other accredited educational providers. Experience in research methodology and statistical methodology. Advanced computer skills including but not limited to RMS, CPIC, Arcview, PowerCase, MTO ISS, and MS Office, including Access. Ability to use the internet as an intelligence tool. Analytical skills, including financial and geographic analysis. Organizational, time management and logical thinking skills. Demonstrated decision-making skills, good judgement and problem-solving. Proven ability to complete a multitude of tasks simultaneously and work in a fast-paced demanding environment. Problem solving abilities in order to process information that has been collected to collate and analyze the information to identify a particular crime area or prolific criminal offenders. Communication and interpersonal skills to interact with members of all ranks within the organization, external agencies, and other police agencies to exchange and clarify information and provide assistance and direction regarding proactive policing resulting in a decrease in crime related offences, serious and organized crime, and/or incidents. Knowledge in the use of the following software i2 Analyst notebook, Power BI, ArcGIS, Microsoft Excel and/or related crime analysis software.
Candidates will be evaluated in several stages, which will include testing, panel interview, psychological assessment and a police clearance check. 
HOW TO APPLY:
If you are ready for this challenge and opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter to: 
Human Resources Department by July 22, 2022 @ 4:00 pm by email 
*We thank all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
The South Simcoe Police is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that it represents the diverse community it serves. The South Simcoe Police is committed to equitable treatment of all individuals in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code. Accommodation will be provided in accordance to the Ontario Human Rights Code and the position requirements.
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 12 months
Salary: $82,000.00-$102,000.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

Crime Analyst: 1 year (required)

Application deadline: 2022-07-22

Title: Sr. Analyst - Data Insights and Scalability
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. 

Job Category Finance and Operations 
 
Job Details 
Position Overview  As a global company that’s growing at the speed of light, both organically and through acquisitions, we are seeking a senior analyst level employee to join the Data Insights & Scalability team to help our organization scale with this incredible growth! The Data Insights & Scalability team is a cross-functional group that is setting the strategic direction for the group, driving cross-functional process improvement, and scale for our Global Revenue Operations organization. The Global Revenue Operations organization is responsible for Quote to Sales Compensation including Product Operations, Sales Operations, Partner Operations & Sales Compensation.   The ideal candidate will have expertise in data visualization in Tableau and hands-on experience with big data sets! We are looking for someone who can bring new ideas on improving processes, adding automation, and building dynamic dashboards for various leadership teams. We are looking for someone with an analytical approach who will be able to gain insights and share them with key business partners. Finally, you will have the opportunity to build relationships with a range of dedicated teams and work with amazing individuals by collaborating to deliver measurable business impact.   Responsibilities 

Build and manage complex multi-source Tableau dashboards for stakeholders, including executive-level leadership, to showcase the impact of operational risk mitigation and connect project work in an accurate and timely manner 
Collaborate with stakeholders to define KPIs and connect data to the impact and risks of the teams within Revenue Operations with the overall goal of monitoring and mitigating operational risks organization 
Collaborate with the data engineering team to curate effective and scalable datasets to fulfill data visualization purposes 
Become the data subject matter expert and triage data quality issues, along with developing automated solutions to eliminate manual work 

 Minimum Qualifications 

5+ yrs of experience in Operations, Finance, and Data Insights 
Expert with data visualization tools such as Tableau 
Ability to be detail-oriented in managing, validating, and auditing metrics and large datasets 
Experience in data storytelling to executive management to create actionable insights 
Experience in analytics, reporting, data analysis, and aggregation 
Ability to “connect the dots” between process transformations and data 
Experience in collaborating with a variety of different partners across multiple organizations 
Experience in building new processes in an undefined environment (being a trailblazer of a process) 
A creative problem-solver who enjoys working in an ever-changing environment 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Passion and love for data/new technology is a must and understanding industry trends 

 Preferred Qualifications 

Active in the Tableau community, e.g has an established Tableau Public portfolio 
Experience in data science demonstrating technologies/ languages such as Python and SQL 


LI-Y 


Accommodations 
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . 

Posting Statement 
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. 

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org . 

Salesforce welcomes all.

Title: Junior HR Systems Analyst
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 The Junior HR Systems Analyst, is part of the HR Enablement team in Canada, reporting to the Senior HR Systems Specialist. This role is responsible for supporting the data management and system activities related to day-to-day HR operations, reporting and compliance. The HR Systems Specialist consults with business stakeholders at all levels of the firm, including Recruitment, Talent Consultants, Payroll, Total Rewards, and IT. As well, this role will liaise with EY’s third party Talent Managed Services provider. Responsibilities vary in scope and requires an individual with HR technology knowledge, experience, and skills. This role is open to any of our office locations in Canada.

 Your key responsibilities

 Participates in the management of HR data within SuccessFactors (Onboarding and Employee Central).
 Assists with the maintenance of SuccessFactors’ interdependencies between global and local EY systems (e.g., ServiceNow, Financial System, Payroll and Benefit vendors).
 Assists with the implementation of projects through configuration, testing and written instructional Quick Reference Guides.
 Supports the Canada Talent Team by working on projects and assisting where necessary to deliver on key initiatives and programs throughout the year (e.g., Acquisitions, Extended Vacation Program, CFE (Common Final Exam) leave program
 Supports enhancements of existing HR systems by participating in system testing.
 Acts as level 2 support in ServiceNow for ongoing maintenance, monitoring and troubleshooting of SuccessFactors, and other global and local HR systems.
 Supports other day-to-day Talent operations including EY Canada’s vacation tool, Provisioning Notification System, and Pre-hire Compliance.
 Assists in managing foundational data creation, new/changes to picklist values or data elements
 Audits and analyzes data to ensure data integrity and liaises with employee or Managed Services on data resolution.
 Supports large data change activities (e.g., mass uploads, mass salary changes and promotions, large intakes of hires).
 Maintains content in knowledge databases that provides Talent information for local audiences (e.g., SharePoint, SAP JAM, Goldie (EY’s 24/7 virtual assistant)).
 May be called upon to produce people-related reports.

 Skills and attributes for success

 Solid HR knowledge base in terms of policy, practices, and operations.
 Ability to remain efficient and extremely organized while handling a high volume of work.
 Ability to prioritize/execute multiple tasks and work under time/deadline constraints.
 Superior attention to detail and commitment to data integrity.
 Demonstrates initiative and ability to seek our answers to questions and solve problems.
 Ability to learn new applications and techniques quickly and effectively.
 High level of customer service and relationship management skills (listening, responding), in dealing with stakeholders across the organization and at third party talent managed services provider
 Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills.
 Strong communication (written and verbal) skills.

 To qualify for the role you must have

 1-2 years experience in HR systems administration and operations
 Knowledge of HR Systems
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
 Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint

 Ideally you will also have:

 Experience with SuccessFactors

 What we offer

 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 Diversity and Inclusion at EY

 Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety

 EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Internal Control - Regulatory Controls, Regulatory Data Analyst (Fall 2022 Internship)
Description:
Requisition ID: 150710  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




 Internal Control - Regulatory Controls, Regulatory Data Analyst (Internship/Co-op)





 Fall 2022 (September to December)




 
Location: Toronto
 Deadline: June 12th at 11:59 PM EST

 Why work for Scotiabank?

 Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services.
 This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.

 Who We Are:

 Scotiabank Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of credit, risk management and investment banking products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include investment banking, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, prime brokerage, debt products, derivatives, foreign exchange and bullion & base metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by Scotiabank.

 Your Work Term At-A-Glance:

 During your internship you will support the Regulatory Controls team by providing timely, relevant and accurate reports to assist with ongoing design and coordination of reporting of Key Performance Indicators:

 Able to use statistical computer languages (e.g., VBA, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
 Familiar with business intelligence tools (e.g., PoewrBI) 
Identify, analyze and interpret trends in complex data sets that pertain to regulatory counterparty data
 Support development of control processes for managing regulatory risk related to counterparty data
 Assist all Regulatory Control team members with a wide range of responsibilities, project deliverables and arbitrary assignments
 Contribution to the design and preparation of reports on daily basis to support regulatory and operational reporting activities.
 Support the delivery of internal (Board, Committee, Compliance, Audit) and regulatory controls related reporting as required.
 Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of both the Bank’s and the Division's business strategies, shifting regulatory environment, evolving risk management practices and methodologies, new products, updated operational processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to drive effective business solutions.
 Actively support efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.


 QUALIFICATIONS
 This role is for you if you are highly self-motivated, and ready to work in a fast paced environment. The processes being built are constantly evolving and changing according to business and compliance needs, and you will be encouraged to contribute your ideas as part of a collaborative process.

 Working knowledge and experience with MS Excel, and MS Word
 Knowledge of database structure and Visual Basic macros are an asset
