 Solid analytical skills with an attention to detail and application of a results oriented approach
 Exceptional time management, and interpersonal communication skills

  This internship will provide you with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward. Throughout your term you’ll also have access to skill-building modules, as well as challenging work-integrated learnings - all of which come together to create a stimulating environment where you will have the chance to thrive. We want you to be a sponge and take it all in, bring your great attitude, always be authentic, and own every opportunity that comes your way. This is your time to shine.

 How do I Apply?

 For students, we believe evaluating you through relationships over resumes, and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. In short, we don’t believe resumes will provide us with an accurate depiction of what you’re truly about in order to properly assess your potential. Instead we want to get to know YOU and hear about the experiences that have shaped you. We know… this might sound crazy but we do not want you to submit your resume instead we ask that as part of your application, you complete the below:

 1) Complete your PLUM Profile here

 2) Complete a very short one-way video interview by clicking here (if you have already done this, you don't need to do it again)

 3) Apply to the role through our career site! When the application asks for your resume, please attach a screenshot of your PLUM and your most recent transcript. We have full access to your entire profile from PLUM, but this is a great reminder to complete it.

 Note: You do not need to complete your PLUM profile or video interview multiple times if you are applying to multiple positions. Also, we have full access to your entire profile from Plum and won’t use the screenshot but it’s a great reminder for each of you to have completed it.
 We thank you all for your interest in Scotiabank! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs

 **In order to be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank and/or Tangerine, you must submit your PLUM Assessment and Video Interview. **

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst, your curiosity never ends. The next question is always on your mind, helping you to understand how data science fits in the big picture of a project. Of the five sub-disciplines of Marketing Science—tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration, and statistical modeling—you're a rock star in at least two. Most importantly, you've got a solid understanding of how they all fit into a project, and you're looking to hone your craft in areas you're unfamiliar with. Also, gaining some leadership experience by providing guidance to junior analysts on daily project deliverables is definitely something you're up for.
 



  You will:
 

Understand what the data means and where it fits into the clients' business.
Ensure proper communication between the Marketing Science team and other disciplines.
Approach analysis process logically to demonstrate how data lead to conclusions.
Drive collaboration within teams to provide support, share skills, and gain insight.
Confidently manage project delivery expectations and communications to project team.


  You have:
 

A detail-oriented mindset with exceptional organization skills.
Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery.
Confidence in your communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to efficiently communicate deliveries and delays of project with follow-ups as needed.
Well-organized approach to working on multiple projects at once.
Passion to always improve your team's craft through ongoing learning and support.



 Critical Mass is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We do not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you are an individual with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@criticalmass.com.

Title: Project Controls Analyst
Description:
Description 
Koch Ag & Energy Solutions (KAES) is looking for a Project Controls Analyst who will be a primary point of contact for project cost forecasting, changes, risk management, and involvement/influence throughout the project lifecycle on small to large Capital Projects across (up to) 6 plants. This role requires collaboration, analysis, and strong relationships with cross site, cross functional teams. This provides an opportunity to create significant value if you have curiosity of how capital projects are executed. 
Our Benefits Package Includes:


 Bonus eligible!
 Automatic 401K company contribution plus with competitive matching program
 Excellent Health and wellbeing benefits
 Tuition Reimbursement
 Much more!


 
This position is preferably based out of Wichita KS but open to Beatrice NE, Dodge City KS, Fort Dodge IA, Enid OK, St James LA, or Brandon MB. The successful candidate would travel about 25% of the time.
What You Will Do In Your Role

 Use critical thinking, analysis, curiosity, and collaboration throughout the following (but not limited to) functions:


As a member of one or more project teams, you will leverage knowledge of phase gate project processes and get the right information to the right people at the right time to make the best decisions. 
Partner with the project teams to:




collect data and perform analysis to assist in determining a baseline budget and updated cost forecast throughout the project lifecycle.
 manage changes to ensure appropriate classification, documentation, and communication.
 manage risk register activities.




Demonstrate initiative to improve project outcomes, processes, and forecasting. 
Share knowledge and solve problems across teams to improve project deliverables across KAES.
 Work around the plant without assistance



The Experience You Will Bring
 Requirements:


 Demonstrated ability to analyze trends/variances and determine root causes along with potential solutions 
Experience applying leading metrics to analyze variances and an understanding of how decisions will influence outcomes


What Will Put You Ahead



Experience on projects and/or turnarounds in an industrial or construction environment.
 Experience with reporting, data analytics tools and visualization software such as Alteryx, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
 Experience with project cost management (including forecasting, change management, WBS/CBS buildup, risk management, reporting, etc.) 
Familiarity with EcoSys, Maximo, P6 or similar project portfolio or scheduling tools. 
Ability to perform risk based contingency assessments and identify key drivers of risks.





This role is eligible for relocation bonus/support




Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.
 At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. 

Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

Title: Analyst, Ecosystem and Climate Science
Description:
Position Details:

Vacancies: 2 

Salary Range: $62,976 - $68,277 / per year 

Employment type: Full-Time contract 

Duration: 12 months, 6 months 

Hours of work: 35 hrs/week 

Work location: Head Office - Vaughan 

Division: Development and Engineering Services 

Business unit: Watershed Planning and Ecosystem Science 

Travel: 10% 

Remote Work: Hybrid 


About TRCA:
 With more than 60 years of experience, Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) is one of 36 Conservation Authorities in Ontario, created to safeguard and enhance the health and well-being of watershed communities through the protection and restoration of the natural environment and the ecological services the environment provides. 

 TRCA works to protect the integrity and health of the rivers and creeks in the jurisdiction, develop a system of green and natural spaces that sustains local ecosystems, and advance sustainable practices that improve people’s lives within our growing region. 


How you will contribute as part of the TRCA team:
 Under the supervision of the Senior Research Scientist, Green Infrastructure, in the Ecosystem and Climate Science (ECS) team, the Research Analyst will be responsible for providing support and assistance in general research activities including literature reviews, geospatial analysis, data analysis, and report writing. These activities will directly support the ongoing projects related to urban forest studies, natural asset management, watershed planning, and green infrastructure research. 

 Specifically, this position will undertake qualitative and quantitative research and analysis including assisting in study design, leading field crews, completing spatial and data analysis, and writing technical reports and factsheets to support a range of initiatives related to green infrastructure and urban forestry. The Research Analyst will focus on producing information to support various municipal projects, building applied research partnerships and pursuing external funding opportunities as well as be a technical resource for internal and external partners. 


Major Responsibilities:


Conduct geospatial and data analysis as needed for the ongoing above stated projects of the ECS team.
Compile, QA/QC, analyze, and synthesize data, as required, from a variety of sources to be used in the relevant projects.
Conduct literature reviews and identify best approaches and methods to inform relevant projects.
Provides subject matter expert advice to internal TRCA groups or programs on topics related to urban forestry and green infrastructure in the context of broader growth planning initiatives, watershed planning, and climate change.
Coordinate/schedule field surveys, including training of seasonal staff or interns in and urban forest monitoring, survey or assessment protocols, and ensuring Health and Safety compliance while in the field.
Prepare summaries, factsheets, and technical reports for multiple municipal urban forest projects.
Performs other duties as assigned or required in accordance with departmental, divisional and/or corporate objectives.

What will you need to succeed:


Four (4) year university degree in urban forestry, ecology, biological sciences, environmental science, geography or related discipline.
University degree at master’s level in urban forestry, ecology, biological sciences, environmental science, geography, or related discipline is considered an asset.
Two (2) years of experience related to major responsibilities.
Strong understanding of urban forestry and green infrastructure management principles.
Demonstrated experience with data compilation, QA/QC, analysis, synthesis, and reporting related to major research projects.
Experience with conducting geospatial and statistical analysis within the broader context of methods in ecological science.
Strong project coordination and communication skills
Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act;
Valid Ontario driver’s license.

What TRCA has to offer you:
 As part of a progressive team, you will have the opportunity to make a positive impact to preserving and protecting nature, while maintaining a balance between the natural environment and built environment. Working with experts within our field, you will join a team of colleagues that are committed to TRCA’s core values of integrity, collaboration, accountability, respect, and excellence (icare). 


You will be part of a diverse and inclusive organization that:


Makes a positive difference in the communities we serve.
Fosters high performance and collaborative teams.
Provides continuous learning and development opportunities.
Offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits program (including Defined Benefit Pension Plan – OMERS/OTPP).
Pregnancy & Parental Leave Top-Up Program.
Provides unique TRCA Perks.
Provides flexible work arrangements.
 Offers potential for career growth and advancement 

 To apply to this posting, click on the “Apply” icon. Please submit your resume and cover letter by July 17, 2022. 

 All new hires are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a precondition to being hired by TRCA. TRCA will comply with its obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code and any other applicable legislation. 

 While the Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) thanks all applicants for their interest, only those under consideration will be contacted for interviews. Please be advised that successful incumbent(s) may be required to undergo a vulnerable sector screening and/or driver’s abstract check as a part of the final step in the hiring process. 

 TRCA is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and TRCA Policies, accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the hiring process, provided the candidate makes their accommodation needs known to the TRCA. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. 

 Personal information you provide through the TRCA recruitment, selection and onboarding process is collected under the authority of the Conservation Authorities Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. C.27. Collection of this personal information is necessary for the proper administration of this recruitment process for employment and volunteer positions with TRCA. Personal information is protected from disclosure pursuant to the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. Any questions regarding this collection activity should be directed to the Supervisor of Records, 101 Exchange Avenue, Vaughan, Ontario, L4K 5R6, 
(416) 661-6600 extension 5216.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description:
If you are a motivated individual with BA experience and have a desire to work directly with business leaders in our organization, this role is for you! This role offers the opportunity for a hybrid work arrangement, with remote work up to 50% of the time.
 The Senior Business Analyst works with internal stakeholders (leaders, subject matter experts and users) and external parties (ERP vendor, OEM vendors and customers) to gather requirements and implement solutions to improve business activities and optimize the process end-to-end. This role would be considered a subject matter expert in their area of accountability. The Senior Business Analyst is also required to provide guidance, support and expertise to the business user groups, Level 1 and Level 2 Service Desk support specialists.
 Responsibilities:

 Create project proposals by gathering requirements from the business, identifying, documenting, and providing solutions to optimize business process. Providing updates to project managers and the business on a regular basis
 Provide Level 3 Service Desk support and ensure ERP issues are tracked and escalated as required.
 Provide support to the eXtend ERP team with release management, enhancements, data fixes and testing.
 Provide support to the Change Management Team by providing insight for areas requiring attention and participate in development of user communications.

 Qualifications:
 Our team is looking for a knowledgeable business analyst with experience in manufacturing, remanufacturing, service or warranty areas. This role will allow the incumbent to work directly with all levels of the organization and have a specified internal customer to support allowing them to be a change maker business process.

 Post secondary education in a related field
 Experience as an IT Business Analyst where you lead projects and gathering requirements from the business
 Excellent time management ability with the desire to get results
 Excellent communication skills
 Solutions orientated mind set with the ability to proactively identify and manage risk

 Apply today; we would like to meet you! To apply for this position or to see other Career Opportunities, please visit our website at https://www.smsequipment.com/en-ca/careers/
 Applications will be accepted until a suitable candidate is found.
 SMS Equipment offers rewarding careers in the heavy equipment industry across Canada. As the largest Komatsu dealer in North America, SMS Equipment gives you the opportunity to represent world-class quality in our product offerings and customer service. A few of the many benefits of working with SMS Equipment include: competitive wages, comprehensive group benefits plans, and RRSP matching.

Title: Statistical Analyst I
Sr. Analyst - Data Insights and Scalability
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. 

Job Category Finance and Operations 
 
Job Details 
Position Overview  As a global company that’s growing at the speed of light, both organically and through acquisitions, we are seeking a senior analyst level employee to join the Data Insights & Scalability team to help our organization scale with this incredible growth! The Data Insights & Scalability team is a cross-functional group that is setting the strategic direction for the group, driving cross-functional process improvement, and scale for our Global Revenue Operations organization. The Global Revenue Operations organization is responsible for Quote to Sales Compensation including Product Operations, Sales Operations, Partner Operations & Sales Compensation.   The ideal candidate will have expertise in data visualization in Tableau and hands-on experience with big data sets! We are looking for someone who can bring new ideas on improving processes, adding automation, and building dynamic dashboards for various leadership teams. We are looking for someone with an analytical approach who will be able to gain insights and share them with key business partners. Finally, you will have the opportunity to build relationships with a range of dedicated teams and work with amazing individuals by collaborating to deliver measurable business impact.   Responsibilities 

Build and manage complex multi-source Tableau dashboards for stakeholders, including executive-level leadership, to showcase the impact of operational risk mitigation and connect project work in an accurate and timely manner 
Collaborate with stakeholders to define KPIs and connect data to the impact and risks of the teams within Revenue Operations with the overall goal of monitoring and mitigating operational risks organization 
Collaborate with the data engineering team to curate effective and scalable datasets to fulfill data visualization purposes 
Become the data subject matter expert and triage data quality issues, along with developing automated solutions to eliminate manual work 

 Minimum Qualifications 

5+ yrs of experience in Operations, Finance, and Data Insights 
Expert with data visualization tools such as Tableau 
Ability to be detail-oriented in managing, validating, and auditing metrics and large datasets 
Experience in data storytelling to executive management to create actionable insights 
Experience in analytics, reporting, data analysis, and aggregation 
Ability to “connect the dots” between process transformations and data 
Experience in collaborating with a variety of different partners across multiple organizations 
Experience in building new processes in an undefined environment (being a trailblazer of a process) 
A creative problem-solver who enjoys working in an ever-changing environment 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Passion and love for data/new technology is a must and understanding industry trends 

 Preferred Qualifications 

Active in the Tableau community, e.g has an established Tableau Public portfolio 
Experience in data science demonstrating technologies/ languages such as Python and SQL 


LI-Y 


Accommodations 
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . 

Posting Statement 
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. 

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org . 

Salesforce welcomes all.

Title: Junior HR Systems Analyst
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 The Junior HR Systems Analyst, is part of the HR Enablement team in Canada, reporting to the Senior HR Systems Specialist. This role is responsible for supporting the data management and system activities related to day-to-day HR operations, reporting and compliance. The HR Systems Specialist consults with business stakeholders at all levels of the firm, including Recruitment, Talent Consultants, Payroll, Total Rewards, and IT. As well, this role will liaise with EY’s third party Talent Managed Services provider. Responsibilities vary in scope and requires an individual with HR technology knowledge, experience, and skills. This role is open to any of our office locations in Canada.

 Your key responsibilities

 Participates in the management of HR data within SuccessFactors (Onboarding and Employee Central).
 Assists with the maintenance of SuccessFactors’ interdependencies between global and local EY systems (e.g., ServiceNow, Financial System, Payroll and Benefit vendors).
 Assists with the implementation of projects through configuration, testing and written instructional Quick Reference Guides.
 Supports the Canada Talent Team by working on projects and assisting where necessary to deliver on key initiatives and programs throughout the year (e.g., Acquisitions, Extended Vacation Program, CFE (Common Final Exam) leave program
 Supports enhancements of existing HR systems by participating in system testing.
 Acts as level 2 support in ServiceNow for ongoing maintenance, monitoring and troubleshooting of SuccessFactors, and other global and local HR systems.
 Supports other day-to-day Talent operations including EY Canada’s vacation tool, Provisioning Notification System, and Pre-hire Compliance.
 Assists in managing foundational data creation, new/changes to picklist values or data elements
 Audits and analyzes data to ensure data integrity and liaises with employee or Managed Services on data resolution.
 Supports large data change activities (e.g., mass uploads, mass salary changes and promotions, large intakes of hires).
 Maintains content in knowledge databases that provides Talent information for local audiences (e.g., SharePoint, SAP JAM, Goldie (EY’s 24/7 virtual assistant)).
 May be called upon to produce people-related reports.

 Skills and attributes for success

 Solid HR knowledge base in terms of policy, practices, and operations.
 Ability to remain efficient and extremely organized while handling a high volume of work.
 Ability to prioritize/execute multiple tasks and work under time/deadline constraints.
 Superior attention to detail and commitment to data integrity.
 Demonstrates initiative and ability to seek our answers to questions and solve problems.
 Ability to learn new applications and techniques quickly and effectively.
 High level of customer service and relationship management skills (listening, responding), in dealing with stakeholders across the organization and at third party talent managed services provider
 Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills.
 Strong communication (written and verbal) skills.

 To qualify for the role you must have

 1-2 years experience in HR systems administration and operations
 Knowledge of HR Systems
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
 Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint

 Ideally you will also have:

 Experience with SuccessFactors

 What we offer

 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 Diversity and Inclusion at EY

 Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety

 EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Internal Control - Regulatory Controls, Regulatory Data Analyst (Fall 2022 Internship)
Description:
Requisition ID: 150710  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




 Internal Control - Regulatory Controls, Regulatory Data Analyst (Internship/Co-op)





 Fall 2022 (September to December)




 
Location: Toronto
 Deadline: June 12th at 11:59 PM EST

 Why work for Scotiabank?

 Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services.
 This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.

 Who We Are:

 Scotiabank Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of credit, risk management and investment banking products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include investment banking, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, prime brokerage, debt products, derivatives, foreign exchange and bullion & base metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by Scotiabank.

 Your Work Term At-A-Glance:

 During your internship you will support the Regulatory Controls team by providing timely, relevant and accurate reports to assist with ongoing design and coordination of reporting of Key Performance Indicators:

 Able to use statistical computer languages (e.g., VBA, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
 Familiar with business intelligence tools (e.g., PoewrBI) 
Identify, analyze and interpret trends in complex data sets that pertain to regulatory counterparty data
 Support development of control processes for managing regulatory risk related to counterparty data
 Assist all Regulatory Control team members with a wide range of responsibilities, project deliverables and arbitrary assignments
 Contribution to the design and preparation of reports on daily basis to support regulatory and operational reporting activities.
 Support the delivery of internal (Board, Committee, Compliance, Audit) and regulatory controls related reporting as required.
 Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of both the Bank’s and the Division's business strategies, shifting regulatory environment, evolving risk management practices and methodologies, new products, updated operational processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to drive effective business solutions.
 Actively support efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.


 QUALIFICATIONS
 This role is for you if you are highly self-motivated, and ready to work in a fast paced environment. The processes being built are constantly evolving and changing according to business and compliance needs, and you will be encouraged to contribute your ideas as part of a collaborative process.

 Working knowledge and experience with MS Excel, and MS Word
 Knowledge of database structure and Visual Basic macros are an asset
 Solid analytical skills with an attention to detail and application of a results oriented approach
 Exceptional time management, and interpersonal communication skills

  This internship will provide you with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward. Throughout your term you’ll also have access to skill-building modules, as well as challenging work-integrated learnings - all of which come together to create a stimulating environment where you will have the chance to thrive. We want you to be a sponge and take it all in, bring your great attitude, always be authentic, and own every opportunity that comes your way. This is your time to shine.

 How do I Apply?

 For students, we believe evaluating you through relationships over resumes, and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. In short, we don’t believe resumes will provide us with an accurate depiction of what you’re truly about in order to properly assess your potential. Instead we want to get to know YOU and hear about the experiences that have shaped you. We know… this might sound crazy but we do not want you to submit your resume instead we ask that as part of your application, you complete the below:

 1) Complete your PLUM Profile here

 2) Complete a very short one-way video interview by clicking here (if you have already done this, you don't need to do it again)

 3) Apply to the role through our career site! When the application asks for your resume, please attach a screenshot of your PLUM and your most recent transcript. We have full access to your entire profile from PLUM, but this is a great reminder to complete it.

 Note: You do not need to complete your PLUM profile or video interview multiple times if you are applying to multiple positions. Also, we have full access to your entire profile from Plum and won’t use the screenshot but it’s a great reminder for each of you to have completed it.
 We thank you all for your interest in Scotiabank! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs

 **In order to be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank and/or Tangerine, you must submit your PLUM Assessment and Video Interview. **

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst, your curiosity never ends. The next question is always on your mind, helping you to understand how data science fits in the big picture of a project. Of the five sub-disciplines of Marketing Science—tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration, and statistical modeling—you're a rock star in at least two. Most importantly, you've got a solid understanding of how they all fit into a project, and you're looking to hone your craft in areas you're unfamiliar with. Also, gaining some leadership experience by providing guidance to junior analysts on daily project deliverables is definitely something you're up for.
 



  You will:
 

Understand what the data means and where it fits into the clients' business.
Ensure proper communication between the Marketing Science team and other disciplines.
Approach analysis process logically to demonstrate how data lead to conclusions.
Drive collaboration within teams to provide support, share skills, and gain insight.
Confidently manage project delivery expectations and communications to project team.


  You have:
 

A detail-oriented mindset with exceptional organization skills.
Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery.
Confidence in your communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to efficiently communicate deliveries and delays of project with follow-ups as needed.
Well-organized approach to working on multiple projects at once.
Passion to always improve your team's craft through ongoing learning and support.



 Critical Mass is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We do not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you are an individual with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@criticalmass.com.

Title: Project Controls Analyst
Description:
Description 
Koch Ag & Energy Solutions (KAES) is looking for a Project Controls Analyst who will be a primary point of contact for project cost forecasting, changes, risk management, and involvement/influence throughout the project lifecycle on small to large Capital Projects across (up to) 6 plants. This role requires collaboration, analysis, and strong relationships with cross site, cross functional teams. This provides an opportunity to create significant value if you have curiosity of how capital projects are executed. 
Our Benefits Package Includes:


 Bonus eligible!
 Automatic 401K company contribution plus with competitive matching program
 Excellent Health and wellbeing benefits
 Tuition Reimbursement
 Much more!


 
This position is preferably based out of Wichita KS but open to Beatrice NE, Dodge City KS, Fort Dodge IA, Enid OK, St James LA, or Brandon MB. The successful candidate would travel about 25% of the time.
What You Will Do In Your Role

 Use critical thinking, analysis, curiosity, and collaboration throughout the following (but not limited to) functions:


As a member of one or more project teams, you will leverage knowledge of phase gate project processes and get the right information to the right people at the right time to make the best decisions. 
Partner with the project teams to:




collect data and perform analysis to assist in determining a baseline budget and updated cost forecast throughout the project lifecycle.
 manage changes to ensure appropriate classification, documentation, and communication.
 manage risk register activities.




Demonstrate initiative to improve project outcomes, processes, and forecasting. 
Share knowledge and solve problems across teams to improve project deliverables across KAES.
 Work around the plant without assistance



The Experience You Will Bring
 Requirements:


 Demonstrated ability to analyze trends/variances and determine root causes along with potential solutions 
Experience applying leading metrics to analyze variances and an understanding of how decisions will influence outcomes


What Will Put You Ahead



Experience on projects and/or turnarounds in an industrial or construction environment.
 Experience with reporting, data analytics tools and visualization software such as Alteryx, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
 Experience with project cost management (including forecasting, change management, WBS/CBS buildup, risk management, reporting, etc.) 
Familiarity with EcoSys, Maximo, P6 or similar project portfolio or scheduling tools. 
Ability to perform risk based contingency assessments and identify key drivers of risks.





This role is eligible for relocation bonus/support




Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.
 At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. 

Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

Title: Analyst, Ecosystem and Climate Science
Description:
Position Details:

Vacancies: 2 

Salary Range: $62,976 - $68,277 / per year 

Employment type: Full-Time contract 

Duration: 12 months, 6 months 

Hours of work: 35 hrs/week 

Work location: Head Office - Vaughan 

Division: Development and Engineering Services 

Business unit: Watershed Planning and Ecosystem Science 

Travel: 10% 

Remote Work: Hybrid 


About TRCA:
 With more than 60 years of experience, Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) is one of 36 Conservation Authorities in Ontario, created to safeguard and enhance the health and well-being of watershed communities through the protection and restoration of the natural environment and the ecological services the environment provides. 

 TRCA works to protect the integrity and health of the rivers and creeks in the jurisdiction, develop a system of green and natural spaces that sustains local ecosystems, and advance sustainable practices that improve people’s lives within our growing region. 


How you will contribute as part of the TRCA team:
 Under the supervision of the Senior Research Scientist, Green Infrastructure, in the Ecosystem and Climate Science (ECS) team, the Research Analyst will be responsible for providing support and assistance in general research activities including literature reviews, geospatial analysis, data analysis, and report writing. These activities will directly support the ongoing projects related to urban forest studies, natural asset management, watershed planning, and green infrastructure research. 

 Specifically, this position will undertake qualitative and quantitative research and analysis including assisting in study design, leading field crews, completing spatial and data analysis, and writing technical reports and factsheets to support a range of initiatives related to green infrastructure and urban forestry. The Research Analyst will focus on producing information to support various municipal projects, building applied research partnerships and pursuing external funding opportunities as well as be a technical resource for internal and external partners. 


Major Responsibilities:


Conduct geospatial and data analysis as needed for the ongoing above stated projects of the ECS team.
Compile, QA/QC, analyze, and synthesize data, as required, from a variety of sources to be used in the relevant projects.
Conduct literature reviews and identify best approaches and methods to inform relevant projects.
Provides subject matter expert advice to internal TRCA groups or programs on topics related to urban forestry and green infrastructure in the context of broader growth planning initiatives, watershed planning, and climate change.
Coordinate/schedule field surveys, including training of seasonal staff or interns in and urban forest monitoring, survey or assessment protocols, and ensuring Health and Safety compliance while in the field.
Prepare summaries, factsheets, and technical reports for multiple municipal urban forest projects.
Performs other duties as assigned or required in accordance with departmental, divisional and/or corporate objectives.

What will you need to succeed:


Four (4) year university degree in urban forestry, ecology, biological sciences, environmental science, geography or related discipline.
University degree at master’s level in urban forestry, ecology, biological sciences, environmental science, geography, or related discipline is considered an asset.
Two (2) years of experience related to major responsibilities.
Strong understanding of urban forestry and green infrastructure management principles.
Demonstrated experience with data compilation, QA/QC, analysis, synthesis, and reporting related to major research projects.
Experience with conducting geospatial and statistical analysis within the broader context of methods in ecological science.
Strong project coordination and communication skills
Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act;
Valid Ontario driver’s license.

What TRCA has to offer you:
 As part of a progressive team, you will have the opportunity to make a positive impact to preserving and protecting nature, while maintaining a balance between the natural environment and built environment. Working with experts within our field, you will join a team of colleagues that are committed to TRCA’s core values of integrity, collaboration, accountability, respect, and excellence (icare). 


You will be part of a diverse and inclusive organization that:


Makes a positive difference in the communities we serve.
Fosters high performance and collaborative teams.
Provides continuous learning and development opportunities.
Offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits program (including Defined Benefit Pension Plan – OMERS/OTPP).
Pregnancy & Parental Leave Top-Up Program.
Provides unique TRCA Perks.
Provides flexible work arrangements.
 Offers potential for career growth and advancement 

 To apply to this posting, click on the “Apply” icon. Please submit your resume and cover letter by July 17, 2022. 

 All new hires are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a precondition to being hired by TRCA. TRCA will comply with its obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code and any other applicable legislation. 

 While the Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) thanks all applicants for their interest, only those under consideration will be contacted for interviews. Please be advised that successful incumbent(s) may be required to undergo a vulnerable sector screening and/or driver’s abstract check as a part of the final step in the hiring process. 

 TRCA is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and TRCA Policies, accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the hiring process, provided the candidate makes their accommodation needs known to the TRCA. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. 

 Personal information you provide through the TRCA recruitment, selection and onboarding process is collected under the authority of the Conservation Authorities Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. C.27. Collection of this personal information is necessary for the proper administration of this recruitment process for employment and volunteer positions with TRCA. Personal information is protected from disclosure pursuant to the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. Any questions regarding this collection activity should be directed to the Supervisor of Records, 101 Exchange Avenue, Vaughan, Ontario, L4K 5R6, 
(416) 661-6600 extension 5216.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description:
If you are a motivated individual with BA experience and have a desire to work directly with business leaders in our organization, this role is for you! This role offers the opportunity for a hybrid work arrangement, with remote work up to 50% of the time.
 The Senior Business Analyst works with internal stakeholders (leaders, subject matter experts and users) and external parties (ERP vendor, OEM vendors and customers) to gather requirements and implement solutions to improve business activities and optimize the process end-to-end. This role would be considered a subject matter expert in their area of accountability. The Senior Business Analyst is also required to provide guidance, support and expertise to the business user groups, Level 1 and Level 2 Service Desk support specialists.
 Responsibilities:

 Create project proposals by gathering requirements from the business, identifying, documenting, and providing solutions to optimize business process. Providing updates to project managers and the business on a regular basis
 Provide Level 3 Service Desk support and ensure ERP issues are tracked and escalated as required.
 Provide support to the eXtend ERP team with release management, enhancements, data fixes and testing.
 Provide support to the Change Management Team by providing insight for areas requiring attention and participate in development of user communications.

 Qualifications:
 Our team is looking for a knowledgeable business analyst with experience in manufacturing, remanufacturing, service or warranty areas. This role will allow the incumbent to work directly with all levels of the organization and have a specified internal customer to support allowing them to be a change maker business process.

 Post secondary education in a related field
 Experience as an IT Business Analyst where you lead projects and gathering requirements from the business
 Excellent time management ability with the desire to get results
 Excellent communication skills
 Solutions orientated mind set with the ability to proactively identify and manage risk

 Apply today; we would like to meet you! To apply for this position or to see other Career Opportunities, please visit our website at https://www.smsequipment.com/en-ca/careers/
 Applications will be accepted until a suitable candidate is found.
 SMS Equipment offers rewarding careers in the heavy equipment industry across Canada. As the largest Komatsu dealer in North America, SMS Equipment gives you the opportunity to represent world-class quality in our product offerings and customer service. A few of the many benefits of working with SMS Equipment include: competitive wages, comprehensive group benefits plans, and RRSP matching.

Title: Statistical Analyst I
Business Analyst legal
Description:
As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for reviewing business operations to address problems and enable continuity. We will rely on you to identify potential risks and opportunities by collecting and analyzing information. Your goal is to ensure that our company operates efficiently. As a Business Analyst, you should have excellent analytical, problem-solving and communication skills. You should be highly organized and able to prioritize effectively while meeting strict deadlines. most importantly experience of legal contract vetting and understanding of business laws for contract framing and vetting and liasoning with lawyers required, especially in the areas of europe, bangladesh, pakistan, Arabic countries and South East Asia.
Responsibilities:

Create business requirements and use cases.
Analyze processes and data to create prototypes of new solutions.
Create documentation and communicate requirements to the technical team.
Architecture design, implemenation and testing of new systems.
Design complex queries and analyze data to extract insights.
Work with business users, subject matter experts or business analysts to get clear requirements for new solutions.
Analyze results from user acceptance tests and refine system architecture.
Build functional specifications from business requirements and design specifications.
Perform other duties as needed.

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $67,237.00-$72,496.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Mississauga, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

Legal knowledge of contract vetting and understanding of laws required for contract framing and liasoning with lawyers especially in UK, Europe, Middle East and South East Asia, including Pakistan, and UAE

Title: Policy, Planning and Research Analyst
Description:
Location: Regional - All Eastern Health Sites
 Base: Waterford Hospital Policy, Planning and Research Analyst (Subject to Classification Review) Facilities Management Permanent, Full-Time 07462POS
 Hours: 75 bi-weekly (8 hour days) Salary: CG-35 ($31.04 - $34.63 per hour) Competition Number: 2022003993 Posted Date: 4 July 2022 Closing Date: 11 July 2022
 About Us Eastern Health is the largest, integrated health authority in Newfoundland and Labrador employing approximately 13,000 dedicated employees and serving a population of more than 300,000 people. The authority offers the full continuum of health and community services including public health, long-term care, community services, hospital care and unique provincial programs and services. At Eastern Health we pride ourselves on providing the highest quality care and service possible to the people in our communities, in our region, and in the province. To do that, we employ qualified, competent and caring individuals who are dedicated to their professions and to our vision of Healthy People, Healthy Communities.
 Job Summary The Policy, Planning and Research Analyst is responsible for policy planning, research, and development of organizational initiatives within the Regional Leasing, Accommodations and Multimedia Productions divisions of Infrastructure Support. Duties of this position will include but are not limited to development, implementation and maintenance of departmental and program plans, work processes, and quality reporting framework. The position will perform research on best practices and comparisons to similar entities to ensure best in class and assist in the preparation of strategic plans/annual reports and additional reporting requirements. Develop strategic business plans to ensure the space needs for clinical and business operations are met while operating within the allocated budget. Compile and analyze data to create reports and briefing notes to advance the strategic direction of the program. Reports and briefing notes created will be for Eastern Health executive as well as for various government departments. This position will also conduct research for a variety of stakeholders (i.e. clinical programs, managers, Executive team, etc.) and provides statistical data analysis and reporting by developing databases, ensuring data integrity, and performing data extracts for stakeholders, The position will represents the program on various committees and working groups with internal stakeholders as well as stakeholders at various provincial government departments, municipalities, community partners, and business owners in the region .Creates internal documents, reports, and presentations as needed. Administers surveys on behalf of the Infrastructure Support. Develops and delivers training to staff.
 This position will require travel to all Eastern Health locations in the City, Rural Avalon and Peninsulas; overnight stays will be required.
 Job Demands By applying for this job, you acknowledge an understanding that regular requirements and demands of this job include (but are not limited to): Occasionally required to lift/move objects, such as files and records up to 10 lbs. Work provides the opportunity to occasionally stand, walk and bend and stretch within the office environment. Constantly required to perform fine finger/precision work while sitting using a keyboard and mouse while entering and manipulating data in electronic documents, responding to information, updating databases, and preparing correspondence. Visual concentration is required constantly for data entry and verification of information in spreadsheets as well as to write reports, emails and other correspondence. Occasionally there is unusual/distracting noise, glare from computer monitors and lack of privacy. Exact results and precision are required when preparing reports, compiling statistical information, and responding to information requests. Auditory concentration includes constant listening to multiple stakeholders requesting information, questioning for clarity and communicating complex responses. Occasionally impacted by interruptions and multiple time pressures/deadlines for immediate results for data or information. Reporting deadlines occur regularly. Work demands do not result in considerable fatigue requiring periods of rest. Occasionally required to drive to various locations to perform work duties
 Job Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration/Commerce, Economics, Statistics or related field is required. Minimum of two years of experience within the last four in evaluation, data assessment and analysis is required. Experience with research evaluation would be an asset. Demonstrated proficiency of MS Office, as well as knowledge of research, and financial methods, techniques, and statistical analysis are required. Demonstrated collaboration, superior oral and written communications skills, attention to detail and the ability to plan and organize is required. Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Satisfactory driver's license and drivers abstract will be required. A satisfactory record of work performance and attendance is required.
 If this is an internal posting only, only applicants of the Eastern Health NAPE HS Regional Bargaining Unit will be considered. Otherwise, if this is posted internal and external, we will accept all applications, but preference will be given to those qualified candidates who are internal to the Eastern Health NAPE HS Regional Bargaining Unit.
 Apply online at https://employment.easternhealth.ca Upon successfully applying for a vacancy then you will receive a confirmation email. If you do not receive this email please contact Recruitment 777-7777 ext 5-2 immediately
 To become a part of our team, please submit your resume/cover letter or application form online, clearly demonstrating how you meet the required qualifications. Include your current mailing address, day-time contact number, e-mail address, competition and employee number if applicable.
 Contact Information for Recruitment Related Inquiries: Telephone: (709) 777-7777 (5-2) or 1-800-563-3693 Email: employment@easternhealth.ca. Applications/resumes are not accepted at this email address.
 If you are no longer interested in the position, you can withdraw your application by emailing employment@easternhealth.ca as soon as possible.
 Eastern Health is committed to inclusive and barrier-free recruitment, selection and onboarding processes. We are happy to assist applicants requesting accommodation or support during the process. Please email employment@easternhealth.ca or call 777-7777 press 5 then press 2 (long distance 1-800-563-3693) outlining how we can help.
 EXTERNAL APPLICANTS: We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate will be required to provide a satisfactory Certificate of Conduct from the RCMP or local Police (Vulnerable Sector Check may be required), educational documents, registration/licensure if applicable and Social Insurance Number.

Title: Business Analyst II, Campaign Operations
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON, CA Calgary, AB, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Edmonton, AB, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27722 
    







     Jobs by Category: Operations 
    







     Job Function: Planning and Analysis 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Join our team:


The TELUS Business Solutions (TBS) organization is dynamic, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial. Together, the team is responsible for driving profitable growth within a key growth segment for TELUS. Our team of technical professionals play an integral part of supporting campaign data execution for the TELUS Business Marketing team. Together, we work collaboratively with Marketing to ensure campaign delivery and accuracy.


You will join a skilled and engaged team that continues to shape the evolution of the portfolio, and find creative ways to reach business clients to ultimately grow and expand our wireless and wireline share.


Here’s what we will accomplish together:


We are looking for a driven, high-energy, technical and results-oriented individual to join the team for the role of Business Analyst II, within the Campaign Operations function.


In this role, you will be spearheading a number of different campaigns across our Acquisition and Base portfolios, in doing so, you will be working with various cross-functional team members to ensure campaign data is optimized, accurate and delivered within the business requirements. You will also help with facilitating data investigations and universe sizing exercises for our strategic marketing campaigns.


Candidates for the role should be curious to understand the “why” and “how” behind the data, and are passionate about using the data to craft a better customer & sales experience.


Here’s how



Examine and interpret data to draw conclusions that drive marketing campaign execution
Assemble multiple data sources across various databases to build campaign ready data
Work collaboratively with a dynamic and cross-functional marketing team to drive results
Extract, Scrub, and modify raw data within SAS, from various data sources
Present data findings and recommendations in forums
Develop new analytical solutions to provide timely insights to the business
Build automated solutions to create standardized datasets to increase efficiency for campaign execution
Implement business intelligence rules, optimize data processes and perform data quality audits
Collaborate with business stakeholders, help foster the relationships and lead data enablement programs
Effectively communicate with leadership and stakeholders providing them with regular updates on programs and new solutions








Qualifications




What you bring



You can write code and automate processes using Statistical Analysis System (SAS)
You have experience spearheading large scale projects, defining business outcomes, managing stakeholder expectations, and partnering with multiple team members
You can manage ambiguity and change with a learning and growth mindset
You love digging into quantitative and qualitative data
You have advanced working SAS knowledge and experience working with relational databases
You have minimum 1-2 years of experience in a similar role and/or related education with demonstrated performance
Proficiency with SAS, Oracle, and other SQL-based tools
Confidence to adapt to and manage changing, and occasionally conflicting, priorities
Excellent time management, project management and organizational skills
Post-secondary degree in Information Management, Business, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or other quantitative discipline

Title: Logistics Analyst
Description:
The Logistics Analyst at Jamesway Chick Master will be responsible for gathering various types of logistics data and utilizing analytical methods to understand, predict, and improve logistics performance and reduce logistics cost. This role leads cost reduction identification, cost/benefit analysis, and devise optimal logistics solution to create more productive, cost-effective, and profitable logistics department. The individual also helps the organization to implement the solutions.
The Logistics Analyst position will encompass the following primary areas of responsibility:

Collects, interprets, and analyzes various types of logistics data including freight expenses, reliability of transport and delivery, and other data related to supply chain management, sourcing, and distribution.
Maintains database(s) of logistics information.
Reviews logistics processes and procedures; identifies, recommends, and implements improvements to maximize delivery efficiency while minimizing costs.
Uses analytic methods and tools to understand, predict, and/or improve logistics operations, processes, and cost.
Reviews and analyzes transportation costs, parts delivery processes, inventory issues such as back orders, and other fulfillment metrics.
Track KPIs to identify trends and potential cost savings initiatives
Ensure compliance with origin country’s export and destination country’s import regulations
Perform other related duties, as assigned.

Skills: 

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required; ability to recommend alternative solutions and translate complex concepts into simplified and understandable examples.
Technically proficient in the areas of logistics & transportation.
Experience and understanding of all shipment modes: Full/Less than Container Loads, Full/Less than Truck Loads, Air freight and Courier.
Experience analyzing large sets of data and ability to create solution-based reports.
Working knowledge of international trade compliance, import/export laws and regulations.
Ability to accurately classify products for country of origin and HS code.


Proficiency in the use of Excel.

Education/Experience: 

Bachelor’s degree in logistics, supply chain, finance, or business is required.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in global supply chain (preferably in a logistics, transportation, distribution, or trade compliance capacity)

Job Type: Fixed term contractContract length: 12 months
Benefits:

Casual dress
Flexible schedule
On-site parking

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Experience:

logistics: 5 years (preferred)
Analysis skills: 5 years (preferred)

Title: RPA Business Analyst
Description:
Job Description: 
Seeking an experience RPA business analyst to support process optimization and enhancement of new processes as well as scoping and implementation of new use cases on existing robots. The RPA business analyst will create and update process design documents, document user stories in the team JIRA board. The RPA business analyst will work closely with the RPA developers and the business SMEs to prepare RPA requirements and documentation.
Responsibilities: 

Elicit, document and analyze current state solution from the existing documentation and in workshops with business SMEs


Based on the analysis of the current state, policy and legislative constraints, and business needs identified by business SMEs, define and document future state requirements in a variety of interim and prescribed artefacts, such as PPDs, use cases, user stories, business rules, data dictionary, workflows and data analytics, issue or option papers


Validate requirements with assigned business resources


Raise any issues requiring further investigation and/or business decisions


Provide business analysis expertise and support to aid decision making by conducting in-depth analysis, summarizing, and providing recommendations.


Manage requirements through various stages, including traceability and linkage between different deliverables while using SharePoint Online as a requirement repository


Creation of Business Process Design document (PDD)


Contribute to the Process Solution Design Document


Facilitate the testing of Automated Process


Assist in the triage for defects

Requirements: Knowledge & Skills: 

3+ years of experience in an Robotic Process Automation Business Analyst/ Developer role


3+ years’ Citizen Development experience using UiPath Clould (Orchestrator, Task Capture, Test Manager, Action Center, Automation Hub, Insights, OCR, Document Understanding) with relevant technical or Process analysis, design and development experience


Must have experience writing Process Design Documents & Solution Design Documents


Proven capabilities to improve manual processes through automation design and execution


Experience with designing and implementing robotic process automation and low code/no code workflow orchestration


Proven ability to liaise with business subject matters in gathering of business requirements


Proven process development skills and solid understanding of project life cycle and the capability to apply best practices knowledge to unique and dynamic situations


Experience capturing and analyzing process flows to identify efficiencies


5+ Experience working with AGILE and Waterfall methodologies and tools


Must have JIRA and Scrum experience


Must have waterfall experience


Communication and Leadership


Ability to work well as a part of a large team of other business analysts and business SMEs


Effective communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills to lead and/or participate in workshops while effectively building relationships and influencing decisions


Experience working and negotiating with a variety of business stakeholders


Excellent project management, analytical and problem solving skills


Superior writing skills to prepare/edit comprehensive reports, and other documents with strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills


Work with a sense of urgency and demonstrate leadership skills to achieve high performance and excellent service


RPA Uipath Business Analyst certifications

#IMPJOB
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

Robotic Process Automation Business Analyst: 3 years (preferred)
working with AGILE and Waterfall methodologies and tools: 5 years (preferred)

Title: Logistics Analyst, Transportation
Description:
Lindt & Sprüngli is recognized as a leader in the market for premium quality chocolate, offering a large selection of products in more than 120 countries around the world. During more than 170 years of Lindt & Sprüngli's existence, it has become known as one of the most innovative and creative companies making premium chocolate, with 12 production sites in Europe and the USA, and distribution and sales companies on four continents.
 Position Overview:
 Location: Mississauga (DC)
 We are looking for an enthusiastic and driven individual to fill the role of Logistics Analyst, Transportation.
 Reporting to the Manager, Logistics, the Logistics Analyst is responsible for all outbound shipments and reverse logistics; acting as point of contact for internal and external parties related to transportation and freight costs. Together with the 3PL, the incumbent will provide the processes, tools, analysis and reports necessary to meet the requirements of the business and to continuously improve on-time delivery while seeking solutions to reduce logistics costs. The Logistics Analyst will also be responsible for deduction management and non-compliance related to Logistics.
 Responsibilities:

 Gather data and execute monthly cost tracking and reporting analysis for B2B and B2C outbound transportation
 Provide analysis and cost studies to support carrier negotiations and rate proposals
 Support long and short-term process improvement initiatives for Logistics
 Partnering with the 3PL and Supply Chain Team, focus on identifying supply chain operational efficiencies and cost savings opportunities.
 Utilize quantitative skills to analyze, validate, manipulate and manage large amounts of data specific to problem solving and trend analysis reporting.
 In cooperation with the 3PL, develop and maintain relevant reports and applications such as transportation KPIs, carrier scorecards and operational metrics.
 Manage carrier relationships, monitor performance and implement corrective measures when appropriate. Assist in the development and implementation of logistics procedures and guidelines.
 Manage deductions and identify solutions to reduce delivery service issues and non-compliance fees related to logistics.
 Work with the Retail Team, Manager Logistics and 3PL to replenish the Retail stores in an operational efficient and cost effective way within the defined lead times.
 Assist the ecommerce team with Logistics related KPI’s, tracking expenses and presentation of quarterly reports
 Check and validate invoices for Transportation
 Review, update and maintain lead times in JDE and routing guide

 Qualifications:

 5 years’ work experience in transportation and distribution in a multi channel environment
 Bachelor’s degree preferred in supply chain, logistics, transportation or related disciplines
 Solid knowledge of Logistics processes and current market conditions
 Strong analytical and data manipulation skills
 Strong process improvement and development experience
 Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work independently & as a team
 Detail and task oriented, self-motivated
 Computer Proficiency, Word, Excel, PowerPoint. BI Analytics is an asset
 1+ years of experience with JDE
 Able to manage multiple, competing projects

 Why Lindt Canada? Join our winning culture and become part of our team of passionate and dynamic individuals in our journey to become the leader in the Canadian chocolate market. Our environment characterizes personal commitment, drive, initiative and entrepreneurial spirit, working together as one team to reach outstanding results. We encourage, recognize and reward innovation, personal initiative, leadership and accountability throughout the organization. We are recognized as a Great Place to Work so come and grow your career with us, it’s a pretty sweet deal. To learn more about our winning culture, visit https://careers.lindtcanada.ca and or follow us on LinkedIn
 We thank all those who have applied however, only selected candidates will be contacted.
 Lindt is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request. Please contact our Human Resources department for more information. #CORPORATE #LI-LINDTCA #LI-Hybrid

Title: Business Analyst II
Technical Business Analyst
Description:
A career in Information Technology, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to support our core business functions by deploying applications that enable our people to work more efficiently and deliver the highest levels of service to our clients. You’ll focus on managing the design and implementation of technology infrastructure within PwC, developing and enhancing both client and internal facing applications within PwC, and providing technology tools that help create a competitive advantage for the Firm to drive strategic business growth. Our Data Intelligence and Analysis - Practice Support team provides PwC a series of organisational technology capabilities that include business intelligence, data management, data warehouse, and data assurance. You’ll help with projects that involve information technology strategy and infrastructure, enterprise architecture, enterprise applications, large scale programme and portfolio management, information technology security, data analytics, computer forensics, and emerging technologies like cloud, mobility and social networking.
  
 This is a newly formed team that will leverage data to rapidly discover, quantify, and deliver through intelligent analytics and scalable end-to-end business solutions. Working initially across the domains of Finance, Sales & Marketing, and Human Capital, the group will help drive analytics adoption across the Firm, accelerating value delivery, developing in-house talent, and building solutions and trust in data-driven decision making.
  
 Purpose-led work you’ll be part of

 As a Technical Business Analyst, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
