Title: Strategic Analyst
Description:
Strategic Analyst 

Primary Purpose: The Strategic Analyst will provide reporting and analysis of planning and assessment activities in support of the university’s strategic priorities. Integral to this will be the connection of planning and assessment to institutional resource allocation processes. The incumbent will frequently be involved in conducting or participating in special projects on behalf of the Provost and Vice-President Academic, Deputy Provost, or other stakeholders supported by the office of Institutional Planning and Assessment (IPA). The position is also responsible for ensuring that assessment activities are closely aligned to, and support strategic planning initiatives at the institutional and unit level.
 Nature of Work: The Strategic Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Assessment and Analytics within the office of IPA. The position will play an integral role in the analysis of qualitative and quantitative information in support of institutional planning and decision-making. The incumbent will conduct a wide variety of writing and analysis projects associated with the assessment and review of university plans and priorities. The position requires the ability to conceptualize and analyze research related to higher education in Saskatchewan, Canada, and particularly with the U15. Responsibilities also include data collection, analysis and reporting related to the integration of institutional planning, institutional effectiveness, and resource allocation processes. The Strategic Analyst will also support various review processes, including the systematic review of all academic programs at USask. The position supports the senior leaders at the university in matters relating to financial decision-making, institutional directions, and assessing performance against plans and goals.
 The Strategic Analyst will be involved in many projects and initiatives that will be confidential in nature and/or have broad impact across the university. The work is executed in a timely and efficient manner, working under pressure in a fast paced and changing environment, balancing priorities, and competing deadlines. The position routinely works with highly confidential and sensitive information such as university-wide budgetary drivers that includes salaries and college/unit budgets as well as faculty and staff complement plans and information. Because of this, the position requires a high level of discretion, integrity, and independent judgement.
 Accountabilities:

 Performs business analysis to understand information needs and requirements in order to provide accurate and appropriate interpretation of data and results to inform decisions of senior university leaders.
 Participates in the evaluation of institutional progress towards realization of the goals and commitments described in the university’s institutional plans and alignment to Government of Saskatchewan priorities.
 Builds relationships with key university stakeholders including working with university leadership and peers to coordinate institutional and unit level planning, assessment, and reporting activities.
 Designs and develops written reports, dashboards, and scorecards to meet the information needs of senior administrators, campus users, and entities external to the University of Saskatchewan. 
Prepares information for university governing bodies, committees, and senior leaders to inform and support decision-making and implementation of strategic priorities and initiatives.
 Conducts comparative and case study research, competitor analysis, institutional analysis, and outcomes-based assessments that pertain to areas of university priorities and goals.
 Supports university review initiatives by assisting with the planning of site visits, development of site visit schedules, preparation of required information, and reporting on review activities.
 Supports the integration of planning, resource allocation and assessment functions through collaborative activities and initiatives with other members of the IPA team and by providing input, feedback, and/or direction on various IPA projects.
 Develops strategic and confidential documents (e.g. white papers, reports, proposals, briefing notes, presentations, etc.) that will often will contain sensitive and at times political information.
 Conducts special projects or reviews, many of which are very confidential in nature, at the request of the Provost and Vice-President Academic, Deputy Provost, and/or Senior Director, Assessment and Analytics.
 Completes concurrent projects in a timely manner, within agreed-upon deadlines, and in a format appropriate to the specific stakeholders.
 Promotes a healthy, respectful, collegial, and productive work environment within the office and in interactions with campus and external stakeholders.
 Performs other related duties or projects as required.

 Education: An undergraduate degree is required. A graduate degree, related training in data analytics, qualitative and quantitative research methods, or relevant professional training/designations pertaining to business analysis, data analytics, or project management would be considered an asset.
 Experience: Five years of experience with analyzing quantitative and qualitative data, developing report and presentations, and producing data visualizations; ability to analyze and convert data into useful information; experience with interpreting and presenting information to organization leaders; ability to work effectively as part of a team or independently; experience developing or implementing projects which achieve expected outcomes; proven success in completing high quality work in an accurate and timely manner; analytical, research, organizational and problem-solving skills; ability to think creatively and identify innovative solutions; proficiency with Microsoft Office tools and various reporting products/platforms (e.g. PowerBI, Crystal Reports, etc.).
 Skills: Highly organized with effective oral, written, and interpersonal skills; ability to work independently, collaboratively and within a team environment; competency in determining information needs, identifying sources of information, designing research projects, analyzing data, extracting key data, and communicating findings to audiences of all levels and degrees of interest; strong research and problem solving skills; proven ability to prioritize and meet deadlines; demonstrated ability to think and act strategically, exercise diplomacy, and implement creative solutions; a demonstrated proficiency with contemporary computer applications; and ability to handle highly confidential information.

 Department: Institutional Planning and Assessment Status: Permanent  Employment Group: Exempt  Shift: Monday to Friday 8:00 - 4:30pm.  Full Time Equivalent (FTE): 1.0  Salary: The salary range, based on 1.0 FTE, is $66,500.00 - 110,000.00 per annum. The starting salary will be commensurate with education and experience.  Salary Family (if applicable):  Salary Phase/Band: Phase 3  Posted Date: 7/4/2022  Closing Date: The posting will remain open until filled. Applications will begin to be reviewed after the posting has been up for two weeks. Number of Openings: 1 Work Location: On Campus
 The successful applicant will be required to provide the following current verification(s) where 'Yes' is indicated below. Further information is available at: https://careers.usask.ca/tips-for-applying.php 
Criminal Record Check: Not Applicable Driver's License and Abstract Check: Not Applicable Education/Credential Verification: Not Applicable Vulnerable Sector Check: Not Applicable
 Please review the University of Saskatchewan's health and safety requirements for faculty, staff and students in consideration of the COVID-19 pandemic.

 The University believes equity, diversity, and inclusion strengthen the community and enhance excellence, innovation and creativity. We are dedicated to recruiting individuals who will enrich our work and learning environments. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadian citizens and permanent residents will be given priority. We are committed to providing accommodations to those with a disability or medical necessity. If you require an accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please notify us and we will work together on the accommodation request. The University of Saskatchewan’s main campus is situated on Treaty 6 Territory and the Homeland of the Métis. We pay our respects to the First Nations and Métis ancestors of this place and reaffirm our relationship with one another. Together, we are uplifting Indigenization to a place of prominence at the University of Saskatchewan.

Title: Operational Business Analyst
Description:
Connect Logistics Services Inc. (CLS) located in St. Albert, is a third party contractor that provides warehouse and distribution services of spirits, wine, import beer and cannabis throughout the province of Alberta on behalf of Alberta Gaming, Liquor and Cannabis (AGLC). We are a member company of DHL Supply Chain (DHLSC), a division of Deutsche Post DHL Group (DPDHL), the World's Leading Mail and Logistics Company.
 We are currently looking for an Operational Business Analyst to join our team. In this Operational Business Analyst role with CLS:

 You’ll be responsible for capital asset management.
 You’ll be responsible for the ongoing review of the general ledger and preparation of reclassifying journal entries as required.
 You’ll prepare monthly recurring journal entries.
 You’ll work closely with accounts payable and accounts receivable in preparation of month end accruals.
 You’ll utilize strong Excel skills in the creation, troubleshooting and enhancements of various spreadsheets.
 You’ll participate in client and corporate audits.
 You’ll work independently to manage deadlines and prioritize your workload in a manner that enables you to achieve results.
 You’ll work as part of a team providing operational support for the month-end close process and provide financial analysis that enables our sites to achieve peak performance.
 You’ll be involved in updating monthly forecast models and annual budget preparation.
 You’ll be responsible for providing time sensitive functional department support which could include spreadsheet development and ad hoc data analysis.
 You’ll be responsible for identifying opportunity for efficiency and maintaining current work instructions.

 For more information, please visit www.connect-logistics.com
 Can you see yourself in a role where you are responsible for influencing operational leaders and decision-making in a distribution center environment? Are you the type of person who takes initiative to solve problems and pursue continuous improvement opportunities? Do you demonstrate the ability to think analytically and creatively while maintaining an intense attention to detail? Would it motivate you when the guidance you provide has a direct impact on company profitability?

 If so, DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you.

 We are looking for a top notch Operational Business Analyst who will provide financial/operational insight and guidance to enhance performance and process efficiency.

 Job Description
 To provide analytical support for all operating activities, such as customer demand/volume planning, warehouse productivity, labor efficiency, throughput reporting and analysis, month end close, payroll, receivables, payables, etc. Also responsible for activities such as indirect purchasing, HR, payroll, temp procurement, collections, and certain GL close responsibilities.

 Customers and/or Vendors

 Provide information as requested by external customers in relation to any and all items on customer invoices
 Audit vendor payables for accuracy and ensure appropriate approvals are obtained prior to payment
 Provide a professional environment with relation to external customer representatives
 Execute daily customer / vendor contract requirements and identify accessorial activity and ensure necessary documentation
 Associate / Inside Site
 Work with Operations and HR department associates on a daily basis, providing support and assistance as needed
 Provide support to Kronos application and set-up to ensure accurate hourly activity reporting
 Interact with GMs, Mgrs., and Supvs to provide analytical support as needed
 Provide back up to the purchasing supervisor when needed
 Participate in the necessary daily activity to ensure a safe, secure, clean and fair work environment for associates
 Direct involvement with Accounting and Commercial Finance departments
 Process
 Provide ad-hoc analytical support to operations personnel in all areas of the operation as needed and requested
 Prepare month end close accrual and reclass journal entries
 Assist as needed with accounts receivable processing and collection
 Assist as needed with billing and proper revenue reporting
 Assist as needed with account payable processing
 Reconcile Purchase Orders as support to expense recognition
 Prepare daily and weekly labor analysis reports for operations productivity analysis
 Participate in the collection of performance measurements consistent with customer, vendor, and site requirements
 Ownership of balance sheets (black-line) account reconciliations


 Required Education and Experience

 Associates Degree in Business or relevant field, required
 Bachelors degree in Business or relevant field, preferred
 1-3 years experience in Accounting or Financial Reporting role, preferred


 Our Organization is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request.

Title: Information Systems Analyst
Description:
Staff - Non Union
 

   Job Category
  M&P - AAPS
 

   Job Profile
  AAPS Salaried - Statistical Analysis, Level B
 

   Job Title
  Information Systems Analyst
 

   Department
  Research | Sadatsafavi Lab | Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences
 

   Compensation Range
  6,677.33 - $10,433.50 CAD Monthly
 

   Posting End Date
  July 19, 2022
 

   Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
 


   Job End Date
  Aug 31, 2023
 

   Job Summary
 

   Respiratory Evaluation Sciences Program (RESP) is a health economics and outcomes research program within the Collaboration for Outcomes Research and Evaluation (CORE) at UBC that contributes to new knowledge in terms of the long-term burden of chronic respiratory diseases and the effectiveness of interventions in reducing such burden.
 


   This new position will be involved in all aspects of design and development, as well as deployment and maintenance of health informatics solutions (algorithm, hardware, and software) for respiratory-related research. Other responsibilities include developing and evaluating study designs, developing statistical models and performing analysis on clinical and administrative health data, help with writing reports and manuscripts, and presenting results to a multidisciplinary audience.
 

 Organizational Status
   The Information Systems Analyst will work closely with, and will report to the director of the RESP program (Dr. Mohsen Sadatsafavi)
  
 Work Performed
 

   Major Responsibilities:
 



     Data mining and Data Marts: to perform advanced data mining algorithm on BC administrative health data to extract hypotheses and recognizing patterns in population.
   


     Data Analysis and statistics: to perform advanced statistical analysis on BC administrative health data to study burden of respiratory diseases, gaps in care, and real-world effectiveness of treatments.
   


     Software architecture, development, and databases: to design and development required application in IMPACT project.
   


     Network Protocols: to design and deployment IMPACT components compatible with current network specifications.
   


     Software Deployment: to deploy IMAPCT components in the clinical field.
   


     Healthcare organizations and workflow: to understand and design workflow of the projects like IMPATS compatible with hospital workflows.
   


     Design and implement research data acquisition solutions based on REDCAP or other research data management systems.
   


     Clinical Knowledge: to understand and work properly with clinical issues in the hospitals.
   


     Present results to multidisciplinary teams.
   


     Other duties relating to the role of Information Systems Analyst as required.
   


 Consequence of Error/Judgement
 

   The successful applicant will be the primary person in charge of designing and implementing the research projects. This entails a great deal of independence and autonomy in decision making. The principal investigators will periodically check the work performed by the Information Systems Analyst.
 


   The task requires the highest level of ethical integrity and analytical precision. Poor judgment in exercising such standards can have grave consequences. If undetected, mistakes can find their way into the scientific domain and affect patient care. When detected, analytical mistakes can result in extensive and lengthy process of correcting the scientific reports and be damaging to the reputation of the team.
 

 Supervision Received
 

   The successful applicant will report directly to the Principal Investigators Dr. Mohsen Sadatsafavi.
 


   Significant content expertise and support is available, both in the relevant clinical areas, and in the methodology and expertise with data management. The applicant will join an active and productive and growing research unit and professional development of the team members is highly valued.
 

 Supervision Given
   The successful candidate is expected to work collaboratively with other employees and trainees, and may provide training and supervision for specific tasks undertaken by research staff.
  
 Minimum Qualifications
   Post-graduate degree in Statistics. Minimum of three years of related experience in research analysis, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
  
 Preferred Qualifications
 



     Post-graduate degree in health informatics, computer sciences, or related field desired
   


     Desired experience in related disciplines: software development, solution development and implementation.
   


     Experience with statistical programming and package development for both server (NodeJS, .NET framework) and client environments.
   


     Experience with data mining and artificial intelligent programs and algorithms.
   


     Experience in collaborative software development workflow, version control, and issue tracking systems.
   


     Solid understanding of health outcomes, evaluation and assessment of health care interventions, technologies and programs, epidemiology, and health care policy, as demonstrated through post-graduate coursework and/or relevant experiences.
   


     Experience with data management and statistical analysis of linked administrative databases in Population Data BC (PopData) research environment platform.
   


     Sound understanding in quantitative research methods, high level calculus, longitudinal data analysis, inference and prediction related to health outcomes research.
   


     Innovative and fast learner, with good attitude, able to maintain accuracy and attention to detail.
   


     Ability to communicate and work effectively both independently and in a team environment.

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Description:
Take your next career step at Mevotech. We are constantly challenging the status quo and raising the bar allowing employees to make an impact within the company.
 Mevotech is a trusted North American leader in the engineering and design of driveline, steering and suspension aftermarket auto parts. Fueled by innovation, our brands feature engineering improvements for maximum durability and performance, as well as time and labor-saving enhancements that drive bay efficiencies and increase shop revenues. Our in-house engineering team always has the Professional Technician in mind, and we are continuously optimizing part design for durability and ease of installation.
 GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
 The Inventory Control Analyst is responsible for overseeing inventory-related issues which include running inventory reports, discovering and analyzing discrepancies in the inventory data, and improving the inventory control systems. The Inventory Control Analyst is also responsible for ensuring data integrity, accurate reporting, and maintenance of all parameters for warehouse layouts. This role will also partner with the Accounts Payable team to ensure the accurate tracking of all inventory transactions.
 SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES

 Monitor and control inventory integrity and control warehouse layouts
 Update data, run reports and identify discrepancies while maintaining inventory control records, and regular management reports
 Analyze actual sales compared to forecast and identify cause/effect relationship of variances
 Perform daily cycle counts, reconcile, and monitor inventory accuracy while resolving any errors or discrepancies in a timely manner
 Make recommendations for corrective actions based on on-going analysis
 Observe all safety rules in performance of duties

 QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

 University degree or college diploma, preferably in a related field
 Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and understanding of data management
 Understanding of technical aspects of warehouse operations including storage solutions
 Thorough knowledge and understanding of bulk and finish goods processes
 Strong problem solver, able to create solutions to challenges in an expedient manner
 Able to communicate effectively with various organizational levels including warehouse floor employees and customers
 Advanced skills in MS Excel
 Ability to travel and work at other locations as required
 Previous work experience in a related field would be a strong asset
 Knowledge of ERP systems an asset
 Able to work Monday to Friday, some afternoon availability required

Title: FastLane Program Business Analyst
Description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

 Reporting to the Executive Director of Applied AI Programs, the FastLane Program Business Analyst will play a key role in the implementation of the program to accelerate adoption of AI in Canadian SMEs. This position is part of Vector’s Industry Innovation team with a mission to expand partnerships with Canadian industry through programs for talent, training, and applied AI projects.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop insights and recommendations on program strategy, SME engagement, and growth opportunities;
Lead, implement, and participate in program-related activities as required;
Identify ongoing improvements to the program;
Outreach to AI and innovation ecosystem partners to identify areas of collaboration;
Build, foster, and maintain business connections with ecosystem partners and high-potential SMEs;
Perform research on high-potential SMEs/sectors;
Inform program statuses and liaise with others in the Industry Innovation and Technology workstreams;
Develop and track program metrics;
Provide assistance to build out PD programming with industry-focused associations; and,
Other duties as assigned.



 SUCCESS MEASURES

The Industry Innovation team reaches its metrics and targets (i.e., client satisfaction and sponsorship growth) as approved by Vector’s President & CEO and Board of Directors.
Internal and external stakeholder feedback is such that Vector's Industry Innovation team provides high quality service, support, and impactful data/resources as required.
Sponsor and SME feedback is such that Vector's programs and offerings are valuable and help to improve and inform various internal processes.



 PROFILE OF THE IDEAL CANDIDATE


 Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, or related discipline.
1-3 years of work experience working with technology startups and scaleups.
Understanding of the competitive landscape as it relates to small- and medium-sized enterprises.
Experience in program design, implementation, and evaluation.
Experience communicating with technical, business, and external stakeholders.
Experience developing plans, building processes, and using analytics to execute successful programs in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
An understanding of not-for-profit organizations is an asset.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong critical and strategic thinker.
Ability to work independently on several projects concurrently and maintain focus and professionalism in high pressure environments.
Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to work successfully with various organizational levels, including colleagues, senior executives, and external partners.
Deep interest in Canada's AI ecosystem and knowledge economy.
Ability to create visually compelling and professional documents, in alignment with established visual identity guidelines.



 HOW TO APPLY

 Please address applications (cover letter and resume) to Richard Haldane, Talent Acquisition Specialist, using the link provided. The deadline for submission is July 15, 2022.  Please note this is an internal posting only and should not be forwarded outside of the Vector Institute. An internal candidate has been identified who meets the qualifications of the role, however, we invite all internal applicants who are interested to apply for this exciting opportunity. All internal applicants will be contacted. (only include for internal applications, not for external postings)
 At the Vector Institute we are committed to driving excellence and leadership in Canada’s knowledge, creation, and use of AI to foster economic growth and improve the lives of Canadians. We strive for greater inclusion in the programs and culture that we build by welcoming and encouraging applications from all qualified candidates. This includes but is not limited to applicants who are indigenous, LGBT2Q+, racialized persons/visible minorities, women, and people with disabilities.  If you require an accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact hr@vectorinstitute.ai and we will happily work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
DSV - Global transport and logistics In 1976, ten independent hauliers joined forces and founded DSV in Denmark. Since then, DSV has evolved to become the world's 5th largest supplier of global solutions within transport and logistics. Today, we add value to our customers' entire supply chain by transporting, storing, packaging, re-packaging, processing and clearing all types of goods. We work every day from our many offices in more than 90 countries to ensure a steady supply of goods to production lines, outlets, stores and consumers all over the world. Our reach is global yet our presence is local and close to our customers. Read more at www.dsv.com 
Location: CAN - Milton, Yukon Court Job Posting Title: Pricing Analyst - 53147 Time Type: Full Time
 Purpose of the position Primary duty is to actively contribute in the Pricing Desk Department under the direction of the Pricing Desk Manager & Country Procurement. This position will interface between customers, our transportation vendors and internal operations regarding pricing.

 Key Tasks

Provide appropriate pricing for DSV products and services to customers by applying the department’s guidelines, performing profitability analysis, and suggesting optimal pricing.
Deliver informed decisions about the appropriate price points for various transport modes (AIR & SEA) based on the analysis of internal, external data and customer needs.
Respond to spot shipment rate requests and implement tariffs when applicable.
Serves as liaison between Sales, Clients and Operations for any questions regarding pricing.
Identify opportunities for improving pricing and profitability of existing accounts
Follows industry developments and competitor pricing strategies that may affect pricing structures, and provides tactical and strategic responses
Analyzes shipment volume and revenue to determine effectiveness and profitability of pricing strategies
Negotiate competitive pricing from transportation vendors on individual shipments or lanes as needed.




  OTHER DUTIES:
  

Creates and maintain client rates on Cargowise one.
Solves Autorating issues together with operations in Cargowise one
Identify opportunities for improving pricing and profitability of existing accounts
May provide functional guidance, advice and/or training to less-experienced pricing professionals.
Initiates profitability analysis and develops plans to increase profitability and maximize yield on specific accounts





  All staff:
  

Perform assigned to support DSV meets its objectives and targets regarding quality, health, safety and environment and follow all requirements as set out in the Quality Health Safety Environment policy.
It is the responsibility of all tasks staffs to ensure that their day to day activities embrace sustainability/Health and safety therefore reducing the impact upon the environment, supporting the communities we work in and reducing incidents in the workplace.




Due to the dynamic nature of our industry, your accountabilities and role may change.



  Function / Market & Industry Knowledge / Business Acumen / Process working
  

Advanced understanding in Ocean Freight & Airfreight
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office suite with emphasis on excel and PowerPoint
In-depth market knowledge (customers, competitors, suppliers, overall environment)
Ability to convert concepts and ideas into value-based customer facing solutions
Ready to take personal accountability for achieving individual and shared goals
Ability to set robust plans well in advance and to initiate action to move projects forward
Expertise and professionalism in customer contacts, understanding of customer requirements, analysis and resolution of problems and complaints
Willing to travel as required





  Skills & Competencies
   COMMUNICATION & PRESENTATION
  

Ability to influence and convince others in a way that results in acceptance and agreement
Ability to shape conversations to ensure focus and understanding
Effective listening
Willingness to engage in constructive confrontation
Ability to clearly and concisely present both written and/or oral information





  ACCOUNTIBLITY
  

Credibility
Assertiveness
Capable to make informed judgments and to generate practical, timely solutions
Ability to find pragmatic solutions by using decision making techniques
Willingness to involve stakeholders in decision making process, to get buy-in and to implement solutions
Supports organizational commitment to ISO 9001, ISO 45001 certification – Montreal location.





  CUSTOMER ORIENTATION
  

Readiness to continuously focus on identifying and meeting customer current and future needs
Readiness to provide alternatives and optimized solutions to the Customer
Ability to establish a successful long-term business partnership with internal and external customers





  COLLOBORATION AND INFLUENCE
  

Ability to work with different cultures and to manage cross functional interfaces
High priority for teamwork
Team player
Capable to build strong and long-term team relationships within and across functions and geographical boundaries and based on ethics and trust





  RESULT ORIENTATION
  

Ability to set robust plans well in advance and to initiate action to move projects forward
Planning & Organizing (Ability to prioritize, plan, assign & control)
Time management (monitoring performance against deadlines and milestones)





  PERSONAL EXCELLENCE
  

Integrity
Act as a Role Model for Group Values and fully adhere to the Code of Conduct
High energy and resilience
High commitment and positive attitude in the face of setbacks and obstacles
High stress level (Ability to work under pressure and deal with tight deadlines)
Be authentic, approachable, open and honest





  Educational background / Work experience
  

Post-Secondary studies in Supply Chain Management, International Trade or related fields
A minimum of 3-5 years international transportation industry experience
Relevant industry certifications considered an asset (i.e. CIFFA, APICS)





  Language Skills
  

Profiency in English
Additional languages considered an asset





  Computer Literacy
  

Advanced Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint
CRM (Customer Management Tool) proficiency an asset




DSV complies with the Canadian Employment Equity Act and welcomes diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities. DSV reserves the right to defer or close a vacancy at any time.
DSV – Global transport and logistics
DSV is one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. 75,000 employees in more than 90 countries work passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services – as part of the operation or in a variety of supporting roles. If you have drive and talent and enjoy responsibility, we’ll give you the support you need to explore your potential and forward your career.
Read more at www.dsv.com

Title: Business Analyst, Health & Dental Services
Description:
Job Description: 
 
 We are Canada Life



 Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
 




  You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
 

 


  Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
 


 Be your best at Canada Life.
 


 We are looking for a 
  Business Analyst, Health & Dental Services.



 This position is suited to an individual who has an enthusiasm for investigating, analyzing and solving problems.
 


 A Business Analyst provides claim solutions to Head Office, Benefit Payment Offices (BPO), Group Customer Contact Services (GCCS) and Field Offices.
 


 As a Business Analyst you will be developing and communicating solutions to a variety of units within Canada Life. The solutions and support you provide will be invaluable to our clients.
 


 What you will do



 Provide direction to Benefit Payment Offices (BPO), Group Customer Contact Services (GCCS) Offices and Head Office staff on complex claim processing problems.
 Establish and implement business or system enhancements, including documentation throughout project lifecycle, for the BPOs and Head Office staff.
 Provide business and technical support to Field Office staff on complex plan designs/complicated claims adjudication.
 Extract, analyze, perform calculations on claims data from internal and external sources; compile reports for BPO, other Head Office Departments, Field Offices/Consultants, Other Insurance Carriers; will involve large volumes of data from multiple sources in varying formats and degrees of complexity. Advanced excel and database knowledge would be an asset.



 What you will bring


 Business related post-secondary education or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 Knowledge of Health & Dental benefits would be a strong asset.
 Business Analysis certification with strengths in data analysis would be a definite asset.
 Advanced skills in Excel.
 Word, Visio, PowerPoint & Access knowledge would be a definite asset.
 Well developed analytical and problem solving abilities.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle changing priorities and fluctuating work loads.


 Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today



 We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!



 Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.



 We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee 
has the opportunity to
 reach their potential.



 Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Title: Credit Analyst
Description:
Be visionary
 


   At Teledyne FLIR, we have a simple but ambitious mission: to develop market-leading thermal and sensing technologies which enhance everyday life. From saving energy, to saving lives Teledyne FLIR is making a real difference in our world.
  
 Our products are used in a wide array of situations to rescue people in danger, detect criminals, conserve energy, navigate safely, provide security around the globe, and protect our environment.
 


   We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
 


 Job Description
 


 Job Summary:
 

   FLIR Integrated Imaging Solutions (IIS), a division of Teledyne, headquartered in the Greater Vancouver area, BC, addresses mainly 2 growing markets: Machine vision for the largest part of our activities, and People Flow Analytics.
 


   Regarding Machine Vision: we provide to machinery manufacturers or system integrators imaging products and solutions that are used for quality inspection, measurement, traceability, vision guided automation and robotics, as well as intelligent traffic systems. Regarding People Analytics: we are currently focused on Retail Analytics, and we provide imaging products and solutions that are used to measure retail customers traffic, customers queuing time, customers flow in the retail space; Essentially our People Analytics products help to replicate the equivalent of web analytics in the physical world.
 


   We are looking to find a Credit Analyst to support the FLIR IIS division, part of Teledyne’s Commercial Business Unit. Teledyne hires on passion and drive to succeed! The Credit Analyst position will be responsible for assisting in all phases of the Credit and Collections process. As the single-point owner of an Accounts Receivable portfolio, this position will partner with customers, key members of the Sales team and Customer Service organizations in support of the IIS’s financial objectives of profitable sales growth and meeting collection targets.
 


   This position will involve a variety of cross-functional projects that drive efficiencies and improve collections.
 


   Primary Duties & Responsibilities:
 

 Manage A/R within established customer credit limits
 Maximize sales and minimize bad debt on assigned customer portfolio
 Conduct annual credit reviews on large and existing customers
 Process credit applications, obtain credit reports and conduct bank and trade investigations
 Assess credit risk; analyze customer financial statements
 Recommend suitable credit limits for management approval
 Provide financial order management support to Sales, Customer Order Services and Repair departments to control credit exposure, effect timely payment, and minimize risk of customer disputes
 Approve and negotiate customer orders for shipment
 Meet cash collection targets
 Monitor and respond appropriately to changes in customer’s ability to pay
 Conduct detailed account reconciliations to resolve problems, chargebacks and/or disputes in a timely manner
 Experience with data analysis, problem-solving and solutions
 Maintain accurate electronic collection notes for each account
 Update Credit Manager for preparation of the monthly Significant Accounts Report
 Maintain Customer Credit Master file
 Provide customer service and develops relationships with internal/external customers
 Communicate Credit & Collection Department and company payment policies to customers and company personnel



   Job Qualifications:
 

 BS/BA degree in Accounting/Finance preferred
 Extremely proficient in Microsoft Office including Excel
 SAP experience strongly desired
 Knowledgeable with Letters of Credit
 Ability to work in high pressure, fast-paced environment
 Must have excellent professional, verbal and written skills
 Able to communicate effectively with all levels and areas of business and customers



   Eligible to be certified to examine, possess, and transfer items under the Canadian Controlled Goods Program and legally authorized to work in Canada
 


 Teledyne FLIR and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
 


   Teledyne FLIR is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: IAM Business/Data Analyst
Description:
Project Description


      Applying to the position, you may join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. Our client is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan to ensure long-term sustainability. The company invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and currently has offices in Toronto, London, Hong Kong, New York, São Paulo, Luxembourg and Mumbai.
       Client attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:
      

Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Being motivated every day by important social purpose and unshakable principles
A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
 If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here's an opportunity.
     




Responsibilities



Documenting the current state of IAM controls, processes, and technical capabilities across the organization, working closely with business, operation, service desk and cybersecurity.
Lead requirements gathering, analysis and documentation of IAM controls, processes, and technical capabilities, with close interactions with compliance, cybersecurity, operations, service management and the business groups.
Participate in defining future state IAM processes and controls, including areas such as Access Certifications, Access Lifecycle Management, Access Request Management and Access Management.
Collaborating with the technical team to ensure alignment between requirements and design.
Participate in defining the future state RBAC framework, including Role mining and engineering, SoD rules, and Role maintenance.
Lead access and entitlement analysis, Role mining and engineering, and SoD rules creation activities in collaboration with business.
Lead application on-boarding prioritization exercise, including identifying and categorizing applications, credentials, entitlements, risk, user populations and usage.
Identifying data issues with application entitlements and credentials, and work with appropriate resources to resolve them.
Collaborating with QA team in developing test plans and supporting the business through execution of user acceptance test cases.
Collaborating with security operations team in developing the target operating model. 




Skills

Must have


Experience delivering 2 or more IAM implementations as Business Analyst/Data Analyst.
Solid understanding of Identity Governance and Administration ("IGA") concepts, such as Access Lifecycle Management, Access Request Management, Access Fulfillment, Password Management and Privileged Access Management.
Good grasp of operational, regulatory, and other risks related the area of IAM.
Advanced analytical skills, specifically data analysis.
Ability to work 9am-5pm Eastern time zone.
Good written and verbal communication skills, presentation, and interpersonal skills. 


Nice to have


Experience in SailPoint IdentityNow implementation project.
Experience in delivering IAM projects in financial institutions.
Located in Canada or the US.
Experience in integration of Workday and ServiceNow with IAM platform.
CISSP. 






Languages

English: B2 Upper Intermediate


Seniority

Senior


Relocation package

If needed, we can help you with relocation process.




Vacancy Specialization 

Business Analysis


Ref Number

VR-78368

Title: Business & Marketing Analyst
Description:
Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.
 


 Marketing, Web Operations is responsible for managing the delivery of the Cision marketing technical roadmap in conjunction with the UX team. The team contributes to the Cision marketing strategy, executing on the feature backlog and coordinating releases.
 

 


   The Business Analyst, Marketing Web Operations facilitates the solicitation of business requirements for the Marketing initiatives, capturing and translating business requirements into tangible specifications, use cases, and other system design artifacts. The role also coordinates analysis and testing activities with other Cision technology groups and third party suppliers. The Business Analyst manages the agile team working in sprints on new projects, features and bug fixes. The Business Analysts ensures changes are implemented to the expectation of the business on audience websites. The Business Analyst also oversees key initiatives, e.g. Search Engine Optimization (SEO), of websites in conjunction with the larger Marketing team. The WebOps team is responsible for user acceptance, representing internal and external users, as well as implementation of new functionality.
 


 #LI-KR1
 

   #LI-Remote
 
 Essential Duties:

 Manage roadmap and sprints for marketing initiatives, establishing timelines and prioritizations.
 Collaborates with product stakeholders to translate business requirements, breaking them down into actionable tasks, creating user stories with acceptance criteria for the design team to conceptualize and the development team to implement.
 Oversees all development & testing
 Seek new opportunities for enhancement of the existing web properties, integration with existing services, and expansion into relevant related fields.
 Create monthly reports on the performance of the services. Benchmark, analyze, report on and make recommendations for the improvement and growth of the WebOps team.
 Manage external resources and vendors to support and achieve department goals. Identify, allocate, and manage resources to meet timely completion of specific project tasks.
 Lead and run analysis planning sessions with the team and product stakeholders. Directs the policies/procedures for business analysis and requirements gathering.
 Apply creative thinking to identify how technology can be applied to solve real business problems and achieve tangible business goals.
 Assist in development and/or review of test plans and scenarios which are traceable to original requirements, to ensure successful delivery.
 Analyze and solve day-to-day issues that occur within existing web properties, escalating where necessary.
 Lead by example; establishes clear expectations; sets direction and priorities; ensures that work levels are balanced among all staff; resolves internal staff issues in a timely manner; keeps staff informed of all appropriate information; builds effective team; delegates at appropriate level.
 Seeks opportunities to improve team efficiency and reduce expenses by streamlining operations.
 Handles other initiatives as necessary

 Qualifications

 Minimum of five years’ experience with application development in a web first marketing role.
 Bachelor’s degree; Degree in Computer sciences or equivalent formal training.
 Experienced leading requirements gathering.
 Fluency with the current and next generation of website and mobile functionality and user behavior; in-depth knowledge of current Internet technology, with a focus on online content publishing and analytics
 Prior experience with the Agile development process in previous roles.
 Experience planning, “road-mapping,” and managing complex processes and projects
 Able to interact at all levels, up to and including CEO, within the organization; to communicate effectively both orally and in writing to diverse audiences; to balance technical and business issues as well as communicate appropriately with both technical and business experts
 Ability to think ahead, anticipating problems and risks.
 Experienced with web-based projects; working with offshore teams
 Rapid self-starting capability and experience in team management; able to work unsupervised and under supervision asking questions when necessary
 Able to switch between multiple projects as the needs of the business dictate; capacity to manage multiple priorities; able to work under pressure
 Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills
 Proven track record of yielding significant increases in website traffic, user engagement, and brand awareness
 Creative, persuasive, and strategic thinker

 Additional responsibilities

 Keen to learn and develop new skills.
 Demonstrate leadership and business competencies that include: conflict/issue resolution, analytical and organizational skills, multi-tasking, relationship building, and effective communications
 Adheres to a high personal standard of quality, organization and work commitment.

 Other qualifications and requirements

 To perform the job successfully, an individual must demonstrate the following knowledge skills and abilities:



 Knowledge of web/internet protocols (HTTP,FTP), technologies & languages.(Java/J2EE, .NET,XML) and RDBMS concepts(ER diagrams etc), JIRA, Google Search Console, Adobe Experience Manager, Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
 Superior organizational and planning skills are essential since several major projects occur concurrently.
 Attention to detail and accuracy
 Written communication skills
 Verbal communication skills
 Interpersonal skills
 Leadership skills
 Strategic thinking
 Self-starter
 Problem solving skills
 Ability to adapt to change and balance competing demands


   As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire, a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.
 



   Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com.
 



   Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.
 



   Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.
