Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
 


   Job Description
 


   SS&C Technologies Holdings, Inc. is a global provider of financial services software and software-enabled services. Founded in 1986, SS&C has built the most comprehensive powerhouse of software technology in the financial services industry – technology that complements our unrivaled expertise and professionalism in fund administration, insurance and pension funds, and asset and wealth management accounting and operations. Named by Forbes as one of America’s best midsize employers, SS&C has more than 20,000 employees and 15,000 clients worldwide, and is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut, with offices throughout North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, and Australia.
 


   We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Operations Analyst to join the SS&C Algorithmics team. SS&C Algorithmics has more than 200 Clients globally; operates in 25 countries and has a team of people who design, develop, sell and support risk analytics solutions for financial institutions. SS&C Algorithmics is headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. Candidates must be in commuting distance to the office and be willing to work in the office at least 2-3 days a week.
 


   Primary Responsibilities:
 

   Provide support to the a global team of senior managers:
 

 Provide support for Algo Sales & Marketing events and communications
 Maintain accurate Client contact lists for both active clients and organizational stakeholders in the Client
 Support the attendance of clients at sponsored events by preparing materials; engaging in out reach activities
 Support events to assist in logistics both prior and during
 Provide support for general business operations, reporting and data analytics as it relates to Finance, HR, IT and Facilities
 Support the Client Success team in the development of testimonials, reference checks, out reach for surveys, client appreciation activities
 Support the creation of corporate presentations – for All Hands/TownHalls, special presentations to clients, staff or other audiences
 Support the GM in presentation planning and materials, scheduling, travel arrangements and client outreach



   Desired Qualifications:
 

 Exceptional attention to detail
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills
 Strong technical skills and proficient with Microsoft Tools (Office, Outlook, Teams)
 Strong problem-solving skills and tactical management skills
 Excellent organization and planning skills
 Has a customer focused mindset
 Ability to learn quickly and be agile - pivot on priorities where required and perform well under pressure and re-prioritize tasks as needed
 Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion
 Minimum 3 years of experience supporting senior management/executive-level staff
 Minimum 3 years of experience working in a management support function either in Finance, Human Resources, Sales or Services Operations
 Experience supporting a global team highly preferred



   Education:
 

   University Degree in Bachelor of Arts or Business Administration
 


   Why SS&C?
 


   Working at SS&C is balanced and fair – especially in challenging times. We offer flexible work schedules, time off, and so much more to keep you healthy, safe, and productive. SS&C offers:
 


 Hybrid Schedule featuring 4-6 days in the office monthly combined with working from home
 Competitive base salary plus EXCELLENT benefits (including medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD and more)!
 RRSP Matching Program
 Global Flexible Time Off Policy (personal/vacation time)
 Sick Leave Policy
 Eligible for an annual performance-based bonus program
 Tuition Reimbursement up to 70% and Professional Development up to 100%
 Candidate Referral Program
 Business Casual dress code (includes jeans)



   SS&C Technologies Canada Corp. fosters a positive, equitable and progressive workforce and is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. We will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process. If you require any accommodation during the application and hiring process, please contact: tacanada@sscinc.com
 


   To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at 
  
   www.ssctech.com/careers
  .No phone calls or email applications please. We thank all candidates for their interest, but only those under consideration will be contacted.
 

   #LI-LM1
 


   Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

Title: CPFR Analyst
Description:
About Us



The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!





Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration



We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.







General information 




All posting locations: Don Mills, Ontario, Canada 
Job Function: 01 - Sales 
Department: 01 - 06 - Sales Planning & Support 
Date Published: 08-Jul-2022 
Job Type: Regular 








Description & Requirements 



Role Overview
 This is a role for someone who craves a global challenge balanced by the desire to be accountable for delivering against the model in the largest business unit for Kraft Heinz. It is both a strategic and a tactical position. Those that do not want to get their hands dirty or build out a function against a blank slate without buying pre-packaged solutions should not apply. Focuses on data analysis that delivers supply chain business results- identifies and actions inefficiencies- builds relationships with customers and internal stakeholders- and monitors the movement of products through the supply chain cycle in both internal and customer’s processes.

 Responsibilities

 Deliver key customer’s and internal supply chain targets 
Conducts mega-data analysis using both internal and customer data to identify and action inefficiencies 
Drive out unnecessary costs- while creating efficiencies and process improvements 
Strategically manage key orders and delivery performance to resolve potential production delays/problems at item-level and trouble-shoot either no shows or past due orders to maximize service and minimize fines
 Prepares standardized and/or ad hoc reports to support business analysis 
Provides customers with order status reports and coordinates ship method 
Manage master data with customer’s item master and order master
 Conduct analyses on forecast/order to bring insights to improve forecast accuracy (both internal and external)
 Analyst level / Customer Collaboration on Supply Chain Systems Settings 

 Requirements

 Bachelor’s degree 
At least 3 years’ experience in related field
 Proficient Microsoft Office (Word- Excel- Access- and PowerPoint)
 Willingness to travel and relocate in a nationwide setting
 Ability to be comfortable in a face paced- stressful environment 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 Preferred understanding of SAP 
Technologically savvy (preferred if adept at Tableau Prep- SQL- Alteryx or Python- etc.)
 Keen analytics
 Results oriented and detail-oriented
 Strong problem-solving skills
 Strong communication/facilitation skills and good negotiation skills
 Statistical modelling or forecasting experience not necessary but preferred





Equal Opportunity Employer–minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity

Title: Information Technology Business Analyst
Description:
At Vintri, we’re doing something really special: making data trustworthy and accessible for everyone.We are on a mission to create a safer world by transforming the way energy companies access, track, and verify their asset data. Through the development of our materials-tracking technology, we help our clients create a single source of truth across their entire supply chain, enabling better decision-making and reducing risk.
It’s not an easy mission.
But we’re up for the challenge. Because at Vintri we don’t shy away from big, complex problems. We chase them. With an insatiable hunger and curiosity that can’t be fed by the status quo. We are a diverse team of collaborators and disruptors, continuously getting better by learning from each other (and our clients) as we grow into one of the leading technology companies in North America.
And we have a lot of fun along the way.
Vintri is currently searching for an experienced Information Technology Business Analyst who can easily move between business analysis, process engineering, and project reporting.
As the IT-BA you will foster links between internal and external stakeholders and the development team – interpreting business requirements, analyzing the design of technical systems and business models, utilizing data for key decisions, and recommending IT solutions with clear reasoning.
An analytical thinker with strong interpersonal skills, you will engage with our team and clients to understand and respond to their application needs in rapidly changing business environments. You are independently capable of managing competing priorities, can solve conceptual problems with strong analytics, and are dedicated to delivering the best results.
The ITBA role may be ideal for you if: You have always been driven by a desire to make things better. And faster. And easier. You are the go-to person who can break down complex ideas into digestible pieces without losing anyone at the table. You are passionate about new technologies, not only learning about them but seeing their potential impact for the world. You get “big data.” You can quickly see information relationships, identify gaps, and communicate them with ease. Modeling data structures is second nature. You’re also a wizard at Excel. You are wildly curious, wanting to know everything about everything, and digging deeper to understand the why. You have an analytical mindset with a healthy dose of creativity, are in search of an exciting challenge where no two days are the same, and you want to join a strong team where you can grow and make a difference.
What you’ll do

Liaise between internal and external stakeholders and the development team
Understand and identify strategic business requirements
Lead discovery sessions and translate findings into meaningful feedback
Model data structures
Analyze large sets of data to make key decisions
Present complex ideas in easy-to-understand ways and talk to a wide variety of stakeholders with all levels of knowledge
Create project reports
Document workflows and business processes
Enhance the quality of IT products and services
Utilize IT data for business insights
Identify opportunities for process improvements
Document best practices and create/revise training materials

What you'll need to succeed

Minimum 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst
Understanding of Information Technologies
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Analytical mindset
Overwhelming curiosity
Exceptional interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail
A passion for technologies and how they can positively impact the world

Nice to have experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Physics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other degrees requiring quantitative research skills
Software and tool experience including PowerBI, Tableau, R, Python, programming languages
Knowledge in any of the following domains: energy, transportation, shop management, IT tool development, enterprise resource planning
Involvement with successful software implementations
Training and coaching experience

To be considered for the position you must: 

Submit a cover letter and professional resume
Complete the Indeed ‘Attention to Detail Assessment’

Application deadline: July 19, 2022 or until a suitable candidate is hired
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Location: This role is eligible for our hybrid working model – partially remote and partially in our Calgary office. Employees have the option to choose a flexible daily schedule that works best for them.
We thank all applicants, but only those that have completed the application as requested and are being considered for an interview will be contacted. We are pleased to partner with VIMY HR in this search.
Why Vintri Technologies?
We are Eager

We are empowered to own our work and take initiative to make our company better
We look for ways to constantly improve, get better, and seek feedback

We are Customer-Centric

We are committed to blowing our customers away
We focus on what is important to our customers, because that is important to our business

We are Stronger, Together

We Win together
We Lose together
We Learn together

We Get Better

We are always learning and create ways to help others learn too
We are innovative and strive for continuous improvement. We are constantly seeking personal and professional growth
We find ways to disrupt

We have Fun!

We don’t take ourselves too seriously and we have fun together
We celebrate the people around us

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $70,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
On-site gym
Paid time off
Wellness program

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:Our employees are vaccinated (which is a requirement for employment) and mindful of the ongoing pandemic. We work in a newly-renovated building and have stand-alone HEPA filters in our workspace. We also work from home 2 days per week to reduce exposure.
Ability to commute/relocate:

Calgary, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

Business analysis: 4 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-07-19

Title: Quality Assurance Analyst, Business Acceptance - Canadian Business Banking
Description:
Requisition ID: 156781  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Quality Assurance Analyst (QA Analyst) – Canadian Business Banking

 Purpose

 Reporting to the Manager, Business Acceptance, the QA Analyst is responsible for the accuracy and integrity of the client due diligence process (KYC) including the review of the CPI and all other associated/relevant documentation for new and existing customers at onboarding and client refresh.
 The Quality Assurance Analyst operates independently day-to-day within assigned authorities/limits and uses sound judgment in the interpretation of data and instructions, and escalates issues with recommendations as required.
  This role contributes to the overall success of Canadian Business Banking’s adherence to Client Due Diligence (CDD), KYC standards and document review in Canadian Business Banking ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives; ensures all activities conducted follow governing regulations, enterprise policies and business procedures.
 Accountabilities:

Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.



 Provide an excellent collaboration experience by:

 o Taking responsibility for reviewing CPI documentation, thoroughly, promptly and accurately. o Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment. o Completing KYC refresh documents in line with established processes and procedures o Advising Relationship Managers of information gaps and requesting additional information as required. o Keeping KYC/AML knowledge current. o Maintaining a thorough knowledge of the KYC and CPI documentation requirements. o Demonstrating professionalism and commitment to adhering to established SLAs and where not possible, develop plan for communication to partners and advise/consult with Manager as appropriate; o Maintaining a good understanding of the Commercial Banking business unit’s products and services. o Actively participate in team huddles and initiatives o Escalating issues and/or concerns immediately to your supervisor for corrective action in a timely manner.


 Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all CPI and KYC/AML documentation, data, and information by:

 o Reviewing all documentation received for accuracy and thoroughness of completion by Relationship Managers in line with regulatory requirements and established procedures o Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Standards , and the Guidelines for Business Conduct o Identifying higher-risk industries/individuals (e.g., PEPs, Sanctions etc.) during new Client Onboardings, Refreshes or Remediations and escalating through the proper channels when necessary. o Working with Relationship Managers, Business Service Centres (BSC)and the necessary Bank partners in order to gather the necessary information as required. o Working closely with the Canadian Banking AML Team to complete KYC/AML remediations of existing commercial portfolios, if required within established timelines. o Maintaining an accurate log of information gaps for training purposes and establishing best practices; o Escalating complex or non-standard structures to your manager as required. o Reviewing name screening alerts in Fircosoft for Commercial Business Units that are under ACRM Lite process and dispositioning the alerts promptly and accurately.


 Ensuring strict adherence to Bank security and control procedures for customer information, data, access to systems and documents by:

 o Adhering to regulatory activities and guidelines including Privacy, Anti Money Laundering/Anti-Terrorist Financing and Know Your Customer policies o Following department guidelines for the storage, access, and delivery of client/Bank documents o Ensuring authentication of clients prior to the release of information o Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. o Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct, and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk. o Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
 Education / Experience / Other Information:


 Working knowledge of the Bank’s products and services
Works very well within a team environment, ability to work independently when necessary
Exceptional organization skills
High levels of accuracy and thoroughness to review and perfect documents
Ability to effectively and concisely communicate issues and concerns related to issues/challenges identified
Experience in back-office production, branch environment or BSC environment an asset
Ability to work non-standard hours as required
Ability to travel domestically if required


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Sr. Data Warehouse and BI Specialist
Description:
Job Description: Sr. Data Warehouse and BI Specialist MyHealth Centre
 Reporting to: IT Manager
 The Sr Data Warehouse and BI Specialist is a critical role in the MyHealth technology framework, and a senior member of the IT services team. In this role, you are primarily accountable for the MyHealth Centre SQL server data warehouse, as well as all business intelligence (BI) reports, dashboards, and other analytic products. In this capacity, the Sr Data Warehouse and BI Specialist will be fully accountable for the development, testing, implementation, and maintenance of all SQL server enterprise data warehouse components (including Fact and Dimension Tables, ETL /SSIS, Analytic Cubes/SSAS), any all Microsoft or other BI products (Power BI/SSRS) utilized within MyHealth Centre.


 Responsibilities: 


Review and document the current SQL Server Data Warehouse and BI Architecture within MyHealth Centre, including the data warehouse table structures, data models, ETL (SSIS), and all current BI reporting products.
Work with the Director, IT Services, and the User Experience Lead, to identify and prioritize future data warehouse and BI requirements.
Work with the Director, IT Services, and the User Experience Lead, to define and design any future state enterprise data warehouse and BI architecture products.
Interpret and analyze source system data to determine SSIS design (including identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets).
Prepare high-level data warehouse design documents (data flow diagrams and data models), and ETL mapping specifications.
Architect SQL server database structures and objects, fine tune SQL queries for performance and monitor latencies during batch processes.
Design and develop all Fact and Dimension Tables (SQL Server Enterprise).
Design and develop Analysis Services Cubes (SSAS).
Design and develop all ETL to extract source data and load the Data Warehouse Tables, and Cubes (SSIS).
Prepare manual and automated test scripts to test SSIS, SSAS, and Data Loading.
Design End User Reports and Dashboards (Power BI, SSRS or other OLAP Reporting Tools)
Troubleshoot and fix issues in all aspects of data warehouse and BI.
Determine methods to evolve and optimize data warehouse processes.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and collaborate with management to prioritize business and information needs, and support complex analytics.
Establish and maintain Master Data Library and work with Data Stewards to ensure conformance to Master Data Management Standards.




 Qualifications, Experience & Requirements: 


5-8 years as SQL Programmer with hands-on experience in Microsoft BI/SQL Server Enterprise stack (2008-2016, TSQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI)
5+ years hands-on development of data warehouse solutions in a SQL Server Enterprise (2008-2016) environment (SQL Server Mgmt. Studio, Visual Studio, etc)
5+ years hands-on experience developing ETL using SQL Server Integration Services (with proven ability to write, tune and debug T-SQL, including tables, indexes, views, stored procedures, functions and triggers)
5+ years hands-on experience developing cubes using SQL Server Analysis Services
5+ years hands-on experience developing OLAP components (including dashboards and reports) using SSRS, Power BI and/or other OLAP Tools
Strong data warehouse design and physical data modeling skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to work under continual deadline constraints.
Ability to quickly troubleshoot issues and work on multiple tasks in parallel.
Excellent coding and debugging skills.




 Personal: 


Have a cheerful, positive attitude and the ability to work effectively with others as well as the ability to work independently. Provide the best possible care for the patient and treat each one with respect, dignity and kindness.

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
Looking for a new challenge? Consider Trufla for your next career.
- Do You see opportunities in problems?- Do You always question the status quo?- Are You passionate about problem-solving and troubleshooting?- Do You like to bring innovative solutions through technology?- Do You like to deliver world-class quality software?
The insurance industry is one of the oldest and biggest industries in the world. In some shape or form, insurance is embedded in all our daily activities. The site that you are currently reading this job posting from has insurance. The server hosting this site has insurance as well.
You may be asking yourself: I am a Senior Business Data Analyst, why does this matter to me?
Because insurance extends to every possible industry on Earth, the nature of insurance products became very complex; hence the compounded layers in the day-to-day operations to sell and manage insurance products. Here at Trufla, we are on a mission to redefine how insurance should be distributed and serviced. We understand that this is not an easy task, and it requires us to push the boundaries of software engineering. That is why we are looking for talented Senior Business Data Analyst's - like you - who thrive through challenges and excel in discovering creative solutions.
What is it like to work at Trufla?
You will be part of a diversified family that has talented people across the globe driven by the same purpose. Our team is excited to face any obstacle that comes our way, and we take on hardships with a smile. We practice the agile mindset, and believe it’s better to get something done than wait for it to be “perfect”. Learning from our mistakes and putting our best work forward are values we live by every day.
You will be an integral part of what we build, but most importantly, we will ask for your input on how we build it. We value everyone’s opinions and encourage open communication. Trufla is always growing, which means there is plenty of opportunity for career growth. We promote education, collaboration, and monthly check-ins to make sure you are on the right track.
Senior Business Data Analyst
About You
As a Senior Business Data Analyst you are familiar with the business intelligence and visualization workflow as well as statistical analysis principles. Your attention to detail and drive to create informative dashboards and reports can be relentless. You understand that in your position you must stand at the center between multiple parties who hold different vocabularies and priorities and become a data-expert and translator. You have tremendous patience and can work with people to help them communicate their own requirements and queries clearly. You have both the skills and knowledge required to mentor other data analysts. As a Senior Business Data Analyst you are flexible in how you communicate ideas – you are comfortable crafting insights into any form your customers and team require in order to understand the concepts and problems. You use one-on-one conversation, conference calls, presentations, meetings, spreadsheets, diagrams, flowcharts, email or complex documents in order to collect and express ideas in the manner your audience prefers. Because of your flexible communication style, you are familiar with various popular applications and business intelligence tools which are commonly used in corporate environments. You are extremely well organized and can balance multiple tasks and competing priorities.
RESPONSIBILITIES
- Translate business requirements and queries into actionable insights- Develop business intelligence dashboards and reports for both internal and external stakeholders- Work and communicate effectively with various technical (data science, software engineering, etc), and non-technical (leadership, account and project management) teams- Make business decisions independently and execute on deliverables in a self-reliant manner- Lead and mentor Junior/Intermediate Data Analysts
QUALIFICATIONS
- 3+ years experience providing professional business and data analysis- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business field, preferably business analytics, economics, actuarial science, statistics, or engineering (MBA / graduate degree preferred)- Strong statistical foundation- Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication / presentation skills- Thorough knowledge of data visualization software (Tableau preferred)- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail- Experienced with SQL and other querying languages- Comfortable with Python- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well both independently and in a team environment with stakeholders at all levels of the organization- Ability to handle multiple priorities and manage deliverables on tight timeframes- Experience leading and mentoring others- Working knowledge of the insurance industry would be a plus- Automation abilities for multi-tenant analytics and understanding of ETL / data engineering processes would be a plus
VALUES & COMPETENCES
- Positive attitude and enthusiasm for employee training and development- Flexible and adaptable with proven problem solving ability- High degree of professionalism and integrity- Demonstrated accountability and reliability in the quality and timeliness of work- Ability to work well within a team and independently- Critical thinker with strong attention to details
Do you think we match? Apply Now!
If you have what it takes, apply to the job through the "Apply Now" button above.
*After applying, complete your application by taking the required assessment below:
Take Assessment HERE
Trufla Technology is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Business Process Analyst
Description:
About the City of Hamilton
 Contribute to the City of Hamilton, one of Canada’s largest cities - home to a diverse and strong economy, an active and inclusive community, a robust cultural and dining scene, hundreds of kilometres of hiking trails and natural beauty just minutes from the downtown core, and so much more. Join our diverse team of talented and ambitious staff who embody our values of sensational service, courageous change, steadfast integrity, collective ownership and being engaged empowered employees. Help us achieve our vision of being the best place to raise a child and age successfully. #BeTheReason




JOB POSTING










JOB ID #: 19175
 Senir Business Process Analyst Corporate Services Information Technology 55 York Blvd.
 NUMBER OF VACANCIES: 1 Full-Time Regular
 UNION/NON-UNION: Non Union Management Professional
 HOURS Of WORK: 35.00 per week

       GRADE: 6
       SALARY/HOUR: $50.654 - $59.242 per hour
      

Note: See appropriate Collective Agreement or the Non Union Salary Range for details.


 Job Description ID #: #6389
 Vaccine Verification – As a condition of employment you are required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated or provide proof of valid exemption satisfactory to the employer prior to your start date. You must acknowledge and agree to comply with any future vaccine policy requirements as an ongoing condition of employment at the City of Hamilton.









SUMMARY OF DUTIES
 Reporting to the Supervisor, Strategy and Architecture, the Senior Business Process Analyst’s role is to analyze and devise complex business process requirements for all IT-related business and operations systems critical to core organizational functions. This includes researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process knowledge, and systems requirements. The Senior Business Process Analyst will also assist the Business Architect in mentoring other Business Process Analysts so as to contribute to the development of business analytics capabilities within the Information Technology Division. 
The Senior Business Process Analyst is also responsible for proactively generating and compiling reports based on his or her findings, complete with recommended improvements to, or new requirements for business processes and operational procedures. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments and to assist in implementing new computer systems.
 The Senior Business Process Analyst leads the process and requirements definition on medium and large complexity projects, requiring expert-level knowledge or insight on multiple business and/or functional areas. The Senior Business Process Analyst may be assigned on one or more projects as a project team member and/or a project lead, and provides coaching to other business, information and database analysts.
 GENERAL DUTIES
 Identifies process and business requirements through the effective use of interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis. 
Proactively communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts such as: business process flows, business requirements documentation, use cases and interface designs
 Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. 
Applies approved methodologies, business experience and understanding of municipal context in conducting requirements definition and management systems analysis.
 Analyzes and translates/interprets customer business needs into application and operational requirements. 
Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.
 Drives and challenges business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans to implement re-engineered business processes
 Develops requirements specifications according to standard templates, using plain language. 
Collaborates and participates with the Systems Analyst and business owners in the planning and execution of system and user acceptance testing. Includes development of test plans, cases and tracking of defects.
 Researches, compiles and synthesizes information with regard to business analysis and process design/redesign methods, staying current on emerging technologies and analysis techniques.
 Shares information regarding modern methodologies for business analysis and process design/redesign with the Business Architect and with other Business Process Analysts, and advise customers (internal and external) regarding appropriate methods to use depending on the need.
 May be assigned to lead an initiative or small project requiring the individual to provide guidance to other IS resources, and to collaborate with staff from Project Services and to report status/progress/issues up through other IT management staff.
 May be assigned to an initiative or project requiring the individual to take direction from other IT Unit Manager and/or Project Manager.
 Works in accordance with the provisions of applicable health and safety legislation and all City of Hamilton corporate and departmental policies and procedures related to occupational health and safety.
 Performs other duties as assigned, which are directly related to the major responsibilities of the job. 
QUALIFICATIONS
 University Degree or College Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related discipline.
 Extensive IT experience, considerable experience in business analysis and process design and experience in the delivery of IT initiatives.
 Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Certification, or related / relevant work experience.
 Understanding of business concepts in a Municipal environment.
 Demonstrated knowledge of application development lifecycles and supporting practices.
 Demonstrated knowledge of application quality assurance best practices and methodologies.
 Demonstrated experience documenting requirements utilizing Use Cases.
 Knowledge of ITIL or related SDLC concepts.
 Experience defining strategic business and IT requirements.
 Demonstrated leadership and project management skills. 
Demonstrated ability to guide and manage a team which may include staff from other IT units.
 Demonstrated ability to use MS Office productivity tools (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project) to create and maintain project documents.
 Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. 
Strong leadership skills.
 Ability to make sound and logical judgments.
 Demonstrated ability to lead and apply structured business analysis methodologies.
 Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.

Title: Analyst Global Inventory Management
Description:
At BRP, we create new ways to move people, where experience is measured in emotion rather than distance. All over the world, our products, successes and aspirations reflect the exceptional expertise of our people. Want to be part of the adventure? 

 We are looking for a Global Inventory Management Analyst reporting to the Global Inventory and Deployment Manager to help us meet our business needs through sound inventory management. In this role, you will have a major impact in supporting the growth of the organization by optimizing our procurement, inventory and deployment policies for BRP's parts and accessories distribution centers. 

 ADVANCE YOUR CAREER 

 By working at BRP, you will develop within an environment at the cutting edge of technology and will be able to apply your analytical mind to complex, large-scale projects. You will be part of an experienced team and will have access to numerous training opportunities to keep your skills up to date. 


YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:
 Perform data analysis to support operational and strategic decisions. 

 Define and improve processes/tools to support inventory management and deployment policies with a view to continuous improvement. 

 Collaborate with various positions to ensure proper management of inventory levels. 

 Define and produce key performance indicators and use them to implement concrete action plans. 

 Help transform the department, including by contributing to the implementation of the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. 

 TO THRIVE IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL NEED TO HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES: 

 2 years’ experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or inventory management role 

 Background in supply chain, engineering or related field. 

 Advanced knowledge of Excel and intermediate knowledge of Power BI (or other data visualization tool) 

 Proficient written and oral communication (in French and English) 

 Positive attitude and strong analytical mind. 

 Is this you? We look forward to receiving your application! 


WE CAN OFFER YOU:
 A very competitive salary 

 An annual bonus 

 A generous allowance of paid leave 

 An annual contribution to a pension plan 

 A group insurance plan fully covered by BRP 

 Significant discounts on our products 

 A personalized career progression plan 

 Access to an online training platform 

 Team building activities 

 Access to a gym 

 WELCOME TO BRP 

 We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours. 

 #LI-GB2

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
The Group:
   Fueling the technologies that drive our products and support our company's infrastructure, the Technology team consists of talented developers, network architects, and IT experts who help make technology one of Morningstar's core strengths. Though our technologists represent a range of skills and knowledge bases, they all view technology as a craft and care deeply about creating positive user experiences. From Agile methodologies to mobile applications to software as a service (SaaS) delivered from our private cloud, we push technology's boundaries to build scalable, elegant solutions that help investors reach their financial goals.
 





 The Role:
       In this role, you will support the development of new features and functionalities of data collection solutions. The data technology business analyst will be responsible for drafting functional specifications for features based on requirements gathering sessions involving business teams. An ideal candidate understands business goals but must also have a firm grasp on technical architecture in order to drive implementation forward. The candidate must be committed to delivering functionality from inception to release in the live service. Close coordination with business teams is expected. Exposure and experience in large-scale system implementation is a big plus. This position will be based in our Toronto office.
      
 Responsibilities
     

 Gather and manage scope, requirements, and overall delivery of features
 Collaborate with business teams to understand requirements for new functionalities
 Cultivate functional backlog with team leads to set priorities and prepare for development
 Work closely with developers to ensure that new functionality is delivered to specification
 Facilitate collaboration between the product, API, and data development teams to ensure integration issues are resolved swiftly
 Perform initial investigation and triage of defects related to relevant features or content
 Where appropriate, present solution options to functional and technical leads to determine the best implementation approach for new functionality or bug fixes


 Requirements
     

 5+ years of experience as a business analyst focused on technical implementations
 Familiarity with relational databases and knowledge in SQL
 Experience with cloud-based solutions is a plus
 Knowledge of software delivery methodologies, specifically Agile
 Excellent communication skills and experience owning solution delivery
 Experience working with multiple teams and managing coordination of distributed development
 Experience in a data-oriented environment and knowledge of data manipulation patterns
 Financial or accounting industry knowledge very helpful
 A bachelor's degree is required

Title: CRM & Loyalty Zone Data Analyst - L'Oreal Information Technology
Description:
Title: Loyalty Zone Delivery Data Analyst 


Function: Information Technology 


Location: Montreal 

 Data & CRM Team - Data Analyst 

 This position is part of Digital IT Zone delivery Team and will support the evolution of our data ecosystem on the O+O experience with focus in Data. The goal of this role is hybrid as we are expecting to build the foundation and clear understanding of our data ecosystem but at the same time to look for the application of business intelligence concepts or machine learning models in the future. Understand business is key as will oversee interpreting data insights and effectively communicating their findings with stakeholders from projects. 

 Responsibilities 

 Conduct Data analyses, generates insights and influence stakeholders. 
Data governance foundation, work with the different stakeholders to master the different dimensions of Data (Ownership, Standardization, Quality, Accessibility and security & Compliance). 
Identify right data sources and use the data to identify possible challenges to analyze them for decision making. 
Map use cases priorities and work in the categorization of them to prioritize the top high financial projects. 
Support IT teams, Data Country Leads, BRM at country/zone level and all external partners to manage data project and secure the right demand management process. 
Work closely with the Zone Digital IT in NYC to leverage their expertise and share best practices and understand our Data & Analytics ecosystem. 
Ensures respect of master data generation process to provide high quality data to the rest of the organization. 
As the team is split in different physical area, ensure to support all the countries that are part of our coverage. 

 Skills and Qualifications 

 5 yrs+ experience in data and analytics from an IT perspective. 
Excellent knowledge of analytics at large 
Capacity to understand business, ask the right questions, and be understandable by non tech/non data savvy stakeholders – Empathy is key. 
Capacity to think on the strategic layer but also on the execution one 
Experience working with Agile-driven projects & teams 
Capacity to think out of the box, data driven with good communication and project management skills 
Being able to work under pressure and on several projects in parallel. 
Demonstrates at least a basic understanding of compliance and data privacy laws. 
Programming languages (SQL, Python, R, etc) 
English, speaking and written is a must. Spanish, Portuguese & French is a plus. 
Position based in Montréal or Mexico City.

Title: Business Intelligence Professional
Description:
Business Intelligence Professional


Job ID : 5917 Category : Finance Brand : Definity Regular/Temporary : Regular Fulltime/Parttime : Full Time Location : Vancouver, Canada









Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
 Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
 Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
 Starting in September, Definity employees move to a hybrid work model so we can collaborate, build mentoring relationships, and solve complex or cross-functional business opportunities together. Our teams work in whichever environment best supports what they're working on and who they're working with. We're actively reinventing our offices as welcoming workspaces that optimize collaboration and empower leaders to use our space to strengthen team dynamics. Our tools and processes seamlessly connect employees from multiple locations, and our culture encourages respectful engagement and flexibility. Leaders work with their teams to determine the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their team, cross-functional engagement, responsibilities and timelines, plus those of our customers, our broker partners, and the company culture.

Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, the Business Intelligence Professional will work with like-minded professionals and our business partners to generate strategic insights in smarter and innovative ways. They will be responsible for executing on business intelligence projects – including design, analysis, and development.
Apply for this position if:

You are creative, curious, and analytical, and want to initiate innovation and positive change in everything you do at Definity by thinking big, challenging assumptions, and identifying threats and opportunities.
You are a go-getter with an agile mindset when tackling obstacles.
You are a people-person who works well in teams with diverse skillsets.

Role Location: Hybrid (Toronto, Waterloo, Vancouver, Montreal) – expectation of 20%-40% of time in office
What can you expect in this role?

Partner with internal business teams to understand their business problems and brainstorm meaningful & creative solutions
Deliver on ad-hoc reports to serve different stakeholder groups
Design, develop and deliver reports, dashboards, and data insights that provide value to our business partners
Maintain and support existing reports, dashboards and other processes owned by the team.
Implement BI best practices throughout the project lifecycle
Participate in strategic discussions to enhance their business knowledge and skillsets

What do you bring to the role?

University or college degree in Computer Science, Business with Computer Science minor, Actuarial Science or a related discipline
Minimum 2 years of experience in a business intelligence role, with P&C insurance industry experience preferred.
Experience using big data databases, like Impala or Hive.
Hands-on experience developing reports and dashboards through visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau) data exploration & analysis tool (e.g., SQL, R, SAS)
Working knowledge of project management methodologies (including agile development) preferred.
Analytical ability to generate insights & present effective data-driven business recommendations to various stakeholder groups.
“Can-do” attitude to solving business problems.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

#LI-JG1
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
 Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it:

 Hybrid work schedule for most roles
 Company share ownership program
 Pension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributions
 Paid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donations
 Educational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for exams
 Focus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parents
 Wellness and recognition programs
 Discounts on products and services

 Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
 Background checks This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

Title: Inventory Analyst
Description:
Inventory Analyst


Universal Truck and Trailer is Atlantic Canada's largest Heavy Duty Truck and Trailer dealership featuring the most up-to-date dealer service bays in Southern New Brunswick. We are an authorized sales, service, parts & warranty dealership for premium products including Freightliner and Western Star. In addition, we service all makes and models for class 6, 7 and 8 vehicles, including luxury class RV's.


We are looking for an analytical, data savvy, team player who is passionate about numbers, details and keeping things organized, ultimately contributing to great experiences for our customers. If you are ready for your next career step but unsure if you have enough work experience, don’t hesitate to apply for this position. We are willing to provide training for the candidate with the right attitude and required qualifications.


 Key focuses of the role would include, 1. Owning database/ERP accuracy and quality 2. Replenishing inventory for multiple stores 3. Identifying slow, excessive, inventory and performing activities to minimize it.


Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintaining and improving parts ERP system data accuracy and quality
Generate vendor stock orders and conduct replenishment activities
Monitor inter-store product transfers for improvements and coordinates movement of strategic and surplus inventory between branches
Manage order escalations and back-order communication
Maintain vendor relationships including timely, regular contact with vendors and suppliers to resolve problems and improve costs
Responsible for the analysis and coordination of vendor product returns and other activities to minimize obsolete, unclaimed special orders, excess and slow-moving inventory
Monitors and report on consignment inventories
Collaborate with Warehouse team to improve inventory management
Support physical cycle counts and year-end inventory counts, investigating variances and resolve issues
Generate ad-hoc reports to support business decisions and assist with purchasing team KPI reporting




Qualifications:

Comfortable with using large data sets and intermediate level MS Excel
Comfortable with technology and learning new applications
Post-Secondary Education would be considered an asset
Supply Chain / Procurement Experience would be considered an asset
Knowledge of purchasing, sales, and wholesale processes
Process Improvement mindset 
Must be an independent self-starter, but have the ability to collaborate when needed




How to Apply
If you are interested in applying for this career opportunity, please apply online at www.jdirving.com/careers. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.


Universal Sales Limited is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.
