Title: Vibration Analyst
Description:
AP Dynamics is looking for a talented and self-motivated Vibration Analyst to join our team in Calgary, AB. The Vibration Analyst will be responsible for the following duties:

Performs dynamic analysis of skid mounted equipment
Performs engineering acoustical and mechanical studies on compressor packages
Conduct field measurements surveys for new or existing facilities at clients’ sites predominantly in North America. The travels are expected to be up to 50% of the time.
Collect vibration, strain, and pulsation measurements to identify sources of concerns.
Perform field data analysis and post-processing.
Produce detailed vibration analysis reports including recommendations for reducing vibration and improving overall design.
Demonstrate effective client engagement, problem solving, effective communication, passion, and excellent technical knowledge within the team and on site.
Apply industry vibration guidelines, codes and standards criteria in the preparation of design recommendations
Produce timely and detailed technical reports
Adhere to AP Dynamics EH&S policies.
Works effectively as a multi-disciplinary project team member
Develop strong customer relationships with the desire of exceeding expectations
Works towards obtaining P.Eng within 4 years and maintaining engineer status with APEGA
Perform other related duties as required

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering.
Register with APEGA as an EIT or Engineer.
Training in Vibration Analysis (e.g. VCAT 2 or equivalent) is a strong asset.
Previous experience in Oil&Gas facilities and rotating equipment.
1 year of field experience in gathering data.
Experience in Engineering Consulting firm is considered a strong asset.
Ability to solve technical design challenges
Must be a Canadian citizen or authorized to work lawfully in Canada, without sponsorship. Must maintain a valid passport to travel outside Canada.
Physically capable and willing to execute site work (carrying heavy measurement equipment, working at height, etc.)
Experience with programming language: Python and Excel VBA.
Knowledge with industry guideline and standards related to vibration assessments (e.g. ISO 10863, API 617, API 618, API 674, EFRC, etc.) is considered an asset.
Proficient in standard Windows software.
Experience with data acquisition system is considered an asset.
Experience managing small projects with tight deadlines is considered an asset.
Strong technical writing skills.
Good communication skills.

We would like to thank you for your interest in AP Dynamics and wish you a career that meets your ambitions.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Education:

Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

field: 2 years (required)

Willingness to travel:

25% (required)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our bottom line is different.
 There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making it possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.   Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.
Job Number: REQ4338 Location: Anywhere in Alberta Apply by: Jul 22, 2022 Paygrade: I (OTH) # Positions available: 1 Leader Name: Associate Vice President, Program Delivery
 As ATB’s next Data Analyst in the Portfolio Management Assurance and Delivery team, you will be accountable for tracking, documenting and maintaining critical data elements that feed our program and project reporting and insights as well as resource and talent analytics. You will elevate our ability to provide meaningful reporting and insights, capturing accurate information and collaborating with internal team members across our Technology and Innovation Team (TIE). As a natural connector of dots, you will synthesize complex data using advanced analytics, data visualizations, and dashboards to evaluate and share progress and results on a given product, project, or program. As a data enthusiast, you will pride yourself on an accurate, transparent, source of truth view of all initiatives across the initial phases of our SDLC.
 If you posses the following characteristics, we encourage you to apply:
 Business Fundamentals

Predictive Client Analytics
Business Analysis
Business Problem Solving
Client Centricity and Value Creation
Metrics Reporting

Interpersonal skills and Leadership

Continuous Learning Mindset
Critical Thinking & Problem Solving
Systems Thinking

Your key areas of responsibilities will include:

Synthesizing data using data visualizations and dashboards tailored to the audience/use
Work with a wide range of data/functions
Producing datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools
Identifying and interpreting trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences
A keen focus on advanced analytics that deal with big data, data processing, and multiple data source

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in math, science or equivalent experience
At least 2-4 years working in a similar role 
Working knowledge in current data science and visualization technologies like Tableau, etc. 
Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, strategic planning and execution skills; verbal, written and visualization capabilities
Strong business acumen, including industry, domain-specific knowledge of the enterprise and its business units

Experience with the following is highly beneficial:

Data Reporting, Visualization & Dashboarding Tools
Data Cleansing, Data Curation, Data Harmonizing & Packaging
Data Privacy & Regulation
Descriptive & Diagnostic Analytics

Benefits
 Be great. Be you. Believe.
 We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.
 What happens next?
 Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.
 Stay in touch!
 ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Program Overview: 
The eHealth Centre of Excellence (eCE) develops, implements, and advances digital health tools and services – such as eReferral, eConsult, Virtual Care, Patient Forms, EMR Tools & Coaching, and Automated Solutions – to better serve clinicians and patients across the province. We advocate for the continued and improved use of technology to enhance the connection and secure information-sharing between all clinicians in the patient’s circle of care, as well as communication between clinicians and their patients. We also support clinicians with tools that provide decision support at the point-of-care and improve data quality, leading to enhanced outcomes for patients.The eCE works collaboratively with system partners, regional and provincial agencies, clinicians, and patients to support priorities that ensure equitable, seamless care for all residents in Ontario, and are co-leads of two provincial programs: the Ontario eServices Program and the Ontario Standards for Care Program. Our founding vision is one of innovation and partnership, and our mission to be the leading, trusted, digital health partner for primary care and integrated patient care.
P*osition Overview: *
Reporting to the Director, eServices, the Business Analyst will play a key role in supporting digital health initiatives across Ontario. The Business Analyst will lead operational, functional and resource optimization effort to achieve operational excellence through workforce planning, process development and improvement. This role requires a strong ability to critically evaluate the information and data identified and present it with an appropriate level of detail. This position will work with the eServices Director, Managers, and program team to ensure the successful delivery of all program activities and create additional capacity to improve and expand program value.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: 

Facilitate workshops with internal and external stakeholders (i.e., clinicians) to collect requirements and conduct workflow mapping
Responsible for the collection, analysis and documentation of data, information, business issues and requirements
Design and develop processes, standards, and workflows to clarify, streamline and optimize processes within the program (continuous quality improvement)
Coordinate and work with other members within eCE to create or improve workflows
Support the workplan coordination, by devising plans and strategies to help the program achieve deliverables (both clinical and business components) and targets efficiently and effectively
Assist in performing cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for eServices program offerings and initiatives to aid management in making implementation and prioritization decisions
Assist in workforce and resource planning of eServices
Track eServices contracts, agreements, and Statement of Work (SOWs) to ensure compliance and to assist in deliverable achievement and budget management
Assist the eServices Directors and Managers in risk and issue management through identifying, tracking, monitoring, reporting, and ensuring mitigation activities.
Support the eServices Director and Managers with various status reporting
Other duties as assigned

Experience, Skills & Qualifications: 

Post-secondary education in a related field
Minimum of 3 years in health care or health informatics in an analyst position
Lean Six Sigma certification an asset
Experience in CQI (continuous quality improvement) activities an asset
Experience in gathering business requirements and workflow mapping
Experience with preparing reports and ensuring the quality of reports and data
Experience with cost-benefit and return-on-investment analysis
Experience with workforce planning an asset
Experience in project coordination/management an asset
Experience with writing business cases an asset
Strong organization and communication skills (written and oral)
Strong attention to detail
Demonstrated interpersonal skills
Strong proficiency with Excel and SharePoint, as well as proficiency with other Microsoft Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Ability to travel within Ontario as required

If this position is of interest to you, please send your cover letter and resume to Human Resources.
Feel like you don’t meet all the requirements? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to learn the rest, we encourage you to reach out to us!
The eHealth Centre of Excellence team is a respectful and inclusive workplace. Upon individual request, hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact Human Resources for assistance.
The eHealth Centre of Excellence team is committed to employment equity. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates including, 2SLGBTQ-identified persons, persons with disabilities, First Nations, Inuit and Métis individuals, and members of Black and other racialized communities, and individuals who speak languages other than English.
We thank all interested applicants; however, due to the volume of resumes we receive only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Project Controls Analyst
Description:
AECOM is seeking a Project Controls Analyst to be based in Edmonton, Alberta. 

 _This position is expected to begin in July/August 2022._ 

 At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world. 

 We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. 

 Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world. 

 Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. 

 We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. 

 You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. 

 We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business. 

 We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career. 

 When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

 + Be involved in review sessions on project status with project management and/or client and highlight adverse schedule variances for corrective actions 

 + Assist in the development of all reports set forth in the client business requirements as well as indicated in the corporate reporting procedures 

 + Review weekly coordination of data. (Cost/Schedule/Trends/Progress) 

 + Ensure you are doing all Project Controls activities in accordance with set Project Procedures and Job Instructions. Includes preparation of schedules, cash flow and variance analysis 

 + Review and provide feedback on miscellaneous project reports. 

 + Provide design and construction teams with forward looking mitigation plans and data 

 + Knowledgeable of planning and scheduling concepts and principles including effects on financial performance. 

 + Supports analysis of schedule, identifies and investigates project schedule variances. 

 + Collects and updates data and updates and produces scheduling reports. 

 + Assists in the development and maintenance of WBS and support activities to implement applicable coding. Supports basic schedule development. 

 + Supports gathering and assembling data for schedule updating. 

 + Supports measurement of project schedule progress and gathers and assembles data for schedule and network updating. 

 + Gathers data for schedule baseline development and maintenance. 

 + Works with the company financial and cornerstone systems and processes. 

 + Applies financial terminology, measures, financial data analysis concepts and principles in assignments. 

 + Recognizes processes/project actions that may lead to project financial impact. 

 + Develops and maintains WBS for small projects. 

 + Assists in the use of drawings and specifications in the establishment of project baseline data. 

 + Begins basic analysis of cost and schedule variances. 

 + Develops knowledge of accounting principles. 

 + Assists in assembling data for trending and forecasting. 

 + Understands progress/performance data and associated concepts and principles. Participates in the collection of progress data and review of performance trends. 

 + Familiar with earned value, scope control and change management concepts, principles and methodologies. 

 + Collects data and produces an initial analysis on manpower, labor hour, and labor cost requirements versus budget limitations. 

 + Collects and analyzes data for tracking actual cost to funding limitations. 

 + Provides support to tracking purchase order and subcontract commitments and expenditures. 

 + Familiar with the concepts and principles of project revenue and cost. 

 + Supports project reporting process as required. 

 + May participate in project cost review meetings 

 Minimum Requirements 

 + Minimum of College Diploma/Certification required 

 Preferred Qualifications 

 + University education in Engineering, Finance or Economics with applicable further development in Project Management would be preferred 


+ Strong computer skills: Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint) 

 + Primavera P6, MS Project 


Additional Information:
 + Relocation assistance is not offered for this position 

 + Sponsorship is not offered for this position 

 What We Offer 

 We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. 

 You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. 

 We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business. 

 We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career. 

 When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started. 

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Title: Digital Marketing Analyst
Description:
SND - Sales & Distributions
Vancouver, Canada
Cathay Pacific
Application Deadline 22 Jul 2022



Company Description
 Let your passion fly! We’re proud to be one of the world’s leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and on the delivery of customer service that’s straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won’t be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!
 Role Introduction
 Cathay Pacific Airways is looking for a highly motivated individual to join the Digital Sales Team in Vancouver, BC. This Full-Time Digital Marketing Analyst position is a multi-faceted role, the successful candidate will focus on developing and delivering reporting and analysis on our direct sales channel to support the digital sales team in the Americas. The role will also support regional digital sales campaigns and initiatives, broader marketing campaigns, social media and website content management. 
This individual will be part of a close knit team that wear many hats but are very open and supportive of each other. Cathay Pacific is entering a period of recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic and while no two days will be the same you’ll be encouraged to find new ways of working and carving out best practice processes to add to our team’s effectiveness and efficiency. 
Key Responsibilities
 Key Responsibilities and Tasks

 Proactively collect and interpret daily, weekly and monthly data using all data tools available to provide consultancy and challenge to the digital sales team to ensure the channel is properly monitored, with areas of improvement identified.
 Analyze and identify performance trends, historical patterns, user behavior and opportunities in the direct channel to highlight gaps to regional and head office teams.
 Translate trends, patterns and opportunities into actionable items for the regional digital sales team.
 Working alongside channel specialists, the regional leadership team, and regional digital sales team, conduct ad-hoc studies on potential new business needs and newly identified market challenges.
 Define optimal regional data collection, reporting and analytical processes in close collaboration with regional business development team.
 Become an expert on the suite of data analysis tools available to Cathay Pacific and mentor the wider team on their application and use.
 Conduct comprehensive regional level analytics and proactively identify synergies between direct sales channel data and broader Cathay Pacific performance data/metrics.
 Conduct tracking and measurement of direct channel KPIs and communicate to the broader team.
 Conduct other reporting and analysis as required.
 Support campaign activities for the region as needed, including but not limited to website content management, social media and partnership/vendor relations.

 Emergency & Accident

 Emergency and Accident and Crisis response responsibilities as required

 Requirements

 Diploma or certificate (in a related Sales, Marketing or Business field) is preferred
 A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in ecommerce or marketing data analysis
 A minimum of 5 years of experience, preferably in aviation, travel, tourism is an asset
 Expert knowledge of Excel and Google Analytics
 Knowledge of Adobe Analytics, QlikView and QlikSense is an asset
 Proficient user of Microsoft Office suite including Teams, Word, PowerPoint
 Experience with Adobe Experience Manager (or any CMS) and Salesforce Marketing Cloud advantageous, but not required
 Demonstrable experience in working in a campaign environment, understand timing and rollout in relation to timely reporting
 Comfortable with a test and learn approach with a focus on continuous improvement
 Good presentation, forward planning and time management skills
 Must be self-driven with a passion for data analysis
 Superior problem-solving and interpersonal skills
 Effective verbal and written communication skills with an ability to adapt communication style to suit different audiences across our global team
 Ability to travel 10% of the time (when global travel resumes)
 Must be willing to work from San Francisco or Vancouver office as required
 Must comply with the Company’s mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination policy
 Must have the right to live and work in Canada

 Personal & Application Information
 Cathay Pacific Airways Limited is committed to employment equity, supports diversity in the workplace and encourages application from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Company Overview Company Overview 

 Incedo is a US-based consulting, data science and technology services firm with over 2,500 people helping clients from our six offices across US and India. We help our clients achieve competitive advantage through end-to-end digital transformation. Our uniqueness lies in bringing together strong engineering, data science, and design capabilities coupled with deep domain understanding. We combine services and products to maximize business impact for our clients in telecom, financial services, product engineering and life science & healthcare industries. 
Working at Incedo will provide you an opportunity to work with industry leading client organizations, deep technology and domain experts, and global teams. Incedo University, our learning platform, provides ample learning opportunities starting with a structured onboarding program and carrying throughout various stages of your career. A variety of fun activities are also an integral part of our friendly work environment. Our flexible career paths allow you to grow into a program manager, a technical architect or a domain expert based on your skills and interests. 
Role Description 
Role Description 

 Candidate will be responsible for working closely with different business areas to define and drive technology-enabled solutions, with a strong focus on: 



Working very closely with key stakeholders within the business, IT teams, and vendor(s) to complete the development of Corporate Fleet, a fleet management application.
Contribute to the adaptation and development of the Corporate Fleet application for Diagnostics, Netherlands and other sites, in collaboration with the fleet managers of those sites.
Supporting Transportation projects such as LogMyCommute, Tripshot, Via, gRide Go, and others.
Support sustainability activities including site and fleet electrification, contributing to site and Roche-wide sustainability reporting, site-wide charging facilities, etc.
 Role and responsibilities 



Facilitate workshops - story-boarding workshops, translate story-boarding artifacts into an electronic format and provide input in design sessions
Work closely with global Product Owner, business partners, Scrum Master, Technical Lead, Developers, Software Quality Assurance to accomplish a successful project delivery, focused on Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
Define Agile structures and apply Agile principles (Themes, Epics, User Stories, etc.)
Document and analyze current and future business process models
Document and analyze requirements, scope, business rules (use cases) and user stories
Clearly communicate keeping IT and the business stakeholders updated on progress, dependencies, risks, issues, key metrics
Plan user acceptance test (UAT), create UAT scripts and facilitate UAT and post-UAT outcomes and next steps
Perform knowledge transfer to training and communications teams
Support user deployment activities as needed
Be able to work flexible hours at different time zones (CET, PST, EST..)
 Technical skills requirements 



6 to 8+ years of experience working with business teams to define business problems, analyze business requirements & define user stories
Strong critical thinking and analysis, small and large group facilitation skills,ability to navigate, negotiate, influence across stakeholders
Demonstrated success handling initiatives of high complexity and risk
Experience with Agile methodology
Ability to multitask, with agility, flexibility and time management, a quick learner
General understanding and exposure to technology evaluation, Workplace IoT, data and analytics.
Experience with Project Management and ability to collaborate on projects without having full project access.
Experience working with global teams located in various geographical locations.
 Qualifications 



Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in business administration, systems design, or equivalent field
 Company Value Company Value 

 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity at Incedo. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Applications Production Support Intermediate Analyst
Description:
The Apps Support Intmd Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

 The successful candidate will be managing support activities for (BCMA) Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory. Our network-driven strategy allows us to offer an integrated suite of wholesale banking products and services to clients who value our unmatched country presence and who require a financial services partner that can help them grow in any country where they do business. Joining this team will enable you to explore cutting edge technologies and acquire core Capital Banking domain knowledge. The ideal candidate should be technically astute, well organized, proactive, and also to possess good multi-tasking skills.
 Responsibilities:

 The Apps Support Intmd Analyst provides technical and business support for users of Citi Applcations.
 Utilizes good understanding of apps support procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other technical areas to field issues and queries from stakeholders, provide short-term resolutions and work with relevant technology partners for long term remediation.
 Develop a comprehensive understanding of how areas of apps support collectively integrate to contribute to achieving business goals.
 Act as a liaison between users/traders, interfacing internal technology groups and vendors
 Participates in disaster recovery testing
 Participate in application releases, from development, testing and deployment into production.
 perform post release checkouts after application releases and infrastructure updates. Develop and maintain technical support documentation.
 Considers implications of the application of technology to the current environment.
 Analyzes applications to identify risks, vulnerabilities and security issues.
 Makes evaluative judgments based on analysis of factual information; resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions Cooperation with Development colleagues to prioritize bug fixes and support tooling requirements.
 Directly impacts the business by ensuring the quality of work provided by self and others; impacts own team and closely related work teams.
 Exchanges ideas and information
 Active involvement in and ownership of Support Project items, covering Stability, Efficiency, and Effectiveness initiatives.
 Performs other duties and functions as assigned in a concise and logical manner.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

 Qualifications:


 2-5 years experience
 Basic knowledge or interest about apps support procedures, concepts and of other technical areas.
 Participation in some process improvements.
 JAVA experience in the past.
 Understanding of TOMCAT Server and Deployments
 Knowledge of active monitoring tools (Tivoli, Nagios, ITRS, Uptime, etc.)
 Previous experience or interest in standardization of procedures and practices.
 Basic Business knowledge/ understanding of financial markets and products.
 Knowledge/ experience of problem Management Tools.
 Understands of how own sub-function integrates within the function and commercial awareness
 Evaluates (sometimes complex) situations using multiple sources of information Developed communication and diplomacy skills to persuade and influence
 Good customer service, communication and interpersonal skills
 Good knowledge of the business and its technology strategy
 Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
 Knowledge of issue tracking and reporting using tools
 Good all-round team member
 Effectively share information with other support team members and with other technology teams
 Ability to plan and organize workload
 Ability to communicate appropriately to relevant stakeholder

 Education:

 Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

 Nice to have skills 

Rest API Knowledge, Understanding on Kafka Integrations
 Ability to develop support tools/scripts as required
 Functional knowledge of SQL + ability to write SQL database script
 Deeper understanding of web technologies
 Understanding of IP networks + ability to analyze and monitor network traffic
 Exposure to Mongo DB technology is a value add


 Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities (including, without limitation, physical and mental health disabilities) during the recruitment process and otherwise in accordance with law. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minority or racialized communities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

 Job Family Group: Technology
  -
 Job Family: Applications Support

 Time Type: Full time

 Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
CanaDream provides memorable vacations for people who want to experience Canada at their own pace. 

 We're open year-round, but our stations really come alive in season (May through October), when we play host to visitors from around the world. 

 At CanaDream you have the ability to make a real difference to our Guests and Customers. Work with a great team; people who know how to have fun while getting the job done to the best of our abilities. Ignite your passion by joining our team! 

 CanaDream is proud to employ individuals who embrace our core values: 


Be happy to
Lead the way
Enjoy the ride
 We are seeking an experienced analyst with experience in both data analysis and finance/business analysis to join our Finance team. Our ideal candidate must possess the ability to progress through tasks with minimum supervision. They must also have a strong team mentality, analytical skills and a willingness to learn and adapt to an ever-changing environment. 

 About CanaDream’s Employees 

 We are a team of experienced, passionate, and dedicated people and we welcome employees from all around the world and with all sorts of life experiences. 

 About the Company 

 From humble beginnings in the mid-‘90s, CanaDream has steadily grown into a leading RV rental and sales business in Canada. Our market-leading brand position has been achieved through a combination of investments in experienced employees across all our locations, with unique build RV floor plans, proprietary technology, continual investment, continual growth and expansion plans, and a fleet of over 1,000 modern RVs for rentals and previously experienced units available for sale. 

 Our vibrant locations are choice locations for customers and guests who are seeking adventures in untamed and breathtaking surroundings and looking to explore the untamed wilderness, wildlife, awe-inspiring mountains, coastal hike trails, bright and bustling landscapes, gorgeous lake views & vast parks. 

 CanaDream’s culture is based on being “Happy to” in every corner, we seek positivity and teamwork; working together to put our Guests at the center of everything. CanaDream’s employees work hard and enjoy the ride. Fun is at the core of our business with monthly staff appreciation BBQs, regular team celebration events, milestone awards and more. 


What’s in It for You:
 In addition to joining a dynamic and supportive team that focuses on staff well-being, you will receive a competitive salary, staff discounts for RV travel, benefits, growth opportunities & comprehensive on-the-job training. We also provide a referral bonus to staff who refer people to come and work with us. Our stations enjoy social events, and you will be welcomed in like family. 

 Our location has a gym, making it easier for employees to improve their health. We also have a pet-friendly environment. 


More About the role:
 Those who are most successful in this role are detailed oriented, possess business acumen and are great at planning, budgeting, forecasting and conducting variance analysis. 


Job Duties:

You will be responsible for the following:


Providing financial and operational analysis that adds value and allows for the making of strategically sound decisions
Presenting data in a meaningful way to stakeholders and making insightful recommendations
Participating in the annual budget and monthly forecast preparations
Management reporting, performing variance analysis, investigating discrepancies, and identifying key trends and drivers
Business scenario modeling
Develop and report on KPIs
Working on multiple projects simultaneously
Entering, retrieving, transforming, and analyzing data

Qualifications:


Have at least 1-3 years of experience in a related analytical role in finance/accounting or data analysis
University Degree in Finance/Economics/Statistics background is highly regarded
Demonstrated advanced knowledge, skills, and experience working in Excel (Power Pivot, Index-Match, VBA, Arrays, etc.). Experience in producing Excel models, what-if scenarios, data collection, cleanup, and data mining
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Experience with business intelligence tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx, Zap BI, etc.), analysis tools (R or Python), or FP&A tools would be considered an asset
Understanding of accounting principles and comfortable understanding financial statements
Have an analytical mindset and the ability to process high volumes of data and interpret complex business issues accurately to non-financial and data users
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment is essential to this role including recommending changes to improve process efficiencies
Experience with financial modeling; able to translate the impact of analysis to the business
Be detail-oriented, able to juggle multiple requests under pressure, and effectively prioritize tasks at hand to meet tight deadlines
 This job is onsite and not remote. 

 If you like the sound of all of this and are ready for a challenging yet rewarding role within a supportive team, and you believe you possess the required skills and experiences, then please apply to https://www.canadream.com/careers/job-openings/. 

 CanaDream treats applicants on individual merit and abides by provincial legislations. We maintain equal opportunity employment for all applicants. Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.

Title: Associate, Business Intelligence
Description:
Company Description
  Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
 When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
 CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:

 Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
 Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
 Accelerated exposure and responsibility
 Global career development opportunities
 Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
 A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance

 If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence (BI) – Management Insights & Analytics, the Associate will leverage data, technology, and partnership across both the Investment Departments and Core Services to support these teams in their decision-making process required for the execution of their responsibilities. Within the Finance, Analytics and Risk (FAR) department, the BI team delivers visual and dynamic advanced analytical solutions by providing an integrated and independent view of key investment and business metrics with self-serve monitoring reports.
 As an Associate, you will be responsible for various projects that involve multiple stakeholders.
 Role-Specific Accountabilities

 Strong ability to work independently and as part of the team in a fast pace environment.
 Ability to work on multiple simultaneous projects with occasional ad-hoc requests and manage time to achieve optimal results.
 Provide support to data management activities through adherence to standard practices.
 Lead and assist the infrastructure for the storage, integration and use of data and databases with the team.
 Leverage strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills to work with data providers and end users in assessing, transforming, and storing data for analytical and reporting requirements.
 Work with the team and Project Manager(s) to create feasible timelines, identify project risks and actively resolve issues.




 Qualifications
 

 A post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, or equivalent.
 5-7+ years of business analysis, data management technology and experience working on complex projects is required.
 Experience developing, documenting, coding, testing, and implementing technical solutions to meet business needs is required.
 Experience setting up data infrastructures and streamlining data with Python and SQL.
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
 Experience working with large data sets with Python and SQL is required.
 Experience working with Cloud technology, Tableau, Jenkins, and Jira would be considered an asset.

 Additional Information
  Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-KE1
 #LI-Hybrid
 At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
 We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.
 Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:
 In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
 Disclaimer:
 CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

 Mandatory Vaccine Policy
 All employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.

Title: Data Analyst, Financial Crime Risk
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 

 Risk Analytics @ Neo 

 Neo’s Credit Risk team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives. 

 The Role 

 Neo is looking for a data driven individual with strong knowledge of advanced analytical techniques to join our team in our Calgary headquarters. Leveraging your knack for data and a strong statistical foundation, you’ll make an immediate impact via development and deployment of advanced analytical techniques across our credit and fraud decisioning projects. You’ll be contributing to our innovative, strategic, and high-performance team with a mission to improve the financial experience for all Canadians. 


What you'll be doing:
 Develop reporting capabilities to actively monitor performance, and identify trends to enable strategic business decisions Analyze risk profiles across the financial crimes vectors, leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to best identify exposure/opportunities Analyze key business metrics including true positive rates, false positive rates, portfolio fraud rates Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to integrate foundational risk practices 


Who we're looking for:
 1-3 years experience in data analytics; experience in risk management,fraud analytics, AML analytics considered an asset Strong knowledge of SQL, R and Python Data-driven, eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication to different audiences Self-starter, highly focused; driven to achieve business objectives Self-organized, ability to prioritize effectively Able to collaborate with others, engage stakeholders purposefully 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst
Overview:
The Application Services team facilitates roadmap development, identifies, and evaluates potential new systems and contributes to the ongoing enhancement and development of solutions that span all key enterprise processes and services. One of the critical sets of processes and systems are the financial and financial reporting solutions. The Application Services team is part of Spark Power's Information Technology Services (ITS) organization. This team will work closely with other members of the ITS team to develop, promote and expand the use of common corporate process and applications within the Spark organization.
Reporting to the Manager, Business Analysis, you will conduct thorough data analysis, help design and implement productivity tools, and collaborate with various teams to ensure we are optimizing our business process ultimately supporting our field service and operational teams. The successful applicant will be part of a team to develop an enterprise application suite that aligns with the organizations' strategic goals working closely with various teams to design and implement the application platform, and ultimately be responsible for ongoing maintenance and enhancements.
Here's what you will do as the Business Analyst:

Understand and contribute to the overall design required for the application solution (Business Process, Data, Application, and Technology) and providing simplified explanations to key stakeholders.
 Ensures the application solution uses and provides enterprise information consistently, integrates effectively with other applications, supports a common application environment and user interaction model, and adheres to the common technology platform.
 Assist in translating business requirements into detailed business and technical needs.
 Plays a primary role in the definition and documentation of business solution strategies including solution design, integration and standardization, and ensures adherence to architecture compliance and implementation governance.
 Work in collaboration with key stakeholders to develop, document, and maintain critical business processes.
 Build and maintain relationships across the organization; collaborate regularly with various departments and operational teams to help envision the solution value and long term benefits.
 Comprehension and communication of common corporate business processes working in collaboration respective end users to identify and suggest process efficiencies.
 § Participates in the planning, development, maintenance, installation, configuration, documentation, training and implementation of new applications/solutions.
 Support in resolution of reported tickets and application-related issues.
 Document application functionality and training materials and conduct end user training sessions as required Coordinate with the ITS team to implement to formulate holistic architecture designs with consideration to business applications, infrastructure, and technology solutions.
 Maintain objectivity at all times to ensure processes, products and solutions are aligned and consistent with Spark's systems and technologies
 Raise and escalate any issues and concerns with ITS management and/or business process owners.
 Make data-driven decisions and recommendations.
 Develop and maintain documentation.

Do you have the Spark? Here's what we are looking for:

University or post graduate level education in computer science, business or related field.
 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field required.
 Additional certifications that exemplify a desire for continued education is a plus.
 Minimum of 3-5 years' experience architecture/design role or implementation of software applications.
 Experience in analyzing data, queries and reports to support business processes and identify root cause analysis of reported issues Experience working with large scale projects linking data from multiple lines of business. This includes multiple platforms and multiple databases.
 Experience in working with Netsuite, Concur and Microsoft Visio is an asset.
 Experience in delivering solutions in an agile environment is an asset.
 Solid computer skills, including Microsoft Office, databases, web-based applications.
 Knowledge of various components of ERP Financials (Operations, Sales & Marketing, Project Management, Asset Management, and Financial solutions).
 Understanding of complex business and financial data and processes.
 Excellent ability to collaborate with all levels within the IT and Business organization.
 Excellent interaction skills and an ability to manage deliverables across multiple projects and multiple locations in a deadline driven environment.
 Demonstrated ability to effectively analyze business requirements and work with project managers to prepare high level estimates for projects.
 Demonstrated proficiency in performing product evaluations, product selection, integrating infrastructure components and developing reusable set of application services to be used across a suite of applications.
 Ability to assimilate, analyze and facilitate information sharing.
 Ability to facilitate meetings such as application end-user or technical training sessions.
 Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
 Experience with dealing with multiple stakeholders.
 Demonstrated success working in a team-based environment.
 Strong attention to detail.
 Self-motivated with a high level of initiative and accountability.
 Organized, diligent, and able to track and manage multiple streams of information on an ongoing basis.

Who is Spark Power?

We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.
 We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.
 We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US.

What we offer our employees:

Diverse and exciting industrial, commercial project and customer base
 Continuous training and professional development, including fully paid training at SparkU!
 Career advancement opportunities
 Competitive wages plus incentive plans
 Excellent benefit package (medical, dental, vision, wellness spending account)
 Corporate discount programs
 RRSP match program
 Employee Share Ownership Program
 Fun, inclusive and diverse company culture
 Employee contests, events, parties and community activities

….and much more
Location:
Oakville Head Office

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence and Data Science (M/F)
Description:
Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence and Data Science
IF YOU’RE READY TO BRING GAME-CHANGING IDEAS TO LIFE AND JOIN A COMMUNITY THAT VALUES PROFESSIONAL GROWTH AND EMPLOYEE WELLNESS, WE WANT YOU ON OUR TEAM.
IS AEROSPACE A PASSION FOR YOU? WELL YOUR TIMING IS RIGHT ON! WE CURRENTLY HAVE AN OPENING FOR A SENIOR ANALYST, BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & DATA SCIENCE IN OUR TEAM AT PRATT AND WHITNEY, A RENOWNED AEROSPACE COMPANY LOCATED ON THE SOUTH SHORE.
IF YOU ARE SELECTED, YOU WILL WORK AT P&W IN THE IT DEPARTMENT AND BE TRAINED BY P&W STAFF FOR A POSSIBLE OPPORTUNITY TO JOIN P&W AS A PERMANENT EMPLOYEE AND CONTINUE YOUR CAREER WITH P&W.
DON’T MISS THIS UNIQUE OPORTUNITY!
Job Summary
The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the preparation and data visualization, data engineering and governance, support to automating recurring tasks and reports, producing business analyzes and manage projects in collaboration with members of his team. He could also be involved in Industry 4.0 projects, depending on business needs and Canadian manufacturing initiatives (connected factory, certification of production lines, system of execution of production (MES), etc.).
Here is an overview of your contribution to the team: 

Develop reports and dashboards in accordance with visualization best practices and achievement standards


Analyze, map and map the relevant systems and business processes to the different mandates


Provide first level support and training of end users so that they can make full use of the solutions developed


Create tables of facts, dimensions and views that can be used in reports and analyzes (SQL, Hadoop)


Create calculated fields directly in the databases to support standardization of key performance indicators


Propose the best possible solutions and key performance indicators relevant in order to achieve business unit and company objectives


Write the documentation of information products in order to allow adequate interpretation

What are we looking for?

Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, technology, business intelligence or business administration (business intelligence profile, analytics, data science)


Graduate university degree in business intelligence, data science, or any other training relevant to the position is an asset


2 to 4 years of experience, but open to new graduates

Title: Energy Analyst
Description:
Entry Date
    

     Now
    





     Working time
    

     Full-time
    




    Entry Level
   

    Professionals
   




    Workfield
   

    Research & Development
   





     Company
    

     K+S Potash Canada GP
    




    Location
   

    Canada, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan
   











Your Responsibilities

Reporting to Sr. Manager, Resource Sustainability, you support in monitoring and analyzing the North American energy market. This position is also responsible for proactively researching energy and Environment Social Governance (ESG) trends and emerging energy technologies, which could be potentially incorporated into KSPC Bethune mine’s process. The position will collaborate with other departments to build upon relationships with Crown utility and industry colleagues and will assist with regulatory consultations, lobby efforts, and government incentive applications. The analyst may represent KSPC in industry association meetings and Crown utility working groups. The Energy Analyst will work collaboratively across the company (e.g., with Site Operations, Projects and Technology, Environmental, Legal, Communications, Corporate Affairs, Finance, etc.) to help develop, refine, and implement an integrated and coordinated sustainability plan on an ongoing basis. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to:



 Build and maintain daily position and pricing spreadsheets which can be used for risk analysis, Mark-to Market and P/L calculations, and forecasting
 Monitor, analyze and record short, medium, and long-term supply and demand drivers impacting natural gas and power prices
 Analyze and report on market drivers across Western Canadian natural gas and power markets, including the identification and impact of structural changes to transport, supply and demand markets affecting the short, medium, and long-term pricing
 Support KSPC’s hedging strategy through critically thoughtful analysis and advice
 Develop ad hoc analysis and reporting as required
 Develop and maintain weekly/monthly key performance indicator and financial analysis data/reports
 Provide strategic analysis and financial modelling of various capital investments in emissions-reducing technologies and projects
 Contribute to development of reporting dashboards and identify opportunities for improvement
 Support the development, implementation, and maintenance of a gas trading system
 Assist in researching government incentive programs and related requirements; provide support for relevant application submissions, as applicable
 Actively support all business units to help drive the effective selection, development, implementation and integration of analytics and KPIs to optimize business activities and develop meaningful business intelligence/reporting
 Review and identify energy invoicing and delivery discrepancies, perform all necessary investigation, and resolve disputes relating to the confirmations and accounting process for natural gas transactions
 Evaluate strategies, technologies, partnerships, and business models to achieve company greenhouse gas emission reduction targets
 Help to identify and prioritize areas for company sustainability efforts and recommend strategies for proactively addressing relevant environmental, social, and governance risks and opportunities in the short, medium, and long term
 Assist in the maintenance and enhancement of KSPC’s Energy Management system, continuously looking for areas of improvement, while monitoring and reporting data








Your Profile

Our company values and recognizes the diversity of the workforce and encourages individuals with the equivalent combination of education and work experience. The ideal candidate will have:




 Bachelor’s Degree in Business and / or Economics (or related field)
 3-5 years of technical experience in an Energy-related or financial data analysis role
 Strong computer and analytical skills, including advanced proficiency in MS Office
 Must be able to think critically and problem solve
 Ability to interface well with other internal departments and outside customers
 Exhibits strong interpersonal communication and organizational skills
 Ability to adapt to different management, communication, and delivery styles for different situations as needed




 The preferred location of this position is Saskatoon however, this position could work out of our Bethune location. Flexible work arrangement may be considered.



 Employment is subject to successfully completing KSPC’s pre-employment checks which may include criminal record check, education verification, functional fitness evaluation and drug and alcohol testing.




 To ensure consideration for this role, please apply by July 17, 2022.







Your Benefits By living our common K+S values across all our locations in the world: We are optimistic about our future, collaborative in building it, and with our entrepreneurial spirit, we aim to dig deeper and reach higher. We remain agile in an ever-changing world. We are innovative, turning obstacles into opportunities – and we do it all in ways that are safe and sustainable, protecting future generations. 
      
 We are committed to being a company where every employee can contribute, grow and thrive, and where we reflect the diverse communities in which we live and work. We are working toward a truly inclusive environment, because we know that the amazing array of differences in our backgrounds, competencies, experiences, race, gender, age, beliefs, sexual orientation, identity and their intersections is key to the longevity, sustainability and growth of our organization. 
      
 In a career with K+S Potash Canada (KSPC), you can look forward to:
      
 Good People and Great Culture
      
 Be part of a team committed to building an innovative and diverse culture. KSPC is growing our business, delivering exciting new opportunities, and giving back to the communities where we live and work.
      
 Challenge and Growth
      
 We support your growth and potential through professional development, training, and a robust performance recognition program. 
      
 Valuable Compensation
      
 Our total target compensation is competitive and benchmarked to the market. We have a Pay-for-Performance philosophy that includes two components: fixed (base) pay, and a short-term incentive (bonus) that rewards employees for their contributions towards corporate, team and individual successes.
      
 Supporting Benefits 
      
 Our comprehensive, employer-paid benefits program includes Life, Disability, Health and Dental, as well as competitive Retirement benefits, Employee and Family Assistance Program, paid work time to help out in your community (volunteer with a sports team or a charitable organization of your choice) and more! We offer a Health Spending Account for extras, like more expensive glasses, or a Wellness Account that covers recreational items, like your park camping fees, hunting or fishing license, and your gym membership.
     





This is Us We enrich life through the sustainable extraction and refinement of minerals to indispensable products and through our working environment, which is unique. Because it stands for everything that really matters in life: Trust, team spirit and meaningfulness for 11,000 employees at 50 locations on five continents. Welcome to K + S.
     


     Working at K+S

Title: System Analyst – Oracle & SQL developer
Description:
Job Details
   


Description



Reporting to the Manager Data Analytics and Integrations, the System Analyst-Oracle & SQL Developer will be a member of the Data Analytics and Integrations team. The System Analyst-Oracle & SQL Developer will be responsible for maintaining, developing, and deploying database code and objects on Oracle and SQL Server platforms.
 Responsibilities

Respond to production incidents and support requests
Write complex SQL code to query data, fix bugs and implement enhancements
Design and deploy various data objects including tables, views, indexes, stored procedures (T-SQL and PL/SQL)
Plan and coordinate data migrations between systems
Diagnose and resolve access and performance issues
Create and maintain technical documentation
Work within the support process standards (and improve when required)
Provide periodic on-call support (24/7)
SOX evidence reporting for databases

Requirements

Strong analytical skills and critical thinking
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong planning, prioritizing and time management skills - must be able to undertake and manage multiple tasks at the same time and work under tight deadlines and operational pressures
Ability to collaborate professionally with other teams
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)

Qualifications

University or College Degree in Computer Science/Technology or equivalent
Advanced knowledge in database coding (T-SQL & PL/SQL)
Demonstrated technical skills (5+years) with Oracle PL/SQL and SQL Server T-SQL
Advanced knowledge Experience in root cause analysis and providing workarounds and solutions for DB code
Good working knowledge of formal change management processes
Familiarity with the main data manipulation languages and the principles of database design

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Req ID: 21943
   Vacancy Type: Temporary
   Number of Positions: 1
   Closing Date: 07/14/2022
 



 Job Summary




Reporting to the Manager, Transit (MiWay) Business Systems, you will provide professional support services to the Transit Division within the Transportation and Works Department:




 Duties and Responsibilities





Project management, business case development, and integrated process re-design and system implementation to support changed processes as they relate to the implementation of transit software/systems.
Configure, troubleshoot Transit ITS (Intelligent Transportation System) Equipment like GPS Systems, Radio Networks, Camera Systems, WiFi/Cellular Gateways, Automatic Passenger Counting Systems and CAD/AVL Systems
Identifying continuous improvement opportunities by collecting and analyzing operations data, identifying and prioritizing process improvement opportunities, and then developing and deploying solutions to align operations to the strategic direction of the Transit division
Business case development and liaises with appropriate internal/external stakeholders in the assessment ,development, and implementation of technical business projects
Submitting written reports detailing project plans, business case justification, business recommendations ,and implementation schedule to the Manager and appropriate stakeholders for feedback and consultation
Developing and coordinating training and information knowledge transfer to appropriate stakeholders as part of system and process implementation as well as to ensure business process effectiveness in all areas of Transit
Providing leadership and facilitating special project teams to assist them in the identification of opportunities, solutions and action plans for implementation





Skills and Qualifications





Graduation from a recognized post-secondary program in Business Administration, IT, or Engineering with 3 to 5 years related experience. Specific knowledge of the Transit and/or financial industry is an asset
Experience with Transit ITS (Intelligent Transportation System) Equipment like GPS Systems, Radio Networks, Camera Systems, WiFi/Cellular Gateways, Automatic Passenger Counting Systems and CAD/AVL Systems is an asset
Experience with SQL database analytics & applications, and IP network architecture will be an asset
Demonstrated experience in evaluating, recommending and/or implementing organizational transformations is required
Previous experience on business process improvement projects, documented and analyzed business processes, calculated benefits for proposed changes, presented solutions, and developed final deliverables
Ability to develop and maintain business plans, evaluate and analyze the functionality and capabilities of existing and proposed business operations.
Thinks strategically about business issues with a strong bias for action and business solutions
Experience and understanding of Transit scheduling, maintenance, garage and on-street practices and procedures
