Title: Research Analyst (TFT)
Company: Waypoint Centre for Mental Health Care
Description:
The Waypoint Research Institute (WRI) is currently seeking a Research Analyst to assist researchers in the design, implementation, and evaluation of research projects. Incumbents may prepare questionnaires, data entry forms, conduct interviews, complete data collection and analysis, and contribute to grant applications and publications under the supervision of researchers.
 
Located at Waypoint Centre for Mental Health Care in Penetanguishene, Ontario, the WRI contributes to the field of mental health by providing strategic leadership on research and academic issues; facilitating innovating science and high quality applied research that aligns with Waypoint priorities; fostering partnerships and research collaborations across Ontario, in Canada and internationally; prioritizing knowledge translation that improves mental health and addictions care; and offering mentorship opportunities for students and trainees in a unique facility.

 Key Accountabilities:

 Conduct literature searches and reviews
 Assist in preparing materials for submission to granting agencies and foundations
 Participate in project meetings
 Assist in preparation of research ethics proposals
 Design, develop, and critique questionnaires or coding forms
 Develop sample selection and draw samples – recruit and/or interview subjects
 Participate in data collection; prepare data entry forms; enter, verify and clean data 
Participate in data analysis plans and assist with data analysis and summaries of results
 Assist in preparing reports, articles, and presentations; participate in presentations within the Waypoint Research Institute
 Maintain a log of all research activities
 Attend conferences and other meetings as necessary
 Prepare materials for submission to granting agencies and foundations
 Attend conferences and other meetings as necessary


 Requirements/Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s level degree (completed or pending) in a behavioural/life science field with relevant post-degree research training preferred
 Demonstrated experiencein qualitative and quantitative research methods and analysis
 Experience in research with a record of achievement in scholarly work (publications, presentations, completed research projects in work or senior undergraduate/graduate setting) 
TCPS2 Certification preferred
 Detail- oriented in order to ensure data is checked and consistently accurate
 Results oriented work ethic to work independently and undertake tasks needed to accomplish work objectives and deliver quality, consistent and timely results
 Demonstrated teamwork, interpersonal, communication and organizational skills 
Proven written and verbal communication skills
 Proven ability to adapt readily to change
 Models and promotes core ethical practice, Waypoint Values, and reflects an optimistic and positive attitude
 Preference for proficiency in French/English language skills\
 You must meet the requirements of our COVID-19 Immunization Policy by providing proof of full vaccination, or a request and receipt of an accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code, including a medical exemption


 How do I apply?
 Waypoint employees apply through the Employee Self-Service portal at https://employees.waypointcentre.ca and external applicants apply to http://www.waypointcentre.ca/i_want_to/join_your_teamby close of business (5:00 pm) onJuly 15, 2022 quoting Job ID WC22-230. Attach your cover letter and resume detailing why you are interested in this opportunity and how you meet the qualifications and key accountabilities specified. 
We are committed to diversity in the workplace and workplace well-being. As such, applications from individuals from diverse backgrounds such as First Nations, Inuit, Metis, members of a visible minority group and those with lived experience of mental health problems or illnesses are welcomed and encouraged. Waypoint welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon require for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All applicants are thanked for their interest in this position, however, due to high volumes only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Customer Development Analyst
Description:
Business Customer Development Analyst

 Are you an innovative and solutions-oriented individual who can think outside the box to focus on the possibilities? Are you passionate about cultivating mutually beneficial long-term relationships? Do you thrive on having direct responsibility for your success? Do you get a rush when negotiating and closing a deal?
 If so, DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you.

 Job Description
 This entry-level role is a development ground to provide a path into Business Development (BD). You will provide support to the BD team & Consumer sector to hit their annual sales target. You will learn by working hand-in-hand with the VP of Business Development, along with all others within the BD team. You will support the sector in their sales efforts, while learning the skills to eventually assist on customer accounts and/or assist in actively pursue business with new customers within the sector.

 Key day-to-day activities include:

 Creating Sales Materials:
 Development of detailed case studies highlighting business successes
 Ensuring the BD team is equipped with up-to-date material
 Interviewing with internal stakeholders, and collaboration with marketing team
 Identifying appropriate medium to share content
 Assisting in RFI and RFP response documents
 Keeping a central repository of this information to be easily located by the BD team


 Market Assessments- strategize on market opportunities/potential growth areas for the sector:

 Market research online (Gartner, Supply Chain News, etc.)
 Arming the Business Development team with trends and key selling points used for targeting
 Create potential customer lists along with the VP of BD to help the team grow their pipeline


 New Opportunity Assessment:

 Initial vetting of potential customers, and gathering the necessary data of those potential customers to make a Go/No-Go decision.
 Discuss directly with the potential customer to understand their needs, size the opportunity, and ultimately determine if there is a business fit
 Discuss/negotiate internally on why or why not the potential customer is a fit
 Contact and set-up meetings with potential leads that have reached out to DHL for help (once every two weeks)
 Analyze RFP and customer data to assess opportunity risk, scope, and financial benefits


 Shadowing and assisting on active pursuits:

 Working hand-in-hand with the lead Business Developer on the deal
 Assisting in data gathering on the customer
 Developing sales materials with the deal team (i.e. presentation decks, case studies, etc.)
 Strategizing a win-plan with the deal team
 Opportunity to travel and be involved in customer meetings
 We want you to get as much experience with a customer as possible, as if/when you become a manager, you will be talking with a customer daily


 Visit operations to better learn DHLs tool-kit/offerings for our customers:

 Depending on your office location, DHL typically has several operations within the area to tourotherwise travel may be required
 Spend time with co-workers from various operations to better understand their day-to-day needs and pain points


 Developing your ability to be customer-facing

 This will come gradually and the more success you show with customers, the more this will be added.


 Training

 DHL is committed to providing you with the training needed to bring you success and development opportunities
 Travel sometimes required for training (with our HQ in Columbus, OH, this is where most official training courses are held)
 Trainings include business writing, learning DHLs sales processes, warehousing and transportation design courses, commercial contracting, negotiation, etc.
 Ultimately you will set-up a training plan for yourself along with your managertailored to areas which you decide training is needed or wanted


 Required Education and Experience

 Bachelors degree in business administration or related field, required
 2 year's work experience in marketing, sales, transportation and/or logistics, preferred


 Our Organization is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request.

 Brand: DHL 
  Address: 90 Matheson Blvd West Suite 111 Mississauga, ON - L5R3R3 
  Property Description: 9349 - Mississauga ON 
  Property Number: 9349

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
JOIN OUR MB COUNTRY LIVING TEAM!
Where we feed the things you love
Are you a meticulous, forward-thinking individual? Are you self motivated and capable of high-level follow through? If your answer was “yes”, then you belong with us!
MB Country Living is looking for a Pricing Analyst to support our Category Manager based out of our head office in Canborough, Ontario. This role will be responsible for supporting the Category Manager with the daily maintenance of retail categories and the implementation of new processes and best practices that drive results. This position is currently available as maternity leave coverage, but we are a growing organization so there may be opportunity in future for a permanent role.
You Are: 
- A retail pricing professional – you come from a retail background, used to using retail math to perform calculations for assortments at varying volumes and frequencies (including a high volume assortment exceeding 15,000 SKUS)
- Dynamic - you are not only able to, but enjoy handling multiple priorities as well as shifting tasks and timelines
- Detail oriented – you don’t mind repetitive data entry and analytics. You understand that margins update daily and accuracy is of the utmost importance
- An innovator – able to identify and communicate strategic business opportunities and risks by analyzing sales performance and competitive landscape
- Self-driven - used to working independently to analyze data and provide relevant recommendations regarding retail pricing and products
- A communicator - with excellent listening, written and oral communication skills, able to clearly communicate with an appropriate sense of urgency
- Proficient in Microsoft Excel - able to utilize its tools and spreadsheets with minimal training
Responsibilities include but are not limited to: 
- Assists in maintaining cost, retail and advertised prices for all SKU’s within the assortment
-Performs competition pricing reviews to ensure our assortments are priced in a competitive and profitable manner
- Creates and maintains reporting as needed to analyze sales and provide actionable comments to the Category Manager
- Responsible for providing timely and accurate information to cross functional partners
- Communicates with internal and external partners with prompt, clear and concise verbal and written communication
- Proofs and edits flyer to ensure accuracy and recommend adjustments as required
- Occasionally required to support store teams on site in times of store builds, re-sets & inventory counts
Required Skills/Experience
- Post secondary education, or equivalent retail experience in a corporate office environment
- Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills
- Experience in a multi-unit retail environment is an asset
Why Join Our Team
- Flexible work options - this is a hybrid position, so you can split your week between working from home and out of the office.
- Avoid the highway – enjoy a scenic commute in to work! A glance out the window onto open fields or green spaces can help lower stress.
- Be part of a growing organization – our company culture combines progressive-mindedness with a simple lifestyle; experience dynamic growth balanced with the relaxation of operating in the beauty of the countryside.
- Casual dress code – our office operates as business ‘country casual’.
- We love animals – spend your days helping improve the quality of life for livestock & pets.
- Limited opening hours leave time for family - our office operates from 8:30am-5:00pm Monday through Friday and is typically closed on weekends
MB Country Living is a thriving, family-owned retail organization, serving communities across Southern Ontario for the past 50+ years by providing a variety of products for agriculture, pets, hobby farms, and outdoor living to suit any budget. Our service sets us apart: our staff are friendly and knowledgeable, always willing to go the extra mile and building relationships to ensure each guest feels as comfortable visiting us as they would be in the home of an old friend.
Our customers appreciate local food production, animal care, the outdoors, and their communities - and we take great pride in our role supporting them.
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Disability insurance
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Store discount
Vision care
Work from home

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:-Physical distancing is enforced-Thorough sanitizing routines in place-Passive COVID screening completed daily-Masks optional-Hybrid position - work from home on occasion
Ability to commute/relocate:

Canborough, ON N0A 1C0: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Title: SAS analyst developer
Description:
Primary Locations: Montreal, Quebec
Attendance: Hybrid

Employee Status: Regular


 Schedule: Full-time


 Do you love challenges?
 Do you like to analyze business needs with the goal of resolving issues that are often quite complex?
 Are you passionate about data? Do you know how to build solid partnerships with business and technology sectors?

 Come join the Advanced Analytics Delivery team! This dynamic and innovative team works on data valorization projects. Join us and be part of a team that will define data analytics of the future.
 Being an SAS Developer in our team means helping other developers, analysts, IT solution architects and business sectors to manage the corporate SAS platform and implement analytics solutions for all Bank sectors. You’ll be part of a team that aims to learn continuously in order to ensure innovative management of data systems.
 Day-to-day tasks:
 Your main challenges

 Conduct various analyses, make recommendations to address business issues in an efficient and sustainable way, and implement them according to the highest of quality standards
 Provide leadership to help users understand and make the best choices
 Certify or modify existing applications and programs based on the needs of users, business imperatives and technology requirements
 Help maintain and upgrade the SAS platform, access management and data security
 Help migrate the SAS platform to the AWS Cloud and integrate SAS Viya into the Horizon advanced analytics ecosystem
 Analyze requests for changes to systems, assess their impact on existing applications, and suggest and carry out the appropriate changes
 Ensure the integrity of computerized data and system stability

 More specifically, you will:

 Analyze, program, and/or optimize the SAS code
 Ensure the technical feasibility of requested changes and understand the business field and industry requirements
 Analyze and review the logic and documentation of existing systems under your responsibility, as needed
 Investigate and resolve problems of varying complexity for application or infrastructure systems
 Monitor control mechanisms to ensure they satisfy user needs and business imperatives
 Establish communication mechanisms with other delivery teams and the business sectors
 Manage adequate and optimal use of software and infrastructure resources
 Meet user requests and help them further their knowledge of SAS

 Requirements

 University degree or academic equivalent in a related field and 5 years of relevant experience
 Experience in SAS program development and support
 Knowledge of the SAS Viya platform, an asset
 Experience with databases
 Knowledge of Unix and Linux
 Knowledge of the banking industry and modelling, desirable
 Knowledge of programming statistical models, an asset
 Knowledge of Agile and DevOps methodologies, desirable
 Knowledge of data protection, desirable
 Leadership, professionalism and interpersonal skills
 Bilingualism, spoken and written (English and French)


 Your benefits
 Upon hiring, you'll be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:

 Health and wellness program, including many benefits
 Flexible group insurance
 Pension plan
 Employee Share Ownership Plan
 Employee and Family Assistance Program
 Preferential banking services
 Community involvement program
 Telemedicine
 Virtual sleep clinic.

 These are just some of the many benefits we offer.
 Being part of the National Bank team means being able to reach your full potential thanks to the many career development opportunities in different sectors, on different projects and with different teams.
 Due to the current pandemic, our entire team is currently working remotely.
 People first
 We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have positive impact on people’s lives.
 Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that's accessible to all employees.
 We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodation, feel free to let us know during our initial conversations.

 Are you ready to live your ambitions?

Title: OPERATIONAL BUSINESS ANALYST (12 MONTHS)
Description:
This position is primarily responsible for reporting on the services provided by Community Legal Clinics and Student Legal Services Offices. The position will be required to work with different LAO departments, external stakeholders (community legal clinics, Ministry of the Attorney General, Auditor General, etc.) and the CLSD Vice President and Director.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role?

 Lead the statistical evaluation of entity service provider performance, according to service contract and LAO policies and directives through review and analysis of financial, statistical and operational reports.  
Lead the regular reporting for the entity service provider program; the program involves qualitative and quantitative reporting from 79 entity service providers.  
Analyze service plan submissions for alignment within expected service levels and relevant priorities
 Analyze population needs, program targets and benchmark in order to recommend service considerations for entity service providers.  
Develop business cases, including recommendations, to support the LAO executive and board of policy, program development and issues pertaining to the transfer payment sector.  
Research and integrate external data into business priority recommendations, examples of sources could include StatsCan, Government open data and/or reports on social trends, NGO reports, etc.  
Collaboration with other departments, external service providers and other stakeholders to improve service needs and reporting requirements.  
Assess impacts of agency decisions (e.g., to reduce or terminate services) to identify and resolve service problems and service gaps.  
Evaluate a range of information/data, impact analysis to determine risks, use benchmarks for assessment of agency and social service system performance and recommend funding allocations in the context of funding pressures.  
Evaluate current service delivery capacity against projected needs and develop short and long-term plans.  Interpret data and create standardized reports for the Clinic Law Services Division, for senior management and for external publication.  
Receive, manage, summarize and analyze data reports provided by service providers.

 How do I qualify?
 Required skills and experience

 Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in statistics, economics, mathematics or finance  
Experience of public administration, organizational theory and practices, community development, social service delivery, LAO and other government/NGO programs.  
Experience in effective business planning within a rationalized system of social programs, developing options, and recommending action plans to accomplish strategic and operational requirements.  
Experience using analytical and quantitative methodologies to develop data and apply benchmarks in analyzing a large variety of financial and operational statistical information to assess agency and social service system performance, conduct or participate in operational reviews and program evaluations.  
Experience with strategic planning, service delivery and client service standards to establish funding and service targets/outcomes to deliver services within system management framework.  
Knowledge of Ontario's not-for-profit sector focusing on social services and access to justice.  
Knowledge of social and economic factors that contribute to the marginalization of individuals suffering poverty.  
Financial management skills and knowledge  
Basic Business Law knowledge and understanding of not-for-profit corporations.  
Ability to remain flexible and work under pressure meeting project timelines  
Demonstrates professionalism across working relationships within LAO and the stakeholders  
Professional, positive, and supportive team player  
Attention to detail, excellent organizational abilities, as well as excellent verbal and written skills

 Legal Aid Ontario values integrity, respect, responsiveness, excellence, independence, accountability, openness and consistency. Our recruitment process reflects our commitment to diversity and inclusion.
  
 Accommodations are available upon request.
  
 Legal Aid Ontario encourages applicants from equity seeking groups, including but not limited to individuals who are First Nations, Inuit or Métis descent, persons with disabilities, women, members of racialized communities and the 2SLGBTQ+ community. We recognize the value of diversity, equity and inclusion and are committed to addressing systemic barriers, and attracting and retaining diverse staff. All interested and eligible people will be considered, with due consideration to all protected grounds under the Ontario Human Rights Code.

Title: Programmer Analyst
Description:
RealDecoy develops leading web and mobile solutions for clients in the Caribbean and North America. We work in verticals across Finance, Search, Commerce, and Product Development – adapting constantly to diverse technical and business needs with innovative solutions and fresh ideas.
This position requires the successful candidate to work as a member of a contracted team embedded onsite within the Canadian Department of National Defence in Ottawa, Canada. The team supports military analysts and senior leaders making long-term strategic planning decisions. The successful candidate may have opportunities to perform data analysis, data science, business analysis, and database analyst tasks to support rapidly evolving requirements and priorities in a results-focused environment.
To qualify, you: 

Must be able to obtain and maintain a valid Canadian Security Clearance at the level of SECRET; and
Must be a citizen of Canada.

As the ideal candidate, you: 

Must hold a Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Computer Science.
Must have a minimum of 3 years’ experience within the last five (5) years:
Developing technical architectures, frameworks, and strategies.
Analyzing and evaluating alternative technological solutions and tools or making recommendations on custom Business Intelligence solutions to address business problems.
Integrating multiple technologies into a single Business Intelligence solution.
Designing, developing, or modifying code and software for custom applications to address functional requirements.
Configuring or tailoring Business Intelligence solutions in support of optimizing information layers to align to analytical views (user interface), models, and visualizations.
Providing coherent user and technical documentation for developed Business Intelligence solutions.
Conceiving, designing, and implementing various Business Intelligence solutions and data discovery tools.
Conceiving, designing, and implementing custom Business Intelligence applications in support of process or data modelling, analysis, and visualization.
Utilizing Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) tools.


Must have a strong oral and written command of the English language.

Responsibilities: 

Develop solutions to support enterprise decision-making processes, involving some, or all, of the following: business analysis, requirements elicitation, solution design, solution implementation, testing, deployment, operations, and maintenance.
Work in close collaboration with military subject matter experts to elicit functional requirements and design solutions suitable to support senior decision makers.
Support business initiatives with tools such as Tableau and Qlik to perform analysis and surface relevant data as visualizations.
Frequent direct and independent interactions with senior personnel of the Canadian Armed Forces and the Department of National Defence.
Participate in processes for elicitation and prioritization of user data needs.
Identify requirements for improvements to existing solutions by determining users' functional and system non-functional requirements.
Write system configuration and maintenance documentation.
Work both independently and as part of a larger development team.
Effective time management, prioritizing work independently.

Required skills include: 

General Skills
Managing multiple concurrent initiatives based upon client’s shifting priorities.
Problem solving, critical thinking.
Discussing solution requirements with business users


Development Skills
General development skills (ex: Python, C#, Java)
Full stack web development
SQL
ETL Tools


Data Analysis Skills
Microsoft Excel
One of: Tableau, Qlik Sense, PowerBI

Our People & CultureRealDecoy is a professional services firm focused on creating meaningful experiences for our clients. Engineering is at the heart of what we do, and we use that passion to craft truly personalized experiences for our customers that are transformative in achieving their goals. We achieve this consistency by fostering a culture of openness: embracing the best ideas in the room, respecting everyone's voice, and exemplifying our core values – We Care, We Lead, We Learn – in everything that we do. Here you will find diversity to be an organic part of who we are as a company because we believe our individual differences allow us to remain fresh, inclusive, and impactful.
*_Benefits: _*We offer a generous compensation package with benefits that include:

Comprehensive Health, Dental, and Life Insurance
15+ days of paid time-off
Hybrid work schedule (in-office & remote)
Learning allowance
Wellness allowance
Internet service allowance

Kindly note: Due to the nature of the work, the successful candidate will be required to live in the National Capital Region (Ottawa-Gatineau metropolitan area) of Canada and (for security reasons) be able to work onsite at Department of National Defence Headquarters (60 Moodie Dr) almost full time. (A small amount of off-site work is possible.)
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Analyst. Core and Performance
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Core Platforms team is part of the Corporate Transformation & Operations (CTO) department within the TD Bank Group Human Resources function. Corporate Transformation & Operations (CTO) is a multi-functional area focused on enabling a legendary colleague experience at TD through:


 Enhancement of HR Application User Experience with innovative ways of delivering HR services
 Strengthening HR Change Management capabilities to execute with excellence
 Optimizing HR processes to simplify colleague experience and reduce HR operating costs

  The HR Business Solutions team is responsible for functional leadership and business operational management of our HR technology platforms with a focus on designing and implementing forward-looking solutions to improve our HR application colleague experience.



Job Description

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Talent, the Business Analyst will maintain the ongoing operations and design, configuration, and deployment of HR Business Processes in MyHR (Powered by Workday) and SuccessFactors(P3).

 Participating in design sessions and requirements gathering
 Working with various stakeholders to understand & clarify requirements throughout various phases of implementation
 Developing operating procedures – evaluating current operating procedures and adapting them for future state of new system
 Evaluating and testing system upgrades
 Writing and executing test cases Validating data and reconciling data conversion
 Document internal workings of software and processes, including workflows of internally developed software and workflows and procedures of third-party software. When documentation does not exist, ensure it is created and maintained
 Recommend process improvements and an implementation plan to streamline and provide efficiencies through automation and process redesign
 Use a combination of product knowledge, data, and teamwork to ensure we provide well-crafted solutions to the Talent team, other corporate functions, managers, and employees in a consultative capacity

 Key Accountabilities
 

 Provide end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitor reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identify potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements
 Manage day-to-day administration of Workday including monthly tasks, quarterly performance forms, tier 2 support, configuration, testing, and troubleshooting of issues related to business processes
 Communicate system availability & outages to business partners/users
 Perform routine break/fix support and regression testing and support the inbound/outbound interfaces to the system
 Assist in the development of detailed system requirements, test plans and training materials
 Review, analyze and create detailed documentation of business processes and systems functionality
 Identify and recommend process improvements, system enhancements
 Deliver subject matter expertise on HR systems based upon functional areas or projects assigned.
 Develop and articulate solution options that consider technical landscape as well as incorporates user experience, scalability, security and best practices
 Provide input to change management strategy and deployment from a systems perspective.
 Develop and implement support models for new functionality/systems deployments.
 Remain informed on current Talent Technology trends and new systems release features for incumbent applications.




Job Requirements


Tech savvy with strong knowledge and familiarity with leading edge HR solutions (MyHR/Workday and SuccessFactors(P3) experience)
 Related experience in system and process implementation
 Strong computer literacy – spreadsheets, data mapping, database software skills
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 Strong business acumen and strategic thinking skills, logical problem-solving skills
 Good interpersonal and collaboration skills
 Innovative with the aptitude to apply design thinking principles to re-imagine the colleague experience from a user perspective
 Ability to juggle multiple priorities




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Analyst / Project Manager
Description:
About the Role
Are you a self-driven business analyst who has experience working in different phases of a project? Have you been working as the Project Manager on a few projects? Do you enjoy being involved in projects from the ground up, taking them from concept to successful completion with minimal oversight? The successful candidate will work directly with clients and manage projects to implement new systems and solutions. You will listen to customers’ budgeting needs, analyze their current processes, implement those processes, and ensure that the deliverables fall within the scope of the implementation.
As this role is multi-skilled, our team members are not expected to start with competence in all areas on day one. Coming from different professional backgrounds, our successful Analysts/PMs have in common the ability to learn and adapt, a high comfort level with software applications, excellence in handling data, and professionalism in a client-facing commercial context. With that said, prior knowledge of mid-market ERP systems implementation is a big plus!
Please note:  We are currently only considering candidates located in Canada.
What You'll Do 

Work within a supportive team to identify, define, and deliver business improvement opportunities for clients.


Work can include process mapping and definition, research, data, and systems analysis, project management, and change management activities.


Monitor project progress by creating a project plan, tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, recommending actions, and managing client expectations.


Improve systems by studying current practices and documenting requirements for the client stakeholders and the technical teams.


Facilitate meetings with Kwixand team members and clients, creating agendas and meeting notes.


Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues for Kwixand team members and their clients.


Perform quality assurance of work products completed by the team before delivery to clients.


Recommend controls by identifying problems and writing improved procedures for Kwixand team members.


Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes, document as part of the change management process.


Coach and support clients throughout the project process and long-term adoption of their business improvements.


Lead the delivery of smaller to mid-sized projects.

Who We Are Looking For: 

Creative systems thinkers who are passionate about continuous process improvement and interested in business and systems analysis, project management, and change management.


You take the time to listen to stakeholders, see things from their perspectives, and celebrate success.


You understand that technology doesn’t solve everything - sometimes, a process tweak can make a world of difference. Your Agile mindset helps you focus on continual improvement and delivering real business value.


You are highly flexible when it comes to getting things done. A friendly and collaborative environment is more important to you than a structured one. You want to work on meaningful, high-impact projects.

Essential Qualifications: 

Post-secondary degree in the field of Commerce, Business Administration, Information Technology, Project Management, Business Analysis, or other related disciplines.


Experience leading business analysis, process mapping, and process improvement.


Experience engaging with stakeholders and clients to gather requirements and develop workflows and solutions.


Experience producing technical and analytical reports for senior management.


Experience in business analysis for software implementation projects will be considered an asset. This includes experience in LEAN methodology.


Experience with project management, including experience with agile methodology and change management concepts.


Experience in designing and facilitating workshops, including business and strategic workshops, will be considered an asset.

Note: If your resume shows education, training, and/or experience equivalent to the essential qualifications listed above, your application may be equally considered.
Skills & Requirements: 

Minimum of 3 years of experience as a business analyst.


Minimum 2 years of experience as a project manager.


Strong knowledge of any ERP solution.


Experienced in leading a team.


Excellent verbal and written communications skills.


Excellent research, analytical and problem-solving skills.


Excellent team-building and collaboration skills.


Ability to establish strong and effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


Exceptional client service focus.


Strategic thinking skills.

About Us: 
Kwixand Solutions Inc. is a Microsoft Silver Partner and Microsoft IT consulting firm. We help our clients successfully leverage Microsoft solutions to increase productivity, connect their workforce, and increase organizational agility and performance. Our primary areas of expertise include Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Office 365, and Business Intelligence (BI).
This is a unique and exciting opportunity to join a young and fast-growing company and make a significant impact on your career. We are a Microsoft Partner and Cloud Solution Provider that strives to become a leader in its field. Apply to work with a company that values independence, flexibility, and personal growth!
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

Are you located in Canada?

Experience:

Project management: 2 years (preferred)
Business analyst: 3 years (preferred)

Title: Business Analyst - Contractor
Description:
We currently have a contract position available for an Independent Contractor in the capacity of Business Analyst. If you are passionate about the ability for technology to drive business performance and you love working various stakeholders to define requirements, this role is for you.  Peace Hills Insurance has a strong history of leveraging technology to enable our business partners to delivery world-class service to our customers. The contracted activities include the delivery of a fully documented data structure, the development of a data warehouse/data lake as well as involvement in project scoping and the implementation process.

The successful contractor in this role will have these characteristics:

High Say-Do Ratio: You do what you say you will do and follow through with commitments. We measure our success not on our plans but on our ability to successfully execute and deliver value to the 
Masterful Multi-Tasker: You balance competing priorities and can meet your commitments across multiple 
Active Problem Solver: When you see an issue that has an ability to impact your projects you jump in to resolve the issue to keep the projects on 
Innately Inquisitive: You love to tackle a new challenge and learn all about it from every perspective. 
Technology Aficionado: The application of technology to solve business problems is one of your passions. You can look at a business problem and understand how technology can be used to deliver amazing staff, partner, and customer 
Natural Communicator: You distill complex concepts and problems into clear and easy to understand communications for individuals at all levels of the 
Team Player: You recognize that large transformations are only successful when a team is working together effectively. 
Proven Performer: You have a history of success in large technology-based You have a history of successfully leading business analysis for complex technology driven transformations.

Deliverables:

Gather requirements within a transformational project for data related projects
Ensure requirements are understood and testable
Ensure that final requirements are tested and signed off
Ensure reciprocal business needs or limitations are considered throughout all stages of the project

Prior experience and qualifications of interest include:

Active business registration to operate as an Independent Contractor
Post-secondary degree in business, information technology, or related field
7 years of experience as a Business Analyst with at least 2 years as an Independent Contractor
Experience within system implementation projects
Experience with business process mapping 
Experience in data mapping, reconciliation
Exceptional communication skills across a range of forums and channels and stakeholders
Experience with Atlassian JIRA system or similar 
Experience within enterprise data warehouse/data lake projects would be an asset
Exceptional documentation and presentation skills
BABOK/CBAP, or equivalent certification is an asset
Experience in insurance, financial services, or other highly regulated industries would be considered an asset


Working at Peace Hills


Peace Hills understands that by reducing work-life struggles, individuals can enjoy a healthier lifestyle while improving productivity at work. Offering a collegial work environment and a work-life balance are just two of the ways we do this.
 If you are interested in this opportunity, submit your resume stating which position you are applying for to Peace Hills Insurance to hr@phgic.com.
 We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted.








Application Deadline: July 25, 2022

Title: Business Solutions Analyst
Description:
We are currently seeking a Business Solutions Analyst for our client in the Oil and Gas sector. This HR Advisor will be responsible for developing and maintaining reports to support the operations of the Human Resources team. The ideal candidate will have 5 years of experience in HR analytics, and a strong proficiency with Power BI visualization and dataflows, MS Excel and Power Query. This contract position is based in their Calgary office.
 
 Tasks and Responsibilities:
 
 Develop and maintain data collection tool on a daily/weekly basis to support Human Resources team members including scheduled data refresh, extraction of working files and change / enhancements (requires close collaboration and alignment with all HR reporting to ensure consistency and accuracy)


Providing data process support for HR Operations team related to data management and integrity and technical use of the tool


Engagement with HR Stakeholders on data needs based on unique requirements per project


Provide custom data and reporting to track progress of each initiative


Ensure data aligns to standard metrics and also adheres to strict privacy standards. Support the infrastructure used to store the data and tool


Evaluate data and report requests, working closely with stakeholders to refine and deliver the required output


Manage the intake and prioritize conflicting high priority requests


Analyze and profile large, complex, multidimensional datasets with a variety of tools


Perform indepth analysis with a continuous improvement mindset to identify trends and/or causal relationships to provide relevant, credible and actionable recommendations used to monitor and measure the effective and efficient delivery of end-to-end processes


Participate in key projects providing input on how to best leverage the information available to assist in building requirements and/or validating business assumptions
 Skills and Qualifications:
 
 Five years of reporting and analytical experience


Advanced proficiency with HCM custom reporting, Power BI visualization and dataflows, Microsoft Excel and Power Query


Preference for experience with workday custom reporting


Strong presentation, communication and facilitation skills


A collaborative approach to achieve the best results and deliver the most value

The aptitude for communicating complex information into meaningful insights


The ability to manage deadlines independently

Experience developing Human Resource KPIs and metrics

Title: Analyst, Pension Insights
Description:
Why join us? 

 Our people make all the difference in our success. 

 As the Analyst, Pension Insights, you will be joining Pension Data & Operations within OMERS to enable cross-platform success for Pensions data – maturing and evolving our data program to enable broader data capabilities and drive analytical insights . 

 This is an exciting opportunity for emerging analysts with an interest in pensions and working with data to advance their career within a growing team. You will help drive analytics and insights by administering and delivering reports, enabling all Pensions teams to make pension administration decisions grounded in data. Reporting to the Lead, Pension Insights, you will use your analytical and problem-solving skills to explore insights about our members by utilizing a pension knowledge base. 

 A successful candidate will be responsible for developing a broad range of reports, conducting a wide variety of data analysis and peer reviewing. Will work collaboratively across several teams within OMERS, including but not limited to, Member Experience, Technology, Legal and Quality Assurance. The Analyst will interact with internal and external stakeholders while always upholding and demonstrating the OMERS vision and core mission. 


To note: We value our talented colleagues, and whenever possible, strive to help them grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you see yourself in this open position, we encourage you to apply! 


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
 Preparing reports for various key stakeholders to present meaningful insights 

 Analyzing large data sets and deriving key metrics and insights 

 Writing reporting requirements 

 Validating and peer reviewing data extracts 

 Ensuring data privacy and protection following OMERS internal guidelines when handling and transporting data 

 Building dashboards and various reports in Power BI 

 Creating visualizations in PowerPoint 

 Working collaboratively across a variety of technical, data science, and business teams 

 Assisting in the development of strategies and tools to deliver on the mandate and objectives of the Pension Insights team 

 Documenting methodologies and procedures utilized for team deliverables 

 To succeed in this role, you have 

 Experience with large scale data projects, including requirements, data collection, data cleaning, and analysis 

 2-3 years of relevant experience (e.g. pension administration, actuarial, consulting, analytics) 

 University degree or equivalent 

 1+ years of experience with Excel and Word 

 Exceptional problem-solving skills and critical thinking applied to data lifecycle 

 Experience working with teams in a fast-paced setting 

 Demonstrable skills in problem-solving and critical thinking 

 Interest and curiosity in learning new ways to leverage technology to mature the approach we take to our work 

 Ability to prepare and format data for presentations in Power Point 

 Knowledge of the OMERS Plan, systems and processes is an asset 

 Experience in SQL is an asset 

 Experience in Power BI is an asset 

 The Pensions Team is constantly evolving, and your role may evolve with it. OMERS is committed to helping you learn and grow alongside us. 


Our story:
 Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Analyst, Commercial Emerging Talent
Category Business Analyst, Automotive
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibly embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 
The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians for the jobs and joys of life in Canada, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers. 
As a key member of our buying team you will be at the hub of our retail organization. You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment for our stores by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. 
Who you are 
We are looking for individuals who are: 
• Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment 
• Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business 
• Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business 
• Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward 
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be. 
What you bring 
• You have an undergraduate and/or post graduate degree in Business, Commerce, Retail Management or Data & Analytics with experience in retail in an analytical role, is an asset. New graduates are welcome to apply! 
• Demonstrated ability to collaborate, influence, and negotiate with colleagues or more senior business members 
• Strong presentation skills with demonstrated ability to adjust style and format as required to suit the audience 
Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. 
About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn. 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Automotive 
 

  Ontario-Toronto 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Recreation and Sport Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 36362

 Company
Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


 Main Purpose and Function
The Recreation and Sport Analyst is a new position responsible for supporting the work undertaken in the Recreation Strategy and Innovation portfolio. The Analyst will lead, coordinate and/or support a range of projects to advance/improve recreation and sport related strategies, plans, policies, procedures, agreements, facility development and business process improvements. Key responsibilities include conducting, reporting, making recommendations and presenting on various types of research and analysis, such as gap and data analysis, qualitative and quantitative options analysis, current and future state mapping, process evaluation and optimization, etc.


The Analyst undertakes work that supports management decisions concerning future state and ongoing operations and/or issues/opportunities related to a specific project, which can be very significant in terms of financial implications and risk. All work is undertaken with an equity, inclusion and decolonization lens.


Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
The position reports to the Manager Recreation Strategy and Innovation within the Recreation Division of the Vancouver Board of Parks and Recreation. The position will work collaboratively with various divisions and departments within the City as well as external groups such as non-profit sport and community organizations, private sector stakeholders, public and private schools and boards and other levels of government.


Specific Duties/Responsibilities

Researches, drafts and supports the development, evolution and ongoing management of recreation-related policies, standards, procedures, strategies, plans, agreements, audits and studies resolving issues and initiating continuous improvement processes as needed.
Identify organizational and business process impacts expected to result from the implementation of new policies, standards, procedures - recommends and implements strategies to minimize those impacts. These include: reassignment of work, rebalancing of workloads, changes to positions or staffing levels, redefinition of staff roles/ responsibilities, reengineering of business processes; helps to build business cases for additional resourcing.
Supports project team members and management in effectively using metrics, financial information, quantitative data and/or qualitative information to identify issues and opportunities, establish key performance indicators and to inform operational and project-related decision-making.
Monitors and makes recommendations on adoption of recreation, sport and health industry standards, trends and best practices; conducts benchmarking, peer surveys, develops, maintains and communicates relevant information to assist with decision-making
Makes recommendations on preferred solutions and develops business cases and value proposition documents including: costs/benefits analysis, financial modelling, risk analysis and initial project planning (scope, budget, timeline, customer objectives and expectations)
Plans, supports and facilitates/implements public engagement and internal/external stakeholder processes
Synthesizes and consolidates complex information into succinct and meaningful written and verbal management reporting, leveraging productivity tools such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Leads or contributes to the development of reports, memos and presentations to the Director, General Manager, Park Board, Council and Committees providing information and recommendations on relevant initiatives as required
Assists or stands in for the Manager, Recreation Strategy and Innovation, at meetings and presentations
May supervise staff, volunteers or coop students.
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.


 
Minimum Qualification Requirements
Education and Experience:

A bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Public Policy, Sport/Recreation Management or a related area.
A minimum of five years’ experience in a position with primary responsibility for undertaking business analytics, data analysis, research, business process reviews/re-engineering and management reporting to support complex and multi-faceted business, operations and/or service delivery projects, to include experience working directly with and/or reporting to senior management in a large organisation
Certifications such as International Institute of Business Analysis or Lean Six Sigma to be considered an asset.
Experience in a municipal recreation setting and with ActiveNet considered an asset.


 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Considerable knowledge of analytics, quality improvement tools, techniques and methodologies.
Considerable knowledge of office productivity tools to effectively research, analyse and communicate.
Considerable knowledge of project management methodologies and standards.
Ability to systematically frame and analyse an issue, opportunity or policy problem, and think innovatively to arrive at a solution that is supported by a balance of facts and good judgment;. present solutions in clear and compelling terms
Excellent organisational skills; Ability to concurrently manage multiple tasks and competing priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to present analyses and solutions in clear and compelling terms, via superior written communication, verbal communication and presentation skills, and especially the ability to create effective and compelling PowerPoint presentations and written reports.
Ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts and team members to provide advice, information and assistance, as well as with senior management.
Ability to manage change and assist people with adapting to change


 
Additional skills or attributes that would be considered an asset for this position are:

Experience working on projects within a municipality and with multiple city departments, a municipal partner, or within another government setting
Experience working with diverse stakeholders and interest groups
Experience in human centred design and/or GBA+
Experience in or knowledge of the Canadian sport system


 
In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process includes answering the following questions in your cover letter.




Please identify the most influential policy, strategy or guideline document impacting sport or recreation in Canada. In one paragraph or less, please tell us why it is important.


Vancouver’s Sport Strategy was one of the first plans developed in Canada to be based on the Long Term Athlete Development model. In one paragraph or less, illustrate the importance of the LTAD model in the municipal setting. 


There are two professional municipal parks and recreation organizations based in BC. Please identify one.


Do you have experience working with ActiveNet?



 
Where operationally appropriate and subject to change, the City of Vancouver has a Flexible Work Program. This program allows staff to work remotely 1 – 4 days a week from locations that are a daily commutable distance from their work at a City worksite. At this time this position is eligible to be part of the Flexible Work Program.


The City of Vancouver has a COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination Policy. All external applicants applying to the City of Vancouver are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire and subject to this policy as a condition of ongoing employment. Candidates may only be exempted from this requirement if they request and are approved for an accommodation based on a reason related to a Human Rights Code ground (such as disability). Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.


Business Unit/Department: Board of Parks & Recreation (1400)
Affiliation: Exempt
Employment Type: Temporary Full Time
Position Start Date: August, 2022
Position End Date: August, 2023
Salary Information: Pay Band RNG-080: $89,283 to $111,609


Application Close: July 13, 2022
At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, LGBT2Q+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.


Before you click Apply now
Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date. 
In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx.. 5-10mins. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a tailored summary of skills and experience related to the position.

Title: HR Systems & Business Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity:  Providence Health Care’s HR Systems & Reporting team is currently looking for a HR Systems & Business Analyst. 
What does the HR Systems & Reporting team do?
 This team oversees the analysis of Human Resource data in order to identify trends in the workforce and opportunities for the organization to improve our processes. This team also ensures integrity of the HR Systems data, and supports accurate reporting for analysis and presentation. 
What you will do:  Working alongside Juveth Loresco (Manager, Workforce Planning & Data Analytics) you will assist the HR Systems & Reporting team with HR data deliverables. Some specifics include:

Assessing needs for various business functions through working with all levels of HR staff.
Identifying and analyzing options and recommending business process enhancements.
Assisting in developing reports needed by various users of HR data across the organization.
Leading and facilitating the rollout of new systems and upgrades alongside HR business stakeholders.
Ensuring data integrity by developing and implementing data auditing systems/practices and conducting data audits.

About you:

Degree in Information Technology, Human Resources, Business Administration or related field.
Three (3) to five (5) years’ related experience in data analysis and data quality management, including the use of querying tools (e.g. SQL, PeopleSoft, Access, Excel) to access relational databases, and analysis tools (e.g. Tableau, SSRS, SPSS, Python, R)Strong statistical skills to analyze data and information.
Ability to understand business requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications.
Ability to foster collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

About us:
 Driven by compassion and social justice, we are at the forefront of exceptional care and innovation. Our organization, Providence Health Care, is a proud winner of three prestigious awards:

2022 Canada’s Best Diversity Employers
2022 BC’s Top Employers
2022 Canada’s Top Employers for Young People

What we offer:

The salary range for this role is $65,254 - $93,802 per year, depending on experience.
A comprehensive health benefit package, including dental, vision, and life coverage.
An orientation session and comprehensive onboarding to all new hires.
A chance to grow professionally and personally, as part of a supportive team driven by innovation and the desire to address the future health needs of patients, families and our communities.

We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent. If your experience is close to the qualifications listed here, please still consider applying.
 Providence Health Care is committed to creating an equitable and inclusive workplace for all employees. We strongly believe in an environment where everyone feels valued and respected, which is reflected in our motto “how you want to be treated.” We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, and encourage applications from underrepresented communities, including (but not limited to) BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+, immigrants, and people with disabilities.

Title: Systems Analyst II
Description:
Staff - Non Union
 

   Job Category
  M&P - AAPS
 

   Job Profile
  AAPS Salaried - Information Systems and Technology, Level D
 

   Job Title
  Systems Analyst II
 

   Department
  OCIO | Engagement Services - Academic | Faculty Support
 

   Compensation Range
  7,278.33 - $11,372.33 CAD Monthly
 

   Posting End Date
  July 14, 2022
 

   Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
 


   Job End Date
  Jul 10, 2024
 

   Job Summary
 

   The Systems Analyst II designs, implements, integrates and supports complex or campus-wide vendor supplied and custom-built applications.
 


   The incumbent may be assigned responsibilities for specific departments and will act as an advocate to champion the needs of those departments. This will include coaching business decision makers, understanding the impact of technical changes on business processes and leveraging common approaches and resources between departments.
 


   This position also acts as a subject matter expert, and provides technical leadership, business process analysis, systems support coordination, and application lifecycle management.
 

 Organizational Status
 

   This role interacts directly with other UBC technology professionals across the UBC community. This position reports to an assigned IT Service Delivery Manager.
 

 Work Performed
 

   Specific Duties:
 

 Designs, implements and maintains departmental IT infrastructure for Application Sustainment to facilitate efficient and effective use of systems for day-to-day operations.
 Facilitates the implementation and maintenance of departmental and enterprise applications. Coordinates the integration of these applications with other UBC systems and services.
 Designs, develops and programs custom software, defines detailed application specifications, standards, and diagrams and develops coding logic flowcharts.
 Resolves complex application related failures and defects independently or in consultation with other IT professionals.
 Perform in-depth troubleshooting using knowledge of network/server administration, internet protocols, database architecture and application configuration.
 Designs and maintains complex databases using a variety of platforms to support application and research environments.
 Provide custom reporting, data analysis and extracts.
 Deploys and maintains websites custom built to client specifications using a variety of frameworks.
 Participates in the assessment of client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify business priorities and recommend options.
 Identifies, elicits, and documents business requirements, defines business rules and communicates requirements for the implementation of solutions.
 Performs formal system audits and develop written procedures, standards and practices to ensure a high level of availability, security, data integrity and hardware/software compatibility.
 Liaises directly and indirectly with vendors and other service owners.
 Implements, configures, monitors, tests, troubleshoots and resolves issues with servers and system software



   Core Duties:
 

 Researches and evaluates vendor supplied applications, develops recommendations, and implements accordingly.
 Analyzes and reviews existing or proposed system features and integration, security, scalability and performance requirements with clients, business analysts, and team members.
 Manages production and non-production application environments.
 Maintains core application infrastructure, including virtual servers, networks and firewalls.
 Plans and performs global configuration changes or module deployments for enterprise or complex applications.
 Integrates vendor supplied applications with existing infrastructure and applications through custom interfaces and components.
 Manages small to medium sized projects and related budgets.
 Provides technical expertise, training, and consultation to other staff.
 Develops or modifies software code to meet specifications or facilitate integration.
 Conducts testing of new or customized application modules to ensure application meets specifications.
 Develops application documentation requirements for functions, modifications, backups and operating procedures. Provides ongoing maintenance and operational support for applications.
 Supports application lifecycle and applies and follows appropriate change management methodologies and best practices.
 Maintains appropriate professional designations and up-to-date knowledge of current information technology techniques and tools and provides input to strategies for ongoing support and upgrade of these systems.
 Builds and maintains good working relationships and collaborates with others to achieve client objectives.
 Performs other related duties as required.


 Consequence of Error/Judgement
 

   This position takes an active, participatory role in ensuring the reliability and high availability of assigned systems, including application monitoring, tier 2 support, problem analysis and resolution, and ensuring services meet or exceed customer service levels at all times.
 


   Errors in judgment, poor planning, or failure to act decisively could have a detrimental effect on the operation of the University. Poor operation of systems will result in damage to the reputation of UBC. Unreliable systems and code errors that disrupt the operations, or failure to meet contractual obligations for performance and availability will damage the reputation of UBC and UBC-IT.
 

 Supervision Received
 

   Works autonomously and with other IT colleagues in accordance with general instructions as to methods and procedures.
 

   Reports directly to an assigned IT Service Delivery Manager. Results are reviewed for achievement of overall and long-term objectives.
 

 Supervision Given
 

   May be required to lead and mentor less experienced Systems Analysts on specific projects or tasks.
 

 Minimum Qualifications
   Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. In-depth knowledge of applications and the business requirements supporting them. Minimum of five years of related experience, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
  
 Preferred Qualifications
 


    Technical school diploma in computing systems technology an asset. Extensive experience with Microsoft Windows and Linux operating systems in a complex network environment is preferred. Experience with network management and security tools including intrusion detection, proxy servers and firewalls. In-depth knowledge and experience of applications and supporting business requirements. Expertise in the design, development and implementation of specific applications.
  


    Experience creating custom and modifying packaged reports with various reporting technologies (i.e Crystal Reports). Experience working with both technical and non-technical clients. Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and priorities while working under pressure to meet critical, time sensitive deadlines. Strong organizational and planning skills.
  


    Possesses knowledge and experience of the following:
  

 Application development tools including; HTML, ASP .NET, PHP and Java.
 Using PowerShell and other scripting languages.
 All industry standard web servers (i.e. Microsoft Internet Information Server, Apache, etc).
 Managing Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL and Postgres database platforms.



    Collaboration - Actively solicits ideas and opinions from others to efficiently and effectively accomplish specific objectives targeted at defined business outcomes. Openly encourages other team members to voice their ideas and concerns.
  

    Shows respect for differences and diversity, and disagrees without personalizing issues. Utilizes strengths of team members to achieve optimal performance.
  


    Communication for Results - Conducts discussions with and writes memoranda to all levels of colleagues and peer groups in ways that support troubleshooting and problem solving. Seeks and shares relevant information, opinions, and judgments. Handles conflict empathetically. Explains the context of interrelated situations, asks probing questions, and solicits multiple sources of advice prior to taking action when appropriate.
  


    Problem Solving - Applies problem-solving methodologies and tools to diagnose and solve operational and interpersonal problems. Determines the potential causes of the problem and devises testing methodologies for validation. Shows empathy and objectivity toward individuals involved in the issue. Analyzes multiple alternatives, risks, and benefits for a range of potential solutions. Recommends resource requirements and collaborates with impacted stakeholders.
  


    Accountability - Sets objectives that meet organizational needs. Provides recommendations to individuals and teams on ways to improve performance and meet defined objectives. Monitors and provides feedback on individual and team performance against defined standards.
  


    Business Process Knowledge - Maps full business processes and designs operational process flow. Facilitates group input and drafts proposals for process improvements. Identifies resource implications. Implements process improvement recommendations within the context of overall business processes.
  


    Information Systems Knowledge - Resolves escalated problems of technical support. Identifies root causes. Sets up and integrates new and enhanced information systems. Identifies customer needs and determines the appropriate approach to apply and ensure resolution. Solicits the input of appropriate technical experts and managers as required.

Title: Market Research Analyst (Full-Time)
Description:
Job Description: 
  Market Research Analyst  Full-Time (Toronto, ON)
 Zonda Home Canada is redefining the future of housing. We are the parent company of Zonda Urban and perfectly placed in the heart of the fast-growing real estate industry. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Here at Zonda, you’ll be able to use your passion and curiosity to drive the next generation of real estate analysts, advisors, and technologists. Zonda is looking for a passionate Market Research Analyst to evolve and expand our team.

 Zonda looks for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. When you join our team, you’ll be in a unique position to make a change with every project. You’ll use your full range of skills to build great experiences and learn about the real estate industry, economics, and data. You’ll be supported with the necessary tools, and you'll be working with an awesome and like-minded team. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary, and collaborative - all working to build the future of housing.

 Who We Are
 Zonda Urban | Zonda Home Canada Inc. is a market-leading research and advisory firm specializing in the collection and analysis of new multi-family residential development data in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Zonda Urban strives to provide a dynamic and team-oriented work environment that offers team-members the opportunity to grow their knowledge and experience within the organization.

 We are looking for someone with positive energy, a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn and grow in the position of Market Research Analyst. Reporting to the Senior Market Analysts and the principals of Zonda Urban, the Market Research Analyst is responsible for assisting with a variety of tasks related to the collection and maintenance of new multi-family home project data in Zonda Urban's proprietary NHSLive data product, and to provide support for our advisory services

 What You’ll Do
 In this role, you will be responsible for:
