Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Why Fraser Health?: 
 
   Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
 

   Effective October 26th, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and the Provincial Health Officer must approve individual medical exemptions.
 

   We are proud of the innovation, dedication, partnership and resourcefulness of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
 

   This is a 
  permanent full-time role, based at our Central City Offices, Surrey, B.C.
  Detailed Overview: 
 Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

 The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for providing leadership in Business Process Reengineering concepts, methods and technologies. Leads the analysis and documentation of business requirements for client-facing and internal Informatics services delivery processes for business, clinical, and systems support services within Fraser Health. The Senior Business Analyst will be engaged in multiple initiatives and will be responsible for project planning, business requirements gathering, data analysis and supporting the execution of projects and change management. Provides leadership and acts as an escalation point for Business Analysts to assist in resolving complex problems. Responsibilities: 
 

Provides strategic planning support and change management services by leading and providing senior level support and guidance in streamlining business processes and best practices for health and corporate information systems capture and utilization.


Leads, develops, and maintains the business processes necessary to facilitate care provider access to health and corporate information systems by conducting feasibility studies and determining user requirements for the uptake of health and corporate information functionality or systems. Leads, coordinates and/or participates in initiatives and process redesign that supports and follows the service management methodology.


Provides senior level business analysis by carrying out work flow analysis, developing business information requirements and models, defining business scope and objectives and planning, designing, or modifying practical manual and automated business processes.


Provides health information systems projects responsibility, under the direction of the Lead or Portfolio Manager, by performing business systems analysis support. Will lead small projects and provide project management guidance to Business Analysts.


Analyzes and diagnoses health information systems applications and/or business issues and provides resolution to either the systems or the business processes. Supports business process changes and/or functional changes to health information systems in support of business practice requirements by testing, modifying, and maintaining the integrated health information systems applications.


Develops Service Level Agreements between Informatics and assigned business areas to support the movement of projects to operational status, maintenance, and support.


Resolves operational issues with health information systems as identified internally or externally from the Informatics Customer Service desk.


Participates in the development, implementation, and evaluation of health informatics goals, objectives, policies and procedures for Informatics and assigned business areas within Fraser Health.


Participates on assigned internal and external committees as required and works collaboratively as a member of the Health Information Systems and Services team. 

 Qualifications: 
 Education and Experience

 Bachelor's Degree in Health Information Systems Management or a related field or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. Three (3) to five (5) years of recent, related experience in a medium to large sized organization. Experience with health and corporate information systems.
 

Skills and Abilities
 Demonstrates the LEADS capabilities; Leads Self, Engages Others, Achieves Results, Develops Coalitions and supports Systems Transformation. 
Professional/Technical Capabilities

Demonstrated knowledge of health and corporate information systems. 
Ability to analyze business processes and business specifications. 
Knowledge of systems analysis, design and development life cycle theory, concepts and practices. 
Ability to develop innovative system/computing technology approaches and
solutions for customer business needs. 
Analytical reasoning and problem solving skills. 
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing. 
Ability to deal effectively with others. 
Ability to organize and prioritize work. 
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team. 
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Title: Business Analyst - Metro Supply Chain (MTH) Inc.
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM 

 Metro Supply Chain is a strategic supply chain solutions partner for some of the world’s fastest growing and most recognizable organizations. We advance our customers’ business through innovative, real-world solutions within a culture that supports our communities, protects our environment and enables our team to thrive. Over the past 40+ years, we’ve grown into a significant operation of more than 80 sites across North America and Europe and 6,000 team members. 

 JOB SUMMARY 
Business Analyst collects and stores data on sales numbers, market research, logistics, or other behaviors. They bring technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of that data, then process, design, and present it in ways to help our businesses, and organizations make better decisions. 

 MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 


Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing users and user roles.
Providing quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Develop reports and analysis.
Providing analysis of data and reports.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Working with stakeholders to design reporting to support business objective
Automation of reporting
Collaborating with other team member to create a business proposal to our client from data review, FSA studies and rate proposal
Ensuring all the data flows properly and accurately between all the logistics and analytic systems
 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS 


Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science or a related field
Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards
High-level written and verbal communication skills
 Join Our Team 


Work in an environment where safety is our first priority
The opportunity to build a career with a growing company
Medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family
Life and disability insurance
Wellness programs to support your family’s well-being
A Retirement Savings Program with a company match
Company team wear allowance
Employee Appreciation Day
Company sponsored social events
Community volunteering
 We are committed to building and fostering a diverse workplace where people feel included and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals. 
Should you require accommodation for a special ability or need during the recruitment process, please reach out to a member of our Human Resources Team.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job ID #342983
 Senior Business Systems Analyst

 On behalf of our client, Procom is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst for a part time 14 month contract in Winnipeg, MB.
 

Senior Business Systems Analyst Job Details

 Reporting to the Supervisor of Application solutions, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will work together with IT and business stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document and
  validate business and system requirements for a major digital transformation initiative.
 
 The first phase of the project includes upgrade of the Amanda enterprise application, addition of web
  services to support communication with other systems, single sign-on (Active Directory authentication), a
  mobile Inspector App to optimize recording of field inspections, Citizen portal for improved customer service, and an Analytics module for better reporting of KPIs and other data needs as determined by the business. The first phase is expected to be in production by January 2023.
 
 The second phase includes addition of other permit applications including new contractor license application, Inspection scheduling and Central property file search to the citizen portal and digitalization of consent, condo, rezoning and sub-division land development process in Amanda enterprise application.
 

Senior Business Systems Analyst Responsibilities

 The Senior Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for: 
 
Eliciting, analyzing, documenting, and validating customer requirements via workshops, site visits, workflow storyboards, and other methods for the new addition to citizen portal and the manual process digitalization in Amanda
Gathering usability requirements, performing usability evaluations and creating UX design for Amanda and Citizen portal applications.
Creating functional and non-functional requirements documents, UI specifications, UI screen design (wireframes and visual design), user stories, etc. for new addition to Citizen portal
Communicating changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Managing and tracking the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforcing and redefining as necessary.
Coordinating user acceptance testing and transition to production activities.

Senior Business Systems Analyst Must Have Skills

12+ years of relevant and recent experience performing business & system analysis and user experience of web-based and mobile-based enterprise applications including their integrations with other systems, with large technical and business changes.
8+ years of relevant and recent experience in UI design (screen flow and task flow), writing functional and non-functional specs and documenting usability requirements for Enterprise web and mobile-based applications.
5+ years of recent experience transforming business requirements into technical specifications for Enterprise applications and portals.
3+ years of recent experience in performing usability evaluations (heuristic review, expert review and usability testing) of Enterprise applications and portal.
3+ years of recent experience in business & system analysis and user experience design with enterprise web applications and portal.
Knowledge of Amanda Enterprise application configuration is an asset
Demonstrated recent experience (3 projects or more) in business and systems requirements analysis (functional and non-functional requirements, UI Specifications, UI screen design, user stories, etc.).
Demonstrated recent experience (3 projects or more) in gathering usability requirements, performing usability evaluations and creating UX design for enterprise web application and portal.
Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to interview and facilitate meetings with stakeholders at all levels in the organization.


Senior Business Systems Analyst Assignment Length

 14 Months (approximately 21 hours per week)
 

Senior Business Systems Analyst Location

 Winnipeg, MB
 

Senior Business Systems Analyst Location

 October 1, 2022

Title: Business Technology Analyst - OpenRoad Head Office
Description:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES AHEAD

 Position: Business Technology Analyst
 Status: Full-Time

 Dealership: Head Office Department: Information Technology

 We believe in doing good for our customers and for ourselves. Whether it’s launching the most anticipated model of the year or purchasing a vehicle for your next adventure, great people and relationships are at every turn with OpenRoad.


 We are proud of our forward-thinking culture developed over 40 years of continuous improvement initiatives. OpenRoad is one of the largest and fastest-growing automotive retail groups in the country (representing 20 automotive brands across 25 locations) with a shared vision to become the national automotive leader in customer experience. As one of Canada’s Best Employers and Best Managed Companies, we are looking for team players who are excited to continually learn, work hard, and take ownership of their roles.


 If you love the idea of joining an organization with unlimited possibilities to accelerate your career, then apply to OpenRoad and grow with us today!

 A Career at OpenRoad Means You’ll Enjoy:

Opportunity to work with a variety of OEM BRANDS: Acura, Audi, BMW, Genesis, Honda, Hyundai, Infiniti, Jaguar, Land Rover, Lexus, Mazda, Mercedes-Benz, MINI, Porsche, Rolls-Royce, Subaru, Toyota, Volkswagen
Amazing Incentives including but not limited to Discounted Vehicle Purchasing Program, Computer Rebate Program, Employee Referral Program, Employer RRSP Matching
Internal and External, Training & Development opportunities for skill development and growth
Be part of a collaborative, friendly, and progressive work culture with an emphasis on transparency, innovation, relationship, and empowerment
Comprehensive Extended Health and Dental plan; tailored toward Associate wellness
Recognition and Engagement Events!


 ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Recommend innovative changes and streamlining technology to improve business effectiveness and efficiency.
Work with various departments (such as Accounting, BDC, Marketing, QA, and Business Analyst) to build relationships and understand business priorities.
Work collaboratively with business stakeholders and technical resources to define the scope and details of data project assignments.
Generate business analysis, and gather information on internal processes and systems, including technology.
Develop and implement technological solutions to improve performance and value, and expand the business model beyond conventional methods used in the industry.
Incite change within the management team and provide consultative leadership.
Other duties as assigned by management.



 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:



1+ years of business analysis, and business consulting experience; specifically in the IT industry, or educational experience from a recognized higher education institution including courses in business/systems analysis, general programming, and the use of software development tools.
Advanced proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and visualization tools like Tableau and proficient in creating and delivering presentations. 
Experience in business process modeling using UML, BPMN, or similar techniques.
Experience in requirement management, including requirements gathering, analysis, and specification documentation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into the application and operational requirements
Able to search for innovative and effective solutions
Knowledge of the development process and the quality assurance methodologies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Working knowledge of SQL is a great asset.
CPBA / PMI-PBA certification and knowledge in a programming language (JS, Python) would be a bonus.



 
Internal Candidates MUST apply by filling out the Internal Endorsement Form on the Intranet. Failure to complete the form will cause a delay in your application.

 https://orag.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=3179

 We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We stand behind the growth of our associates to help them achieve their vision and goals.

 JOIN US AND GROW WITH US!

 We thank all those that have applied. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

Title: Analyste de Données confirmé/ Senior Data Analyst
Senior Fire Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 36592

 Company
Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.


Vancouver Fire Rescue Services (VFRS) is an equal opportunity employer who is looking for a highly motivated individual to join our family of Fire Fighters, Fire Prevention Officers, Public Education Professionals, Chief Officers and Administrative Staff. VFRS prides itself on being one of the most progressive fire departments in North America while at the same time maintaining a strong sense of tradition. Vancouver Fire Rescue Services invites qualified candidates to apply for the position of Senior Fire Data Analyst.


 Main Purpose and Function


The Senior Fire Data Analyst is responsible for data modeling and data integration work related to the design and delivery of analytic data visualizations for VFRS consumption. The position will be responsible for designing, configuring and implementing analytic solutions to support the strategic direction for the Department. Using a variety of tools and technologies, the role works as part of the Organizational Performance and Business Operations team, and is responsible for: (a) design and creation of consumable data for analytic purposes, (b) rapid development of data models to address a number of wide ranging analytic challenges, (c) design and build-out of an analytic ecosystem architecture that supports both central data application creation as well as enabling self-service advanced business analytics and (d) supporting the design and adoption of data governance and data management. Technologies in use or may be used in the future include: Qlik, PowerBI, Excel, FDM, SMS, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP AOLAP, SQL Server and SQL DataWarehouse, and ESRI/GIS. The position interfaces with key business leaders from VFRS as well as the City’s Corporate Leadership team. The work performed will enable VFRS to leverage performance metrics to support strategic, operation and financial decisions as well as support service transformation by driving accountability, improving transparency and increasing value for money.


Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships


The position reports to the Assistant Chief of Analytics & Decision Support. The position calibrates tools to translate raw data into valuable business insights and provides insights and recommendations to senior staff using strong logical reasoning skills and business intelligence to drive high performance and quality.


Specific Duties/Responsibilities



Understand business needs and objectives and provide evidence-based support to develop business cases for resourcing needs such as staffing levels.
Lead and support the development of strategies for effective data analysis and reporting to support departmental strategic direction.
Develop, monitor and analyze performance metrics, financial data and benchmarks to establish the cost efficiency and effectiveness of services.
Provide data analysis and financial decision support which could include financial modelling, business analysis, and business case development
Create a standard department wide methodology for benchmarking performance and efficiency
Configure and support the implementation of qualitative and quantitative analytics solutions to further departmental goals and strategic plans.
Design and create consumable data analytics, including departmental metrics, using BI tools. 
Identify and correct data discrepancies and build a data quality assurance model.
Extract data and reports from multiple sources (e.g. Operations, Training, and Prevention) and maximize the utilization of the Departmental BI tool.
Build systems to transform raw data into actionable business insights and reportable goals.
Apply industry knowledge to interpret data and improve performance.
Keep abreast of industry news and trends and apply to data systems to provide relevant metrics.
Provide analysis supporting the short term and long term departmental direction including providing supporting metrics for the same.
Design and document performance measurement framework.
Present findings with departmental leaders and other stakeholders. 
Develop and maintain user training and documentation.
Perform other duties as assigned.


 
Minimum Qualification Requirements
Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management or related field or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. 
Preferred Masters of Business Analytics (MBAN), or Professional accounting designation (CPA), or Masters of Business Administration (MBA) 
Minimum of 6-8 years of experience supporting business information systems, business intelligence or reporting systems, and two (2) years project management experience.
Experience in supporting and developing strategies to support major corporate decisions and identifying performance measures to inform strategic decisions.
Business intelligence experience, familiarity with data management, BI tools, data mining, designing reports and dashboards to facilitate evidence based effective decision making.
Extensive experience in strategically answering complex business problems through data analysis, scenario modeling and creative thinking.
Initiating business process improvements, supporting strategic decisions and change initiatives for a large organization.
Significant experience in supporting and facilitating complex multi-stakeholder initiatives and engagements
Experience with the creation and presentation of public information (formal/informal reports, other publications) as well as engagement involving a diverse range of stakeholders.
Proven ability to simultaneously manage multiple organizational priorities, projects, and deadlines.


 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Thorough knowledge of rules, regulations, policies, standard operational guidelines and standards within a fire service environment.
Advanced knowledge of performance metrics, finance, and business concepts.
Strong business acumen and the ability to link financial and operational metrics. 
Working knowledge in project management and market research.
Knowledge of current Business analysis techniques.
Advanced knowledge of Data modeling and data management principles.
Knowledge of Road Network building and manipulation.
Knowledge of Qlik, PowerBI, Excel, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP AOLAP, SQL Server and SQL DataWarehouse, and ESRI/GIS; familiarity with other business intelligence tools.
Significant in-depth working knowledge of computers, computer systems, programs and capabilities.
Knowledge of Fire, medical or other emergency services is preferred.
A proven record of being forward thinking, coupled with the skills of being able to articulate ideas in both written and verbal form.
Extensive experience and analytical skills in reaching sound decisions and resolving complex problems.
Demonstrated analytical skills and strong organizational abilities.
A good understanding of Fire culture would be an asset.



Business Unit/Department: Analytics & Business Support/Fire Rescue Services
Affiliation: Exempt
Employment Type: Temporary Full Time - 1 Year
Position Start Date: August 22nd 2022
Position End Date: August 25th 2023
Salary Information: Pay Band: 8 Exempt - $89283.00 per annum


Application Close: July 21st 2022


At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, LGBT2Q+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.


Before you click Apply now
Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date. 
In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx.. 5-10mins. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a tailored summary of skills and experience related to the position.

Title: Analyste des prix à temps partiel/Part-time Pricing Analyst
Description:
An English message will follow
LXR est un détaillant omnicanal, socialement responsable, de sacs à main de marque de luxe vintage et autresaccessoires personnels. Nous approvisionnons, authentifions et sélectionnons avec une attention particulièredes articles d’occasions de haute qualité de marques iconiques telles que Hermès, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Prada et Chanel.Nous vendons les articles à des prix attrayants par le biais de notre site de commerce électronique, www.lxrco.com,ainsi qu’à travers les plateformes de nos partenariats à travers l’Amérique du Nord. Notre modèle omnicanal est égalementsoutenu par dix points de vente au détail en magasin et les activités de ventes de gros.
*Veuillez noter que seulement les candidats qui sont au minimum partiellement vacciné seront considérés. *
L'analyste des prix assistera l'équipe des achats et des opérations en saisissant et en contrôlant les prix et les coûtsquotidiens de nos produits. Le candidat analysera également en permanence les fluctuations du marché etréagira avec efficacité et urgence pour fournir des recommandations sur les prix. La personne fera partie des conversationsstratégiques sur les prix et jouera un rôle intégral dans la mise en œuvre.
*RESPONSABILITÉS*

Mettre à jour et préparer les modèles de prix
Rechercher et surveiller les prix sur le marché
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe d'achat pour s'assurer que les coûts du marché sont à jour
Analyser les données et recommander des stratégies de tarification qui aideront à rationaliser l'efficacité de notre tarification et la précision du marché

QUALIFICATIONS

Baccalauréat ou DEC (ou en voie de l'être) en affaires, en mathématiques ou dans un domaine connexe
Forte maîtrise d'Excel
La connaissance de Power BI est un atout
Esprit d'analyse
Bilingue (oral et écrit)
Solides compétences en communication (orale et écrite)
Esprit d'initiative
Capable de pivoter
Aime les défis
Bonne gestion du temps et capacité à respecter les délais

AVANTAGES SOCIAUX

Environnement de travail dynamique
Conditions de travail hybrides pendant la pandémie
Politique de recrutement interne
Rabais employé
Programme de recommandation des employés
Facilement accessible par les transports en commun (métro de Castelnau)

CONDITIONS D'EMPLOI

Temp partiel, 15 à 20 heures par semaine


Le générique masculin inclut le féminin et est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte.

_-_
LXR is a socially responsible, digital-first omni-channel retailer of branded vintage luxury handbags and otherpersonal accessories. We curate, source and authenticate high-quality, pre-owned products from iconic brands such asHermès, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Prada and Chanel and sell them at attractive prices through our e-commerce website, www.lxrco.com,as well as the e-commerce platforms of our partners across North America. Our omni-channel model is also supported byten retail “shop-in-shop” experience centers and by wholesale activities.
*Please note that only candidates who at the minimum are partially vaccinated will be considered.*
The Pricing Analyst will assist the buying and operations team with entering and monitoring the day-to-day pricing and costing of ourpre-owned luxury merchandise. The candidate will also continually analyze the fluctuations in the market and react with efficiency andurgency and provide recommendations on pricing. The individual will be part of strategic pricing conversations and play anintegral part in implementation.
*RESPONSIBILITIES*

Update and prepare the pricing templates
Research and monitor the prices in the market
Work closely with the buying team to make sure market costs are up to date
Analyze the data and recommend pricing strategies that will help streamline our pricing efficiency and market accuracy

QUALIFICATION

Bachelor’s or DEC degree (or in the process) in Business, Mathematics, or related field
Strong command of Excel
Knowledge of Power BI is an asset
Analytical
Bilingual (oral and written)
Strong communication skills (oral and written)
Self-starter
Able to pivot
Likes challenges
Good time management and the ability to meet deadlines

BENEFITS

Dynamic work environment
Internal recruitment policy
Employee discount on all products
Employee referral program
Ability to work 100% remotely during the pandemic
Easily accessible by public transportation (metro de Castelnau)

EMPLOYMENT CONDITIONS

Part-time, 15 to 20 hours per week

Type d'emploi : Temps Partiel

Title: Residential Market Studies Analyst, Economic Consulting
Description:
Job Category: 
Economics 
 
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! 

The opportunity 

Reporting to the Director, Economic Consulting we are looking for a Residential Market Studies Analyst, to join our National Economic Advisory team. You will play a pivotal role conducting research, analysing data, and contributing to studies for our residential feasibility consulting practice. 

Who you are 

You are a recent grad with an interest in economics, planning, urban development or policy analysis; with exceptional research, data analysis, and writing skills. You are detail oriented and have an interest in consultative report writing and working as a trusted advisor in residential or mixed-use studies - and you are looking for an opportunity to be trained and mentored in this field. You want to join a national team at a scaling industry leader offering competitive analysis and advice founded on data and integrity. You have an entrepreneurial spirit, the growth mindset, and the willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to learn and make an impact. 

What you will focus on 

Conduct research. You will collect data from both internal and third-party sources regarding economic, demographic, real estate market, and other topics as required. You will correspond with industry participants to elicit and compile real estate market data. 
Prepare information for reporting and analysis. You will perform data entry for analytical models and prepare preliminary analysis. You will support complex consulting reports by writing, editing, and proofreading assigned sections under the supervision of a Senior Analyst. 
Build and create. You will use GIS software to perform spatial data analysis and provide high-quality graphic outputs and mapping. You will assist with the development and maintenance of analytical models. You will create informative and visually compelling tables and charts for consulting reports. 
Learn. You will continuously upgrade your knowledge regarding the market and industry trends. 


As our new Analyst, Residential Market Studies, you bring: 

The education and motivation. You have a university degree in Economics, Statistics, Urban Geography, Urban Planning, Business, or a related discipline. You take ownership of your tasks, are detail-oriented, and comfortable supporting the efforts of a team acting as a key contact for disseminating information. 
The technical skills. You have basic research, quantitative and analytical skills. You are proficient in MS Office, including Excel. GIS software knowledge is a benefit. 
The interpersonal skills. You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills. You are collaborative and can build relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders. You are comfortable reaching out via email or phone to obtain information and confirm details. 
The flexibility. You have a valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle. You are willing to work the occasional weekend or evening to complete studies or attend client meetings, forums, and information sessions when it is safe to do so. 


What’s in it for you ? 

Impact, reputation, and collaboration . Our National Economics Advisory Team conducts more than 100 feasibility studies a year, and we are ramping up. We have a top-end product, continuously evolving to meet the needs of our clients and backed by a reputation for delivering services with independence and integrity. This is a chance to be part of an organization with one of the largest repositories of real estate data, inhouse built tech products to access and analyze the data, and experts in appraisals, construction costs, and valuation. 
Exposure. We work on projects across the country, presenting new and unique challenges with leads generated through marketing and a reputation that precedes us. This is an opportunity to gain an incredible amount of exposure and hands-on opportunity working with renowned experts in the field, including VP and Chief Economist, Peter Norman, supporting your work and learning as you go. 
Career development. We have a year-over-year mandate to develop the broader team; you will have endless possibilities for growth with the chance to move up to a Senior Analyst, Consultant, and beyond, across the group into commercial real estate studies, or into another line of the business. 


We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what's new by following us on LinkedIn . 

Come realize your potential at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: Business Analyst I
Description:
About ATS Traffic
 ATS Traffic is a family-owned business that has been getting people home safely since 1966. We provide traffic control, on-street services and signage products and services across Canada, currently operating out of offices in Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Saskatoon, Langley, Kamloops and Winnipeg.
 As the successful candidate you will demonstrate the ATS Traffic Core Values at work every day:

 Do What’s Right
 Our People Matter
 Trust Through Teamwork
 Striving for Excellence


 About the Positions
 ATS Traffic is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our high-functioning Technology Team based in Edmonton. Are you customer-service oriented? Do you approach every situation with a solution focused approach? If so, we want to hear from you!
 The Business Analyst is a fundamental position that contributes to the success of ATS Traffic by addressing the needs of the business in terms of software applications and processes. Business Analysts help drive critical business decisions by analyzing business processes, associated metrics and designing reports. They communicate these results to both managers and the Executive, and often provide suggestions based on their findings.
 As a BA - Reporting and Analytics, you must have a bachelor's degree in information systems or a related field. You should also have advanced skills in SQL and Power BI, among other software programs. The ideal candidate has the ability prioritize tasks and manage time well, and effectively communicate the results of your analysis.

 Responsibilities

 Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout the business.
 Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary to ensure accuracy.
 Regularly examine data reports to locate and resolve mistakes throughout.
 Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports.
 Create business reports that provide insight into key data points.
 Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers.
 Support various departments, including Executives, marketing and sales, in reaching their goals through analysis.
 Monitor data to identify changes in financial and business trends.

 
 Qualifications

 One to three years of experience as a financial or business analyst
 Experience in Microsoft GP, Power BI, object-oriented programming and other data analysis programs
 Analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports
 Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
 Ability to use SQL and Power BI to create apps, graphs, charts and dashboards
 Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively relate data to coworkers
 Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions
 Tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
 General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow


 Why Choose ATS Traffic?
 We have always been a family-owned business. When you join ATS, you aren’t just a number: people remember your name and treat you like one of the family! You’ll be working with a team you can trust, and you’ll be excited to come in on Monday morning.
 Other perks include:

 RRSP Matching Program
 Health Spending Account and Healthy Lifestyle Spending Account
 Competitive benefits package
 Regular company events like barbecues and holiday parties

 Do you have a good attitude? Are you unafraid to speak up and tell us what you think? Do you work for a higher purpose? Do you do whatever it takes to get the job done? If this sounds like you, we think you’d be a great fit at ATS Traffic – apply today!

 We thank all applicants for their interest, however only selected candidates will be contacted.

By applying to this posting you will receive auto-generated emails to the account provided. Please ensure to check your junk/spam folder as these emails may be re-directed.


 Experience Required
 
 2 - 3 years: Using Microsoft GP as your source of truth in creating applications and dashboards
 1 - 3 years: Business Analysis and report generation

 Education Preferred
 
 Technical/other training or better in Information Technology or related field

 Licenses & Certifications Preferred
 
 Class 5 Non GDL

 Behaviors Required
 
 Thought Provoking: Capable of making others think deeply on a subject
 Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
 Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking

 Motivations Required
 
 Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
 Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
